Wealthy, handsome werewolf who has never experienced love and never understood the pull of a true mate-check! Heated attraction and sweet romance-check! That and a whole lot more! Fabulous entertainment and an awesome read!Complimentary copy received in exchange for an honest review.

Title: Once A CheetahSeries: Safari ShiftersDesignation: Book Four, Paranormal Shape Shifter Romance Standalone NovellaAuthor: Lola KiddReading Platform: Kindle UnlimitedMy Rating: FIVE ROCKIN' SAFARI STARS *****Yowza! Once A Cheetah is the fourth release in Lola Kidd's charming new Safari Shifters Series and it is a breath of fresh air for lovers of paranormal shifter romance! I totally love it! The story is imaginative, original, fresh, exciting, romantic and sinfully sexy. The narrative is exceptionally well written in the third person with alternating his and her points of view. The dialogue is smart, playful, well executed and flows effortlessly. The characters are well crafted, unique, captivating, engaging and sexy as sin. Kidd skillfully combines these elements into a sweet, fast-paced, fun-filled adventure brimming with easy lighthearted humor, seductive romance and a totally new twist on sexy shifters. What didn't I like about this story? Not a darn thing! So, are you ready? Buckle up my lovelies! Let's go on safari!Shifter Island is located in the South Atlantic off the coast of Africa and just happens to be the hottest vacation destination around. The resort is a large island park which includes a safari-themed amusement park, an actual safari tour, a five-star beach resort, a new nightclub, a romantic honeymoon resort and Safari Town where the staff live. With names like Wild Eats, Club Safari, Wild Resort, Blue Sky Honeymoon Resort, how can you not love it? And it's owned and operated by shifters. Hubba! Hubba! Safari Island is the only place on earth you can go on a safari where the lions could stroll over and turn out to be one of the tour guides??!! Oh my! An island full of hot, hunky shifters of every species imaginable - Sign me up!Beautiful Clementine Blue is definitely the newest media darling. Now that she's won So You Think You Can Cook, a popular reality TV cooking competition, her career is white hot. Sadly her personal life is so not! But things are looking up. She's been invited to audition to cater a wedding on Safari Island which just happens to be the most popular tourist destination in the world. Her Mom, Bunny Blue, who is also her manager and agent, thinks it could result in her being invited to be the head chef of their upcoming new restaurant, Blue Ridge, set to open this winter. This trip to the island for the audition and to cater the wedding could be a real boost to her career along with lots of free publicity and it could also be a working vacation, especially since the couple have agreed to pay all her expenses. Besides, the couple had specifically asked for her, so surely she already has this in the bag. What could go wrong? It would be a win-win, right? She could just relax and concentrate on cooking. She could always worry about her personal life and a relationship once she was on track with her career. She wouldn't even think about flirting or finding a guy; she would just let nature takes its course. Really???Parker Travers is a world renowned vegetarian chef who just happens to also be a cheetah shifter. Vegetarian cheetah chef? Huh? His latest restaurant, Not Your Average Cheetah, in Beverly Hills is turning out to be a big flop while he's busy as the head chef at Wild Eats on Safari Island. His latest girlfriend, Jasminda, who is an occasional performer on Safari Island, is not his true mate and things are not going well with them at all. She's just another name on a long list of failed relationships. Heck, maybe he would never even be able to recognize his true mate. Everyone had always said there had to be something wrong with him anyway. Who had ever heard of a cheetah who is a vegetarian? Crazy, right? It's bad enough being a professional failure; he didn't want to fail in his personal life as well. Maybe it's time to cut his losses and be celibate for a while, concentrate on getting his career back on track. And a good place to start would be catering the upcoming wedding for Branch Dunkin and Maura Trebel on the island. That could get him lots of free publicity and really get his name back out there. There was only one little problem and her name is Clementine Blue and what a beautiful problem she is! Nope, not going there. Never going to happen! She's his competition and he wants to win this job to cater the wedding. He's a famous chef with restaurants all over the world. He could easily win this competition and keep his paws off the lovely Clementine Blue, right? Hmm....I wonder??? No spoilers from me but I will say this....Handsome vegetarian cheetah-shifter who is also a world renowned chef-check! Beautiful celebrity chef who is the latest media darling-check! A no holds barred competition to cater a media event wedding on Safari Island-check! Heated attraction and sweet romance-you bet! That and a whole lot more! It's nice to see the heroine go after the hot guy for a change even if it is for one night - or more! Hubba! Hubba! Deliciously cute and sinfully sweet! I can hardly wait for Ward Langston's story next! Although this is the fourth book of the series, it is a standalone novella and does NOT have a cliffhanger.

Title: Bearly In Time: Connor and RebeccaSeries: Werebears of New HampshireDesignation: Fourth and FInal Book of the Series, NO CliffhangerAuthor: Kim FoxReading Platform: Kindle UnlimitedMy Rating: FIVE DELIGHTFULLY ENTERTAINING STARS *****Wow! Kim Fox has dazzled her readers yet again with Bearly in Time, the fourth and final release in her fun-filled Werebears of New Hampshire Series and I absolutely love it! It is quite simply a brilliant conclusion for an absolutely amazing series. These are just the cutest, sweetest, funniest, sexiest and most heartwarming stories ever! But be forewarned - they will tickle your funny bone and tug at your heartstrings and you'll be a fan for life! The narrative is exceptionally well written in the third person with alternating his and her points of view from the hero and heroine of the book. The dialogue is smart, snappy and flows effortlessly. The characters are fascinating, engaging, endearing and simply fabulous. I found myself completely enthralled by this group of hilariously captivating characters. Although this story is a bit more of a tear-jerker than the previous three tales, Kim still manages to squeeze in quite a few chuckles and giggles for her readers. I began sniffing on the first page and by the time I reached the end of the first chapter, I couldn't hold back my tears. What can I say? I'm a very emotional reader! My heart broke for both Connor and Rebecca and I sobbed through most of the book, that is, when I wasn't shaking my fist in anger. But never fear, Kim never lets us down and always finishes her story with a wonderful happy ending. I love it when a great book like this one invokes so many different emotions and I think I experienced them all while reading this book. This story has a perfect combination of drama, humor, heartbreaking angst, heartwarming romance and of course, good old fashioned bear bonding and dreamy sex! And Kim even sneaks in another great life lesson in this story, one that my Father also taught me: Believe none of what you hear and only half of what you see - looks can sometimes be very deceiving.  Although this story can be read as a standalone novella, I would highly recommend reading the previous three books in the series but if you can't, at least read the first book in the series, Bearly Breathing, which is where we're introduced to this wonderful cast of characters and of course, where we first meet werebear Connor Jacoby and beautiful kindergarten teacher Rebecca Sanderson.It had been a little over two months since Rebecca Sanderson won a free weekend kayaking getaway from Brooke Excursions located in the beautiful mountains of New Hampshire. Becka had invited her two best friends, Angie Hawkins and Grace Briggs along on the trip and all three set out for the adventure of a lifetime. Their exciting getaway at Brookes Excursions quickly turned into a nightmare when their outing was interrupted by a dangerous kayaking accident and a violent storm resulting in the girls each being separated and then stranded overnight with one of their handsome guides. Oh no! And each of their guides were hunky werebears! Oh yes! So, naturally they hooked up! Oh my! Rebecca had been rescued by hunky grizzly bear-shifter Connor Jacoby who also happens to be the owner of Brooke Excursions. Rebecca was immediately attracted to handsome Connor and Connor seemed to be quite taken with Rebecca as well. A week later, Rebecca finds herself once again making the trip from Manhattan to New Hampshire to see her new beau Connor. She had decided to surprise Connor by arriving a day early which in hindsight may have been a mistake because what she saw broke her heart. She ended up being the one surprised. Seeing Connor with another woman had hurt so much more than when she discovered her fiance, Mark, had been having an affair. She was completely devastated with nowhere to go except back to the apartment she had once shared with Mark. Now, here she sits, back in Manhattan and only five more days until she marries her cheating fiance who claims it had all been just a misunderstanding. A misunderstanding? Not! But why did she ever think a handsome bear-shifter like Connor could ever love her? She isn't smart like Angie or beautiful like Grace. She's just a plain old kindergarten teacher in her thirties whose fiance even thought he could do better and cheated on her. Why would Connor be any different? It was all an act; Connor had been a player all along and she fell for it - hook, line and sinker! He probably gives all the women who come for kayaking the same spiel. How in the world had she wound up in love with one man (well, bear-shifter) and soon to be married to another? Now, she's probably making an even bigger mistake by marrying Mark. Does she even love Mark? Or does she love Connor? She had run away that day without even as much as talking to Connor so maybe she should give him a chance to explain. Or not - especially after she sees him with the same woman again! What the heck? What's a girl to do?Connor Jacoby can't believe that Rebecca has blocked his calls and refuses to talk with him. He's in love with her and he and his bear both have bonded with her. She is his mate and he wanted them to start a future together. He thought she loved him as well. What in the world happened to make her go back to her cheating fiance. He has no idea and Rebecca refuses to tell Grace or Angie why she changed her mind. Connor is a broken man. He would spend the rest of his life in misery mourning the loss of his mate but he has to at least see her one more time. Maybe if he sees her in her wedding dress and happy, it could at least give him and his bear some closure. Oh my! Poor Connor! What a mess! Will Connor and Becka find their way back to each other or will Becka marry Mark? No spoilers from me but I will say this....Handsome grizzly bear-shifter with a broken heart-check! Beautiful kindergarten teacher who should never believe what she thinks she sees-check! A cheating fiance and a very unhappy scheduled wedding-check! Heartbreaking angst and an unfortunate misunderstanding-check! Sweet romance, a few bundles of joy, several happy endings and some good old fashioned bear bonding-you bet! Oh, and did I forget to mention dreamy sex? Well, duh? It is a Kim Fox story after all, so yeah, that's included! That and a whole lot more! Deliciously cute and fabulously entertaining!

Title: A Mate for YorkSeries: The ProgramDesignation: Book One of Series, Standalone Novella, NO CliffhangerGenre: Paranormal RomanceAuthor: Charlene HartnadyMy Rating: FIVE DELICIOUSLY SEXY STARS*****Yowza! Charlene Hartnady has obviously been hard at work and her phenomenal creativity and imagination have definitely been working overtime as demonstrated by A Mate for York, the first release in her brand new series, The Program. And may I just say WOW! I love it! The story is original, unique, well crafted, cute, fun, romantic and seductive. Heck, I'm 63 and even I wanted to apply for "The Program." The narrative is exceptionally well written in the third person with alternating his and her points of view. The dialogue is smart, snappy, well executed and flows seamlessly. The entire book is extremely well edited which is always a big plus for me. The characters shine as brightly as the beacon of a lighthouse. They are captivating, fascinating, engaging, endearing, sexy as sin and at times, laugh out loud funny. Another big plus for me is the recurring appearance of characters from Charlene's previously released books which reinforces not only the validity and believability of the series but also the familiarity of the world in which the book has been written. It is always such a treat to see how our favorite characters are doing. Charlene skillfully combines all these elements into a delicious tale filled to the brim with a little light humor, fun-filled adventure, a dollop of suspense, a generous measure of a romping good time and loads of dreamy romance! Where can I sign up for "The Program?"Kings Zane and Brant are now proud papas of a bouncing baby boy named Sam and when they aren't trying to keep Queen Tanya happy and satisfied, they're both busy implementing their new "Breeding Program" also known as "The Program." What? Breeding Program? Oh yes, I said breeding program. Zane and Brant have learned through Ward, Stephany's new alpha wolf mate, that humans are, in fact, strong enough to survive a mating with shifters and vampires other than the kings. It seems the shifters have been doing it for years, in secret of course. The Kings have finally embraced this new idea and have been hard at work drawing up the contracts with the humans and finalizing the arrangements. Their hard work has finally paid off and they're launching the first stage of "The Program" by advertising for women to volunteer to date a vampire. Huh? Yep, the initial trial will be called "The Dating Program." Wait - what? What's the difference? Well, I'm glad you asked. The difference is that there will be no mating and no sex with the participants of the initial trial. It will be blood-drinking only. What? Oh, did I forget to mention that part? This trial is for three days only and is strictly to determine if the chosen vampire males can drink blood from the human women without experiencing bloodlust. Oh my! Unfortunately, quite a few vampires suffer from the affliction which can turn calm, disciplined vampires into blood crazed maniacs who can drain a human of all their blood within minutes. Oh no! And, there's no way to tell who will succumb to bloodlust until they actually drink from a human. Yep, that's right! It can be a bit risky. But the human women have been carefully screened and those chosen for the trial will be paid $45,000.00 a day for every day they complete the program so at the end of the three day trial, they could receive as much as $135,000.00. That is, if they survive. Just a minor little problem but all precautions and security measures have been taken. Unfortunately, all of this has become a necessary risk since vampires are becoming extinct. Although it's dangerous for human women to give birth to vampire babies, most female vampires cannot safely birth children at all and have to be sterilized. Sadly, the births resulting from vampire/human unions have been only male children. As a result, there's a shortage of viable women thereby creating the problem - they need human women. Unfortunately, not everyone is happy about this newest little development and have already made an attempt on King Zane's life. So now it seems that the vampires and everyone involved with The Program may be at risk. Oh my goodness!But no matter the danger or how insurmountable it may seem, nothing  will stop York. Most of the vampire guards had decided to participant in the combat competition in order to win a position in the new breeding program - the chance to have their own female - a soft, beautiful, curvy, human female. Who wouldn't fight for that, right? It had long been York's dream to have a mate and a family. Most vampire males never do. Only the Kings had been allowed to mate humans - until now. But that was all about to change and York had already been promised a slot in the program in exchange for a favor he granted Brant's brother, Xavier, but nonetheless, York wanted to fight and earn his position. He is the Captain of the Elite Guard after all and he doesn't want to be accused of receiving favorable treatment. He is the biggest, baddest and best of all the vampire warriors. And of course, as usual, he succeeds again just as he will be successful at proving that he would never succumb to bloodlust. Piece of cake, right? Wrong! Human females are, indeed, very hard to resist, especially the ones with beautiful green eyes like Cassidy, the first female candidate he meets. And she tastes even better than she looks! He would have his female and he wants this one - rules and contracts be damned!Cassidy is almost thirty and still has absolutely nothing to show for her life other than a death certificate for a no good selfish husband and an unexpected mountain of debt, which of course, was all because of his gambling and his weekly trips to "The Kitty's Paw", an escort agency. She had hoped by this point she would be settled into a wonderful life with the man of her dreams and two or three children but all she has is painful memories, heartache, a crappy job with a lecherous boss, a pile of debt and a zero bank balance. But, there is a light at the end of the tunnel. If she can only be approved to participate in the vampire "Dating Program", she could make enough money to pay off her debt and have enough left over to start a new life - somewhere else. She could make it through three days, right? She just has to let them drink a little blood. Easy Peasy, right? Not when her very first vampire is hot, handsome, sex-on-a-stick York! Buckle up my ladies! We're in for another wild ride! No spoilers from me but I will say this....Beautiful human widow with gorgeous green eyes and lush curves-check! Handsome Elite Vampire Guard determined to have his human female, rules be damned-check! A large cast of wonderful characters-check! Two exasperated Kings-check! A new Breeding Program, a dash of humor, a lot of fun, a little angst, and a pinch of suspense-check! Heated attraction, fiery passion, sweet romance and dreamy sex-you bet! That and a whole lot more! Deliciously cute, seriously sexy and delightfully entertaining!

Title: Strife Part FiveSeries: The Strife SeriesDesignation: Book Five of a Multi-Installment Serial, Not A StandaloneAuthor: Sky CorganMy Rating: FIVE DELICIOUSLY ENTERTAINING STARS *****Yowza! Sky Corgan has gone and done it again! And just what has she done, you ask? She's dazzled her readers with yet another riveting serial and what a sparkler it is! Strife is her latest offering and will be released in multiple installments so be forewarned, there will be cliffhangers. Each book is a relatively quick read with only approximately 40 to 45 pages which makes it perfect for a quick break or lunchtime treat. Personally, I love the excitement and anticipation of a well written serial with a great oh my god cliffhanger and Sky Corgan is a master of her trade. She knows exactly how to tease, tantalize and titillate her reader for maximum effect in order to create the pinnacle of a wonderfully entertaining experience. Strife is an extremely well written dark and compelling romance with complex characters but what is most surprising in this story is the underlying element of humor which I find that I very much enjoy. The story is told in the first person by the two primary characters, Pepper Kimbrough and Dmitri Strife, with alternating his and her points of view by chapter which just happens to be my favorite style of storytelling. Although the story is classified as a dark romance, it's anything but gloomy. It's exciting, fast-paced, appealing, realistic, romantic and seductive. The characters as always shine brightly in Sky Corgan's work and these are no exception. They are fascinating, captivating, engaging, relatable, sexy as sin and sometimes quite humorous. Corgan skillfully combines these elements into an enticing and divinely entertaining experience for her readers.Book One: Pepper Kimbrough came to Hollywood to fulfill her dream of becoming an actress. That was Plan A. Unfortunately, Plan A hasn't worked out so well. Of course, neither has her life but she's managed to survive, albeit by the skin of her teeth. She may not be innocent and vulnerable but she's definitely desperate. And hence, her current predicament - down on her knees with her head in James Sumner's lap with her mouth on his.... well, you know where her mouth is. Yep, this is now her life and this is what loosely passes for a somewhat questionable interview for a job - or at least she hopes. No, life certainly isn't beautiful, not for people like her - at least not yet. Sometimes, it's as ugly as your own worst nightmares and this is definitely one of those times. The only question: Is Pepper strong enough to survive it??? The memories of her past say no but her determination and inner strength say yes. Now it's time for Plan B: Please this jerkwad Sumner, get the job as a call girl making $500.00 an hour, save her money, go to college, then become rich and famous. But is she really willing to sell her body as well as her soul to accomplish her dream and yet somehow, still hang on to her sanity? Or ultimately risk her sanity to fulfill her dream? She's been through worse and it's not forever, right? Right!? She can do this and stay sane; she could be a escort/call girl, couldn't she? It's actually rather ironic since she had actually grown up rich and now she's only one breath away from homeless and starving. This is all worth it, isn't it? With only $9.03 left to her name, it has to be. She no longer has a choice. Or does she???Rock Star Dmitri Strife has conquered the musical stage and now he's ready to conquer the big screen stage in Hollywood with his first starring role as Brodie Grant in the upcoming new movie, Master of Payback. He's just arrived and it's his first night in "tinsel town". His friend John is surprising him with a night on the town and it does turn out to be quite the shock. Instead of going to a club, John is taking him to a private brothel with beautiful babes galore, all willing to submit to his every desire. Oh my! But Dmitri has had his fill of endless nights of booze, never ending parties and meaningless sex with women always looking to use him as a means for fame and fortune. He doesn't wanted to be caught up in that nightmare again and almost leaves - until he sees her - the beautiful, blonde that wanders onto the balcony where he's hidden in the shadows. She looks so innocent and so sad. He can't help himself; he needs to know her name. But surprisingly when he approaches her, she doesn't seem to recognize him. He just won't tell her who he really is so he tells her his name is Brodie Grant, the name of his movie character, instead. This night may work out after all. Hmmm.... I wonder?????Book Two:Pepper, who has been given the moniker of Alexis by her boss James Sumner, spent her first night as an escort talking with Brodie/Dmitri and NOT having sex. Huh? Nope, no sex. During their night together, Pepper/Alexis confesses to Dmitri/Brodie that she was adopted but the day after graduating from high school, her parents kicked her out with only $700 and said they never wanted to see her again. What the heck? Pepper feels like a complete failure after not being able to seduce Dmitri/Brodie and begins to have serious doubts as to whether she can actually continue this job but unfortunately she's out of options so it's this or starve. But Pepper soon realizes that she may be in way over her head. Thirty five year old Dmitri Strife is very much looking forward to meeting his co-star, Marie Overton. It has long been his dream to meet and woo the beautiful sophisticated movie star and knows this is the perfect opportunity. Apparently she doesn't feel the same since she didn't even bother to show up for the cast luncheon so there will be no date tonight with Marie Overton. So, what's a handsome, successful heartthrob to do??? Request another night with Alexis/Pepper, of course!!! Oh my! And still, no sex! But strangely, Dmitri finds that he enjoys being with Alexis/Pepper and is drawn to beauty and her innocence and is somewhat puzzled by his feelings toward Alexis. He knows an association with her could be dangerous for his career but he can't seem to stop himself. He convinces himself that it's just the easy camaraderie he experiences with Alexis and nothing more.Book Three:Dmitri has started filming and finally meets his co-star but at first, Marie seems mildly interested in him. She leaves before he can ask her out. But is he still interested in her? Or would he rather spend time  with Pepper? Hmm...Is his interest due to sympathy for Pepper's plight or possibly or is it real friendship he feels for the lovely young Pepper? Or could it be something more??? But the feelings Pepper/Alexis feel for Dmitri are far from friendly. Pepper/Alexis enjoys her time spent with Dmitri and more than a little attracted to him. She hopes to see him again and a small thread of hope is born that maybe, he may just feel something for her other than physical desire. James informs her that Dmitri has indeed requested her company again for the night.  I wonder if Pepper/Alexis will be able to seduce Dmitri this time???  And yes, Pepper/Alexis now knows that Brodie lied to her about his identity and is really Dmitri Strife! Oh my goodness!Book Four: Dmitri finally has the chance to ask Marie Overton for a date - and she accepts. But the long awaited date falls short of his actual expectations. Despite their great on screen chemistry, Dmitri is just not feeling a real connection with Marie. It seems, all Dmitri can think about is Pepper. Yep, his thoughts are filled with everything Pepper. It's only been one night since they were last together but he wants to see her again. And it also seems that Dmitri may have finally realized that he wants to do so much more than just see her and be her friend. He wants the beautiful young Pepper but will she still be the same innocent escort? Or did she have a client last night? Dmitri doesn't want anyone else to have Pepper and he's shocked at his own self revelation. He wants to be the only man to touch her beautiful body. What's a rock star to do? Request another night with Pepper, of course! No matter the cost!  This is their third night together, so will they or won't they?Book Five:They will and they do! Oh my! And it was fabulous -  or at least it was until Pepper surrendering to temptation, took a sneak peek at Dmitri's phone and saw the text message from Marie Overton. Oh no! Oh yes! Another brittle piece of Pepper's already fragile heart shatters in her chest as she realizes that Dmitri is like all the other men she's ever known, a liar, a user, a player and never to be trusted. And her conclusion about Dmitri is certainly reinforced when she sees Dmitri and Marie Overton together at a club on the same night he has already arranged with James to have her for the evening but fails to show feigning a business engagement. What? And the final nail in Dmitri's coffin is Marie kissing Dmitri - on the mouth! Oh no! Oh yes! What will Pepper do now? Will Pepper still want Dmitri after becoming aware of his relationship with Marie Overton? More importantly, what will Dmitri do now that he realizes he may not want Marie Overton after all. Marie Overton is certainly not the person he imagined her to be? It seems that Dmitri Strife has a decision to make - an important one that could affect his career, his life and his future. What does Dmitri truly want? Whom does he truly want? What will he decide? No spoilers from me but I will say this...Beautiful young woman who came to Hollywood to fulfill her dream of becoming an actress but has fallen on hard times and is now broke and almost homeless-check! Handsome rock star who is tired of his life as a famous musician and has come to Hollywood for his first starring role in a movie-check! An unexpected meeting of two lost souls-check! Heated attraction, fiery passion, heartbreaking angst, sweet romance and steamy sex-we'll see! That and a whole lot more! Fabulous entertainment and an awesome read! I can hardly wait for the next installment!Complimentary copy received in exchange for an honest review.

Title: Reawakening the Dragon: Part FourSeries: Stonefire DragonsDesignation: Part Four of Four, Multi-Installment Series, Not A Standalone  Book Seventeen of Stonefire Dragons SeriesAuthor: Jessie DonovanMy Rating: FIVE DRAGO-LICIOUS STARS *****Oh my glory! Jessie Donovan has done it again! And what has she done, you ask? She's just released another astounding installment of Reawakening the Dragon, a continuation of her stunning mega-hit series, Stonefire Dragons and may I just say - WOW! This release is the fourth and final installment of Reawakening the Dragon but never fear, it's not the end of Jessie's dragon tales. Jessie never fails to tease, tantalize and titillate her readers with her amazing talent, incredible skill, unlimited imagination and entertaining repartee. I love it! The story is original, imaginative, fresh, novel, exciting, suspenseful, fast-paced, romantic, arousing and let's not forget well developed and hilarious. The dialogue is exceptionally well written in the third person with multiple points of view. It is also well edited, smart, witty, seductive and flows effortlessly. The characters are fascinating, intriguing, engaging, endearing, sexy as sin and at times, hysterically funny. Donovan is a true master of her trade and expertly combines these elements into a deliciously entertaining paranormal romance filled to the brim with heart-pounding danger, thrilling adventure, spine-tingling suspense, laugh out loud humor and passionate romance. What more could you ask from a great book? Not a darn thing! So, are you ready for another wild ride??!! Buckle up my lovelies! Here we go again!!!Part One:BBC reporter Jane Hartley desperately longs to be more than just a pretty face on camera. She wants to be taken seriously - to be a respected investigative reporter and is willing to do whatever it takes to achieve her goal including placing her own life in imminent danger. In order to write the story that could change the course of her career, she knows she must find the new location of the dragon hunters. She has gleaned information from every possible source and finally has a lead on the possible location for the Carlisle hunters. If she can pull this off, not only will she have the story of the year but she could also help sway public opinion even more in favor of the dragon-shifters. After working closely with the Stonefire Dragon Clan, she now knows they are not the monsters the Dragon Hunters and the Dragon Knights have portrayed them to be. Well, maybe none except head protector Kai Sutherland. Investigating this story and becoming acquainted with the people from Stonefire has reignited her desire to discover the truth and she's determined to find the hunters, expose them for the monsters they are and have her story - even if it kills her. Unfortunately, it just might since no human has ever revealed the inner workings of the dragon hunters but that's exactly what she intends to do. And she was doing just fine until Stonefire's head protector, Kai Sutherland showed up and threw a monkey wrench in her well laid plans. Who does he think he is anyway??? She will never allow the sexy Stonefire dragon-shifter to interfere with her investigation! Or would she??!! No, she will not! At least not until she's finished her story and secured her reputation as a truly respected investigative reporter. Visions of sugarplums and Kai naked will just have to wait! Or will they??!! Nope, she can't afford to sleep with the handsome protector, especially if she doesn't want her story to be labeled as biased. That would only serve to destroy her credibility and her reputation. It'll be torture but she can most assuredly resist the growly dragon-shifter. Can't she??After the capture, torture and death of Stonefire's first female protector, ex-army dragon-shifter Kai Sutherland has only one objective - protect his clan by locating and taking down Simon Bourne, leader of the Carlisle dragon hunters. And in the process, he can also seek retribution and revenge for his brethren. And his plans are going well until he finds BBC reporter Jane Hartley right smack in the middle of a group of Carlisle hunters in a pub in Newcastle. What the heck? He will not allow his dragon's lust for the beautiful female reporter to disrupt his mission and he will never, ever share information and work with her! Nope, never! He will never allow himself to be distracted by a female ever again! Or would he??? What in the world is wrong with his dragon? Eleven years ago, he had been rejected by his true mate, dragonwoman Maggie Jones of Snowridge Clan,  but for the first time since his heartbreak, he has finally been able to forget the female who should have been his mate - just by listening to Jane's voice. Oh my! But he doesn't have time for a human nor any female for that matter, so her voice is all he could allow himself to have. Now, if he could only get his dragon to shut the hell up!Part Two: Stonefire Head Protector Kai Sutherland has finally agreed to work with BBC reporter Jane Hartley on finding the location of Simon Bourne and the Carlisle Dragon Hunters. Unfortunately, they are unaware that the Dragon Knights have posted a 5000 pounds bounty on Jane's pretty head.  As they begin their mission, Jane is betrayed by her contact, a man referred by her brother Rafe Hartley who is a member of The UK Special Forces. Uh oh! An attempt is made on Jane's life and Kai is injured trying to protect her. Fortunately, the pair is rescued by another protector, dragonwoman Nikki Gray, and returned to Stonefire where Kai can receive treatment for his gunshot wound. Kai may be injured but that hasn't curbed his dragon's lust for the lovely reporter - not one little bit. His dragon is driving him insane! After two mind-blowing kisses, Kai can no longer deny his attraction for the sassy reporter and discovers that he may desire Jane just as much as his dragon. With Jane now in charge of Kai's care  and living in his home back on Stonefire, it just got a whole lot harder for the stubborn pair to resist each other and if Kai's dragon has any say in the matter, Kai may just have a new mate - that is if he can keep her alive and away from the Dragon Knights as well as the Dragon Hunters. Oh my! And he still can't get his dragon to shut the hell up! It may not be possible for a dragon to have more than one true mate but Kai's dragon is sure determined to have Jane! Now that a bounty has been placed on her head, Jane is in even more danger than before. She doesn't want more people getting hurt because of her story. For her own protection, Bram insists she must stay on Stonefire land and as a result, she's afraid her credibility may now be compromised. That in itself may not be so bad but she's still determined to help sway public opinion in favor of the dragon-shifters and possibly with the aid of her big brother Rafe, she still may be able to help. But is Jane willing to sacrifice her story, her credibility and her reputation to have Kai? It would be hard for any woman to be objective around handsome dragonman Kai but judging from her body's reaction to his two kisses, it may well be worth it! Will she be able to resist Kai - that is if his dragon can convince him to make a move???Part Three: Kai is now recovering from his injury under the watchful eye and care of his new houseguest. Yep, you guessed it - Jane Hartley. And Kai's very randy,  rambunctious dragon seems to have developed a one track mind and Jane Hartley is the only car on the track! Oh my! After Kai opens up to Jane about his past and the events that followed his true mate's rejection, Jane is more determined than ever to have a relationship with the handsome dragonman. She wants him and has made up her mind to give him a chance and once Jane Hartley makes a decision, she gives up all doubt and embraces her choice and she's definitely ready to be embraced by Kai Sutherland. And it seems that Kai as well as his dragon desire their lovely houseguest. They both want her - now! Unfortunately for Jane and Kai, there are other pressing issues at hand. Namely, Jane's brother, Rafe Hartley of the UK special forces who has just arrived to lend a helping hand to Stonefire, albeit begrudgingly. And he doesn't like the fact that his sister is now living with a dragon-shifter. Oh my goodness! Nope, not one little bit! But maybe Stonefire Protector Nikola Gray can change his mind or just give Rafe a much needed attitude adjustment like a swift kick in the pants. Oh no! Oh yes! Nikki and her young dragon are both very much attracted to Rafe Hartley and have been ever since she saw him while serving in the military. He's the only man, human or dragon, to whom she's ever been attracted. And in the words of Nikki's dragon, "Young dragons need sex and kisses. Find me some!" I love Nikki's dragon! But Nikki has to be careful. She's tired of only being known as the first born from a human sacrifice. She wants to earn the respect of her clan and helping Kai take down the dragon hunters would be a great way to start. Besides, humans are too complicated and fragile, something she certainly doesn't have time for right now not to mention the fact that it's not allowed. What? It's been four years since she's seen Rafe and her dragon is still driving her crazy about him. Female dragon shifters can rarely recognize their true mates until they kiss the male and her dragon is determined for Nikki to manipulate Rafe into kissing her! Oh my goodness! According to their laws, it's Nikki's duty to mate with another dragon in order to produce a dragon-shifter child. Rafe and Nikki can never be together, could they?  Not with his attitude! It looks like love is in the air at Stonefire! It's a war of wills at Stonefire and I can hardly wait to see who wins.Part Four: Kai has finally recovered from his injuries and has been cleared for duty by Dr Sid. She has also cleared him for certain other activities as well. Umm.... I'm sure you get the picture as to what the "other activities" are. It seems both Kai and his dragon are totally enthralled with the beautiful Jane and are determined to have her in their home, their heart and in their bed. Oh my! And Jane definitely wants not only Kai but she also wants his dragon on board as well. The risk of seeing Maggie and succumbing to the pull of his true mate worries Jane. It would break her heart if she gives up everything for Kai only to be left holding an empty bag and broken heart. As their physical relationship explodes into one of fiery passion, their  understanding and trust between them also grows into something much more substantial and lasting than just heated attraction and lust. After both reveal their past shortcomings, heartaches and hurdles, they each realize how deeply they each feel for their family, their clan and each other. And yes, it is definitely now Jane's clan as well. But will it be enough to cement their future together?  In the meantime, there are more serious matters to consider - like surviving their enemies. And as always, Jane has a plan for luring the Dragon Knights into revealing themselves and hopefully being captured by the DDA. Oh yes, when does Jane not have a plan? But will it be good enough that Bram will give the go ahead and will they be able to stop the Dragon Knights for good? Will Jane be willing to trust Kai and his dragon and take a chance on a future at Stonefire? Can Kai's dragon find happiness with Jane? Will Jane give up her career and come to live permanently at Stonefire with Kai? Will the DDA ever allow it? Will Kai be able to protect Jane and his clan from the dragon hunters and the Dragon Knights? Does Rafe remember Nikki and is he even attracted to the beautiful, courageous Stonefire Protector? Will Rafe be able to help Stonefire and protect his sister from harm? Hmmm...I wonder??? No spoilers from me but I will say this....Beautiful determined reporter-check! Handsome head protector dragon-shifter-check! One very randy and exceedingly stubborn dragon-check! A possessive, pig-headed, domineering big brother in the special forces who is determined to protect his sister-check! A beautiful young dragonwoman determined to earn the respect of her clan-check! A large, diverse and very intriguing cast of characters-check! Danger, suspense, adventure and heinous enemies galore-check! Heated attraction, fiery passion, sexy banter, a little self imposed angst and some steamy dreamy sex with a hot hunky dragonman-you bet! And the icing on the cake - many of our favorite characters from Jessie's earlier series make an appearance and lend a helping hand. That and a whole lot more!!! Save a dragon - ride a dragon-shifter! Deliciously cute, seriously sexy, fabulously funny, completely captivating and delightfully entertaining. Fabulous entertainment and an awesome read!Complimentary copy received in exchange for an honest review.

Title: You've Got TailSeries: Peculiar MysteriesDesignation: Book One, Standalone Novel, NO CliffhangerAuthor: Renee GeorgeGenre: Paranormal Romance/Comedy/MysteryMy Rating: FIVE DIVINELY ENTERTAINING STARS*****YOWZA!!! Renee George hit the ground running with You've Got Tail, the first fabulous, fun-filled novel in her spectacular new series, Peculiar Mysteries. Yes siree! This isn't my first rodeo with Renee George so I know to expect the unexpected but I must say, she even surprised me with this one. George exploded out of the starting gate, put the pedal to the metal and screamed down the straightaway all the way to the finish line. I was completely out of breath by the time I reached the end. I laughed, giggled, chuckled, snorted, sniffled, snickered, snuffled, sobbed, sniveled, howled, hiccuped and guffawed through the entire book without even the first hint of boredom, apathy, impassivity or dissatisfaction. By the end of the book, I was bawling like a six year old who had just dropped my ice cream cone. Yep, it was that good! And who in the world said paranormal romance couldn't be funny and mysterious? Well, whoever it was didn't send Renee George the memo because You've Got Tale is not only romantic, sweet, sexy and passionate, it's also hilarious and a magnificent whodunit! Move over Melinda Gordon, there's a new ghost whisperer in town and her name is Sunny Haddock! The story is exciting, original, well crafted, humorous, suspenseful, romantic and sweeter than honey. And did I say hot? Oh yeah! It has lots of action, in and out of the sheets! Hubba! Hubba! The narrative is exceptionally well written in the first person with the story being told by none other than the fabulously funny protagonist, Sunny Haddock. The dialogue is smart, sassy, snarky, snappy, witty, hilarious, well executed and flows effortlessly. Personally, I think Sunny would also make a phenomenal stand-up comedian, if she could take time off from giving psychic readings to all her new friends in Peculiar. And speaking of friends, the characters in this lively tale are simply magnificent! They are fascinating, captivating, engaging, endearing and laugh-out-loud funny. By the end of the book, I felt as if I personally knew every single character and Sunny, well, she was  glorious; she literally sparkled. Heck, I even fell in love with the ghosts! I may have had the slightest girl crush on Judah. Okay, it was more than a little girl crush but in my defense, he was completely adorable. George skillfully combines these elements into a divinely entertaining paranormal tale filled to the brim with danger, drama, suspense, mystery, murder, kidnapping, comedy and romance. Oh, and did I mention sex? Yep, it has a little of that too. What didn't I like about this book? Not a darn thing!With a name like Ambrosia Sunshine Haddock, Sunny never had a chance at a normal life. No siree! So, it didn't come as much of a surprise when Sunny realized she was a psychic, more or less. Well, mostly less, that is until she arrived in Peculiar, Missouri searching for her former roommate, best friend and future business partner, Chevvah "Chav" Trimmel. Chav had left the shores of sunny California and made the trip to Peculiar two years prior when her younger brother, Judah disappeared. Chav had fallen in love with Peculiar and its town folk. In fact,  she invited Sunny to join her in opening a vegetarian restaurant in the small town. Chav had even named it Sunny's Outlook. How sweet! Two weeks prior to her scheduled moving date, Sunny receives a mysterious text from her bestie Chav simply stating "Sunny. I need u." Oh my! And now, Chav has disappeared too! Oh no! Yep, gone without a single trace. Well, get ready Peculiar, 'cause here comes animal-loving, strictly vegetarian, squeamish-at-the-sight-of-blood, not-so-sunny, Sunny Haddock and she's loaded for bear! And squirrel and coyote and werewolf and raccoon and deer and anything else that gets in her way. She's hell-bent on finding her friend and she will not rest until she does. She has no time for distractions from Chev's hot, handsome younger brother, Babel "Babe" Trimmel, who seems determined to either wrestle her into bed or run her out of town! Huh? Whatever! Babe may be more irresistible than crack on a cupcake but she refuses to buckle under pressure! Except, in bed of course. Oh, and all the other wonderful town folk want her gone too! What the heck? Well, she may faint at the sight of blood, especially her own, but never let it be said that Sunny Haddock is meek of heart or short on courage. She's staying! And they can't make her go! Can they ?!? Can Sunny solve the missing persons mystery and will she be able to find Chav before it's too late? I'll never tell! No spoilers from me but I will say this...Beautiful, sassy human psychic-check! Handsome, determined werecoyote-check! Large cast of unforgettable characters including the ghosts-check! An adorable ghost coyote-check! Danger, drama, murder, suspense, puzzling disappearances, heinous villains and a mystery only Sunny can solve-check! Fun, laughter and quite a few giggles-check! Heated attraction, fiery passion and a blazing hot romance between an older psychic and a younger man/coyote-you bet! That and a whole lot more! Deliciously cute, fabulously funny, seriously sexy, completely captivating and divinely entertaining!!! Hands down, one of the best books I've read this year! This is a standalone novel with NO cliffhanger with a wonderfully written happy for now ending and by that I mean, George leaves the door wide open for future adventures for psychic, not-so-sunny Sunny with her younger man at her side and in her bed!Complimentary copy received in exchange for an honest review.

Title: Redeem the WolfSeries: Wolf Valley RaidersDesignation: Book One, Standalone Novella, NO CliffhangerAuthor: Harmony RainesReading Platform: Kindle UnlimitedMy Rating: FIVE DELIGHTFULLY HEARTWARMING STARS *****Harmony Raines has dazzled her readers yet again with another brand new series and folks, it totally rocks! Redeem the Wolf is the first book in Raines' heartwarming new Wolf Valley Raiders Series and WOW! She's outdone herself - again! I love it! I'm always amazed by the range of emotions I seem to experience while reading a Harmony Raines' story. She never fails to evoke a perfect mixture of sadness, heartache, happiness, joy and yes, sometimes even anger over an injustice suffered by one of her characters. Some writers are born with a natural ability as a storyteller and Harmony Raines has been blessed with this talent in spades. She always knows exactly how to tug on our heartstrings, tickle our funny bone and warm our hearts with sweet romance and fated love. The story is well crafted, unique, heartwarming, passionate, sensual and romantic. The narrative is well written in the third person with alternating his and her points of view by chapter. As always, the dialogue is extremely well executed and flows seamlessly. The characters are captivating, engaging, endearing and relatable. Raines skillfully combines these elements into a delightfully entertaining paranormal romance that will satisfy your sweet tooth and melt your heart! This is a sweet, sexy, feel-good romance that will warm your heart and make you smile.We first met wolf shifter Kurt as the villain in Snowbound With The Bear. In order to gain rank within the pack, he made a selfish bid for power by offering his cousin Fiona up as a trade to an unscrupulous tiger shifter seeking a virgin mate. Unfortunately, his plan didn't work out so well and as a result, he became trapped in a snowstorm in the mountains and in order to survive, he had to remain in his wolf form. When Kurt was finally rescued, he was too weak to shift and became locked in his wolf form which can easily happen when a shifter remains too long as their animal. It can also affect their mental stability and Kurt had to be hospitalized. His only hope for recovery lies in the hands of one beautiful woman who seems to work miracles for patients with this special problem. His sanity now rests on a woman whose face and scent has haunted him for months. He knows she must be real - she has to be and he doesn't even know her name. The only thing he knows for sure is she ran from him but he must find her, and soon, or he may just lose his mind - again. He nor his wolf may be able to survive without her because she is his true mate. Oh my! Obviously, a human doctor could be of no use at all but nurse Nadine Dury isn't strictly human. Huh? Oh no, Nadine is fully aware that she isn't fully human and desperately feels the pull of the mating call. She is undeniably drawn to Kurt and the pull is getting stronger every day but for his sake, she must remain strong and stay away from him. She's an imposter. How could he ever love someone like her? Or something like her? She doesn't even know what she is and she can never allow anyone to learn her secret. But will Nadine be able to deny her fate? I'll never tell. No spoilers from me but I will say this....Beautiful, kind-hearted nurse who seems to be able to help everyone except herself-check! Handsome wolf shifter who experiences a life changing revelation and is now willing to do whatever it takes to find his true mate-check! A mysterious vicious wolf intent on claiming something that does not belong to him-check! A town in trouble and in need of an alpha-check! Heartbreaking angst-check! Heated attraction, fiery passion, sweet romance and fated love-check! And Raines even includes two wonderful life lessons at no extra charge. One, you can never outrun your fears nor your fate and two, with the right motivation, anyone can change their stars. I loved it! Deliciously heartwarming and delightfully entertaining!

DELICIOUSLY SINFUL, DELIGHTFULLY WICKED AND DIVINELY ENTERTAINING !!!Title:What He WantsSeries: What He WantsDesignation: Book One of Multi-Installment Serial, Not a Standalone, Includes CliffhangersAuthor: Hannah FordHeat Level: RED HOTMy Rating: FIVE DIVINELY ENTERTAINING STARS *****Wow! I'm in love with this series! In fact, I love it so much that I wanted to share my review for the first three books in Hannah Ford's seductively dark serial, What He Wants. Oh yes, I did say serial which means multiple installments and dare I say it - cliffhangers. Yikes! Personally, I love a great white-knuckle, hold-your-breath cliffhanger but to each his own, right? For me, it's  like watching my favorite weekly television drama but don't let that discourage you. Hannah never leaves us hanging. She releases a riveting new installment once or twice a month like clockwork. Originally, I read each installment as it was released under the Kindle Unlimited program but you don't have to wait. Ford has released sixteen books in the series to date and the icing on the cake, they're all available under the Kindle Unlimited program! Woo Hoo! This collection is the compilation of the first three books in the series, What He Wants, What He Craves and What He Demands. It's the perfect way to dip your toe and test the water. This series totally rocked my world and I'm sure you'll love it as well! It has a little bit of everything to suit almost everyone! Each successive release becomes more interesting, exhilarating and enticing. The story is exciting, thrilling, compelling, powerful, mysterious, suspenseful, intense, romantic, arousing, sensual and steamy. Whew! That's a real mouthful but those are only a few of the words that came to mind while reading this story. The narrative is exceptionally well written in the first person with alternating his and her points of view. Yum  - my favorite! The dialogue is smart, snappy, well executed and flows effortlessly. The characters are fascinating, captivating, engaging, intriguing and sexy as sin. Ford skillfully combines these elements to create a dark, compelling and seductive tale filled to the brim with murder, mystery, suspense, secrets, deceit, betrayal, intrigue, passion, romance and plot twists that will blow your mind. And did I mention BDSM and toe-curling sex? No? Oh yes, it's also included. Yowza!Law student Charlotte Holloway may only be 21 but she has worked tirelessly to gain favor with her law professor and now she finally has the long awaited opportunity to prove her worth. She has been assigned to work with him on a very high profile murder case. The client is  none other than Noah Cutler, a very powerful and sought after attorney himself. But at her first meeting with the new client, she realizes that Noah is her mysterious one time hookup from the bar the previous night. Huh? What the heck? And as women connected to Noah continue to turn up dead, Charlotte is drawn deeper and deeper into his life and his world of BDSM. And it seems that Noah Cutler has plans for Charlotte. But what are his motives and what plans does he have in store for the lovely Charlotte? Will Charlotte become another victim? Oh my! Sexy dominant attorney-check! Beautiful submissive law student-check! Danger, drama, murder, mystery, betrayal, intrigue and suspense-check! Heated attraction, fiery passion, powerful romance and steamy sex-you bet! That and a whole lot more! It's one hell of a great ride!. Fabulous entertainment and an awesome read!

Strong bags - that's what you get with the Hefty Ultra Flex.If there is one thing I would like different from this one is more bags in the box. 14 is a strange number - maybe it's so you can use one per day and get through two weeks, but I don't go through that much trash.Aside from that, these bags are perfect for a variety of needs - but two specifically that I've been really pleased with.First, recycling. We tend to have more recycle than trash, because we're pretty picky about making sure trash is actual trash and has no possibility of recycling. That's mostly food waste that doesn't get composted, or things that are clearly not going to be recycled. That means we have a TON of plastic, paper, and metal that needs to get stored for two weeks before the recycle bin gets picked up. The hefty ultra flex provides a HUGE amount of storage room for these things, and it does tear even when we put in cardboard boxes or metal cat food cans with sharp lids. It's easy to tie up and then easy to throw into the recycle bin. And it has TONS of stretching room - you can really fill it up.Second, yard waste gathering. If you live in an area that requires you to put yard waste in a bin, that can sometimes be a pain especially if you have lots of leaves or small branches to gather up. These bags are perfect and reusable to scoop up yard waste, dump it in the bin, then go back for more. The reusability of bags without them tearing apart is great - and you'll find that several trips can be made using the same bag - then use the bag for regular trash or recycle and you're good to go. I hate having a bunch of waste and we try to reuse things as much as we can - so why not your "trash" bag?Overall a solid 5 star product which is strong, durable, flexible, reusable, and is now on my subscribe and save list every single month.

What you get: a KIND Healthy Grains popped dark chocolate with sea salt snack bar, which is gluten free, non-GMO, and contains 6 super grains.The product is called a "granola bar" but don't expect it to be as thick as your typical granola bar. This one is pretty flat and more square shaped, which personally I think helps make it easier to chew than a granola bar. The taste is pretty mild actually - it doesn't overwhelm with chocolate or sea salt. It doesn't taste like it's filled with sugar (good - in fact sugar is way down on the ingredient list), and it's got a nice texture. I ate the entire bar in one sitting (it's only 1.2 oz so it's not like you're eating a meal).Since I'm regularly looking for gluten-free snack options - this one actually works quite well. For an afternoon snack when I'm feeling peckish but don't want to be overwhelmed with sweet - this works. I would like a bit more of a bold chocolate and sea salt flavour, but it does seem to go well with all the whole grains and doesn't make me feel like I'm eating candy.I will give this a solid 4 stars - and would purchase it for regular healthy snack use.

What you get in the box:Carrier top (including top access door) & bottomFront gated door12 screws and nuts (you will only use 6 in the assembly)Instruction papersLots of plastic and tapeA note on shipping: On my particular order it took one month to arrive. Generally I don't see amazon products taking this long - so it has taken me some time to get the product and prepare a review.The product seems well-tooled. The top and bottom sections fit into each other with only minimal effort, and the instructions are easy to follow to get them connected. Putting the front door on is easy to do and the mechanism has gentle moving springs that allow for one handed front-door operation (I point this out because nothing else on this carrier can be done with just one hand).After fitting the top into the bottom and connecting the front door, you'll fold down the four plastic flaps on the sides and lock them into place. This seems to be an unnecessary component to the product, as you will next be screwing the top into the bottom with six provided screws and nuts. In essence this gives you six screw-based locks and four plastic locks. Completely unnecessary and time consuming - and for those of you who want to take the carrier apart for easier storage, the screw-based locking is a showstopper.You will also see from the attached pictures that the screws are ridiculously hard to install - you have to push the nut into the bottom and hold it in place with a finger while you screw the screw in from the top side, making sure the nut doesn't fall out in the process. There are six of these to do - three on each side, however, you're provided 12 of them in the shipment, so I guess you can find another reason to use screws somewhere else.If you want the ability to remove the top from the bottom for easy storage DO NOT install the screws, otherwise you'll have to unscrew 6 of them just to dismantle the box for cleaning or storage. Based on what I've seen, using the four plastic locking tabs is sufficient for a medium or small cat to stay secure inside the box.Moving on to the top entrance door - this was a selling feature on the carrier so that you can load the pet in from the top or front. Problem is that it takes multiple hands and is not easy to open. On the top you'll see two spring-based levers that you have to pull forward. They do fit well into the recessed area, but unless you have tiny fingers they are not easy to get back out again. If you open one side then it opens like a door (vs. removing it completely from the top) which is nice, but the door doesn't stay open (keeps falling back closed) so you'll have to hold that open while trying to get your pet inside. This is a neat design in concept, but in actual use it's easier said than done.The front-loading door is what you would expect from a pet carrier. Works every time and opens and closes smoothly. I haven't had any issues getting a cat into and out of the front. On the top I find it easier to completely remove the top door vs. opening it from one side only.It's plastic so it's easy to wash out if your pet has a mess inside (which happens more often than not at our house). There are plenty of air vents all around the sides and top so your pet gets good air flow while traveling, but also some privacy. I generally put a small towel in the bottom of the carrier just to give them more comfort on a quick trip.So overall I'm taking two stars away for the product being very difficult to assemble, having unnecessary locking elements on the sides, being unable to very quickly take it apart for cleaning, and for the top door being difficult to manage whether removing completely or lifting a single side.I think there was some real possibility here for a clever product that allows flexibility in pet loading...but it seems overthought and overworked. I will continue to use it without the screw-based locking, and rarely using the top access door.

What you get: two "floral design" lace curtains.Opening the package is very easy. Unzip the top and pull the curtains out. They are wrapped around a long piece of folded cardboard and are easy to remove.As you are unwrapping them from the cardboard, the first thing you're going to notice is how insubstantial they are. It's basically white fishnet with a floral pattern. The scalloped edges are poorly cut/tooled and mine were already quite frayed right out of the package. The work appears sloppy. I assume it is done by machine...but it looks like the knives must have been dull the day that mine went through the factory. Bits of fabric on the sides and bottom are completely uneven and look a mess.The material has a bit of a waxy feel to it, but otherwise feels sort of like 1-ply toilet paper. The stitching around the edges is uneven, sloppy, and sad.Since they are lace - do not expect ANY amount of light coverage from these. They are barely there and will not provide any darkness for your room if that's what you're interested in. As for privacy, they don't offer privacy either.The curtain rod sleeve at the top is uneven and poorly stitched. I took a ruler and measured the width in random places across the top and found up to a 1/4th in variance back and forth all the way across. This is less noticeable once you put the curtains up - but given the other quality issues I'm not sure you're going to leave them up for very long.If you are looking for a cheap, poorly constructed, floral lace accent curtain then this might work for you. If you want quality, light coverage, privacy, or something that actual looks nice...move on to something else.

There's something very specific about this toothpaste that really sold it for me.That's usually hard to say - because it's toothpaste. After this many decades of products you really don't differentiate on anything other than texture and taste. They _all_ whiten your teeth. They _all_ are designed to remove plaque and stains. So companies seem to be almost desperate to switch things up so you'll buy a new product. Look, we all use toothpaste (well hopefully) and as long as you're using something consistently and seeing a dentist you should be fine.But...there is something that has always irritated me about many toothpastes and that is the texture and how it "holds up" to brushing. Frankly I don't care much about taste - mint is fine, coolness is fine, whatever is fine. But when I put the toothpaste on my toothbrush I want it to stay there and I want it to hold its consistency during the course of brushing and cleaning. That's where this product from Colgate shines for me.The product has a translucent white colour, with a texture unlike other pastes I've tried. This not only helps with brushing, but also with making the tube itself more clean. I haven't noticed any glops of toothpaste clinging to the dispenser. Every other toothpaste in a squeeze tube is a MESS - but this one isn't. The consistency of the paste keeps it from sticking and glopping to the container - and that's winning for me.When I put it in my mouth it doesn't immediately break up and fall out into the sink. It holds together and clings to my teeth for brushing. Again, winning. I feel like I'm wasting less of this product to the sink, and keeping more of it in my mouth for brushing.I do realize that differentiating a toothpaste seems a bit strange these days - but this is a product I can actually say I would get again for no other reason than the texture/consistency of the product. Yes it has a great (and light) minty coolness - but the selling point for me is that translucent white solid texture, which means less mess, and better mouthfeel for brushing.This one gets a full five stars from me.

What do you get?A large tablecloth that will fit many sizes of table but is designed for a larger one since it's 70x84 inches.I put this on a smaller 4x3 tall table and it draped pretty far down the sides. That's great when you are using it for serving with guests over, but for sitting at the table for normal dining it's a bit too large and lays on your lap while you sit. That's not the fault of the tablecloth, it's just something to be aware of if you don't use this on a table large enough to accommodate 70x84 inches of fabric.The most important thing for me is easy cleanup with a variety of spills. That could be random bits of food, oil from a salad dressing, or the always enjoyable wine spill. These things do happen, and getting a moist cloth to quickly wipe it up is generally good for this tablecloth. It also holds up well in the washer.After several cycles, it has always come out with minimal wrinkles (I don't like using fabric softener with a tablecloth since it's going to be right where my food is), and I have not noticed any pulling or stretching of the fabric. Doesn't seem to be shrinking in the wash (I always wash on cold), and even with a colour-safe non-chlorine bleach it holds the colour (which in this case is a sort of shiny blue patterned look).The best use for this particular tablecloth, for me, is in outdoor use on a 6 foot table. It provides good coverage and looks nice in the spring because of the bright blue. You can then just shake it off (if you haven't spilled anything major on it) and fold it up for the next time.Overall a solid product, so I'm giving it 4 stars for looks, ability to do quick cleanup, and its durability in the washing machine and dryer over the course of several cycles.

Here's what you get: 4 delightful, crystal clear glasses for daily use and entertainment.Here's what I think: They work!The Food and Wine for Gorham glasses are a nice, elegant, sophisticated touch for your daily use or for having guests over to enjoy a tall glass of lemonade or tea. With a sturdy base, and solid glass construction, the glasses fit well in the hand and hold a nice dinner-sized glass of liquid. In terms of stability they sit well on a table and with the bottom portion slightly wider than the top I have not had any concerns about accidentally tipping over and spilling on the table.Washing these in the top rack of the dishwasher presents no problem, and they clean nicely to a sparkle finish. After repeated use and repeated washing I haven't noticed any loss of luster or transparency in the glass, nor have I seen any scratching or marring of the finish.Overall a solid 4 stars for these glasses.

Freshness abounds in the Irish Spring Signature Exfoliating Bar Soap (try typing that three times fast).What do you get?A pack of three large soap bars which are described as "man sized" - which basically means they are hearty.What do they smell like?Irish Spring.Yep - the product smells just like the wonderful green version of soap - it's a crisp scent that takes you back to the waterfalls of Ireland (are there waterfalls in Ireland?) and with a peppery man-scent aftertaste. But seriously, there's really no scent like Irish Spring - it's been one of my fav scents of soap since Lava soap of years gone by.And speaking of Lava soap...what differentiates this Irish Spring product from the rest is the "exfoliating scrub" element - oak that gives your skin a light abrasive cleaning and really gets those dead skin cells off and down the drain. It feels good going on and isn't rough on the skin - but still feels manly, whatever that means.After using the soap (if I can get practical for just a moment) I noticed that the pleasing scent lingers for a while after showering. It sort of doubles as body spray / cologne but in a much nicer way. Personally I like the fresh smell that lasts through the first part of my day. It's kind of a just-showered smell...and it's especially nice to use if you shower just before bed, because you're going to crawl under the sheets and drift off into a pleasant waterfall-like dream-state as you're transported to the Emerald Isle...I'm getting carried away here.Overall a solid product from Irish Spring and I will definitely be buying MORE of this great soap. Solid 4 stars!

What you get:Numi tea K-cups in the flavour of Moroccan MintThe positive:Aroma - the tea smells wonderful during brewing and as you're enjoying the product. The minty smell is pleasing while not overpowering. I've had mint tea before that can double as a decongestant - this tea doesn't. It's mild and pleasing but not overwhelming or what I would describe as "powerful mint" scent.What concerns me:There's a lot of plastic waste in these cups. Inside the translucent cup you'll see the small tea bag. If you look at some of the better coffee pods for Keurig style machines you'll find some that do not use a plastic cup at all - it's just the coffee inside a mesh filter. There is no real practical reason for these cups to have the plastic "shell" - they only need the tea bag style interior and your results will be identical. That's because the water isn't hanging out inside the cup steeping...it's being pressurized right through it into your tea cup or mug. So to me, there's a lot of waste here because most people won't take the time to follow the printed instructions to remove the foil top and recycle the plastic. People are going to just grab it and toss it.I also have to agree with many other reviewers that the tea is VERY weak. I've tried it on small, medium, and large and the taste is just above flavoured water. Now, I don't always have to have strong tea, but you can get the same quality by putting a few fresh mint leaves in hot water and steeping them. There doesn't seem to be much added value in this product beyond what you can do yourself with a fresh sprig of mint and water.If you're looking for a bold tea, this isn't it. If you're looking for a very mild mint-ish tea, then this will work fine for you. I'm giving this product a middle of the road rating not because of the strength of the tea (because YOU might prefer the more mild style) but for the product waste as the primary detractor of one star.

What you get:3 products in one package: Acne deep scrub, Spot/Blemish control, and a "Mattifier"The deep scrub is meant for daily cleansing for your entire face / neck; the spot zinger is to put specifically on a blemish; the mattifier is a lotion-like product designed to minimize visible pores.Let's start with the packaging - it's not frustration-free.Each of the containers inside the box is attached and held in place by a 1"x1" sticky piece of foam. The products are difficult to remove from the box and get away from the stick foam, and in the case of the mattifier container I was left with foam still stuck to the bottom of the product when I finally got it out of the box. I'm not sure that I've ever seen product packaging this unfriendly. The packaging doesn't impact the function of the product, but it's important to note that you will not have an easy time removing them from the box.Product 1 - Acne Hater Deep ScrubThis is a greenish gel product that smells sort of like fruit cocktail with mint. You get your warm water going, and massage it all over your face and neck. I've done this both in the shower and at the sink. The product smells very nice and goes on easily. The abrasives in the gel are just the right texture so as to provide the scrubbing power, but not feel like you're scratching your face. It was easy to work up into a light lather and then wash off in warm water. My preference is to do this in the shower so that I can completely wash it off my face. At the sink it took a lot more time.After finishing, the scent remained and was pleasant, and my face had a cooling sensation.Product 2 - Spot ZingerThis is a white thick cream in a small tube that you put directly onto blemishes. It's go salicylic acid just like every other acne or pimple treatment out there. It goes on clean and massages in without an oily residue. In terms of product performance I always compare these things to Burt's Bees Blemish Stick, which is a product that I have a constant stock of because it's just that darn good. Burt's Bees will get rid of a blemish is less than 24-hours in most cases. This product does seem to work well but took a little longer to clear up a spot I had on my face as compared to my preferred product. It didn't fail...it just wasn't as fast or effective. It didn't have a negative smell - but I guess smelled like many other acne creams on the market.Product 3 - Swirled MattifierI've never heard this term before. Basically what it's supposed to do is reduce redness and pores so that your skin looks smoother and shiny and whatever the heck mattifier really means. My nose has some visible pores so that's where I started. This is a pump bottle with a thick white cream that is the consistency of a typical face / skin lotion. It went on smoothly (and it's recommended you use it directly after using the cleaner and spot zinger - thus the 1-2-3 system). I didn't notice an immediate decrease in my pores but I guess they were a bit less visible. It wasn't significant enough for me to say there was immediate effectiveness. I will say that my skin remained smooth and the product was not oily or greasy. From the lotion perspective it went on easily and didn't make me feel like I was caked in product. That's good.Overall I would say this is a solid product line. My favourite product of the 3 is the deep scrub because of the very pleasant and not overpowering scent, the ease of use and removal, and the way my skin tingled when it was done. In terms of the blemish fighting components - they work...but so do most other acne products on the market so I'm not sure how to differentiate those from the rest.I suppose that as a "system" these work well together in a 1-2-3 format. You can do it in less than five minutes and be on your way without anyone knowing that you have a bunch of product on your face. High marks for staying non-greasy and non-oily, and for the light scent that actually seems to work well.I give these products a solid 4 stars (but the packaging gets a fail).

5:58 Mins Got this product to test and I must say I was very impressed with it's quality and ease of use.  It's well built and the extra features mean I don't have to carry so much in my pockets all the time.  What a great idea.  And it doesn't get hot when you use the cigarette lighter either.  Very convenient.

This is the best bottle made since the original Thermos came out year ago.  It keeps things colder than cold even during the hottest day.  I left it in my car while shopping at the local mall.  When I returned to my car, the bottle was warm on the outside, but the water inside was just as cold as when I got it out of the fridge before I left my house.  Amazing.  I'm going to get a couple more.

We have a young rescue dog that still has "accidents" in the house.  This works great to remove the smell and clean up the mess very easily.  We are going to make sure we have plenty on hand until she gets into the schedule of appropriate bathroom time.
Wouldn't' have my Apple Watch on my wrist without a glass screen protector on it.  This works great.  Fits perfectly.
I always keep some in my emergency survival kits in both our cars and house.  Great addition to our kits.
This is great to keep in my garage to check my tire pressure.  Very accurate and heavy duty.  The best one out there.
I love these because they are so easy to keep clean.  No nooks or hidden areas where dirt and grime can hide.  Love them.
Getting rid of all the dry skin and callouses from my feet was always an issue, but not anymore.
I have bad dandruff, but this product does what it says and moisturizes both my hair and my scalp.  No more dandruff.
This is so easy to install and you don't realize that it's even on.  But it protects the aluminum case of my Apple Watch perfectly.
Who knew something so small would have such a great sound.  I was skeptical, but so very pleasantly surprised by this player.

We hated our old regular garden hose.  This is awesome... So quick to expand and just as fast to coil back up.  Space-saving too.  and I love the hook that comes with it so you can hang it up on the faucet while not in use.  Great design.
This works great on my feet and also on my elbows too.  No more rough spots anymore.
Got this for my aunt's birthday.  What a perfect gift.  She never takes it off now...
These work just as described.  They can get to all those tight muscles and then some...
Got this for my wife's PSP.  She had one before, sold it and then got another one... This case if just perfect.
Got this for my mother-in-laws new puppy.  She loves it when she's walking her in the evening time... So much easier to see her and for them to be seen.
Just what I needed to power all of my USB devices.  Very good construction.  Way heavier than I expected.  Nice and solid unit.
Love me some Dr Who and Funko is the best... Now the two combined are Awesome...
Great Read

Very heavy duty and easy to use at the same time.  I gave them to my brother who power lifts and he loves them due to the ease and quickness he can change out the plates on his bar.  Much faster than the conventional collars.
These are so comfortable and easy to wear.  I always seem to lose other headsets because they won't stay in my ears.  These stay in perfectly and are easy to use and charge.  The color is great also.

This thing is way more comfortable than I ever thought it would be.  It is the memory foam I'm sure.  I put it on while sitting down watching my favorite show and fell asleep while wearing it.  How's that for a testimony.
