Additionally, the bowls are dishwasher safe and I have washed these a few times in my dishwasher and they looks just as beautiful as they did coming out of the box; the images on the bowls don't peel off or chip with multiple uses and washings. These are not microwave, freezer, or oven safe however.This is such a beautiful and elegant set and I'm looking forward to using the set for years to come. They are definitely worth the price!

My 3 year old loves My Little Pony and Rainbow Dash and was so excited to get this Glow Pony! Rainbow Dash is super soft and cuddly and measures about 11" long. She has shiny satin rainbow colored hair in the front and a long spike of hair in the back as well as little blue wings and a rainbow tail. Her cutie mark is on her bottom on the back and even the white part of her eyes are lightning bolts. Her face is cute, although they gave her a flat pig-like nose. On her back is a Velcro closure that houses the battery compartment (runs on 2 AA batteries that are included) and also the on/off switch. We've owned similar types of bedtime toys in the past that have Velcro closures that won't stay shut all the way, but this one does, so I'm pleased about that. A nice feature is that you can actually remove the battery compartment and machine wash Rainbow Dash if your child spills something on it.On her tummy is a large purple circle that when pressed will play 6 soothing songs, including the My Little Pony theme song. It's easy for a child to operate Rainbow Dash by his or herself by pressing the tummy; we've found that pressing it around the music note will turn it on, but pressing it anywhere else on ours doesn't turn it on. The belly glows a soft amber color that is bright enough to light up the area around the child, but not so bright that the child can't fall asleep. It has a replica of Rainbow Dash's cutie mark inside the tummy that lights up too. Since my daughter has been learning to sleep in her own bed, this has been a lifesaver because she's scared of the dark and it serves as a cuddly nightlight for her. I thought about getting her a GloWorm but when I saw this, I knew she'd love this one much more.One complaint is that the music plays really loud and there's no way to lower the volume; similar toys usually have a low and high volume setting, so I wish this one had the ability to play at a quieter volume, especially at bedtime because the loudness isn't conducive to falling asleep. Also, the music doesn't automatically shut off with a timer, which I find annoying because I always have to sneak in her room to turn it off and it will drain the battery quickly if it's running for such a long period of time. To turn it off, you just squeeze the tummy again and it makes a chime sound as you turn it off. Overall, this is a really cute bedtime pal for a young child and my daughter has enjoyed pushing it in her doll stroller and taking it wherever we go. It seems to be of high quality, minus the few flaws, and will surely be loved by any My Little Pony fan.

My preschooler has recently become interested in the solar system, more specifically the moon, and she loves this book. We've read it many times and it still holds her attention. This book gives many interesting facts about the moon and splits the information well between the pages so that there isn't too much text per page, including that it's 238,900 miles from Earth, that the moon influences the ocean tides, that many scientists feel that something collided with Earth that tossed rock and debris to form the moon, and information about its orbit. Other topics covered include solar and lunar eclipses, cultural legends about the moon, and information about previous voyages to the moon. My favorite part of the book is the simple explanation of the phases of the moon that even my daughter can understand.This is a very well written book and does a fantastic job explaining complicated concepts in easy to comprehend terms. The illustrations are eye catching, engaging, and very detailed and showcase the text well. I teach second grade as well and when we do our solar system unit, I always use this book to teach about the moon.

My 3 1/2 year old daughter loves My Little Pony, especially the My Little Pony blind bags, so I was so excited to surprise her with this Sweet Apple Acres barn. I ordered it online, but be warned that the product photo is very deceiving in regards to how big the barn looks. I was expecting a much bigger barn and was very disappointed that it is very small - only about 9" by 10." The front of the barn is beautifully detailed and colorful as are the accessory pieces that come with it, but I was also very disappointed that when you turn the barn around to see the inside of it, it is completely red and plain on both levels of the barn! No detailing at all. Granted that you can decorate the barn with some of the included accessories, but I was expecting colorful detail like the outside of the barn. The manufacturer needs to include a photo of the inside in the product photos so customers know what they are getting ahead of time.Despite my disappointment in its tiny size and lack of detailing inside the barn, my daughter loves it and has really enjoyed playing with it. I really love the accessories the set came with, including Granny Smith and Crimson Gala ponies (both are rare to find), the rocking chair, table, apple bushel, treats, picnic blanket, and squirrel. All of the accessories are adorable and very detailed. My daughter has so many of the blind bag ponies, which are about 2" tall, so they fit perfectly into the barn and are the same size as the included ponies. Be aware that the play set is designed for the blind bag sized ponies and not the larger pony figures. There are other members of the Apple family available for purchase separately. Overall, this is a really cute toy and has provided my daughter with hours of fun and any My Little Pony fan would love it!

I tried the Proactiv Acne treatment line years ago and found it to be too harsh on my skin, so I was sure this Dark Spot Correcting Serum would dry my skin out the way the older products did. However, this product is gentle and doesn't irritate or dry out my skin at all. In the box is a 1 ounce bottle of the serum in a sturdy glass bottle, which has a pump mechanism. Although the bottle is really small, it will definitely go a long way because you only need to press it down just a little to get enough out; don't press it down all the way because you'll get way too much as I did the first time. The active ingredient in this product is 2% Hydroquinone, which works as a skin lightener and it's supposed to work on acne scars, sun spots, liver spots, and age spots.I have a small sun spot on one side of my face and I've been using this product daily for a month and haven't seen any improvement in lightening the spot, so I'm disappointed about that. The bottle states that you should discontinue usage if you see no improvement in 3 months, which looks like it will be the case for me. One caution is that the box states that some spots become darker after using this and that your skin will be more sensitive to sunburn.  I did use it on an old acne scar and have seen that fade a small degree, but not as much as I'd hoped. I wonder if the gentler formula is the reason why it doesn't work very well. At this point, with very little improvement shown, I don't think this is worth the $50 price tag at all.

I bought this for my 3 1/2 year old Palace Pets fan and she loves it! Bloom measures close to 3" tall and she has a sparkly removable crown. Her body has embedded glitter inside, which is cool because not only does it make the pony sparkle, but it doesn't make a mess with glitter flaking off everywhere. Bloom's tail is a very sparkly fushia color, but the hair does get frizzy after playing with it for a while. My daughter's favorite feature is of course the fact that when you press the button on her side, she glows. My only complaint is that she doesn't stay lit up for long, only about 3 seconds, so I wish she'd light up longer. Overall, Bloom is very cute, well made, and a fun addition to any Palace Pets collection.

My 3 1/2 year old is obsessed with My Little Pony as well as these "blind bags" she discovered on a YouTube channel. In the blind bag, you get one approximately 2 1/2" tall pony and a trading card that tells you the name of the pony as well as a fact about that pony. The catch is that you don't know which pony is in the bag until you open it, so the element of surprise makes it super fun for her. There are 24 different ponies in this series, so you do have a chance of getting duplicate ponies, but also a good chance of getting the different ones. This series has a few of the staple ponies like Rainbow Dash, Pinkie Pie, and Apple Jack, but also lots of ponies from Sweet Apple Acres I had never heard of before like Apple Bumpkin, Uncle Orange, Sprinkle Stripe, and Apple Split.These have made great behavior incentives for my daughter and we enjoy playing with them and adding to her collection!

My daughter loves the "Wheels on the Bus" song, so when I found this Halloween version, she was thrilled. The illustrations are bright, colorful, and engaging. Even though there are monsters, witches, and ghosts in the book, they are drawn in a friendly way so as not to frighten a young child. She sings along with me as we read it and it holds her attention wonderfully. It definitely encourages active participation and also has a counting concept built into it for numbers 1-10. After we read it, I usually have my daughter help me count the cats, witches, monsters, etc. on each page to practice her counting skills or I'll ask her what colors certain objects are, so there's a lot of education value to the book as well as just being fun to sing along to.Some of the lyrics are : "One spooky bus goes rattle and shake, rattle and shake, rattle and shake. One spooky bus goes rattle and shake all through the town." "Three noisy cats go meow, hiss, hiss, meow, hiss, hiss, meow, hiss, hiss. Three noisy cats go meow, hiss, hiss, all through the town." "Ten goofy ghosts say, "Boo-oo-oo, Boo-oo-oo, Boo-oo-oo, Ten goofy ghosts say, "Boo-oo-oo all through the town."We enjoy the book so much that we bought another one for my daughter's preschool teacher to share with the class this Halloween. Very cute and interactive story/song!

This is the second board game from Educational Insights that I have purchased (the other was Sneaky, Snacky Squirrel) and I absolutely love the educational concepts and high quality pieces. You get the cute cut out shape box, which doubles as the playing board when you lift the lid, a pair of Frankie the Cat tweezers, a spinner, 4 place mats that show you the shapes you need to collect, and several foods of each shape (circle, square, rectangle, and triangle and one of each shape for the crescent, star, oval, and heart). I like that there is no assembly required because the company already attached the food cards to plastic pegs for you, so you can play as soon as you open it. The game is intended for ages 4 and up, but my 3 year old can play just fine. Also, it's for 2-4 players, but ours came with a fifth place mat by mistake I guess.The concept of the game is that you need to be the first player to help Frankie the Cat deliver all five courses of the meal using your shape recognition skills. My daughter already knows her shapes pretty well, so this is a really fun way to reinforce the concept of shapes as well as teach strategy skills for collecting the harder to come by shapes first like the crescent, heart, or star, for example, and also the strategy of taking the shapes you need from another player if you spin that option. To play, you spin and use the Frankie the Cat tweezers (which also helps with fine motor skills) to pick up the shape indicated. You can land on a circle, triangle, square, or rectangle and must take that shape; if you already have it, you can't do anything on that turn. You can also spin two "Chef's Surprise" options that allow you to pick a food that matches any of the four shapes pictured that you still need. You can spin a "Yuck! Fly in my Soup" option, which means you have to put back one of your foods. There's a lose a turn option as well as a "That Looks Delicious" option that allows you to take a food from another player that you need. One round can last about 10-15 minutes, especially if you keep losing your foods or keep spinning shapes you already have.I love how it takes this early math concept and makes it so fun that kids don't realize they are learning. Even at 3 years old, this game holds my daughter's attention through several rounds, up to 30 minutes all together. I love how thick the cardboard playing pieces are so I don't worry about them getting bent and torn like most other board games on the market. I continue to buy games from this company because of the educational value and the high quality construction. This game has become a family favorite of ours and we play it almost on a daily basis. Awesome learning game!

I purchased these tights to go underneath my My Little Pony Rainbow Dash Halloween costume, even though they are technically dance tights. For the cheap price of $2.99, I wasn't expecting these to be of good quality, but they are EXCELLENT quality. I was really worried as I was trying them on that I'd end up ripping them, but I have worn them a few times so far and they still have no tears at all. The material feels thin and is obviously stretchy, but the weaving of the material is so well done that they won't snag. I have washed them a few times and they still look as good as when I took them out of the package.Because they are one size fits all, the fit isn't going to be exact, but I expected that. I'm 5'6" and they were pretty long for me, so I had to hike them up high and fold the waistband down so they didn't bunch at the bottom. The only negative about them is that they are like old school highwaisted Granny Hose. Expect to have them hiked up pretty high. Mine were pulled up just below my chest under my costume to get the best fit, which isn't the most comfortable, but it worked. Overall, if you are looking for great quality but inexpensive tights in a variety of colors, these are an excellent choice!

My 3 1/2 year old daughter loves this set and has played with it nonstop since we got it. The set comes with a thick, sturdy storage tub with a snap on lid that stays shut even when the tub is dropped. I really like the storage tub because you can fit some extra play-doh molds and tools inside of it that didn't come with the set. The storage tub also makes it easy to travel with the set since it keeps everything together. This set comes with 5 small jars of Play-doh (2 shades of blue, red, purple, and yellow), a 4" hollow plastic dough roller, a dough extruder, a 4" "ruler" with 3 shapes on it, a 4.5" plastic knife, 3 fruit molds (strawberry, bananas, and a pear which also looks like a balloon). 3 large cutters (heart, circle, star), and 9 mini animal shape cutters, which measure about 3-4" long. The included animals are an alligator, cat, fish, cow, dog, giraffe, teddy bear, dolphin, and mouse.The Play-doh itself is of the standard expected quality and my daughter loves the extruder so she can watch the Play-doh ooze out of it when she presses it. The "ruler" shaped tool can slide onto the bottom of the extruder, which allows the dough to come out in that shape (moon, circle, or star). It is however, somewhat difficult to clean all of the dough from the inside of that. The roller is decent and works well, but I do wish it came with a rolling pizza cutter type of tool as well. I really love the shape cutters. They are made of plastic, but they are more than sturdy enough. When you roll out the dough, the thinner you roll the dough, the more likely it is that the shape won't hold, but if you roll it on the thicker side and press the cutters into the dough, it will hold shape much better and slice the dough perfectly and cleanly without the dough getting stuck inside the smaller crevices of the cutters. In fact, we haven't had to clean them or pick little dough bits out of the cutters at all. On the underside of the knife there is  a small birthday candle mold, which I don't like because when you press dough inside of it, the dough gets stuck in the crevices of the mold and around it and is hard to peel out. The fruit molds held shape well and were easy to peel the dough back out of.So far the set has provided us with hours of fun and she has fun making the animals and creating stories for them as she plays. If your child loves Play-doh and animals, this is an awesome set and we are very pleased with it.

My 3 1/2 year old daughter insisted on being Pinkie Pie for Halloween this year and since we always do family themed costumes, I was so excited to find this Rainbow Dash costume for myself. I wear a size 4, so I purchased a small in this costume and it fits perfectly! In the costume bag, you get a beautiful rainbow colored wig, the rainbow dress, felt wings, an ear headband, a colorful tail, and two blue hooves. The dress is very pretty and has a tulle skirt, but it is very short, so I suggest wearing some spandex shorts or solid turquoise tights underneath. I love how curly the wig is and it fits an adult head comfortably while hiding your real hair. It has 2 small hooks and eyelets inside so that you can adjust it to fit your head, however, the second one in my wig broke off immediately. Luckily, I could still adjust it. The hooves have elastic on the top so that they will stay put on your legs and hide your shoes. They hold shape decently and if you don't want them dragging on the ground, I'd position them so the bottom is just above your shoe soles or they'll get dirty and scuffed as you walk. The wings were a bit bent when I took them out, but you can reposition them; they have elastic loops to put your arms through and they are comfortable to wear.As adorable as this costume is, the quality factor is lacking on some aspects of the costume. The first thing I took out was the ear headband and the ears are just rubber super glued to the headband and as soon as I took them out, the glue on one of the ears was coming off, so the ear was half hanging off already. I had to hot glue it back on. Also, the cutie mark on the dress is literally stitched in two tiny places to hold it onto the dress so I can totally see it falling off, plus is was severely bent. The worst is by far the tail, which I don't plan to use because it comes with a huge safety pin and when you attach it to the back of the dress, it hangs limply from the weight of it and you can see the pin! Lastly, the dress had a small dirt stain right out of the bag. For the cost of the costume, they could definitely fix these imperfections.Overall, I do love the costume and it is a great value in that the costume is complete and you don't have to buy the wig or accessories separately. I'm excited to wear it this Halloween and also for my daughter's My Little Pony birthday party!

I bought these for my 3 1/2 year old daughter to use during her swim class and she really likes them. I researched many different brands and chose these because of the mainly positive reviews and I'm very glad I did. I love the blue and pink colors and most importantly, they don't allow water to leak in around the lenses and the lenses don't fog up. They are scented with a cherry scent which my daughter was excited about and the scent continues to last swim after swim without being overpowering.The only thing that I wish was better on these is the adjustable strap. I made them pretty tight on my daughter's head to keep the water from leaking in and after a while in the pool, the straps seemed to loosen and had to be readjusted. Overall, these are very well made and serve their purpose and I'd highly recommend them over other brands.

As a lifelong Cher fan, I have seen most of her concerts, movies, and specials, but I had never seen this one and I loved it! Filmed in 1991 at the Mirage Hotel, it features a show from the "Heart of Stone" tour. The DVD only features a couple songs each from 1987's "Cher" album and 1989's "Heart of Stone," so you will not get a retrospective of songs from her career prior to those albums, but you do get to see her take on several cover songs, which was an awesome treat. The cover songs include Gregg Allman's "I'm No Angel," The Eagles' "Take It To The Limit" (my favorite of her covers), Bob Seger's "Fire Down Below," and The Doobie Brothers' "Takin It To The Streets." Her own song listing includes "We All Sleep Alone," "Bang Bang," "I Found Someone," "If I Could Turn Back Time," "Perfection," and "After All." While this isn't a high production, visually spectacular concert like her Believe and Farewell tours, it is awesome none the less and features Cher at her best. She does do several costume changes, but they are much more understated than the aforementioned tour outfits.The DVD also has several bonus features, some of which are not interesting like "Cher's Big Blooper" which just shows her trying to sing with a faulty microphone, a TV commercial promoting the tour, and a photo gallery which literally has 6 photos from her show. The backstage home movies and "I Survived the 1990 Heart of Stone Tour" footage of her dancers and crew discussing Cher were interesting. I really liked the bonus performances, which include some cover songs: "Hold On," "Many Rivers to Cross," and Tougher Than the Rest." Cher actually introduces the performances and tells you how to use your DVD player remote to switch between her performances of these songs in 3 different settings: at the Mirage, in rehearsal, or on the actual Heart of Stone tour. When you switch between them, each version is slightly different. My definite favorite bonus feature is Cher performing my favorite of her songs "Heart of Stone" as a duet with Bon Jovi's Richie Sambora, who she was dating at the time.If you are a Cher fan, this is a must see performance and an excellent DVD concert to add to your Cher collection!

My daughter discovered these on a Youtube surprise toy video and she loves them! In each bag, there is a pet, an accessory for it to sit in, and an extremely tiny "deco bit" that has a peg on the end and fits into a hole on the accessory and/or pet. Note that these are VERY small and only measure between 1" and 1 1/4" tall and that for the price you are only getting ONE pet in the bag.The pets that we have gotten are really cute (a fox, a raccoon, an owl, and a porcupine), but are very easy to lose because of their size, so we store ours in her Littlest Pet Shop carrying case to prevent that. What we love most is the element of surprise with these blind bags because you have no idea what's inside until you open them, which really excites my daughter. There are 24 different pets within this blind bag series so your chance of getting a duplicate pet if you purchase multiple bags is less, but still a possibility.As much fun as these are, the deco bits are completely useless and have nothing to do with the type of pet (a porcupine came with a pencil deco bit), not to mention that the deco bits are like 1/8" long and were lost within 5 minutes. I'm giving these 4 stars for the useless deco bits, but mainly for the ridiculous current Amazon price of $9.33 for ONE tiny pet in ONE bag! I buy these at Target for $2.49, which is still a little pricey for how small it is, but they make great incentives for my daughter. Check a retail or toy store for these before you spend 3 times the actual price on these! Overall, they are fun to play with in the bigger Littlest Pet Shop and we love the element of surprise!

My daughter discovered these on a Youtube surprise toy video and she loves them! In each bag, there is a pet, an accessory for it to sit in, and an extremely tiny "deco bit" that has a peg on the end and fits into a hole on the accessory and/or pet. Note that these are VERY small and only measure between 1" and 1 1/4" tall and that for the price you are only getting ONE pet in the bag.The pets that we have gotten are really cute (a fox, a raccoon, an owl, and a porcupine), but are very easy to lose because of their size, so we store ours in her Littlest Pet Shop carrying case to prevent that. What we love most is the element of surprise with these blind bags because you have no idea what's inside until you open them, which really excites my daughter. There are 24 different pets within this blind bag series so your chance of getting a duplicate pet if you purchase multiple bags is less, but still a possibility.As much fun as these are, the deco bits are completely useless and have nothing to do with the type of pet (a porcupine came with a pencil deco bit), not to mention that the deco bits are like 1/8" long and were lost within 5 minutes. I'm giving these 4 stars for the useless deco bits, but mainly for the ridiculous current Amazon price of $7.17 for ONE tiny pet in ONE bag! I buy these at Target for $2.49, which is still a little pricey for how small it is, but they make great incentives for my daughter. Check a retail or toy store for these before you spend 3 times the actual price! Overall, they are fun to play with in the bigger Littlest Pet Shop and we love the element of surprise!

I bought this for my 3 year old My Little Pony fan and she likes the book and we've read it several times. The story is about Twilight Sparkle receiving a letter from the mayor saying that all the ponies are invited to the Equestria Games in Rainbow Falls. All the familiar ponies (Rainbow Dash, Applejack, Pinkie Pie, Fluttershy, Twilight, and Rarity) travel by train to get to Rainbow Falls, leaving Spike behind to take care of the animals. Twilight continues to read facts about Rainbow Falls to the others aloud as they explore the town and prepare for the games and she writes and sends postcards about what's going on to Spike. The Ponyville Flyers end up qualifying for a relay race in Crystal Empire, which is another book in the series.The illustrations are colorful and my daughter enjoys pointing out all the ponies in the pictures. The book includes some removable postcards as well similar to the ones Twilight sent to Spike. The book has a lot of text per page, about half the page in fact, so this book is more suited to an older child. My daughter likes it but has a hard time sitting through all the text before wanting to turn the page. I'm giving it 4 stars because I found the storyline to be a bit lacking and not very interesting, but if you have a My Little Pony fan, they'll enjoy it.

I bought this for my 3 year old after she fell in love with it at Target ($29.99 there, cheaper than the current Amazon price which charges $5.99 third party shipping on top of the base price) and she hasn't stopped playing with it since she got it! The carriage is so beautiful! It's made of semi sturdy plastic and has plastic gems embellishing the gold carriage; it has doors that open on both sides and comes with a white solid plastic horse. The horse has a blue set of reins that attach to it's face (they fall off frequently) and to a notch on its side and a pink set of reins that attach to hooks on the carriage so the horse can pull it. The carriage rolls easily across hard floors or carpets and can be used with the horse or alone since the reins detach. My daughter has used a variety of Barbie and Disney Princess dolls in the carriage and depending on the doll height, it can be hard to slide them in. Barbie type dolls around 11" tall will fit.As much as we love the carriage, I am slightly disappointed with certain parts of the construction. The doors feel flimsy and while you can open and close them, closing them isn't as smooth as it should be. We have to push the door sideways towards the front of the carriage and then snap it shut because the hinges doesn't line up exactly where they should. Also, on the back of the carriage, there is a clip and seat where you can let another doll ride once you clip its waist in, but this is also not easy to do. The clip is too small and hard to stretch open around a doll's waist. It requires more strength than a child has, which is frustrating for my daughter.Overall, this a beautiful carriage, despite the minor construction flaws, and lots of fun for a little girl to reenact the Cinderella story or to use with other dolls.

My 3 year old discovered these My Little Pony blind bags on a Youtube Channel and these blind bags have been an awesome incentive for potty training - she loves them! The ponies measure about 2 1/4" tall and are made of hard PVC plastic. Despite being so small, they are adorably detailed and colorful and my daughter enjoys the surprise of seeing which pony is in each bag since you don't know until you open it. Along with the more well known ponies like Pinkie Pie, Rarity, Rainbow Dash, and Twilight Sparkle, there are tons of new ponies we hadn't heard of like Lily Blossom, Fizzy Pop, and Sweetie Blue. There are 24 different ponies in this blind bag series, so while there is a chance of getting duplicates, you have a greater chance of getting different ponies if you buy multiples.Most of the ponies just have one cutie mark, but there are a few special ones (Rainbow Dash, Pinkie Pie, and Twilight Sparkle) who have cutie marks all over them. Each pack comes with the pony and a trading card that shows the pony's name and a line that tells you about the pony. We really love these and the only reason I'm giving them 4 stars is because the current Amazon price of $8.80 for ONE pony is ridiculous! I pay $2.49 for these at Target, which is still a little high considering how small it is. If you can get the better price, these are perfect for any My Little Pony fan and the element of surprise is lots of fun!

I bought this for a three year old and she is so thrilled drawing on it everyday. The kitty measures about 8" tall and comes with a plastic bottle to feed the cat with and ONE marker, so you'll want to buy an additional pack of the Doodle markers. The kitty is made of soft fabric and has white baby pins, hearts, bottles, swirls, and more drawn on the fabric. You can draw anything you want all over the kitty, bib, and bow. When you're ready to start over and clean it, you need to put it in a pillowcase and machine wash in cold water on the gentle cycle. I put it in the washing machine by itself because I don't want to risk the marker bleeding onto my clothes. You can tumble dry it on low or let it air dry and it really does wash completely clean and like new! We've washed ours several times and it hasn't shown any signs of fading or tearing, so it's really well made. My daughter loves taking it to bed and cuddling it before she draws on it again the next day. Awesome and fun way to allow creative expression!

I bought this for my daughter's third birthday and she loves it! When put together, the pool measures about 9 1/2" x 12" and has lots of beautiful detailing on it including textured swirls across the top of the pool wall, Barbie logos and bows on the plastic umbrella, and blue and pink tile design on the sides of the pool. You can easily fit 4-5 Barbies in it. The pool has a pop in hard plastic umbrella, hard plastic bench for the Barbies to sit on, and a gorgeously designed ladder and slide. Adult assembly is required and takes about 10 minutes to snap all the pieces together. The instructions are only pictures and the one part I had an issue with was on the white part of the ladder. When you put that together, there is an "L" for the left side and an "R" for the right side written really tiny on it, which I didn't realize at first, so make sure you have them on the correct side. I really like the embedded glitter on the slide and the dolls slide easily down it and into the pool.The pool also comes with two little plastic drinks that you can snap into the holes on the side of the pool. My one complaint about the pool is that the pool itself is made of a vinyl plastic instead of hard plastic. I wish that it was made of hard plastic because I'm always worried that it'll tear and leak from constant use. So far it's holding the water just fine and not leaking, but a hard plastic would be much sturdier and damage resistant. Overall, we really love the pool and it's lots of fun!

This is such a gorgeous dress and very reminiscent of the 80s Barbie dresses I had for my dolls as a kid, so I got it for my daughter's Barbie. The dress is hot pink and the bodice has embedded sparkles in it and ruffles on the bust trim and on the front of the skirt. It has a velcro closure on the back and comes down about an inch below her bottom. The outfit also comes with a little gray clutch bag with a loop that fits snugly around Barbie's hand and very beautiful gray "ruffled" high heel stilettos. Well worth the price in style and quality!

I bought this Beach Raquelle doll to go with the Barbie pool I bought my daughter for her birthday. She measures about 12" tall and is made of hollow plastic because she can be placed in water. I like that her makeup is tastefully done and not trashy looking like so many dolls on the market today; she's just wearing light pink lipstick and eyeshadow. Her bikini is really pretty and doesn't take too long to dry when she gets wet in the water. The suit is easily removable when you want to change her into different Barbie dresses and clothes. I love that Mattel is making dolls with more diverse looks than blonde hair and blue eyes.Raquelle's arms and legs don't bend, but you can move them up and down, sit her down, and move her arms out to the side as well. Her hair is very pretty and curls in the back, but after getting wet and air drying several times, it becomes frizzy and tough to brush through. Overall, this is a beautiful and well made doll who is worth the price.

I bought this for my 3 year old daughter's LeapPad 2 and she really enjoys playing with it and I love all the educational value in it! This game is designed for pre-readers and beginning readers ages 3-5 and works on a lot of skills including letter recognition, letter sounds, phonemic awareness, rhyming, spelling, word building, word recognition, counting, and creativity. There are 5 games all together that each work on a combination of the aforementioned skills, though none of the games have specific names when you tap them.In the camera game, you are asked to find three things that rhyme with a provided word, such as "man" and you move the camera with the stylus to center on the rhyming item and press the shutter button to take the picture. In the boat naming game, you are given the outline of a letter and jumbled puzzle pieces that fit together to fill in the parts of the letter, which also works on spatial reasoning. After you complete the puzzle, you get to be creative and use the paint brushes to decorate the letter and then you get to see your letter on the boat. In the digging game, you are asked to help the dogs dig for their toys (all three of which start with the same letter) by rubbing the stylus over the dirt and it's really cool to see the dog's paws dig the item out. Once you've uncovered all the items, you drag them into the box that has that letter name. These were shown as capital letters, so throughout all of the games your child will see the letters in both formats, upper and lowercase.In the painting game, you help Emily Elizabeth decide what to paint by choosing letters to form a 3 letter word and she will paint that item. Even if your child can't read yet, once a letter is picked, it only shows you choices that would make sense as the next letter to spell a word. After each completed game, you earn stickers and it will count out loud how many stickers you have so this helps with counting as well. Once you earn 10 stickers, you unlock a new story in the story game. The story game reads and highlight each word as it reads so that helps the child with word recognition and sight words.All of the games are very user friendly for a young child and explain what they need to do. This is one of the best and most educational LeapPad games we have purchased and I highly recommend it. It makes learning to read a lot of fun and the child doesn't even know they are learning!

My 3 year old and I had a lot of fun making these mini globes! In the box you get 4 clear plastic domes, 4 foam base plates, 4 characters (Aurora, Ariel, Flounder, a squirrel), 1 shaker stick, 1 rubber ring base, 3 rubber globe bases, 5 glitter tablets, and a tray. The characters are very cute and tiny, smaller than expected, and only measure about half an inch tall, but they are very detailed. I like the ring and globe bases because they are very detailed and a few are shaped like princess crowns and castles to go with the Disney Princess theme.To make the Glitzi Globes, you turn a clear dome upside down inside the tray and pour water into it to the very top (excess water spills over into the tray) and drop a glitter tab in. The glitter tab didn't dissolve in ours like it said it would, so we had to shake it really hard to get it to break up once we finished the globe. Then, you put a character on the little pin on the foam base, turn it upside down, and push it down really hard into the water filled dome. A little bit of water will spill out into the tray. Make sure you press around the edges so it forms a tight seal. Then, put the finished Glitzi globe into a base of your choice. Lastly, press the globe onto the shaker stick and shake vigorously to break up the glitter tab. The bases shown on the front of the box are not necessarily the ones you get. We didn't get a blue base or a purple base as in the picture, so you'll get random bases.These were really easy to make, but I wish for the high price, you got more globes to make. The current price of $24 is ridiculous for what you get and for how quickly you can use the whole kit, in about 10 minutes. You can buy it for the half the price, $12.99,  at Toys R Us, which is where I bought my kit. I'm also giving it 4 stars because the pins on the foam base plates are too flexible and the holes in the bottom of the characters were smaller than the pin heads so it was really hard to press the characters down all the way and securely. We had to remake the Aurora globe because when we shook it to break up the glitter, she fell off the pin due to improper fit and the flimsiness of the pin, so I was glad they give you an extra glitter tab because we needed it. Also, the ring is cut too small, because we could barely fit it on my 3 year old's ring finger and pinkie so it will be way too small for older kids to wear.Overall, this is a cool craft and we will be purchasing another kit to make!

I bought this puzzle for my 3 year old and unfortunately I was somewhat disappointed with it. The puzzle has 46 pieces and measures 2 feet by 3 feet when put together. I like that the pieces are so large that they are easy to manipulate for small hands. The puzzle shows Aurora's kitty Beauty, Belle's dog Teacup, Cinderella's dog Pumpkin, and Snow White's bunny Berry. It's very colorful and I like that it's not a traditional rectangular puzzle but has scalloped edges, which makes the puzzle more challenging since it has no corners.As much as we like the puzzle, the item photo shows a box to hold all the pieces, but mine was in a thin plastic bag with the same image on it and a flimsy handle. Because of the shoddy item packaging, when we took it out to put it together for the first time, several of the pieces were already bent or split at the edges BEFORE we ever played with it (see photo - bent piece on the left, edge split on piece on the right). My daughter and I always do the puzzle together because it is a challenge for her and she is very careful with the pieces and after putting it together a few times, a few more of the pieces were already peeling up. Also, the first time we put it together we noticed that all of the pieces (even the ones that didn't arrive bent in the bag) didn't lay completely flat so some of the pieces don't lock together properly. Sadly, the construction of the puzzle is very cheaply done and dollar store quality! Definitely not worth the $13 price tag.

I go to a lot of potluck dinners at my friend's house about 35 minutes away from my house and most of the time, my casseroles cool significantly by the time I arrive until I tried this handy casserole carrier! I've had others in the past that I ended up just throwing away because they didn't retain heat for more than 10 minutes, but this carrier does a fantastic job of keeping my casseroles hot and ready to eat at the potluck without needing to be reheated.The carrier measures about 16" x 10" so it'll fit many sizes and shapes of casserole dishes. I have used it for both standard sized rectangular casseroles of 13" x 9" , but also for a circular casserole dish 10" in diameter and though it does slide in the carrier a little, it still remained hot and no food spilled out. I really like the large size of the carrier because you can also put serving utensils inside the carrier to transport as well. I really like the red checkered design and the fabric is a thick canvas material with a sturdy metal zipper to keep the carrier shut and help it retain heat or cold. Do keep in mind that you can't place a dish in it that is hotter than 200 degrees because you could melt the lining.I'm giving it 4 stars for two reasons: 1. Though I do like the fact that it has handles, they are only held together with a strip of velcro and the handles are sort of thin and bendable. I think it would be better if the handles were reinforced and also had velcro that wrapped 360 degrees through and around the handles, especially if you are carrying one of the heavier Corningware dishes. And 2. I wish that this had a pocket inside to hold a cold or heat pack to give it extra cooling/heating power. You can certainly still put one in the carrier, but it doesn't stay in place too well.Overall, this is a well made and attractive casserole carrier that does an excellent job and if you frequently go to potlucks, parties, or barbeques, this is a must!

Having never used a Vornado brand fan before, I expected typical output based on its small size, but this is by far the best fan I have ever owned! The fan is lightweight and compact at only 11.5" tall and about 10" wide, but as small as it is, it circulates air incredibly well within both a small and large room. I have used it in my bedroom, which is about 200 square feet and in my basement which is about 450 square feet and despite the room size difference, the difference in circulation is negligible when on the high setting. The air output can be felt from one end of the room to another and it keeps both rooms cool and comfortable. The fan has deep blade curvature, which allows it to circulate more air with each spin than a traditional fan. On the back of the fan are two "cones," which allow it to spiral the air in a tornado fashion so it sends the air output farther, giving it superior air circulation compared to other fans.I like the retro look and bright red color, but most importantly I love the solid and sturdy metal construction of the entire fan.  It seems like everything is made of plastic these days and doesn't last as long as things used to, but this fan is the exception. The stronger and much more durable metal materials make it well worth the price tag and ensure a longer life of the product. There are also rubberized "feet" on the bottom of the fan so it won't scratch your table and I also like that you can adjust the fan up or down a full 180 degrees. You cannot adjust it from side to side though. There are two speeds, low and high, that you can adjust on the back of the fan with a dial. On the low setting, the fan is soundless and on the high setting, it's relatively quiet and about as loud as a microwave.Because of its compact size, it's easy to fit in my suitcase and take with me when I travel and provide me with white noise on the high setting to help me sleep when I stay in hotels and also circulate the air comfortably instead of freezing with the air conditioning. I like that the company stands by its product and provides you with a 5 year warranty as well. Overall, even though this is more expensive than most fans of this size, it is well worth the price in durability, quality, and effective performance. Highly recommended!

With spring finally here, I have been grilling quite often and really like this Cuisinart Grilling Thermometer! In the package, you get the 8" long thermometer (5" is the metal thermometer probe), a hard plastic probe cover, and a small circular AG13 cell battery that you'll need to insert. One feature I really like is the magnet on the back of the thermometer because it holds securely on the outside of the grill when not in use. I still put my grill cover on, but you'll need to be careful doing that or you'll knock the thermometer off. The probe is very well made and sturdy.To use the thermometer, you press the on/off button on the back and insert it into the center of the meat at least half an inch into it to get an accurate read. The meat temperature will be displayed on the large digital screen. I tested this on several types of meats including steaks, pork loin, and chicken on the grill and compared the temperatures it indicated with my dial meat thermometers and they were almost identical in readings so this digital thermometer is very accurate and efficient. I do prefer the digital readout of this thermometer over the dial types. If you want to change the readings from Fahrenheit to Celsius, you hold the on/off button until you see the change. This thermometer doesn't seem to automatically shut off (I let it sit for 10 minutes and it still didn't shut off) so you'll need to remember to turn it off or you'll waste the battery. Since the probe doesn't come off the thermometer, you'll need to hand wash it.One feature I really like is the "flex neck" on the top of the thermometer. You can leave it flat or bend it to a 45 or 90 degree angle, which I find handy when grilling so it faces straight up and I don't have to bend down and turn my head to read the temperatures. The probe cover is really well made and has a clip on the side.I'm giving this 4 stars, despite how accurate it is and how much I like it, because the battery cover on the back is poorly made. You can use a coin or a small flathead screwdriver to turn it and open it. I inserted the battery and the cover kept spinning instead of tightening. I looked at the inside of the battery cover and saw that 2 of the 4 pieces of plastic that lock the cover on had broken off with no pressure (see photo) before I even got to use the thermometer! Fortunately the rest of the thermometer is made well, but I have to use a piece of tape to hold the battery cover on now. Overall, this is a very accurate, easy to use thermometer and if you do a lot of grilling, this is a great tool to have!

I got this tablecloth to replace a similar one that had a hole in it and for the most part I am pleased with it. The design is beautiful and colorful and matches my kitchen decor perfectly. The tablecloth wipes clean easily without the colors fading or smudging like I've had with other tablecloths.The tablecloth has a soft underside, but it is definitely not 3mm thick as advertised. It's only slightly thicker than the paper tablecloths you can get at the party store for 99 cents so I don't feel the quality is worth the price of $10. Because it's so thin, I don't see it lasting very long before it gets a tear.

I bought this for my daughter's 3rd birthday and she and her 6 year old cousins love playing with it! The table measures 35" across x 27" high x 15.5" depth. I was afraid that the table would be too short for my daughter because she is very tall for her age, but it comes up to the bottom of her belly in height. The older kids can sit on chairs and still play with it. I love how easy the assembly was and that it required no tools! It took about 3 minutes to put together because all you have to do is snap in each of the table legs and put the lid on. The construction of the table is very sturdy and the legs don't wobble at all, even with 4 kids reaching across it and leaning on it. I chose this table not only because it got great reviews, but because it didn't sit on the ground and get bugs all over it like many other sand boxes I looked at. We bought a 50 pound bag of sand and it fits perfectly in the table.I love the lid feature because we have this on our deck and it keeps the rain and bugs out of the sand. The lid isn't as sturdily constructed as the rest of the table and is a tad flimsy, but it does the job and keeps the sand clean and dry. On the lid, there is a thick, stretchy bungee cord loop that attaches to the bottom of the table to lock the lid on. When the cover is on, it has a really cute car track embedded in it, which my nephew enjoys to race his cars around.It's nice that the sandbox came with a few sand toys (green bucket, yellow shovel, green sand claw, and yellow sifter). For the most part these items are well made but very small. My daughter loves the green sand claw because it looks like a bear claw and she loves making lines in the sand with it. I highly recommend supplementing what they give you with other sand toys. We have a sand toy set for when we go to the beach and she really enjoys using those items instead of what came with this.Overall, this is a very sturdy table and has provided the kids with hours of fun, so we are extremely happy with it!

This is the best flashlight I have ever owned! Before I bought it, I read the reviews here on Amazon and some of the older reviews stated that it wasn't bright and gave the incorrect lumen levels. This flashlight is LED 250 lumens which is super bright and basically lights up the entire room! The flashlight measures about 9 1/2" long and comes with 4 AA batteries. The light has an easy to press rubberized on/off button and two levels of light brightness. When you press it the first time, it's on the highest level, press it again and it's on a medium brightness level. Press it a third time to turn it off. The beam of light has a concentrated circle of light in the center and also emits a dimmer large diameter of light around it. I used it while working in my attic and crawl space with no other lights on and it lit the entire space up well from wall to wall, about 25 feet across.I really love the sturdy construction of this flashlight and that it has a hard casing to protect it from breaking should it fall. I dropped it off the top of the ladder when I was on my roof and it fell to the ground about 15 feet below me and it didn't break! It still works perfectly fine. I also really like the rubberized and grooved ends of the flashlight, which keeps it in place without rolling, especially important if you are using it on the job. It also has a nice metal belt clip to clip it on your pants if you are using it on the job. Additionally, I like the finger grooves on the handle because they make it very comfortable to use. My only criticism is that the battery compartment is not clearly marked as to which direction to insert the positive and negative ends of the batteries, but after a few tries, you figure it out.I liked this flashlight so much that I ordered another one to keep by the bed upstairs and one for my husband to use at work. If you're looking for a high quality flashlight that can withstand rough conditions, this is your best bet!

My daughter caught lice at her daycare and I had never dealt with lice before so I was freaking out. I got this from my local pharmacy after reading how ineffective many of the RID style treatments were from so many reviews. I was so happy I got this because nits were gone so fast! The product is non-toxic and doesn't contain harmful pesticides like all the other brands, so I felt safe using this on my daughter. The box says you can use it as young as 6 months old. Included with the 6 ounce bottle is a "professional" nit comb with metal teeth that are very close together so it effectively picks up the nits (eggs) and removes them from the hair. I also like that the comb is easy to clean (boil in hot water for about 10 minutes) and is reusable should you have a lice problem again.The product is very simple to use and doesn't require much time or effort to complete the treatment. To use, shake the spray bottle and spray it on DRY hair about 4-6" from the head and completely saturate the hair starting at the scalp and work to the ends. I recommend using a towel around the shoulders because when you saturate the hair, it does drip if you have long hair. I used my fingers to work the spray all over the scalp and then we let it air dry. Once the hair is dry, DO NOT rinse the product out and then use the nit comb to comb out any eggs and lice bugs. The comb does a wonderful job of getting it all out and you can definitely see what is coming off. I love that you can use this as many times as you want in a day to make sure all the nits and lice are dead. I personally didn't care for the smell of the product, which smells of black licorice, but it definitely beats the chemical smell of other products. Most importantly, it WORKS! I continued to use it for a few days on my daughter's head and by the second day, I wasn't combing any more nits out because they were all dead and gone. One 6 ounce bottle lasted us 2 treatments of fully saturating the hair.Another nice aspect of this product is that since it's a spray, you can use it on multiple people's heads in your household, though you would want to properly boil and clean the comb to prevent reinfestation. One great thing about the Licefree company who makes this is that they have a hotline you can call if you have questions about the product or if you have questions about lice in general. I called the number several times when I was freaking out about my daughter having lice and they were so friendly and helpful and gave some great tips.Here are some lice tips:1. Inspect the hair under bright light. You can tell the difference between nits and dandruff flakes because if it's dandruff, you should be able to slide it off the hair with your fingertips. If it's nits, it will not come off the hair.2. You may need to retreat lice infested hair another time to be sure it is completely gone.3. Wash all clothing that was worn or linens that came in contact with the lice in hot water and dry on high heat for 30 minutes to kill nits.4. Boil combs in hot water to kill nits for about 10 minutes.I also found Licefree lice preventative shampoo that we use on my daughter on days she goes to daycare and it does work because she hasn't gotten lice again after several of her classmates did: Licefreee Everyday Gentle 2 in 1 Conditioning Shampoo 8 ozHighly recommended and effective!

After a lice scare at my daughter's daycare in which several kids in her class passed lice back and forth, I started using this on my daughter's hair on days she goes to daycare to prevent her from catching lice just in case. The shampoo contains tea tree oil and coconut oil, which are natural lice repellents. To protect your kids from lice, use the product as directed. You are supposed to wash the hair once and rinse, then wash it again and let the shampoo sit in the hair for 3 minutes before rinsing.The product is definitely effective because my daughter hasn't gotten lice and several of her classmates have gotten it repeatedly. My only complaint and the reason I'm giving it 4 stars is the horrible smell of the shampoo. It smells very chemical and the smell lasts long after her hair has dried, so I wish they'd add some pleasant scent to it to mask the chemical smell.One great thing about the Licefree company who makes this is that they have a hotline you can call if you have questions about the product or if you have questions about lice in general. I called the number several times when I was freaking out about the possibility of my daughter having lice and they were so friendly and helpful and gave some great tips.Aside from the smell, this is a great product to prevent lice and give a parent some peace of mind!

Since my daughter was born, I've tried many types of nasal aspirators including bulb syringes, battery operated ones, and the ones that you have to use your own lung capacity to facilitate the suction, but I've always found the bulbs to be the most effective. Of course the main problem with bulb syringes was mold growth because they can be rinsed out, but not properly cleaned or dried, so every year I'd buy new ones. I was so excited to find the first truly cleanable bulb syringe in the BoogieBulb!I ordered the 3 oz size, which is slightly larger than the standard bulb and is made for toddlers. This has a wider tip that I've found fits my daughter's nose more snugly, which in turn makes the suction more powerful because there are no gaps between the inside of her nostril and the syringe. Despite the fact that the bulb is made in two separate pieces, it will NOT come apart when you're trying to suction the child's nose if you are using it properly. When suctioning, press your thumb upward on the bottom of the bulb and release to collect the mucus. If you squeeze if from the sides, it will come apart and not suction properly.The best part of the bulb, besides its powerful suction, is that it can be taken apart and cleaned so there's no chance for mold growth. I wash ours in warm, soapy water with a clean rag and I got a straw cleaner to scrub inside the syringe part and get out all the mucus, then I let it air dry. It is a little pricey at nearly $14 dollars, but it is well worth the cost for peace of mind that there is not mold growing in it like traditional bulb syringes and it pays for itself in not having to constantly buy new bulbs. Highly recommended!

I have recently redecorated my bathroom in purple and gray with floral accents and this trashcan fits my motif perfectly! The trashcan measures 10" tall, so it's small enough to fit between the commode and our sink, but large enough to fit several days worth of trash in it before needing to be emptied. I was expecting it to be made of thin, flimsy plastic for the price, but was pleasantly surprised that it's made of hard acrylic plastic and is quite sturdy.The purple color is gorgeous and the flowers are very detailed. I especially love the embedded glitter inside the plastic, which gives it sparkle, but doesn't make a mess. The item photo doesn't show it, but there's also an image of Tinkerbell on one side of the trashcan that's not mentioned in the description either. You can of course hide that by turning that side of the trashcan towards the wall. It's also very easy to wipe down and clean. If you're looking for an inexpensive but high quality trashcan, this is a fantastic choice!

My 3 year old loves My Little Pony so I got this to use as a second toy box in her playroom. It measures 30" x 15" x 16.5" and is much more spacious than I expected! We can fit several Barbie cars, My Little Ponies, Barbies, kick balls, baby dolls, and so much more inside of it. I love the colorful print all over it, which features Applejack, Twilight Sparkle, and Pinkie Pie on the front and Pinkie Pie and Twilight Sparkle on the top cover. The trunk is made of canvas and has a velcro closure flap on the front to keep it closed, as well as two canvas handles on the sides if you need to carry it. If you want to fold it up and store it, it collapses easily and lays flat. My only criticism of this trunk is that when it's full, the sides and front bow out. So now the cardboard backing on the front is permanently bent. Overall, we are very happy with it and if you're looking for an inexpensive, but great quality toy box, this is an awesome choice!

My 3 year old daughter is Frozen obsessed and super excited to see the "Frozen Fever" movie short. Until she gets to see it, we've been reading this book, which is the same story as the movie short. The story centers on Queen Elsa being super excited to plan a special birthday for Anna and Elsa is obsessing over every detail from the cake to the party banner to all the presents. Kristoff and Olaf are on hand to help as Elsa wakes Anna and leads her on a scavenger hunt for all these thoughtful presents she has made for Anna. Unfortunately for Elsa, she's coming down with a cold and every time she sneezes, little snowmen appear and run around the castle, unnoticed by Elsa and Anna. Anna keeps insisting Elsa rest but she doesn't want to ruin the day so she keeps pressing on until she nearly falls as she becomes dizzy from a fever. At that moment, everyone yells surprise and Anna was presented with her cake. She was so happy and Elsa finally rested as Kristoff and Olaf delivered all the little snowmen to the ice palace and Marshmellow on the North Mountain.The story is cute but I felt like the plot is somewhat lacking. I though that the little snowmen would play a greater role in the story and present some funny challenges to the party, but they contributed nothing to the book plot and were just there. They also didn't include the funny part from the movie trailer where Olaf is caught eating the cake. Of course this is not noticeable to my daughter, but an older child might pick up on that. Included in the book are over 30 stickers, many of which are sticker gift tags with "to" and "from" written on them to go with the birthday theme of the book.The illustrations are actual still shots from the movie short and they are very colorful and wonderfully detailed. Overall, this is a cute book, slightly lacking in plot, but we still enjoy reading it and seeing the life the sisters have after the original Frozen movie.

I got these Disney Store dolls from the actual retailer (where you can get them much cheaper) for my 3 year old Frozen fanatic and we love them! Both Elsa and Anna measure 12" tall and are stunningly detailed. They look exactly like they do in the "Frozen Fever" movie short and both dolls are fully jointed and moveable at the head, wrists, elbows, shoulders, hips, knees, and feet. For my daughter, the only downside is that they are hard to make sit down because their feet spread so wide  apart that she can't have them sit in her Barbie car.Elsa has a beautiful floor length blue-green floral print gown with a gorgeous sparkly and sheer cape. Around her shoulders on the cape are pretty pink flowers which also adorn the entire back of the cape as well as glittery blue flowers. For the most part, the glitter doesn't shed, which is definitely a plus compared to other Disney Store dolls we've purchased in the past. I like that on this version of Elsa, she's wearing her blue ice shoes unlike the original Elsa doll. I don't like that they are held on by little rubber bands, which are a hazard, but if you remove the bands, her shoes won't stay on. Elsa also has her classic braided hair with a pretty purple flower on the side.Anna is wearing a pretty blue sunflower printed gown with a dark blue sparkly bodice and a green floral vest. She has a mesh underskirt and has her hair in a bun with a sunflower tie in the back. She also has a pretty sunflower and snowflake bracelet. She has black shoes, which were held on with rubber bands, but unlike Elsa, her shoes will stay on when you remove the bands.They are exceptionally well made dolls and are lots of fun to play with. If you have a Frozen fan, these "summer' Frozen dolls will be a hit!

I have a 3 year old daughter and two 6 year old nieces who come over a lot and I'm always looking for crafts to do with them that don't make a mess and these are perfect! Even though it's recommended for age 5 and up, you can still make these necklaces with a younger child as long as you help them. In the kit, you get two 38" long pink necklace cords, two 38" long purple necklace cords, 4 clasps, 20 foam jewelry shapes (butterflies, rainbows, hearts, bows, stars, flowers, and peace signs) in various sizes, and 6 mess free glitter sheets. The purple and pink glitter sheets are larger than the others at 3.5" x 4" and the green, blue, silver, and dark pink sheets measure 2" x 3.5." Even though the sheets are small, the foam bead sections to use them on are tiny so you'll have enough with some left over.To use the kit, you carefully peel off and discard the white paper shape from the bead, for instance a flower petal or section of a butterfly wing, which has sticky material underneath it. Then you peel the white paper backing off of the desired glitter sheet, press the glitter sheet over the sticky part of the bead, and rub it for a few seconds with your finger to transfer the glitter and lift up carefully. When you do this, on the glitter sheet, it leaves an impression of the shape you just did so that way you know the next part of the sheet to use. You'll want to start on the corner of the glitter sheet and work your way around it placing the shapes very close to one another versus starting in the middle so you won't waste it.Once you've used the glitter on the foam beads, you string them onto the necklace cord, which has hard plastic melted around each end like a shoelace in order to make it easier for you to string the beads. Each bead has two small holes in the sides which you feed the cord through and they stay firmly in place on the necklace without moving, which is awesome so you can space the beads out on the necklace. On the front of the box, it shows a necklace on which there are tied knots to give it a look different from a traditional necklace but unfortunately there are no instructions on how to do that, which is a shame. We just made standard necklaces and the girls had a blast. The cords are very long but you can trim them to fit the size of the child; you'll need to trim off the hard plastic on the ends anyway. To attach the clasps, you need to feed the end of the cord through each part and tie a double knot to hold it in place. The clasps are very hard to open once the necklace is on so a child will need help with this for sure.I was amazed at how easy this was to do and how gorgeous the necklaces turned out! And they were truly mess free without the need to let it dry. Right after we transferred the glitter to the beads, I scratched at it with my fingernail to see if glitter would flake off and it didn't at all.Though it looks like there's not much to transfer the glitter to at first, many of the flowers have individual petals and the rainbow has lots of stripes to do. Aside from how mess free these are and how much fun the girls had, I really like how creative this allows the child to be with all the colors and to truly make a design all their own. They show you examples on the packaging, but you don't have to follow that and can make any color scheme you want. One cool thing is that if you don't have a section of glitter left that's large enough for the shape you're doing, you can piece it together with leftover glitter from all the sheets. I plan to get more of these for guests to make at my daughter's birthday party.Overall, this is a very well made set with lots of creativity options and it is a truly mess free craft!

My 3 year old loves games and we've both really enjoyed playing this younger version of Uno, which has lots of similar rules to the Uno card game I loved as a kid. Children who are 3 or 4 years old may need some help to play, but they will still enjoy it. The game includes a plastic barn, 24 farm animal game pieces, and instructions. The sturdy plastic barn measures 8" x 5.5" x 4" and serves as a part of the game as well as a handled carrying case for the whole game, which is perfect if you are taking it for a long car trip. There are 4 cows, 4 pigs, 4 chickens, 4 sheep, and 4 skunks, one of each in the four colors (blue, green, yellow, and red). The skunk serves as a "skip" to make another player lose a turn. There are also 4 farmers (white pieces) to use as a "wild" that when played, you get to choose the color. The figures are really cute and have stickers on them for their faces and molded details on them, such as a curly tail for the pig and wings for the chicken. The game pieces are small at 1.5" tall but also chunky enough for a preschool child's hands to manipulate easily. My daughter sometimes just likes to play with the animals and put them to sleep in the barn or have them play, so the game doubles as a toy!To play the game, you have to put all the game pieces in the barn, shake it up to mix them, and each player picks out 5 pieces from the barn. One thing I didn't like is that since you have to mix them up, many of the animal faces are visible and face up when you open the barn to pick, so what we did was make a rule that you have to close your eyes to pick your pieces so you can't cheat. The barn door folds down to place one random piece from the barn on it to start. On your turn, you have to either play the same animal on the barn door or the same color. For example, if there's a blue pig on the door, you can play a blue cow or a green pig. If you have a wild farmer piece, you can also play him at any turn. If you play the farmer, you get to choose the color for the next person. When you play a figure, you push the the previous piece into the barn and put the one you're playing on the barn door for another player to match. If you have nothing that matches, you pick 1 piece from the barn (we again said you have to close your eyes so you don't cheat) and if it matches, you can play it, but if not you have to wait until your next turn. Once you have one piece left, you have to say "Uno Moo"  and if you don't say it and another player notices, you have to take 2 pieces from the barn. Whoever gets all their animals back into the barn first wins!The concept of the game is really cute and a lot of fun while also helping a preschooler work on color identification, animal identification, matching skills, and strategy skills by trying to play colors that the other players don't have. My one criticism of the game is that it is easy for other players to see what you're picking if you happen to pick a game piece from the barn that faces up or if they are sitting right next to you at the table. I wish it came with something to hide your pieces.If you're looking for a fun game that you can play with your preschooler that also has educational elements to it, this is an awesome choice and a perfect transition for when they get older and can play the Uno card game!

I have a picnic table on my deck that we use most seasons, but since we have nowhere to store it during winter, it tends to get pretty dirty from all the rain and snow after each winter and has to be power washed. I am extremely pleased with this cover! The cover is a beautiful hunter green color and is large, measuring 72" x 57" x 30." My picnic table measures 72" x 54" x 28" so this is perfect fit. You also get four 37" long cords and 4 cord locks so that you can secure the cover to the picnic table.The grommets that you feed the cords through are weatherproof, which is nice so rust doesn't stain the cover.  Simply insert the cord into a grommet by the table leg, wrap it around the table leg, and feed it through another grommet close by, and press down on the cord lock to feed the cord ends through it. Then, slide the cord lock upward until you get a secure fit. Personally, I didn't need to use the cords since the cover fit so snugly on my picnic table, but if you live somewhere that tends to be very windy, I'd recommend using them.The textured fabric is very thick like canvas with a smooth, waterproof underside. We just got 10" of snow and my picnic table is out in the open on the deck and this cover is truly waterproof because when I dusted off all the snow and lifted the cover, my picnic table was dry and clean underneath. The packaging also states that the fabric is tear resistant which is great because when I was putting it on the table and trying to maneuver the cover so the cover corners matched up with the table corners, I snagged one corner on the edge of the wood and it didn't tear or leave a mark. The stitching on the fabric is also very well done, so I don't imagine it would get holes in it after long term use.I did like that it came with a matching canvas carrying tote to store the cover in when its not in use, but unfortunately, the tote is so much smaller than the cover and its nearly impossible to get this huge cover back into it. So I've decided to use the carrying tote as a reusable grocery bag. If you are looking for a high quality, attractive, and truly waterproof picnic table cover to protect your table, this is your best bet!

My 3 year old Barbie fanatic really loves this set! In the set, you get a 12" Barbie doll with a beautiful white top and floral dress skirt with black heels, a 2.5" tall plastic color changing dog, a small eyeshadow brush for spreading the water, and a 6.5" tall plastic table to hold the 1.5" tall doggie tub. Barbie's head and arms are movable but her joints aren't so her elbows and knees are stuck in the same position and it's harder to make her sit down during play because of this. I really like that her makeup is classy and tasteful and not trashy like so many dolls on the market today. After getting wet and air drying several times, her hair becomes greasy feeling, frizzy, and harder to manage and brush through, so I'm not fond of that.The dog comes in the package vibrantly colored in hot pink, purple, and blue and to change him to white, you dip him in warm water in the doggie tub. To add color to him, you use cold water, but it must be VERY cold water or it won't work. The item pictures are deceiving because in the pictures, you can use the eyeshadow brush to make designs on him, but this did NOT work for us. I followed all the directions and used the little brush and ice cold water and no color showed up. The only time that color showed up was when I dunked the dog in the water so the brush does nothing in that regard. I even tried to use hot water when he was fully colored to make a design and again it didn't work and to get his fur back to white. I had to rub the brush really hard on the dog, so the color changing feature on the dog really only works when you dunk him in water versus using the brush, thus making the design potential for him nonexistent.Barbie's white top is made of soft cotton and when you use the brush and cold water, you can draw designs on it anyway you want, so I love the creativity options of the doll. However, my doll's shirt doesn't have a large section of blue when wet as the item picture shows, but a tiny 1/4" strip of blue on her shoulder and the majority of it is pink and purple when wet. Once her shirt is dry, it will return to white, but it takes about an hour for it to air dry, which is far too long for a child to patiently wait so play time gets limited in that you can't do a bunch of different designs in one sitting since you have to wait for dry time. I tried blowing the top with a hair dryer so that it would dry quicker and that allowed it to dry within minutes. Only the front of her shirt is able to be colored. The eyeshadow brush has very thin padding and is flimsy so I can't see it lasting long, but you can replace it with a clean, better quality eyeshadow brush from your makeup bag.Overall, this is a fun set and we enjoy it a lot despite the issue with the brush and the dog's color changing. If your little girl loves Barbie and dogs, this will be a hit!

As a follow-up to 1989's Red Devil (re-released in 2015 as "Red Devil: The Book of Satan, Evil on Earth 1" as part of a series), Green Devil continues the ideas and story from Red Devil while also serving as a stand-alone story.  However, it's not necessary to read Red Devil to enjoy Green Devil, though the references to the earlier work in the story may prove distracting for some readers.Much like Red Devil, Green Devil tells the story of a criminal investigation uncovering an ancient evil (and a plan to destroy North America) based near Salt Lake City, Utah.  Religion, particularly the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints (Saperstein uses the term Mormon) and Native American beliefs, plays a huge role in discovering and fighting the evil.Green Devil is a supernatural thriller, which doesn't hold up as well as the older Red Devil, in large part because the characters are nowhere near as engaging as in Red Devil and in part because of some plotting or factual flaws that detract from the story.  For example, a character has a farm adjacent to a rich villain's property, and the curiosity of that character poses a threat to the villain.  However, instead of simply buying out the farm, the villain decides that terror and murder are better strategies.  Saperstein also makes some mistakes, identifying one character in an early chapter as a G-10 government employee and in a later chapter as a G-12 employee.  However, government pay grades are GS (e.g. GS-10, GS-12) not G, and a GS-10 employee isn't particularly powerful in the DC arena from which the character originates.  Formatting errors like two characters speaking in the same paragraph or italicized paragraphs that are actually dialogue pop up from time to time, just enough to annoy the reader.A bigger concern is that Saperstein risks following a formula in plotting his stories.  Green Devil follows a plot trajectory very similar to Red Devil, with some minor deviations leading to a conclusion seen before in Red Devil.  Hopefully, future novels in the series won't simply rehash the same plot with a different villain.Still, despite these flaws, it's still a good read.  Though reading Red Devil isn't necessary, I would still suggest reading Red Devil first as an introduction to this universe.  Green Devil continues the story, but just isn't as gripping.  If you enjoyed the earlier Red Devil, you'll also enjoy this continuation, but in my opinion, probably not as much.

I first read Red Devil back in 1989 when it was released as a mass market paperback.  It's a joy to see it released in a Kindle format, as it's a particularly enjoyable supernatural mystery/thriller.The story is set in the 1980's, with a worried Soviet premier assigning an investigation into the circumstances surround the death of a close friend to another close friend, a KGB investigative colonel.  As the case unfolds, it becomes clear that Colonel Peter Somoroff is facing an ancient evil, and that he may be out of his depth without a lot of assistance.Saperstein cleverly takes a story which is part spy thriller, part mystery, and part supernatural horror and creates a work which is greater than the sum of its parts.  Drawing in large part on a mystical version of evil, author Saperstein successfully creates a universe ripe for further exploration.  The ending of Red Devil promises further explorations into this created world.  Now, in 2015, we finally see not only a re-issued Red Devil, but also a sequel.Re-reading the story over two decades later, it's still a great read.  It moves quickly, and the story is intriguing.  If you enjoy a good story and a bit of supernatural horror, you'll love this book.  It's not like the techno-thrillers which came to dominate the 1990's, but a much more old fashioned thriller driven more by the story instead of weapons/technology.  Well worth the time to read.
