One could safely suspend a quarter in the air in these without worrying about the bag failing.  They wash up easily.The only downside is that they're rather heavy....maybe 3-4 pounds...and take up quite a bit of room in a pack.  I left them in the truck until my harvest because I didn't want to cart them around all day.Would I buy them again?  Probably not.  There are some very tight-weave heavy duty game bags (as opposed to the more chinzy cheesecloth variety) available that worked just as well for less money and a fraction of the weight.  I used the Alaska Game Bags (Alaska Game Moose, Elk, Caribou Rolled Quarter Bags Bags, 60-Inch (Pack of Four)) and preferred them on this hunt.  If I don't foresee needing to suspend quarters with the bag, the heavy duty Alaska game bags work marvelously.  Further, if I needed to suspend the quarters, I could tie the string directly to the quarter and then surround the quarter with the bag so that the bag itself is not holding the weight.

This is the same product available in auto parts stores and was a direct fit for my 1997 Ford Ranger 4.0L V6.  Each of the 6 wires was slightly longer than the OEM wires, so I had no difficultly making them reach.  Each boot had a dab of dielectric grease...a nice touch...although I added a little bit more grease to make it to my liking.  I installed the wires in conjunction with Autolite XP103 Xtreme Performance Iridium Spark Plugs. I've had no performance problems with them.  Neither have I noticed any notable increase in performance, though I think I did detect a faster startup and smoother idle.  They were not numbered (as were my OEM wires), so I took care in matching up sizes before installation.I took away 1 star because the female terminal inside one boot was slightly misaligned and I had a difficult time getting it to seat with a tactile click.  I recommend you take care when seating the boots on spark plugs so that you don't accidentally bend the metal terminals.

I'm a lifelong shooter and have reloaded somewhere in the neighborhood of 18,000 rounds over the last 15 years.  After years of putting up with heavy recoil and cutting my bench sessions short on heavy recoiling rifles, I purchased the Caldwell Lead Sled DFT.  I lucked out at Cabela's during a 50% off sale last Thanksgiving, and walked out the door with it for about $125.  Even at $175, I say it's worth the cost for sighting in heavy recoiling firearms.  Working up handloads on my .300 Win Mag was miserable prior to this.  It is, frankly, effortless now.Pros:- Despite the many pieces in the shipping box, it's easy to assemble with included tools and great instructions.  Total assembly time was about 25 minutes.- Made of substantial materials:  beefy metals and very sturdy components.  It weighs about 20 pounds alone. It doesn't feel cheap and I was pleasantly surprised by its robustness.- Fit and finish is terrific:  Good paint, good texture, close tolerances.  The green cordura fabric will last a lifetime.  It's rigid, unlike a lot of the rests on the market that easily flex or wobble during use.- Cuts recoil on my .300 Win Mag by about 90%.  I'm using it with 75lb of shot.  The front of the rifle still hops up about 1 to 2 inches, and the sled moves to the rear about 1/2".  It's enough that I have to reset elevation and windage adjustments after each shot.  Consider putting something under the rubber feet so that they don't get sandpapered by a rough concrete shooting bench like mine did.- The elevation and windage adjustments are smooth and allow minute corrections.  Final hold, however, still requires input from the shooter.  I can get the rifle very close to zero with the adjustments, but simply pressing my shoulder against the buttplate or gripping the rifle's stock is going to induce some movement.  In other words, this isn't a set-it-and-forget-it rest.  I still need to practice a good grip, good breathing, and good trigger pull if I want to keep my crosshairs on zero.  Having said that, the sled reduces my effort at holding zero by 70%--so much so that I was tempted to ignore breathing discipline while shooting.Cons:- It's difficult to fit more than 3 Caldwell Lead Sled Weight Bags on the tray.  I use 3 bags which contain three 25lb bags of lead shot.  Because the cam locks for the front slide protrude down into the tray area, they interfere with the front bags, and the tray isn't quite wide enough to hold 2 bags of shot side-by-side.- Because the gun is not allowed to recoil freely, some say it could cause damage to the stock in the long run.  I'll report back if I experience this.- It's taller than shooting bags alone, so you may need a booster seat at the shooting bench to get to the correct sitting height.All in all, I was very impressed with its quality and usefulness.  It made me think, "Wow, it's definitely worth what I paid for it."

Season 3 has the same feel and style as Season 1 and 2.  It's still totally contrived but the contrived circumstances are entertaining and funny.  Each character has a personality that is further developed in this season.Pros:- No sex, nudity, or profanity.  (What a welcome relief!)- Traditional family values are a virtue.  Many episodes end with a light-hearted prayer around the dinner table where Jesus' name (gasp!) is invoked.- Funny, contrived redneck behavior.  (C'mon, these guys run a multi-million dollar business that has spanned decades:  They're just putting on an act when they behave silly, uneducated or otherwise.)Cons:- Like Season 1 and 2, there are still a few occasions when I see them discharging firearms in a way that I think is risky (e.g. shooting in the air or shooting at targets close to themselves or others).I appreciate watching a TV show that really is family friendly rather than one that is purposely designed to be as shocking and as immoral as possible.  Good work, Robertson's!

Season Two has the same feel and style as Season 1.  Yes, it's totally contrived but the contrived circumstances are entertaining and funny.  Each character has his/her own personality that is further developed in this season.Pros:- No sex, nudity, or profanity.  (What a welcome relief!)- Traditional family values are a virtue.- Funny, contrived redneck behavior.  (C'mon, these guys run a multi-million dollar business that has spanned decades:  They're putting on an act when they act silly, uneducated or otherwise.)Cons:- Like Season 1, there are still a few occasions, though less so that Season 1, when I see them discharging firearms in a way that I think is risky (e.g. shooting in the air or shooting at targets close to themselves or others).The Robertson's hit it out of the Park with Season 2!

These socks are really comfortable. They are warm and I love the look of the socks. They are sewn well and the quality seem to be great. They are the perfect size for my feet. They are the right length. I have washed them and they keep their shape. I really like them and would recommend them to everyone. I received these socks at no cost in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

These socks are really cute and comfortable. They are thick so my feet stays good and warm and because they are thick they are really comfortable. They have pretty designs on them. They are a bit long but thats how i like them. With winter coming up I will be wearing them a lot. I received these socks at no cost in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

This is a beautiful bird house. I love watching birds outside my home. I think birds are just really pretty. The opening is small so its perfect for wrens and other very small birds. This handcrafted birdhouse looks sturdy and well made. It has a nice sloped blue roof ans the body of the house is white with a brown base. It has a nice chain so it can be hung in a tree or maybe on a porch. I cant wait to put this outside and watch the birds. I would recommend this to everyone who loves nature. I received this wonderful little bird house at no cost in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

The SoundLogic XT Rechargeable Wireless Rave Bluetooth Speaker is awesome. I love that it gives off a nice light show. As the music plays the front changes colors and when bass hits the color gets higher. I think there is around 8 different colors. Its really pretty at night. The speaker itself is nice. It can stand up or I can lay it down. The sound is crystal clear and gets really loud.It is rechargeable so you dont have to worry about batters. I love that I can use it Bluetooth or plug in the cord and plug into my device. I love listening to music and love to jam out and this speaker allows me to do just that.  It starts to pair to my devices in seconds. It comes partially charged right out of the box. This is one of my favorite portable speakers and since it is portable I can take it with my places. The casing seems tough and it looks great. I would recommend this speaker to everyone. I received it at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

1:51 MinsThis set right here is really cute. I love farms so I just think its really neat. There is a lot of detail in this set. It comes with 2 cows, a wheel barrel. 2 signs, a milking station, a lady farmer, 2 milks, a tractor and wagon with moving wheels, and 2 barrels. Everything looks well made and realistic. the only thing I thing I would add to this set is a barn.Its nice to get a toy that doesn't require batteries. these days everything requires batteries. The wagons top is removable so its easier to load and unload stuff. The tractor has a hitch on the back so the wagon can hook right up to it.I am giving this to my nephew for Christmas and I truly believe he is going to love it. I love the color of this one. I got pink. The bottom is lower cut and fits great. They are very comfortable. The top is thin and it was a little awkward at first but I finally figured it out. The material is soft and feels good while its on. its cute and unique. I would recommend this to others. I received this at no cost in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

This bathing suit is really cute. Its purple and has polka dots. The material is soft and comfortable. The bottoms are a high cut but thats actually how I like it. Its easy to move around in and just looks really cute. I would recommend this to everyone. I received this suit at no cost in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

This is a perfect set for traveling. I know traveling by car can be tiresome and I always wish I had a pillow. This some really seems to be of high quality. It comes with an inflatable travel pillow, earbuds, eye mask, ear plugs, and a cable holder for the earbuds. The ear buds work great and are crystal clear. the eye mask fits perfect and is very comfortable. Even the ear plugs are comfortable to wear and really helps when you want to nap and your partner wants to listen to music. It comes with 2 cows, a wheel barrel. 2 signs, a milking station, a lady farmer, 2 milks, a tractor and wagon with moving wheels, and 2 barrels. I bought this to handle larger fruit as I'd been using a green lime squeezer for years that worked well but forced me to buy smaller lemons or use a reamer to juice. Seller is very conscientious provides recipes, etc. However the juicer isn't as efficient as my older and smaller green lime squeezer. I followed the directions to place the squeezer on the counter, which is awkward, since trying to squeeze it by hand holding it over something to catch the juice didn't seem to squeeze out enough juice. Lemons seem to fold in on themselves inside the sieve part trapping juice inside the lemon no matter which way I insert the lemon half. Totally couldn't handle an orange. It is stainless steel and seems well made so I'm not sure what the problem is but if I buy another I'd probably buy the cheaper yellow lemon squeezer although reviewers have mentioned that they are no longer the same quality as the ones made years ago. Are we done with overseas manufacturers yet? What has happened to so many of the products over the years that worked great only to discover in replacing them that they are now made overseas and just aren't the same quality anymore.

Not the cheapest pillow inserts but definitely much better than average. They have plump loft and nicely fill pillows and aren't easily crushed. I'll put in the warning that appears in other places regarding pillow forms...measure your pillow cover before you order a pillow insert and then purchase a pillow insert that is at least 2" larger than the pillow cover. For example I ordered these 18" pillow inserts for pillow covers that were @ 16". These are very fluffy and nicely fill out the cases. I bought them to replace the feather and down combination inserts that were sold by the Pottery Barn to go with the cases years ago. They never seemed full enough and there were chicken feathers poking through the cushions that I'd pluck out weekly. Finally got sick of the feather down combo and bought these which work so much better. Definitely happy with the change.

Love it. I bought this to replace a quiche pan I'd had for years. Love the non-stick finish and 10" is a great size. I found it "used" from Amazon for only $8.80 which was a steal. Although it didn't come in original packaging it didn't appear to ever have been used.I've had several Chicago Metallic baking items and they have all seemed to be of good quality.

Don't want to get into a big brouhaha about what a toaster "should cost" etc....obviously this toaster is expensive...and you can make toast in countless ways without it...enough said. I've probably bought 15 toasters, toaster ovens, etc. since 1968. They are covered the range of toasting bread...some were fine some were total dogs...I bought all these toasters not because I have some kind of fetish but because at different times I've needed different toasters. Initially I received a GE Toaster Oven as a wedding gift...my Mom's had worked great...mine died in a relatively short time and before dying it basically dried the bread rather than toasting it. So I bought another...and by then I had a family and a piece or two at a time wasn't cutting it...so I bought a toaster that could do several slices of bread at once. You'd think that would be it...but of course we moved onto Bagels and the slots were too narrow and slicing them narrower was a pain (literally) and the toaster would try to toast both sides of the bagel. Ok so I finally moved onto a toaster that would be both wide enough and toast just one side of the bagel and then I began baking artisan breads...I could control the width of the slice by the bread was always longer than the slot and so I'd have to cut the slice in half so the length would fit into the toaster. In between times I'd toast bread in the oven but as I now live alone turning on the oven for a single slice of bread is insanely energy inefficient...I was also tired of dragging the toaster in and out of the cupboard each morning because it hogged so much space on my counter to make 2 half slices of bread for my eggs so in a fit of pique I checked Google for what's the best toaster and up popped this toaster...what sold me was that it was very narrow reducing the amount of space it took up on the counter...AND it could adjust itself to both the width and length of whatever bread I tossed into it. It toasts just one side of a bagel for lox and cream cheese perfectly and has several settings for various shades of toast. Since a few reviewers mentioned the toaster died after 10 pieces of toast, I've waited until I'd made toast a hundred times and so far it just keeps getting better and better. There is a learning curve which the manufacturer mentions: Fresh bread is "moister" so you need to set the buttons to a higher level in terms of darkness to toast it, conversely if the bread is dryer you push a button for lighter toasting. It holds a long slice of artisan bread and toasts it perfectly without cutting it in half, the sensor seems to figure out every once you told it what you want. Try to cut the bread with a flat surface as I noticed with one piece that I more or less ripped from a loaf of fresh bread the uneven part of the crumb that stuck out toasted darker than the rest of the bread. Do not leave the toaster plugged in after you are finished using it unplug it as it stays on and ready for the next job of toasting immediately if you don't unplug it.Finally while it has a function for defrosting frozen bread I haven't used it because when I freeze bread I freeze rolls and so it's easier for me to toss the roll into the microwave on defrost bread for 22 seconds and then slice the roll in half  if I'm going to toast it. I never freeze sliced bread so I have no idea if this function works or not.

Nice coasters, good thickness, color and pattern a good match to Spode blue Italian. Offered at various sites with a fluctuating price so if you don't need them now shop around. I choose Amazon because they had the best price at the time I was looking and free shipping but I've seen them on eBay and Home Click at the same price or less although sometimes more hence the advise to shop around. One caveat with any of these types of coasters is that they work well with hot drinks like tea or coffee but if you put a sweating glass of something cold on them they tend to cling to the glasses and or course they don't absorb water so you need a cocktail napkin under the glass.

Bought generic re-manufactured cartridges and OMG a real mess...printer didn't recognize them, they leaked and needed to be installed over and over again. BUY THE REAL THING....they are more expensive but definitely less trouble in both the long and short run. These worked fine the printer recognized them and installing was a one shot deal.

Next time I'll buy the real thing. The price was right but OMG what a mess! Almost impossible to get the printer to recognize you've put in a new cartridge, they leak all over the place because you have to install, re-install, re-install...and of course this is all done AFTER you've removed the sealing strip. I must say the seller was very nice after I explained the problem they credited my account...but despite being a "nice seller" the next time I'll just buy the regular Epson cartridges and not have to deal with either the mess or frustration.

Beautiful, nice thickness, good color and is a good match to Spode Blue Italian plates although slightly lighter shade of blue they are a perfect match to the Spode coasters. I saw some cheaper on eBay however once you include shipping and the fact that these were shipped free with Prime and delivered in two days I decided to go with Amazon.

Sent it back. I thought I knew what hermetic meant "complete and airtight" the lid for this pitcher came with a plastic ring that kept the lid from staying on the jar. A piece of cheap plastic that I assume was the holder for the lid was loose inside the pitcher...the top far from being either complete or airtight wouldn't even stay on the pitcher. . Ridiculous. I've been a fan of Amazon for years but lately I've been really disappointed in the quality of goods I've received...this was another total piece of knock off junk. Rather than buying this jug...save your money and use an old mayonnaise jar with a piece of plastic wrap as a stopper. Buyer beware.

Just what I was looking for an electric knife that stores easily, works well and the price is right. I had had an electric knife years ago...it died eventually and I replaced it also years ago and was very disappointed in the wimpy "newer version" so I just didn't use an electric knife for years. Recently I decided I really wanted to try an electric knife again for things like slicing artisanal bread, carving turkey, slicing ham, etc. but I wanted something that would not take up a lot of storage space and would have the "umph" to do the job easily. I have been very pleased with this Oster model very handy, easy to operate and relatively inexpensive...biggest thing to remember with any electric knife is avoid hitting the bones when carving and it should last for years.

Wonderful source of Persian recipes well presented with great straightforward instructions on how to achieve authentic results with ingredients readily available. Definitely a 5 Star cookbook and relatively rare in terms of most cookbooks featuring ethnic cuisine. Not a coffee table cookbook but one you can actually cook from I highly recommend it.
Excellent flavor, fresh and pungent. Zamouri Spices was a good source of this interesting spice.

Wonderful collection of Craig Claiborne recipes. Like having years and years of his NYT columns. Claiborne, Beard, Franey, Child...really brought American cuisine out of the boondocks great nostalgia and a must have cookbook.

Does anyone else think Tommy Lee Jones always seems like the same character in every movie no matter who he's supposed to be portraying? I think George C. Scott captured Patton so well that it seemed that a better job of portraying another swashbuckler general would have been a plum role for someone. Gregory Peck was a little better but I'm still waiting for someone who really can do MacArthur well. I thought Matthew Fox who stars as General Bonner Fellers, an Army officer who, after WWII, is tasked with deciding whether Japans Emperor Hirohito will be hanged as a war criminal really carried the movie then again is appears in virtually every scene. I grew curious about Matthew Fox's character and wanted to know more about him and why he was demoted after the war...fascinating story...Google General Bonner Fellers... would like to see that as a movie.

Really old B movie. Background shots were distractingly one dimensional...acting well lots of "emoting" acting not so much...every seemed to be playing to a single camera. I watched but kept thinking change channels but like a train wreck or homework assignment I watched it all the way to the end.

Filmed by BBC and HBO in 2007-08 an interesting inside picture of the Hussein family dynamic. Is this what it takes someone crazier and more paranoid than the Shiia and Sunni who have been fighting each other since Mohammed died?

I love this cookbook. While I had purchased several Indian cookbooks in the past this one is the BEST. Recipes absolutely delicious...easy and practical. I have recommended it to several friends who are equally thrilled. The Quick Fish recipe and various condiment recipes are incredible.
Loved this series my only regret was that it was too short...wish they'd done a Season 3, 4, etc. through Claudius.

I am really pleased with this Immersion blender. I bought it to replace an older immersion stick with multiple blades that was just ok...I noticed one reviewer said it was hard to clean what I've discovered is that since the base is stainless steel when I want to clean it, I boil some water and just put the Quik Stik into the boiling water after rinsing it off to sterilize it. No problem at all. I'd shopped around because as I've gotten older I find lifting a pot of soup and pouring a bit at a time into a blender problematic...so felt that if I could skip the step of pouring split pea soup into the blender and back into a pan...life would be easier. This quik stick is like a little outboard motor and works fine...no lifting although it's not as fast as a blender does small batches it's just easier for me than doing all that lifting and pouring back and forth. Also much more convenient than pulling the blender out of the cupboard rather than just reaching into the drawer to get the Quik Stick.

I'd ordered the pudding cookbook in this tiny little UK souvenir series...expecting it to be "cute" but not necessarily useful. I love it...every recipe has turned out candies exactly as I had hoped. Did require ordering some specialty items like golden syrup, black treacle, glucose and demerara sugar but while there are "substitutions" that can be made I wanted to give the recipes a fair chance...an instant read thermometer is helpful too...but I promise the recipes are lovely and you will enjoy them if UK candy items are what you're looking for.

In recipes I've noticed when a recipe calls for Glucose they blithely suggest going to the local drug or chemist shop...I've tried that and maybe it's my area or the age of mega chain drug stores but they've never had it and look at me like I'd asked for something bizarre. Ordered this with other ingredients needed to make the recipes in "Favourite Sweets and Toffee Recipes" by Birkett Foster. Worked perfectly and showed up quickly along with other specialized ingredients I needed. So I'm pleased and it was cheaper than the sirop du glucose from France also available online.

While this demerara sugar is ok, I should have just bought it at the grocery store where it was cheaper...but I was ordering ingredients for everything in the British souvenir cookbook "Favourite Sweets and Toffees" and as I had a couple of cans of golden syrup, black treacle, glucose I just tossed this in to get it all shipped at once. If you have access in your local grocery store check the price and quantity and it might be cheaper.

I wanted to make black pasta and had recipes from a Spanish cookbook that called for squid ink...while I am a fan of calamari I wasn't excited about trying to either trying to extract ink from any of the fresh squid available in the Bay Area...or using a jar of liquid ink as the ingredients included various things in addition to squid ink.I decided to try these packets...as was pleasantly surprised as they are dry, can be used more or less like you'd use a spice as they are dry and when added to wet ingredients such as pasta dough or the sofritto of paella they blend perfectly introducing only the mild seafood umami flavor of squid ink. I'm very pleased as in addition to being convenient rather than producing the "brownish" tint of a lot of squid ink mixtures this gave me the true black I had been looking for in black pasta. Delicious.

While I realize the differences in cooking times, length of grain, tastes and aroma between various varieties of rice and the unique qualities of rices such as Arborio. I had never tried Calasparra or Bomba rice but as I was exploring Spanish cuisine and trying to make authentic paella I figured I had to try the correct rice.THIS IS PERFECT! Cooks quickly, absorbs an incredible amount of  liquid well while retaining the distinct "al punto" (similar to al dente in Italian cuisine) bite. My only regret was this bag wasn't larger as my first seafood paella (serving 6) used 3 cups so I figure each of these bags will only make 2 average sized paella.

I was interesting in making authentic paella and read that finding authentic sweet smoked paprika from Spain, as well as Spanish saffron where essential...I had authentic Hungarian Paprika to make Hungarian dishes...and a tin of smoked paprika that didn't impress me...but I'm the type of cook who figures after buying the paella pan, a cookbook, Spanish saffron even though I already had saffron and bomba rice which I'd never heard of...why balk at spending $5.00 for some more paprika. OMG it's incredible....I've never imagined paprika could make such a difference in terms of a making a soffrito....I highly recommend this brand it is truly amazing in terms of flavor...so much so I bought 3 cans to get the sale price  on another site along with the saffron and some other items. Spices despite having the same name are not uniform in quality or freshness but this brand was marvelous and incredibly red just as paprika should be. Immediately recommended it to a fellow foodie to try.

I like this fluted pastry wheel...it's large wheel is efficient, the handle is comfortable, the price was right...but I felt the wheel could be sharper as while it cuts pastry when I tried to use it to make pasties and needed to cut around the rim of an inverted bowl to make a perfectly round 6" circle...while it cut it didn't do so neatly leaving pieces that needed to be torn away by hand...despite using uniform pressure. Still of you plan to do nothing more than cut in a straight line it's fine...and the price is right.

Season 4 was a disappointment as the plots seemed more or less "thrown at the walls" to see what might stick. However as I had previously bought Seasons 1, 2, 3, I felt I had to pre-order this Season in hopes that things would return to the former quality of the story thread in Season 5...when I love a series I don't want to skip Seasons. Really not loving the "rape" angle for Anna and Bates...we covered all the prison aspects already...Just a plot line developed to maybe distract us from the "hole" left by Matthew's departure...ditto the schizophrenic treatment of the character Thomas...he's a creep in the initial seasons, then he suddenly seems changed and repentant now he's suddenly back to being a weasel...What's up with that? Surely we could give the downstairs as seedy screwed up characters a break and move on to how the upstairs is going to save the estate, raise the little ones particularly Mary's child that no one...not the grieving Grandmothers or Mommy bother to visit...again what's up with that...having lost one's son or husband...it doesn't follow that neither would not focus on the child...I don't know but my feeling this season was...Good Lord Fellowes "Keep Calm and Carry On" pick up a story line that's not recycled and is vaguely reminiscent of something other than a tawdry soap...quiet flailing and develop the characters you still have. Photography and acting as always excellent...now they just need a clue and a plot.

To clarify those shopping for Agatha Christie's Poirot DVD's this collection contains all 12 A&E (Arts & Entertainment Channel) feature length Poirot films:After the FuneralCards on the TableDeath on the NileEvil Under the SunFive Little PigsThe HollowLord Edgware DiesMurder in MesopotamiaThe Murder of Roger AckroydThe Mystery of the Blue TrainSad CypressTaken at the FloodIf you're a fan as I am at least with a list and definition of which films are included will help you shop the multiple versions of Poirot out there. The collection of 12 discs has a play time of @ 19hours 39 minutes plus some "bonus features" not included in the approximate time.Great mysteries, beautiful settings and an outstanding cast...who could ask for more? I'm thrilled and even though the collection is $39 it's actually a bargain at @ $3.25 a disc to own the whole collection as it was $53.69 at Barnes & Noble and much more expensive if you buy the individual feature length versions of these Poirot films.

I'm a semi-pro photographer. In other words, I am paid, have some skill, but I don't make my living doing it. My main software of choice if Adobe Lightroom, but while that is a wonderful tool for photographers, it does have limitations. With Lightroom, you can enhance what is already there, touch up skin and go wild with colors and tones. But you can't open closed eyes. You can't really move elements within a photo. You can't add things that aren't already there.But with this, you can. I'm amazed at the tools included. The price of this software is very similar to Adobe Elements, but you get everything Elements has, and MORE. You get a warp tool. You get a serious number of brushes that are great to use. You can edit RAW photos. You can add text and make it wrap. You can do so much!There are easy modes for those who want something nice and quick. But I often find those effects to be heavy-handed and way too processed. But with this, you can go into the edit mode and do everything yourself. Use those layers, adjust the tones, make it look real nice.Is it difficult to learn? Probably, if you have no previous experience at all. But I wouldn't say it's any more difficult than Photoshop, or GIMP.It has two versions: 32 bit and 64 bit so you can choose what works best on your computer.Who is this software for? Someone who is serious about photography but hates the thought of subscription services. (I am one of these.) Someone who doesn't want to pay through the nose for software.Does this replace Lightroom? No, it doesn't. Lightroom really shines in that you can edit tons of photos AT ONCE. This is necessary if you are a professional. But if you're a hobbyist and you're not dealing with hundreds and thousands of photos, then this is really the only thing you need.Can't recommend it enough.If you do decide to get this and are having a hard time learning how to use it, there are plenty of good tutorials on YouTube, not to mention

When I first got this, the thing was wildly inconsistent. One minute my head was 96.2, the next it is 98.4. (These readings were almost taken back to back from the exact same spot.) The reading would also vary greatly based upon which spot on your forehead you would use. It was also difficult to use because it didn't come with explicit directions. There's all sorts of beeping going on and I'm not sure what they all mean. How long am I supposed to hold the scan button? Where on the head do I scan? There were some directions on the packaging but they weren't specific or helpful.I was very frustrated with this thermometer and just stuffed it into a drawer. However recently, my baby got sick and I couldn't find our regular thermometer so I got this out. It said everything was fine. I tried it several times and it varied from 98.2-98.8 which seemed more consistent. But you know, I still was worried because I just didn't know how reliable this was. My husband finally found our regular thermometer and everything was indeed okay.So would I recommend this? I don't know. For the price, I think you could go with something more reliable and proven. When your child is sick, you need those readings to be spot on.Note: I received a sample in exchange for my honest opinion.

I can't believe how well this works! I"m one of those who hates going to the bathroom in public places, and heck, even at a friend's house. But unlike most, I detest the aerosols and other bathroom deodorizers. They're so heavy handed, and they just feel like you're trying to over power the bad smell with chemicals.But with this, it actually works and I like it that it's made from essential oils because if there's any ... um... back splash, you don't have harmful chemicals on your skin.It's very easy to use: just shake, spritz three times, do your business and flush. And the smell really is gone, not just a good smell covering a bad one.The ultimate test was when I had my husband try this. My husband can really bomb a bathroom (sorry honey!) so much so that it lingers LONG afterwards. But he tried this, and I entered the bathroom immediately afterwards and nothing but good smells! I was blown away!The only bad thing I can think of, is that the Rose geranium smells is a bit strong, and it does linger in the bathroom for some time. But it's a pleasant smell and doesn't seem too chemically. And it doesn't smell like a layer covering another layer.

Fits a bit large. My husband, who typically wears  34X32 had to use a belt when getting this size. But the pants feel VERY comfortable and warm. Perfect for autumn or winter. Looks good on him too.Easy care and maintenance (machine wash and dry) and seems well made.

I got this wig in purple, and as you can see in the photo, the color is rich and vibrant. I love the length and how it curls at the ends and it really looks good on. It will fit most heads - It looked great on my six year old, myself and even my husband! (Who has a very big head! He loved wearing it, thought it was hilarious!)The only thing we didn't like was how hot it was to wear. But this is true of every wig, there's no getting around it.We all love this wig; it's perfect for Halloween, cosplay or just every day shenanigans.Note: I did receive a sample in exchange for an honest review.

I have a photography business and it's very important that my business cards look nice. Besides, I spent good money getting good quality cards, I hate to carry them around in my purse or wallet and have them get bent out of shape.This little card holder is just perfect. It's professional looking and keeps my cards in pristine condition. No concavity, no bent corners, no folds. Fits right in my pocket for easy access.Note: I received a sample for an honest review

Got this for my almost-seven-year-old boy and he loved it. Still loves it.We read it together with me doing the voice of bird and him doing the voice of squirrel. But after we finished reading it, I still catch him picking it up by himself and going to his room. Then I would here little outbursts of laughing or squealing.The story is one of friendship between two very different personalities. And at first they don't get a long, but as the journey progresses they see the value of each other.The story is a great one, very age appropriate, and the illustrations are brilliantly colorful and expressive. I really can't recommend this enough. We're buying all the books in the series!

I've never had boyshort underwear before and didn't know what to expect. After using them for several days now, here are the things I like/dislike:Like:-They really are breathable. I'm firmly a cotton girl but I have to admit, these are pretty nice too. They're very soft and pretty airy.-Colors are neutral, nothing way out there.-Fit was perfect-Launder well and low maintenance (Yay, no hand washing!)Dislike:-They did not look flattering on me. The waistline scoops down right at the belly and makes it look bigger/flabbier. Of course this could just be a particular thing with my body shape so I didn't ding off any stars for this.-There is only elastic at the waistband, none for the legs so they do move occasionally.Just a note to keep in mind: the colors are assorted so you may not get what is pictured. I got a different pack with grey, white, black and pink (not the nude color) but it seems like all the colors are neutral so you shouldn't be too unhappy with the color choices.

I'm a huge fan of essential oils, and among them, Lavender has to be one of my favorites. This bottle came very well packaged. It was sealed TWICE so there's no leakage, and then encased in bubble wrap. The scent is exactly as I expected. The only thing of note: while the description says it is organic, nothing on the bottle indicates this.Very sweet and calming smell.

Wow, these things are delicious!I have to admit that I'm a chip fiend. I sneak in potato chip snacks all the time, and it's happened more than once that I suddenly and unexpectedly find I've eaten the entire bag.With these, you get the crisp crunch and the burst of flavor with not so many calories. Spicy, but not too spicy. (I'm a spice wimp and can handle these.) Best yet it's not deep fried so you don't get the greasy fingers and clogged up arteries that you would get with chips.I know it says gluten free, which is true, but it does have carbs. (In fact, the first ingredient is tapioca starch) so those avoiding carbs would not want to get these.But otherwise, I love them. I think I finally found something decently healthy to satisfy my potato chip lust.

This doll... where do I even begin? I got this for my daughter and though she was a bit young for it, I thought she would still be able to appreciate some elements of the toy. But I was wrong. The doll scared her. Freaked her out is probably a more proper word. She kept hiding behind me and peaking out to look at it.But do you know who *did* take to the doll? My son! He actually loves it and plays with it for hours on end. So at least it is appealing to children and that is a very important element. Which is why I gave this four stars. But if it were solely up to me, I would knock down a few stars.First of all, it *is* a little scary. I can relate to my daughter. When the baby is chewing, the mouth chomps up and down and there's a mechanical sound accompanying it so it is a little weird. Secondly, the head is so heavy that it often falls over. And then the baby says words to the effect that it can't eat while laying down. My son cannot get it to sit and often just feeds it in his arms. I can get it to sit after many tries. We'll probably just wind up propping it up with some books.Also, there's the food. It's basically play doh that you shove into its mouth, but then it sticks there and doesn't go down to later be "changed" in the diaper. My son usually uses his finger to make it go down, but as the directions clearly state, fingers should never be placed into the doll's mouth. (Good luck with that one!)So in summary, I'm not crazy about this doll. I prefer traditional ones that don't have bells and whistles. But I can't just go on my feelings because this isn't for me -- this is for my child, who for some reason, LOVES this doll. And in the end, isn't that what really matters in a toy?

The idea behind this is nice - you can strum and the tuner will tell you which strings are flat or sharp instead of laboriously going through each string. However in practice, it just doesn't work. I think maybe the overtones interfere with it because I could tune each string (and it would register as perfect) and then strum and it would say 2 or 3 strings were off. I've yet to have the strum feature be reliable.Of course tuning the old fashion way - each string at a time - works great on this. And the display is very bright and easy to read. But if you're going to be tuning one string at a time, there are other (cheaper and better) tuners that are more suited to the job.

Got the dark stone wash jeans in 34X32 for my husband who's 6 foot tall and 160 lbs. They're a great pair of jeans. he says they fit just right, seem well made and look good on. Not too snug but not so roomy that it looks messy. The 1% spandex makes them nice and comfortable when he squats or sits down, and the elastic waistband is also nice.

I wasn't quite sure what to expect with this game. I ordered this for my six year old boy, who knows nothing about Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. I wondered if, not knowing the story line or who the characters are, would he still like it? And the answers seems to be yes! He played it non-stop for a week!This game is very different than previous leap pad games. It did not come with a cartridge, the game itself is downloaded via wi-fi or over Ethernet if you connect it to your computer. The cards themselves...well, he had a hard time figuring them out on his own so I did have to help him. But once he figured it out, it was kind of cool. The camera recognizes the cards well, even in low light conditions. The characters popping out of the cards was quite a novelty and very neat. But what I like best about the cards was the fact that my child was physically interacting with the game, not just staring at the screen in a mind-numbing way. The game works with math and fraction skills, but also is very much a game so there is a fun factor too.All in all, we've been pleased -- he enjoys the fun and I like that it's reinforcing math skills.

We got our camping lantern and absolutely love it. Why hadn't anyone thought of this before? It's useful in so many ways! It comes with two USB adapters, one male and one female. So you can use the female and plug it into a laptop and charge the light. Or if you need something to be charged you can use the male adapter. (You would also need your charging adapter because few phones are going to be able to use the female USB by itself) If you feel like roughing it (or are in an emergency situation where there is no electricity) you can hand crank the thing to power up the three phase alternator within the light. No constantly searching for batteries!We have used it both as a flashlight and lantern. My six year old likes the lantern because it's cool and has a "camping feel." I like that the light is very bright and so versatile. It has a handle that you can use to hold or to hang up, and since it collapses into itself, it's small and very easy to pack. I think this light would be useful not only for camping trips but in emergency situations as well.Note: I did receive a sample in exchange for an honest review. At no point was I under any obligation to give this a positive rating.

Got this for my six year old son to bring to school. So far, he loves it. Very easy to get water out of but it doesn't leak out and make a mess all over his lunch bag or backpack. The handle makes it easy for him to bring it to the cafeteria when it's lunch time and the design is nice but not too cutesy.For me, the cleaning isn't too hard, especially since you can pop it into the dishwasher. (You do need to dismantle it first, otherwise all the little parts will get mildew)All around, this has been a great bottle.

I have four hummingbirds fighting over the feeder I have in the yard, so hoping to alleviate some of the congestion, I got this window feeder. (Plus, I was looking forward to some up-close observations of the birds.)On the first day, two of the birds hovered by looking at it but did not feed. On the second day, I had one feed. On the third day, I had two feed. After that, nothing.I've tried moving it to different windows and still nothing.My personal theory is that the hummingbirds are scared by their own reflection because they think it is a competitor bird. Because my birds know full well this feeder is out there; they just choose to fight over the one in the yard and ignore this one.But I have to add that the ant moat on this works spectacularly. On the first day, I installed it without the ant moat. I read previous reviews where people complained the suction cup wasn't holding. So rather then add extra weight to it, I figured I would go moat-free. Besides, we really don't have  any kind of an problem where I live. But wouldn't you on on the second day, I woke up in the morning to find a steady stream of little black ants heading for this thing? I dusted off the ants, quickly installed the moat and then dropped of my son at school. I forgot about the whole thing until lunch time, where I observed the poor hapless ants swimming around in the water. The line of ants was still there, much not as strong. By dinner time, the line of ants was entirely gone leaving only the waterlogged ants to their fate.So the moat works spectacularly. Wish the hummers actually used it.

Ever since I had children, I've become much more aware of what goes on my skin. My baby daughter is always blowing raspberries on my arm, gumming down on my fingers and get even giving me kisses. That makes me aware of what ingredients are on my body lotions because I really don't want her ingesting anything terrible while she's loving on me.So I"ve started making my own body oils. Mostly I had been using sweet almond oil but the shelf life is only one year. Plus, it does have a tinge of scent to it. I've used jojoba before but it's very expensive.This coconut oil, so far, is the best thing that I've ever used. I use it after a shower and my skin is so soft. I add a bit of lavender essential oil and it soothes the senses.I've loved this so much that I now use it on my baby too. I prefer this over the mineral oil in baby oil. I would buy this in bulk if I could since the shelf life is so long!

I got this for my son who's always biking, scooting or running around outside. It's great to hold things for him, such as the garage door opener so he can let himself in, but mostly it's for safety reasons. With the summer solstice past us, the days are getting shorter and he's still playing when it's dark. So I have him wear this and I feel like it makes him more visible.I like that the belt feel sturdy and well made. The straps are adjustable so that it can fit on my husband, or it can fit on my skinny little son. The par that holds things looks tiny, but in reality the back is a gusset type design so it actually contains a lot more than you think it can.So far we've been very happy with this. To me, it seems like a more practical (yet cooler?) version of a fanny pack. And I love it!Note: I was given a review sample in exchange for an honest/unbiased review.

We've got a two-story house. The wi-fi antenna is on one side of the house on the second floor. The Roku is clear on the other side on the first floor. If we use the wireless with the Roku, the video is so slow to load. Like slower than sprouting mushrooms, slow. And it stops intermittently to load some more. Needless to say, this is annoying. So I jumped on the chance to get this power line adapter.It's so easy to set up. You stick an Ethernet cable into it, hook it up to your router, then plug it into any plug in your house. Then go to where you need fast internet, plug the accompanying unit into the wall outlet, then viola! You have an Ethernet port! It really is incredibly easy! And it's really fast too, so much faster than when we were using wi-fi.And added benefit is that with this model, you don't even lose the use of your plug outlet since it has the power socket on the back.We've been really happy with this, con't recommend it enough.

Update: 11/17/2015 - This laundry cart is now out of commission. Shortly after writing this review, one of the wheels broke off. We supper glued it back on, and that worked for awhile, but it's now broken yet again. But this time, the wheel didn't simply come off, the wood housing for it actually split. For the price you're paying, this should last longer than this. What an utter disappointment. I've changed the rating to two stars. Original review follows below.When I saw this laundry cart available, I immediately got it. Visions of my children neatly throwing their whites and colors in the appropriate bag right before jumping into the bath swam through my head. No more picking up clothes! No more hauling the heavy (and unwieldy) Rubbermaid plastic basket up and down the stairs. I was delighted and excited to try it out.But in practice, things were a bit different.Assembly was very easy and my husband had it up in no time. The first thing that struck me was "Whoa, it's much bigger than I thought!" It didn't fit in the kid's bathroom. So much for putting it next to the bath tub. There just wasn't room.So the next option was to put it in my bathroom. And again, there wasn't room. I mean, I suppose it fit but it was in the way and made navigating in the bathroom cumbersome.Next, I tried putting it in our closet. It's a small walk in closet and immediately saw there wasn't room there either. Finally, we settled on placing it in our bedroom right next to the bathroom door. And it works great there. Love it that the bags are movable and so light. Love it that the colors are neutral and go with any color scheme. Love it that there is ample room int he bags so you've got a good size load when they're full.If your laundry room is on the same floor as this cart, I envy you because there is no heavy lifting involved at all - just wheel the cart to wherever it needs to go.So this laundry cart is great. Ample size as long as you've got a good place for it.

I have two children: a baby girl and a six year old boy. Both of them have dry skin/ eczema problems. In the beginning, with the first one, I would use baby lotion on his skin but it didn't help the eczema. Also, I found out that baby lotion actually has lots of questionable ingredients, even the "hypoallergenic" and "natural" ones. The pediatrician recommended good old petroleum jelly, which helped the eczema. However I was still not happy because the jelly still had a very industrial oil smell to it. I know it says it's refined and "purified" but I didn't like the idea of putting it on my sweet baby.The only solution that I have found is to use natural oils with essential oils. So far I have tried Jojoba oil and this sweet almond oil.This sweet almond oil is wonderful; both children use it and no reactions, nothing. It goes on so well and makes their skin so soft. Each of them has their own little bottle and my son loves it that mommy made it just for him. I put several drops of lemon grass for his (because that is the scent he loves best) and a few drops of lavender for my baby girl. With my baby, I give her a bath, give her a little all over massage with the sweet almond oil with lavender and she gets so relaxed. Makes bedtime a lot less stressful and she drops right off to sleep.So far, I really like this oil. My only complaint (and this seems common with many oils, not just this one) is when I received it, the outside of the bottle was very oily, as if some had seeped out during shipping.)Note: I did receive a free sample for review, however I did try my best to be honest and unbiased.

We've used this several times on outings with my 11 month old daughter, and it's great for both restaurant highchairs and grocery shopping carts. Very nice and soft with colors that are gender neutral. (I'm one of those moms that are against saturating baby girls in pink and purple.) The pockets are ideal to stuff little toys in there for baby to find. ( If I put my things in there, like sunglasses or keys, the baby always gets them.) I also like very much that it can fold into its own little pouch. Makes it easier for me to stuff into the diaper bag.Now on to the bad things, which aren't really that bad at all. First, I'm the only one that can make it fold into itself. My husband has tried valiantly but cannot figure it out. Also, (and this is true with ALL cart covers, not just this one) it's a little cumbersome to lug around, unfold, place it, then put it back when it's time to leave. I found it's just easier to wipe down the cart with sanitizing wipes and then just put the child on the cart. Some might think I'm a lazy mom but I like to think of myself as practical. This is my second child and I did the whole cart cover thing with the first one but with the second one, my hands are fuller, my time stretched thinner and I'm much more willing to take the easy route.But with all that said, if you're going to get a cart cover, this is the one to get. One of the better ones that I've seen.

This chair was simple to put together and it's fairly attractive and nice looking. It gets the job done but is it comfortable? Sadly, no. The bottom cushion is hard. After my husband assembled it, I made the mistake of plopping down into the chair and Ow! My bottom hurt for the rest of the evening. Truth be told,  I had a bruised tail bone (I recently gave birth and since the birth, my tail bone has not been the same) but even my husband agrees that the chair is very hard. The only person who likes it in the household is my six year old son, who only likes it because he gets to spin and roll around in it.

Got this for my six year old son and he loves it! Assembly was easy, and once done, the track works as it should. Love it that it comes with three color shifter cars. Two of them were ones he already had from other color shifters tracks, but he didn't mind getting duplicates.Play is messy (which you would expect from all the dunking tanks) so we actually have him play with this outside or in the bath tub just to make things easy. He comes back to this toy again and again, so I would definitely say it's a hit!

This came at the perfect time as our 11 month old has had a cold for about a week now and her nose is dripping like a faucet. We have Nosefrida and while the idea is similar, this oral suction aspirator is much better. For one thing the tip slightly tilts up and is smaller, making it easier to place gently in the nostril. The Nosefrida is so big that you have to put it slightly outside of the baby's nose therefore making you lose a bit of suction. So in short, I got a lot more snot out using this.The other thing I like is it's made of silicone and is soft. The tip (if you accidentally poke your baby with it) is quite pliable and doesn't hurt. Best yet, because it's silicone you can just pop this sucker into the dishwasher. Love that feature! I also like it that the part that goes into your mouth is hard. On the Nosefrida, it's soft and my husband would involuntarily bite down on it occasionally which impeded the air flow. That is not a problem with this one.The only thing I don't like? The filters. You have to use a new one each time. And I can't find where to buy replacement filters or how much they cost.  It comes with a number of them, however when those run out, it looks like we're just going to have to use it as a bulb aspirator.

I've got an 11 month old baby who loves to press her face against the window in our kitchen nook. This happens on a daily basis. There are spit trails, palm prints and when she's sick, there's even snot stains. Licking the window is not a rare occurrence. So am I going to be cleaning this window with Windex? No way! I just take a microfiber cloth, put some water on it and scrub away all the nastiness. If the window is particularly dirty, I'll add a bit of vinegar to the water mix and it does the trick. It doesn't leave any streaks and the window is clean, ready for little miss to gaze once again at the little birds and squirrels on the other side.I also use these towels to dust throughout the house. I used to use swifter but felt guilty throwing the dust thingies away after each use. Seemed wasteful. But these towels pick up the dust without spreading it or adding it to our air. Once done, they go right in the washer and dryer.I also use them to clean my iPad screen, computer screen and even my eyeglasses too. So many uses! Which is why I liked getting these towels in bulk. I got the red ones, and I know others have complained about color bleeding but so far, I have not experienced this. All around, these towels have proven to be very handy!

Please note: This is not for a crib! This is for a cradle pad, which is very small compared to a crib mattress. To gwt an idea for size, it fits snugly over our changing pad. Other reviewers have stated that it fits the standard crib mattress and that's not true. I'm not sure if many people have cradles...but for those rare ones who do, this is the sheet for it.It's incredibly soft and I like that it is organic cotton, however one time in the washer and dryer and there are already threads coming loose. Over all, I haven't been too impressed by the quality.

I got this for my 6 year old son and he absolute loves this. As I type this, he's marching around our yard carrying this under his arm. When he woke up in the morning, the first words out of his mouth were "can I play with my water truck?" He's even asked if he could bring the water truck to the dinner table, where I promptly said "No." (I had to draw the line somewhere)At first he wasn't that impressed because the truck's not very big. It's also very light weight, and the water spout/gun didn't look impressive enough. But we put water in, took it outside and he pushed the handle down. His face lit up when he saw how high and how far the water squirted! He let out a squeal and said "Mom, did you SEE that! It went almost as high as the neighbor's roof!!" (It did not; our neighbor's house is nearly three stories tall but I guess to our son, making half way was close enough)And now that he's carrying it around everywhere, it's kind of a good thing it's so light weight.Of course with this toy, you have to have the talk of "Don't shoot people in the face with it"And really, it's basically a water gun, but I guess for people who are anti-gun but still want their kids to have fun, this is the alternative.Either way, the toy is a hit. Perfect for playing outside in the summer.

I'm getting closer to 40 years and the wrinkles on my face are starting to get noticeable. I've seen products like this advertised a lot lately so I thought I would give it a try. After using this a few times, here are my thoughts:- When I first opened the package, the tip that was already on the device (the coarse one) had a fine white residue on it. As if it had previously been used or perhaps was dirty from the factory? Either way, it was very unappealing to have something that goes on my face come out of the box with residue on it. The other two tips were clean.- I used the precision tip on low suction because I have sensitive skin and did one area of my face. I tried my chin and only my chin so I could compare how my skin looked between my chin and the rest of my face.- The feeling was weird. It's literally vacuuming your face while you slide this abrasive tip over your skin. You have to slide it very slowly, and this is hard to do so since the thing is sucking away at your skin. After the first time, my chin was majorly red and irritated. The irritation subsided pretty quickly though. The second time it was red and irritated as well, though again, the irritation only lasted minutes after I was done.I have not seen any difference or improvement in the skin, however I will freely admit I have not used this enough for it to work. The thing is, it's uncomfortable and unpleasant enough that I'm dubious I want to do it again.I do feel like if given a chance, this could work to reduce lines and wrinkles because it is sucking the collagen back into the lines. Of course it is also stretching your skin out a bit with the suctioning so I'm not sure if the trade off is worth it.Also, you have to use a new filter every time you use the device. EVERY TIME. So you're constantly sinking money into this. It comes with a bag of 30, and you can buy more from the manufacturer's website (I think it's $9.99 for a bag of 30 filters) So it's not too expensive, but still not cheap either. Especially considering the money you've already spent purchasing the system.So Can I recommend it? Not really. But am I encouraging people to stay away from it? Not really. If you're in the the "beauty takes pain" camp then you might be more open to this than I am.

This is my first non-kitchen knife and so far, I've been impressed with it. Very sharp, light, and portable. (I've tried cutting things of various thickness and it's performed very well) The fact that it has a flashlight built in is very handy too. Flipping the blade open is easy to do, and closing it is easy too, but requires two hands and is hard to figure out but once you do, it's no big deal. The handle feels firm in my grasp, and doesn't seem likely to slip. The belt clip means that if I'm wearing pants with no pockets, I can still carry this around and have my hands free.My only complaint is lack of instructions. It comes with a small slip of paper with drawings on it which is hard to figure out. It tells you how to close the blade, but not really. I was also curious as to how to care for the knife, since this was my first one. I went on to the manufacturer's website to see if there was more information. I found this knife, clicked on "download instructions" and got a blank page! Doesn't give me much confidence in the company. I know this knife comes with a lifetime warranty but I don't know how good the company is that backs that warranty.But the company aside, the knife does seem to be in good mechanical condition and does everything it's supposed to. All around, I'm pleased.

This was much more work than I initially realized. Call it ignorance on my part but I thought I would just dump a few seeds in the bald spots on my lawn and then fresh, green, grass would sprout.But no, I realize that's pretty unrealistic. You have to dig up the bald spots and get rid of the dead grass, loosen the dirt and then once you spread down the seed and mulch, you need to diligently water it. Thankfully, we've had lots of storms/rain in my area so it has mostly been a hands-off thing for me after the initial lay down.I really like that it has everything included: the fertilizer, mulch and seeds combined together. So far things look good!

I got Elements 13 because the full Photoshop program was daunting to me. It seemed overly complicated, plus, with the creative cloud subscription service, I would be forever paying money just to use the software. Elements 13 appealed to me because it was simple, and the things I learned using it would help me with Photoshop should I ever decide to upgrade and go all in.But I hit a snag. Elements 13 wasn't as simple as I thought it would be!Sure, the quick modes and guided modes were easy, but I really wanted to use expert mode and it was a little baffling. For example, I wanted to add text to one of my photos. Simple, right? Just use the text tool. Which I did, but for the life of me, I would click on my picture, type, and nothing would show up! It was very frustrating!That is, until I got this book. I love this book. So detailed. Gives examples. You don't have to read everything, just the parts you need to get what you want accomplished. It's written in easy to understand language. Has many photos and illustrations to show you exactly what it's talking about. Love it!And compared to the other book on Elements 13 that I got (Teach yourself VISUALLY Photoshop Elements 13) this one is so much better.
Such a joke, both of my children (my oldest when he was a baby and my 9 months old) pulled these off with no trouble whatsoever. Also a choking hazard to boot! Don't get this!
Absolutely LOVE this series. I REALLY, REALLY, hope they make more seasons. Great for people who like political satire, or fans of the Daily Show.

Got this for my 8 month old baby and we love it! It fits her perfectly, is very soft and she loves the vibrant colors. It absorbs well and when I throw it in the laundry, it doesn't bleed colors over everything. Bets yet, it's big enough that my older son (who is 6 years old) can use it as well.

I'm an hobbyist photographer, which means I've got a *ton* of raw images that take up a lot of space. But these are my "culled" images, and many of them are very important to me so I was really looking for a back up system in case my computer goes kaput. (I'm also a mom to a 6 year old and a baby which means I have tons of video footage too.I've thought about doing cloud storage but I just have SO MUCH that it would take forever to upload everything. Plus, what if I chose a company, move all my files and the company goes out of business? Or somehow loses my files? I know, these are not likely events but still, call me paranoid if you must.This Seagate fit the bill for what I need. It had enough memory space to last me a while, and it was such a cinch to hook up to our router. That way,  both me and my husband has access to it. He has a Linux computer and I have a Windows 7 machine. Both seem to work fine with this Seagate.So far, I've been very happy with it!

My son absolutely loves hot wheels and has many of these track builder sets. Even by itself, this thing is pretty fun. He loves how the cars gets "rejected" by being popped off and I like it that it has many configurations so that it doesn't get old too quickly.It is fairly large and will take up quite a bit of space in the child's room. This is especially true if you have other track pieces and the child builds upon this, which mine did. That's another benefit to this - with the additional tracks pieces, really, the possibilities multiply.I like this because (with the additional pieces) there's room for engineering and creativity. And the "zoom" factor makes it addictive for him to play this as opposed to being on the iPad all day. By itself, it's still a good toy but I think to really get the full benefit, you should get additional track and at least some of the other track pieces.

I'm not sure why this happens but it happens a lot. The label on the vitamin bottle will say "Kids complete" (or something along those lines) and they are actually far from it. Often, they are missing iron and calcium. That is the case with these Smarty Pants vitamins but it's also true with many other childrens chewables or gummies vitamins too. Why do they do that? It find it frustrating as these two things are very important for growing young bodies.Also, I don't like that kids over the age of 3 need to take 4 gummies per serving. That's a lot! Especially considering they don't taste very good. My 6 year old son didn't like it. Curious, I tried them too and thought they tasted awful. The gummies are coated with sugar so you would think it tastes good but it doesn't.I'm sure others might like these vitamins but they just didn't work out for me and my son.

My kids and I have severe allergies to dust and pollen. (Lucky husband has almost none. Why couldn't they get his genes on this one huh?) So I was thrilled to be able to get this. We already have the Hoover WH10600 which we love so I had high expectations for this one.Immediately out of the box, I thought this thing was huge. It looked like a wall air conditioning unit, it's that big. We didn't see any manual with it, but it did come with an extra charcoal filter. We plugged it in and it, whoa! The thing is *really* quiet.  So much more quiet than any other air filter I've ever owned. I was really happy with it (for all of two minutes) when I decided to test out some of the features.And that's when the disappointment hit. None of the buttons worked. NONE.I looked online for the manual and we did everything it told us to. We tried not pressing too hard like it said, and still, nothing. My husband tried it. I tried it. We can't even turn it off, we had to resort to unplugging it from the wall.What a huge let down. I still give it three stars because the low setting works fine for our use. (It's in the baby's bedroom) but it would have been nice to be able to use the other features.

I've been a crocheter for over twenty years and in that time, I've come to realize that organization is key. I can't tell you how many times I've misplaced a specific hook, or my stitch markers have gone missing. I've gone looking for scissors on more than one occasion and those yarn needles are never where I think they are. All these doo-dads are so small and get lost so easily, which is why this organizer is a blessing to me. I LOVE that everything is in one place, no more hunting for this or that. And it's handy because I often take my crocheting to various places to keep myself busy - waiting during my son's music lessons, dental appointments, in the car pool lane at my son's school - and this little clutch makes it so easy to have everything with me.All the implements seem to be equal in quality to what I already have. Definitely would recommend this for the beginner - you get everything you need all at once. And even for those who have been crocheting for a long time; it's a perfect crochet-on-the-go companion.I received a free kit for review purposes but wouldn't hesitate to buy this in the future for gifts for friends.

Got this for the little one, who is 8 months old. I know she's four months away from the recommended age limit, however she actually does like to play with it. She loves gnawing on the little plastic figures (Her favorite is the farmer!) and she loves to toss them down the silo. I'm surprised (and thankful) that she hasn't gone nuts with the door which triggers the sounds. (Don't worry, if you kid DOES go nuts with the door you could always turn the sound off and then pretend that it broke.)The barn is much bigger than I thought it would be. My oldest, who is 6 years old also plays with it. There was a peaceful moment when the two of them were playing, side by side, with this toy and I was so filled with joy that I ran for the camera. But then the moment I took the lens cap off, the big one was playing with a toy the little one wanted and crying broke out. So the moment was lost but I am hopeful that it will happen again. :-)

I have two children, the youngest currently at 8 months and in the middle of teething. I've always just believed that spoons were spoons, they're kind of all the same, but that notion was proved wrong with these. They are the best baby spoons I've ever used between both of my children. My baby girl LOVES these. The reaction to them was far more than I ever imagined. Her eyes literally opened wide and she gurgled and smiled as she bit down on these spoons. Even my husband (who normally is oblivious about baby gear) noticed how different and nice these were.They're silicone which means that they're safe. (Pacifiers are made of silicone if that tells you anything) I don't have to worry about BPA or any other chemicals. They're colorless so no worries about dyes or harmful colors and they're very easy to clean, just pop them in the dishwasher. Probably the best thing about them is the squishiness of them. Even after we feed her, baby loves to gnaw on these while the rest of us finishes our meal. It's kind of like a spoon, teether/toy all in one.Will definitely be getting more of these.
Absolutely love it! The humor is silly yet witty and all the actors are great. Looking forward to season 2

The idea for this is pure brilliant; I thought it would be a time/sanity saver. I mix pumped breast milk with formula, and need 3 oz of formula for each bottle. If you've ever mixed bottles, you'll know that 3 oz is difficult to make because it's 1 scoop for every two ounces. Measuring out 1.5 scoops (when there is no halfway mark on the scoop itself) is an exercise in trial and error. We thought this would save us since you can set the machine to 3 oz and, la-dee-dah, our troubles are over!But reality kicked in and we are still measuring and mixing bottles by hand. Why you ask?Several reasons:1. Our bottles do not fit on this machine. We use the Dr.Brown's glass bottles. The 4 oz. size is too short and the machine winds up missing the bottle and spraying formula everywhere. If we use the little stand that comes with it, the 4oz bottle hits the top and doesn't slide under very well. We tried using the Dr. Brown 8oz glass bottle and that doesn't fit at all.2. When the formula reservoir was 1/3 full, the machine thought it was "empty" and refused to work.Putting the thing together was also not a walk in the park. The directions could have been clearer and there were so many things to wash. Overall, the idea was great, but the execution not so much.

I got this for my 8 month old baby (who is in the middle of teething.) It's cute as a button and just the perfect size for her little hands, not to mention it's easy to just slip into the purse or diaper bag when we're on the go. The spikes of the hedgehog are rubber and perfect for gnawing on. The backside has green little nubs that provide sensory stimulation, and the belly makes this an instant percussive instrument.But by far, the favorite feature has got to be the surprise mirror. She loves sliding the hedgehog and looking at herself!Great toy, would definitely recommend.

My baby is 8 months old and we got this mainly for the "play" feature. This is our second child so we actually had two pack n' plays from my oldest, however my baby hates to be placed in these pack n' plays. The floor is off the ground on legs and when she crawls around or moves, the floor wobbles and moves with her. This has proved to be very frustrating and she always screams to be let out.She's perfectly happy to sit and play in this however because the soft mat is on the floor and doesn't shift around under her. It's so much more stable. She's happy with it, which means I am THRILLED!But this is an all-around great tool to have with baby. I actually wish I had this when my little one was born. She had GERD and had so much trouble with spit-up the first few months of her life. This inclined sleeper, placed next to our bed, would have been a God-send to me. Instead, we tried various other things (like sleeping in a swing, or rocker) which did not work out too well because they caused other sleeping issues.  (The swing squeaked loudly when she moved, the rocker positioned her head in such a way that it was hard for her to breathe.)The inclined sleeper does have buckles to keep your baby secure. It is rated for babies up to five months, or whenever the baby starts to roll or turnover.The diaper changing clutch that comes with this is also very nice. I've had many portable diaper changing mats in the past that come with my diapers bags, but this one, by far, is the nicest. Easy to clean, has good cushioning to make baby comfortable, and a pocket for everything.Can't recommend this enough!

They call this the "nifty fifty" lens with good reason. Absolutely love it! It's like getting a whole new camera!I've used this indoors with low light, outdoors in bright sun. Once I put it on my Rebel, it has permanently stayed there and I plan on keeping it there.

This review is for those looking to buy this used since you really can't buy this new anymore. The question is: Is this worth buying used? Will I still get much usage out of it? The answer is a resounding YES! Go for it!I have always been interested in photography, however DSLR cameras are EXPENSIVE. Entry level models are around $500 and that's a lot of money to sink into something you're not sure about. So when the chance to get this used came up, I jumped on it. It was my first DSLR and I was nervous, but it was something I was dying to try. And I'm so glad I did! I now have other cameras and consider myself a hobbyist enthusiast, and despite having newer/nicer cameras, I still take this one out and use it quite often. It's an oldie but a goodie!This things I like:1. Built like a tank. I have bonked this thing so many times, and while I have not outright dropped it on the cement floor, I've come pretty close. I can't believe how nice it still looks despite my abuse.2. It's simple. I really don't need Wi-fi, eye-fi, GPS or any of those bells and whistles that the newer models come with. I want a beautiful picture with good focus and vibrant colors. This camera delivers that. I shoot in Raw and the processor doesn't slow down much. (Well, except when I'm photographing children, who move a mile-a-minute and I need to capture EVERY MOMENT, then the buffer gets a little overwhelmed.)3. The menus and buttons are intuitive. I did read the manual however you kind of don't really even need to. The minute I got this, without knowing anything about photography, I started shooting immediately. My hands and eyes were just itching to capture every moment around me and this camera, on auto, does a good job of that. Obviously it is to your benefit to learn to use manual mode, however for the beginner, it's nice to have the auto work so well while you're trying to get a grip on aperture, shutter speed, ISO and such.4. Despite being simple, it does have all the features that you need to capture that great photo. It has front and rear curtain sync flash; matrix, center-weighted and spot metering, auto exposure lock, single auto focus and continuous auto focus among other features.Some things people might think are cons:1. Only three focus points. I actually don't think this is a con, since I mainly just use the one in the middle and recompose, however some people like to have options and three isn't many.2.  CCD sensor. I know CMOS has dominated the latest image sensors, but I find that the CCD on this one produces quality images that are comprable to my newer CMOS DSLR cameras.3. Only 10.2 MP. But truthfully, even though the newer ones have more than double the MP of this one, 10.2 mp is more than what you would ever really need. If you read up on things, you'll find that megapixels is not your main concern when looking for a quality camera.So really, the cons aren't really cons for me, though I suppose some people may think of them as cons. So if you can get this camera for really cheap used, I would jump on that.
