I've had outdoor solar lights before and they're usually quite dim, but in this case, the lights are vibrantly bright! Makes it easier for the husband to come home at night and not have to use his cell phone as a flashlight to see where he's going.The fact that this is solar makes it much easier mowing-wise. No wires running through the grass to have to wind up or trip on. We've loved this so far!I was given this as a sample, but will be buying more in the future.

This looks amazing and if your a Minecraft player you will enjoy wearing this out at parties. It is a bit expensive for what it is but I like that it is cardboard that you can collapse for the rest of the year waiting for Halloween. I do suggest getting some 3-4" foam to put up at the top of the box so that it fits better and pushes the cardboard ring down on your head better. Makes it a bit more adjustable and will help for kids trying to wear this, allowing for them to turn their heads.

Before you get upset that I wrote "Build quality feels cheap"; I am coming from a solid stainless steel jenair deluxe NSF dishwasher where the door weighed like 10 lbs. This Bosch performs amazingly better than that old jenair, yet weighs significantly less. I am glad we purchased the one with the handle on the front after reading many reviews about it being a weak spot with the hidden handle ones.For the review:This DW is almost silent, no seriously. The Jenaire was so loud you couldnt talk in the kitchen with it running. Quite often my wife will ask me when I am going to start the dishwasher and Ill gladly reply... " Its already running!"The dishes come out spotless. Our old DW had a seal breaking down (one of the reasons we were getting rid of it) and it left little rubbery black spots on all of the dishes. One cycle in the Bosch and all of those spots were gone.Minor niggle: You almost HAVE to use a drying agent to get the dishes perfect. Because of this the cost of ownership is a tad higher on the front end, but the energy efficiency of this DW probably more than makes up for it.Setup:Wow - Completely doable by most people. It comes with a junction box that is super easy to setup and install. I was so blown away that I didnt have to lay under the DW for 3 hours trying to connect all of the power connectors. That little junction box plus plug that you can remove was a delightful surprise.As I stated it was very light and easy to put in under the cabinet.Overall we are VERY happy with our purchase.Thank you for reading my review.

These sheets are really nice. They do copy well which is what I suggest to do while making characters then transfer them over to these sheets. I believe as of this review that these are no longer in print. Making them sort of rare, another reason you might want to copy them. The paper is really sturdy and should hold up to multiple erasing and writing (willpower area).Highly recommended!

I have had other linksys routers in the past but since they were purchased by Cisco, you know the router people; the quality has drastically improved. About this router. I have this hooked up behind my cable modem. In front of it is a 12 port Gigabit switch and this is in-between. Setup was very easy and as stated it is almost effortless with the built in setup. Now for the specifics. I noticed that this router did extend beyond my old router by a good 30 feet. The file transfers were on par with my previous router. I have 2 kids in the house and everything is wireless so we really tested this thing out. I never noticed a slowdown on any file transfers, it just seems that this router is a beast.Overall we are very pleased with our new router and expect it to last some time. I will update this as we use it more.Thank you for reading my review.UPDATE:12/14/05Ok so after my initial setup I began to have random drops on both 2.4GHz and also 5.0GHz. I suspect a firmware update will be out soon because this is a problem with this model I will update this review when I find out about it. Performance wired is fine. Its the wireless that drops often. I talked with the techs at Linksys *(it comes with 6 months free tech support if you register it), and they suggested to update the firmware even if it is 1.0 because it might be better than the factory default. I declined to do this but I suspect it will not make a difference.They also suggested setting the 5GHz to 20 or 40 MHz and setting 2.4GHz to channel 6 by default. I did this and as of this update its been up 1 hour with no dropping. IMHO this is completely unacceptable for a router in this price range. It is my hope they have a new firmware soon.

This headset from Turtle Beach, while based on Disney Infinity as a theme, is right on par with the company's other offerings. This set comes with some cool features:- Ability to change covers on the side (they are stickers that are similar to laptop/phone skins)- A cord that is almost 1 mile long (ok thats an exaggeration, but really it has a super long cord)  I think this is to reach a console and remain on the couch. You can remove the long section and be left with a standard length cord with a headphone/phone mini jack plug on the end.The sound quality is very similar to my Xbox Turtle Beach headset. Its has rich bass and good highs. It really shines at the midrange, which makes sense as this is for VOIP communications with your team mates.For children?Because Infinity is a child's game, I gave these to my daughter to use for a few weeks. She has worn them almost non stop while she is playing with her electronics or tablets. Quite often she cannot hear me because of the passive noise suppression built in. It fits her head quite well and she has never complained of any pain for wearing long periods.Overall this is a great headset, the theme is fun for kids or fans of Infinity!Thanks for reading my review :)

High quality fryer!We bought a Waring Pro fryer for our food truck a few years ago and has held up well since we sold the business (we kept the fryer). It had seen some commercial use for the 2 years we had it. Getting long in the tooth; when this one popped up we grabbed it. First off the quality is top notch! The Waring had a dial timer that NEVER worked correctly. This one has a digital readout that is easier to see. *When making double fried- french fries its critical for the timing to get a consistent product. The DeLonghi fryer with its digital timer is super easy to monitor cook times. The dual zone is nice because you can make 2 batches at the same time and alternate the frying you are doing.Pros:+ Digital timer+ Dual Zone allows for faster cooking and cooking multiple things+ Great constructionCons:- Cleaning might be a problem over time but for now it cleans up well (I am thinking of when the grease gets to be more sticky in the corners)Overall we are VERY happy with this fryer and would recommend!

Fantastic sandbox with some fun side quests.I finally finished this last night. I have had it a while now. This is not due to lack of playing but instead being able freely roam and explore. The story is very compelling and engaging.Pros:+ Amazing story+ Fun multiplayer (go Ellohime!)+ Sandbox - explore the whole city of Chicago and outlying areas+ Open Missions+ Great CarsCons:+ Aiming sometimes is off+ AI is flakey at timesOverall I REALLY enjoyed this game and recommend it!

The image shows what looks like a 60" tv on this unit. Unfortunately they used all small electronics so once I put it together I was surprised just how small it really was. Besides that; it assembles well. Like an IKEA product the assembly is pretty straightforward. It supports my electronics very well and has a nice clean look.Overall pretty happy with this unit.

Its a really good shower caddy. I had to get some more heavy duty shower rings at the dollar store. With all the weight of the shampoo, conditioner and other stuff quickly adds up and the metal bead rings bent under that weight. I bought a set of heavy duty plastic rings from the dollar store that hold up all of the weight pretty well. It does a good job and it is very handy to have that stuff hanging in the shower instead of sitting on the sides.Overall very happy with it!

I currently have 4 monitors on my standing electric desk. Prior to this I had 3 monitors mounted on a triple tree bar. The one I ordered was cheap. Both in manufacturing, quality and performance (3 monitors were all at different heights over 3 inches different). Because of this I had guessed this single mount would be similar. I was COMPLETELY wrong. First off this is from 3M. It comes with a nice 3M pad for your desk. The build quality is fantastic. It looks professional. You will not be ashamed to show it off. It has a TON of customization options. Its flexible in many different ways. Comes with allen keys so you need nothing to get this setup. Even the VESA mount screws are supplied and they are thumb type (BRILLIANT).Totally recommend!Thanks for reading my review!

This bed is absolutely amazing. For this price you generally do not get a mattress that is memory foam. We were pleased how it arrived in a large box and not a crate that we were expecting. It was easy to set up. Smelled a bit funny for a day but that cleared up quite well. Give it at least 24 hours before using it.Pros:+ Comfortable+ Supportive+ Easy to install+ 2 Free Memory foam pillows (also a con see below)Cons:- The memory foam pillows are a great bonus, my biggest issue with them is they are made from the foam scraps left over. Because of this they are made up of irregularly shaped little bits. They compress well and dont really cause a problem I just want to mention it.Overall highly recommended! Thanks for reading my review.

As far as I could tell I could not find a definitive answer about this speaker set working as hard wired. It does by the way. Standard wired minijack and RCA plugs.Pros:+ Great sound+ Easy to install+ Quality buildCons:- Turns off after a time and sometimes a lag to turn it back on.I have the older version of this set and have had it over 5 years now. This one looks and sounds the same but its the power on pause that makes me wish for the older one again.Overall happy with these speakers.  Recommended.

Got this set and my son and I are having a blast playing with it. The car is pretty fast and crazy wild to control. My main issue is with the life of the battery. It seems that it only lasts about 10 minutes and then its dead. Would like it if it was a bit longer. Besides that this thing is super fun. Perfect for the upcoming holidays! See if you can get it to jump as high as the top of the tree. The car is super rugged for how small it is. I am glad they took into account that it is going to be slamming into the side walls and of course flying when they designed it. Overall pretty rugged. Get another car to charge so you can play longer.Pros:+ Fast+ Rugged+ Fun+ Easy to setup and get goingCons:- Battery life is 10 minutes or so- Car is a bit hard to control, but that is because if it steered the linkage would almost 100% for sure break.Overall this is a fun set for you and your kids to play with. I recommend getting another car because of the battery life.

Fits well and offers a lot of protection for back and sides. Front screen will still need some sort of protection because this does not come with a screen protector.My last phone I did not have any sort of protection and it slipped off the dresser and landed flat on its back. The screen shattered. I decided at that point to get a protector for my new phone. I looked for an Otterbox solution but at the time there was none.Pros:+ Cheap+ Durable+ Easy to installCons: - No front screen protector includedOverall the con is very minor and I really enjoy this case.

I see what the other people were saying about the clip on this pop filter being weak. What I did to help it out was tip it forward and because it was so bent it prevented it from slipping. Its hard to explain but it works ok now and I didn't have to use other clips or rubber bands.My setup:>> Rode desktop boom arm>> Heil PR 40 end shot micPros:+ Easy to install+ Easy to use and adjust+ Good size for end shot micCons:- As stated in other reviews clip is pretty weakOverall I like this pop filter and the clip being the weakest part is not so bad.

Easy to install, very sturdy and can hold a surprising amount of smaller items. I installed this into my daughters bedroom. It was a perfect option for our little artist. She is able to keep all of her coloring, painting, gluing and cutting accouterments within arms reach of her easel. Also it has helped us keep her room cleaner than we had it before with the various boxes and cases we had her other stuff in.Pros:+ Easy to install+ Easy to set up+ Holds a good deal of items+ SturdyCons:- None really. We really love this wall storage solution

Overview:Ok lets say I love this software! For the past year I have been putting all of my family history on Ancestry. It has been pretty good with regard to finding details out that I might not know. The main issue I have with Ancestry is the monthly cost. With this software you get 3 months deluxe US, which is almost 2x the cost of this product, for that alone its worth it.Reports:(+)So what makes this software so great? The reports mostly. I have one branch of my tree go back to 1060. Thats more than can be shown on any tree available from Ancestry. The farthest you can go on the web is around 3 generations not 25 generations. With the reporting tools on this software you can get a variety of reports that flesh out your family. Ones such as marriage report listing whom everyone was married to. A generation report listing who was born under whom. Honestly there are too many to list here, each one is a very unique way to view a part of the story.Seamless integration with Ancestry:(+)I lost not a single bit of data transferring it from the web down to my computer. All I did was log into ancestry from Family Tree Maker and it drew down all of the data in a GENCOM file. Once in the software it populated a local database with over a years worth of work. With my personal experience this was pretty great.Trees:(+/-)Along with reports the trees available are all great tools for showing your family. I mean the software is Family Tree Maker it should also print out the trees. It does with some great designs. Unfortunately the trees on the software are also limited. I believe you can go back max 6 generations but then it stops. The designs are pretty good to show different relationships. Overall I would have liked more generations, knowing the tree would be physically huge but that is what I want to show.Manual: (-)Holy cow! This is the most convoluted huge tome I have seen in a very long time for a manual. My advice; skip it. Nice effort on their part to add it but it makes even opening the box a daunting appearing task that might scare more users than help them.Summary: (+/-)If you are a versed internet user/ computer operator you can expect this software to perform as an essential at-home addition to the work you have done on Ancestry. If you are just starting out on this journey it might be better for you to use the website first and then start using the software. Their website has much of the same interface and use along with other family members you may not know providing key pieces to your tree. I dont think of this as a solo tool but instead as an augmentation of another (Ancestry). As that, it excels.

Fantastic!This hoover is one of the most powerful hoovers I have used in a long time. Matter of fact when its in the low carpet setting the suction is so strong I cant slide it across the carpet. Not sure if that is a good or a bad thing. I am guessing over time it will mellow out. But for now I cannot run it in low mode on a 1/8 inch thick area rug because the suction is so strong. Besides that there are some really nice features that this vacuum brings.1. Hardwood floor setting. - This is handy in my house because we have almost 100% hardwood flooring in the house. It turns off the brushes (sometimes - read below)2. Cord winder. I had the next tier down from this one and it did not come with a winder. This one has a nice winder in it (strong like bull).3. Pet and HEPA filters - Its amazing how fine of a dust you will see in the canister after use. Its the fine dust that it gets up that is so beneficial to those with allergies.Some pros and cons:Pros: + Easy to assemble - basically 1 long threaded cross head screw. - a bit tricky to line up sometimes + Ability to turn off the brushes + Super strong suction - I cant set this at lowest setting on my area rugs it wont move + Lots of accessories + Great Suck for a Buck ratioCons: - Sometimes its a real pain to get the hardwood mode to engage. Best trick I find is turn it off stand it up till it clicks, engage it then turn it back on - Hard to push on low carpet even with it set on high. This may be because its so new but it is a struggleOverall I love this new hoover and recommend it!

So difficult to use, the "documentation is terrible". I ended up giving this to my daughter to use as a night light but even then we could not get it to function correctly. It is so counter intuitive to use dont even bother wasting the electricity on this. If you are lucky to get it to function right the LEDs are hard to read in anything but a pitch dark room. On top of that the gentle "sunlight" function does not even work.Overall skip this product and search for something better.

The 3rd installment of Dead Rising made officially as an XBox One release day game, is full of issues. The story takes over as Nick and his friends look to escape the city infected with a mass zombie horde. The zombies in this game are slow and stupid, not nearly as silly as some like seen in World War Z or as incessant as the ones in Day Z. Now if you follow my YouTube channel you will see I am big Zombie fan. I did a whole series where I played some 30 zombie games. Getting this game for the Xbox One was almost a no brainer for me. I was soon disappointed with the game I got day 1.The main issues I have with this game are these. When you have a brainless slasher combat game you need simplicity of control.Often I would be fighting and accidentally hit a button that would throw my weapon away. Or when in the midst of combat I needed to eat some food the devs decided that picking up a bag of chips and then eating it should be 2 separate buttons. While from the outside it seems so common sense that it should be easy to remember, in the midst of combat its anything but intuitive and a real chore to remember the keys. Sure with enough muscle memory you might get it but its really difficult in the beginning. Ok so your amazing with muscle memory.Ignore that part of my review if you will. Instead the physics are laughable at best. Several times I would bump into another object to have my car explode and I flip no less than 300 times down the road to stand up unscathed. Once I bumped into a parked tow truck (a side rescue mission to clear out the zombies around this girl) The car became damaged but I kept on clearing out the Zeds.What happened next was hilarious if it wasn't so sad. The car blew up, I flipped 300 times in the air and flew into a building a block away. When I stood up I had killed all of the Zombies around the girl and every car in the area was on its roof.  Its not just when the car blows up that the physics are laughable its most things you hit/run into when driving.Shooting in this game seems a bit off too. Its hard to describe, but the camera angles are all wrong. You never get to really aim well. Its just a sloppy mess and your better off not using a gun at all.Pros:+ A day one zombie release for Xbox One+ Lots of carnage+ Silly situations are funCons:- Controller a mess (too many functions for a hack & slash game)- Camera following is terrible when shooting- Physics are atrocious with regard to explosions and damage- Feels really sloppy- Graphics are for Xbox 360Overall I was not happy with the gameplay/controls/physics. Also this is an obvious 360 game ported to the One. The graphics are decent at best. I realize its a release title and they didn't write it for the One but it still feels old.Recommendation:Skip this for now and get it in the bargain bin next year.

I have use other brands but I keep coming back to the Bayer ones due to their accurate reading and super fast response time. For whatever reason you need to use these, the fact is Bayer strips are used in the medical field for a reason. Highly recommended.

My daughter really enjoyed this book. She is at an age that chapter books are the natural progression in her reading skills. Nothing better than her favorite characters interacting in an interesting way to keep her wanting to read more.

I am an old D&D gamer and was curious which Pathfinder adventure I should have started with. Someone recommended this adventure to me. It is perfect mix of story, pace and combat to keep 4 brand new characters busy for at least a year. The biggest problem I have is trying to get the group to stop playing. Its got all 4 of them super jazzed about the next time we meet. Totally worth the price, for pro DMs and even new ones starting out.Here are some suggestions:>> Get the accompanying miniature set (get bases from Piazo they are cheap, dont buy the beastiary box just to get the bases.)>> Use Piazo's website to assist in each leg of the adventure. It will guide you as you go, especially if the party veers off track too far>>  Get a big whiteboard for maps. The chessex mat doesn't erase well at all and I am not glad I bought it.>>  Use the internet for printouts handouts and moreOverall I am so glad I got this adventure. Highly recommended!

Got this one and another one for my kids that absolutely love Pikmin. Its been through the wash a few times already and held up well. The flower came off of one but a few quick stitches fixed it up. Overall a nice plushy at a good price!

Got this one and another one for my kids that absolutely love Pikmin. Its been through the wash a few times already and held up well. The flower came off of one but a few quick stitches fixed it up. Overall a nice plushy at a good price!

Sofar no complaints. You have to know how to run this through your machine before you leave a bad review. This is the authentic spirit paper. It comes in an envelope (not the box) and works just fine. Go check YouTube for videos how to use your spirit machine.

I built my laptop with this processor in it. I used an MSI barebones kit. It took a while to get the right processor. This one is a bit long in the tooth but it still performs quite well. Temps are low and it has not thrown 1 BSOD since I built it about 6 months ago. All in all very happy with this processor.

One star taken away because after a week or so of play the tail almost came out. I shot a bit of super glue in there with a syringe and it held the tail perfectly. Might just have been a slight defect on the manufacturing side. Overall its a nice toy.

As others have said the biggest complaint was no bases. You do not need to purchase the bases in the bestiary box. Just go to Piazos website and purchase a bag of bases there for a couple of bucks with shipping. No need to purchase a nearly fifty dollar box of pawns just to get the bases.Ok there are most NPCs in this set, found a couple mentioned in the adventure not shown in this box. Its ok I just used others or found photos on the web.Overall its a great addition to the adventure path Rise of the Runelords!

I had gone to Michael's a few years back and had a frame made for my LOTR 2 Towers poster. The custom frame cost much more than the poster did. Move ahead 5 years and my son throws a ball in the house shattering the glass on the frame. Instead of going back to get another one made I decided to replace it with this frame.Pros:+ Super easy to install+ Mounts flush on the wall with supplied screws+ Easy to swap posters (if you wanted to)+ Translucent background means you can mount it on a lightCons:- Plastic is a bit cheap feeling and has waves in it- Be very careful with rare posters the sharp(ish) edges of the internal frame where the poster goes may ruin the edges.Overall I love this frame bought 1 more for my new complete cast signed Hobbit poster

Ok enough with the puns. I have an older hoover upright animal and a dyson animal. Did I mention I have animals? Comparing these 3 products is not really equal. The Dyson is over 5 yrs old and the other hoover is over 1yr old. That being said the Dyson still performs as well as the newer hoovers. As far as this model I am really impressed with it. It does clean the carpets really well. I did the 2 pass test with this and the older hoover. I vacuumed a room with the previous model, then went back over it with this one. I got almost 2x as much dirt in the canister as with the previous hoover and this was me vacuuming the room in sequential fashion.Pros:+ very powerful and works well on hard wood floors.+ Setting below low carpet makes bare floors easy+ nice accessoriesCons:- older model had power button this has a switch half way down the body in the back behind a door next to a leopard.- no auto retracting cord (Previous model had it)Overall its a really good vacuum with a high bang for the buck value.Thanks for reading my review.

I have been tattooing one way or another for 18 years. I took a break about 10 years ago and decided to recently get back in the game the "right" way.I am apprenticing under an old friend of mine that is now running a very successful studio. He recommended I get an inexpensive kit to start off with. This book was included with the kit I bought. Good thing too, it by itself is over 1/3 the cost of the kit. All I have to say is it is well worth the money. Being involved with tattooing for as long as I have, as a client and apprentice and hang about, I have seen some real bad examples of hubris and downright hatred of people not going in the way they did.What I mean is, an artist will almost always say they magically apprenticed first and never once tattooed themselves or anyone before becoming an official apprentice. This is basic BS, which CR Jordan points out almost immediately. As soon as I read that I felt comfortable enough to understand this guy is on MY side and not about to throw some old school boys club mentality at me. Instead this book is a wonderful guide to get the basics out of the way when thinking about jumping in the business.This book will NOT make you a tattoo artist. It will NOT get you a job. It will NOT teach you everything how to run a tattoo shop. It WILL give you the basic lingo and methods so that when you do go in for a job you sound informed and educated. That is what most artists want from their apprentice. They want to see that you are willing to go out and learn on your own enough of the basics so they can talk to you; "Hey man, grab me a 5RL, 7 Mag and a couple of barrels". After you finish this book you will know what they are talking about.It gives you the confidence to feel you can handle the basics in the shop and the confidence of your teacher that he doesn't have to spend months getting someone off the ground.Overall I have never read a better book in the intro to tatooing than this. I have several old books from Huck Spaulding and others that look pretty and have very little info. CR Jordan puts the rubber to the road and gets you running fast.Highly recommended!Thanks for reading my review.

7:43 MinsThanks for watching my review of the NAS Server.Please watch the video for the specifics.Here is the rundown:Pros:+ Powerful network server for your file storage needs+ Very adaptable to your network needs either consumer or pro+ Free Windows backup software included; (acts like Time Machine)Cons:- Little to no documentation included (paper version there is a PDF you can read electronically)- A bit noisy while running.Watch this in HD on YT: youtu.be/MOZh8LW_A6gOverall these are minor issues. I am very pleased with the way this works and installation was a breeze. Highly recommended!Thanks for watching my review!

I have 2 Macintosh Laptops that are getting a bit long in the tooth. I decided to test this drive out on Windows 7 as I have 8 drives hooked to this PC and had plenty of choices to benchmark against. Upon removal from the box I noticed it now looks much different than other reviews have shown (excellent video reviews by the way). Anyway the case is now changed appearance and is much smaller and compact. One thing to note there is still a standard SATA port that connects the main body to the base. Removing the main body is easy just hold the base down and pull up gently. It removes very easily.I have uploaded a graphic to show just how well it performs vs an internal SSD, and an external HDD. The numbers do not mean anything other than its nice to see just how well this drive performs. Because it is so fast I highly recommend it for use as a media drive, backup drive (Windows Backup and Mac Time Machine). It  is quiet and has a nice light white glow as it operates.If you flip through the graphics above look for one with my Geekasurus logo on it to see the various benchmarks.Pros:+ Installs easily+ Finish is that of flat black slightly rubberized (no fingerprints)+ Can be formatted for Mac or PC+ Super fast USB 3.0 Speeds (see graphic)Cons:- Did not come with thunderbolt cable as mentioned in other reviews. Just 3.0 which is fine, just thought I would mention it.- USB 3.0 connector is not standard shape on the base side, meaning you cannot get a longer cord cheaply and will need to purchase one that is made by Seagate (really?)Overall the cons are not really all that bad and as it stands this is a great 3000 GB drive that is only marginally more than a barebones drive without the external case and SATA. Highly recommended!!!Thanks for reading my review.

I set this up according to the manufacturers instructions. One thing I did was use a GPS to mark the path I tried wearing this pedometer. I did a simple 1 mile walk. The GPS marked 1 mile traveled, this pedometer was over 300 feet off. While this is not major the long term use would lead to a significant difference. You can adjust it and I am sure with more fiddling you would get it right.Pros:+ Can upload the data to your PC+ Easy to use and install+ large numbers make it easy to readCons:- as stated would take some fiddling to get it right.Overall I think its a good solution for some people. I think it could use some work.Thanks for reading my review.

I am on a low carb high fat diet. Because of this I am limited in the breads I can make. Mostly they have a ton of eggs in them. My recipes are full of oils but due to the eggs they tend to be very sticky. When using this pan I can easily bend the sides out and take the loaf out with absolutely no problem. The glossy finish inside makes the bread smooth and shiny when it comes out. Its similar to a non-stick Teflon pan but with no chemicals to deal with.Pros:+ large size+ easy to remove the bread out+ dishwasher safeCons:- None really.Thanks for reading my review.

The build quality of this dolly is really good. I do have one small complaint that I will mention below but overall its a fantastic device for amateur video producers. The design is really strong, you can tell that this was made by a company that thought of many issues that video creators face while trying to shoot. The wheels can be rotated in several different ways. Because of this you can go from a straight dolly to a panoramic with no tools or any major fiddling with it. Just look at the top of the device and it tells you which way to set the wheels to do what you are trying to do.Pros:+ Well made high quality+ Easily adjustable with no tools+ can install cameras and different mounts via the central adapter+ Wheels are smooth and quiet (didnt pick up any noise on mic camera).+ well thought out!Cons:- This one is more a problem of physics. When you take the feet off of your tripod and put them into the round parts of this dolly you cannot extend the tripod to max height. If you do the small size of the dolly makes your tripod extremely tippy and you risk smashing your expensive camera on the ground. This can happen with the tiniest pebble or dirt hanging up the wheels.  I almost lost my camera 3 times trying to use the dolly to do a pan while the tripod was at eye height.This is just a warning and not a major issue with the dolly. If you intend on using your tripod with this you will need a shelf or table at waist height to roll this across. I applaud the multiple uses for this, tripod at full height is not one of them apparently.Thanks for reading my review.

I am usually not a fan of anything wireless when referring to a gaming peripheral. The reason for this is you may be in the middle of a part of a game that if you lose the peripheral you will lose the match/game/raid... whatever. I kind of feel the same way about this headset, other than talking might not be as critical as hearing. Most assuredly not as critical as a mouse and keyboard.The installation was a bit of a pain if you generally dont read instructions (like most guys). I recommend reading the instruction manual for sure. There is one minor issue I have and Ill list it below.Pros:+ Comfortable+ No cord means you can move your head freely during game time.+ Good sound+ Decent microphoneCons:- Headphones do not operate via USB. This is a wireless only headset. As I mentioned above if you are gaming and the batteries run out, you would think you could plug it in to use it as last measure. I could not and that bugs me more than anything. Forcing you to use it as a battery only device removes 1 star.Overall I still love this headset, just would like to see it allow USB operation.Thanks for reading my review.

I didn't see this drive was for Mac when I ordered it. Its ok, I formatted it with NTFS and use it just fine. Beyond that this drive works quite well. As a USB 3.0 it is perfect for use as a backup drive. After some testing it performs better than other USB drives I have.Pros:+ Easy to install+ For use on Mac or PC+ USB 3.0+ Quiet+ Universal SATA adapter that can be used for other SATA USB Drives (I tried it on 3 different ones).Cons:- No reason to say its Mac, other than its preformatted for Mac.Overall this is a great USB backup drive. I highly recommend it!Thanks for reading my view.

About 2 months ago we shifted our diet to low carb high fat diet. Because of this it is tough sometimes to find products with high levels of saturated fats. If your wondering what I am talking about watch Fat Head. The more fats in the diet the better for you. Now to the coconut oil. You dont need much so when you first get this product you may be suprised that almost 1/3 of the container is empty. It is because as the oil condenses it shrinks a bit. There is a full 16oz in there but like with a bag of chips this settles after packaging.Pros: + Lots of good fats that are healthy for you + Melts easily + Does not add any flavor to the cooking (in case you were worried that all of your foods would taste like coconut, it doesn't)Cons: - They should have used a smaller container. It looks like almost 1/3 is missingOverall great cooking supplement, I recommend it to anyone on a LCHF diet.Thanks for reading my review.

We've tried other rescue remedy products and truthfully, I have no idea if they did anything.  But I take this before bed and it works as good as, if not better than, my melatonin (I take 2 mg's to help me fall asleep).  I've already place my next order.
I was hoping to replace my Neutrogena sesame oil, but this oil is too thick and hard to apply to skin.

I have so many of these bottles.  They are great.  They used to make a weird whistling sound after you drank from them and you had to unscrew and rescrew the lid to make it stop.  Their newer ones have solved that problem, as this one has not done that once since I bought it.
Had a breast reduction and tried on a gazillion bras afterwards looking for comfort, prettiness and support.  This has all three.  I love it so much I bought almost every color.

I bought a used mat for 15% off, and I swear it's new.  Just the packaging was opened.  Great mat, but the fabric does sort of bunch a little on top.  I also wish they had a cover for the velcro strip since we only have one right now.  My daughter has been practicing her gymnastics at home and I feel as though she's much safer now that we have a quality padded mat.

Bought this for my almost 4 year old for her pre-school nap time.  It's super cute and she loves it.  However, it's very narrow.  I'm sure she'll figure it out, but just wanted to warn people that it's more narrow than even a standard size foam mat that most pre-schools use.

My daughter likes these, those not as much as the foam ones, but they are super tight.  There is a raised piece of rubber inside the hole that will carve a dent into your pencil if you don't use something to rub it off first.  I used a letter opener with serrated sides to clear that out of the middle.  Even after doing that, these are very tight to put on and hard to move when the pencil needs sharpening.  That said, they are pretty and work well to give my daughter a correct and more comfortable grip.

These are super cute and my daughter loves them, but they are too loose.  I wrapped tape around like some other people commented and that worked great, but my duaghter said it made it too hard to sharpen her pencils with the tape on (it gums up their sharpener), so she just lives with it all loose on the pencil.

When this arrived, it had a big scratch on the belt buckle.  I was going to send it back, but then asked my daughter if she minded the scratch, and she was willing to live with it, so we kept it.  She's worn it maybe 3 or 4 times and the elastic is misshapen in places.  My daughter is a TWIG, which is why we needed the belt - to hold up her jeans and jeggings that swim around her waist a lot of the time.  So, it was not stretched out from being to small.  We adjusted it for her waist before the first wearing, so it's just from her putting it on and off a few times.
Really, this does what it says and lasts a good long time, but I just can't say "I LOVE IT" for a water filter!

I like Zevia sodas - be warned they are an acquired taste, though.  The stevia is super sweet tasting at first, but not long after, you get used to it.  It's like switching from diet coke to real coke, or from diet coke to coke free...when the sweetener used changes, it takes a bit to acclimate to the new flavor and then you're good.Anyhow, the reason I took off 2 stars is because while I was willing to put up with some flavors I didn't like as much, I didn't realize how many of the flavors have caffeine in them.  I'm used to natural sodas being caffeine free, since it's a terrible additive!  I don't drink anything with caffeine in it, it makes me jittery and sick to my stomach, so finding that 4 of the flavors are actually caffeinated was a disappointment.  Maybe if I'd looked closer at the flavors/ingredients I would have seen this in advance, but thought I'd post here so someone else who doesn't like caffeine won't make the same mistake I did.Update:  So, I finished all of the sodas and want to report 1) that caffeinated sodas don't have a ton of caffeine in them.  If I drink a diet coke with caffeine, I am woozy and sick to my stomach.  I didn't experience that after drinking the caffeinated Zevias.  And also, I noticed they now have other variety pack options with only caffeine free drinks, so you don't have to buy 24 of just one flavor.  I'm trying the fruit mix next, which has 4 different fruit flavored sodas, all of which are caffeine free.  So, I added a star back for those two reasons.

For the $14.50 I paid for it, it's basically a piece of high quality elastic with a very nice slip buckle.  Worth it in that I didn't have to sew the two end pieces and find the parts, but pricey for a very simply made belt.  I will probably just make any more belts like this that I need for my daughter.
Bought this to work out to.  It's really catchy at first, but it tends to get old pretty quickly.

I wrote a long review only to have it censored because I used a four letter word with an asterisk.  This novel is disgusting.  Alex, the "hero," is a total hypocritical arse who deflowers a drunk girl just out of the schoolroom one night, but no worries because she was a serving girl or learning to be a whore...so he thinks since he doesn't really talk with her first.  Of course, she's really a young lady who followed a friend to a ball and was fed spiked punch and then abandoned by her friend and the man who talked them into going.  So basically, the heroine, "Charlotte," was raped (drugged with alcohol and taken advantage of, even if she "enjoyed" it).  Fast forward many years and Alex is back in England after his father died and is now an Earl.  He sees Charlotte at a ball and decides instantly that he will marry her, but doesn't realize she's the girl from the party.  She does, and brings it up several times, but neither of them asks or gives details, because of course that would end the book right there, and we can't have that.  Instead, they stupidly grope along - he pursues her, seducing her whenever he can and finally convinces her to marry him.  She, after hearing his story about how his first wife was a "whore" because she slept around before marrying him, didn't think it was important to straighten out their past with him.  No, instead, after they make love on their wedding night, she has to comment, "oh that didn't hurt like the first time."  Why? Because if she didn't, they couldn't have the next part of the book where he calls her a whore and says disgusting and terrible things to her that he can never take back.  He then abandons her and tells her he's going to dump her in the wilds of Scotland instead of continuing to Italy where they were supposed to Honeymoon.  He then forces her to ride in the "third coach" with the servants and rides on ahead to his estate there.He has time to think about everything and decides that she must have slept with his twin brother, and only once, so he can live with that, and then looks forward to "forgiving" her and treating her like his own private whore...I mean, wife.  Who cares, same thing to him.  She arrives and gives him the cold shoulder for ONE DAY and then....he realizes his error and apologizes for all the horrible things he said, and when she brings up this night they slept together he lets her finish for once and realizes SHE is the girl in the garden and he get down on his knees to beg her forgiveness.  Nope, he tells her in a condescending way that he will overlook her sleeping with his brother and not set her aside, but that she will sleep with him whenever he wants or else.  Yes, that's right, he threatens to ruin her name and set her aside if she doesn't sleep with him!  RAPE, again.  So, then, she says fine, but lays there like a dead fish.  He doesn't want her that way, and when he can't get a rise out of her, he goes to leave.  Whew.  Glad that horrible scene is over.  Except it's not.  SHE calls him back, asks what's wrong.  She was trying to act like a lady, since he said she behaved like a whore before.  He told her he only said those things in anger because someone else had "conquered" her first, but now he's over that and she can be a whore all she wants, but only with him.  Does she throw him out for his callousness?  Does she tell him to go to hell?!?!  NO!  She acts the whore (her words) and they have lots of sex.  All is well.  Then he has to go off for some trip and of course, she is pregnant but doesn't realize it, his twin brother comes home, you see what's coming.  He goes off again accusing her of being a whore with his brother and getting pregnant...ugh.  He doesn't even bother to ask her, no he just ASSUMES it's true.  This is the worst "romance" novel ever.  If you like RAPE, followed by RAPE, and a lot of demeaning verbal abuse in between, then by all means have at this novel.  Otherwise, avoid it like the plague and seek out a writer who treats her women with a modicum of respect.

I just love this song.  I do dance aerobics and this song makes you want to get up and dance.  If you like working out to cool music, check out RefitRev's routine for this song - it's a lot of fun:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_nHttrzbmG0&list=WL&index=21 (I don't have any affiliation with them by the way - they are a fitness group in Texas, I think, and I live in the NW).  If the link doesn't work, just look for RefitRev Bombastic on YouTube and you'll find it.  I looked up Bonnie McKee after I fell in love with this song and she has written for Katy Perry and other major artists for years, so it's no surprise this song could be a Katy Perry anthem, or that she's doing the whole cotton candy colored hair and themed costume approach either.

I have a pair of Howsers with a quilted nylon exterior that I love, but are getting scruffy after a year of use (I can't go barefoot, so I have a pair of indoor only slippers that I wear EVERY day, all day in the house).  So, I ordered this pair thinking it would be the same, but with a cooler exterior finish.  They look just as nice in person as on the website and fit perfectly, EXCEPT for one major issue:  The top of the shoe where you see some sheepskin sticking out?  Well, it "tucks" under when you put it on your feet.  You *could* take about 10 seconds every time you put them on, digging your finger in and straightening that out, I suppose, but I want a shoe I can slip on and wear without hassle.  So, I'm sending them back and ordering another pair of the quilted nylon kind.  Super bummed at this flaw in the design, as they are a really attractive slipper.

Reading through the negative reviews, I saw a lot of people say these shoes are hard to get on unless you have flat feet, and that there was no arch support.  I have flat feet, and I have been moving toward barefoot shoes (or at least ones that don't have a giant arch support in them), so they are perfect for me.  I have been walking around in them for a while now and feel like they are comfortable, with cushion in the heel, but definitely NO arch support.  My feet will be doing the work, which is how I like it.  If you want or need arch support in your shoes, I don't think you'll like these, but for me they are great.  Also, the style is attractive from the top and the side, and they add about an inch to your height (important for us shorties).
Quality product but was too big.  Sadly I ordered early and missed the return window by a few days by the time I finally tried it on.
This trimmer was great for about a week and then it stretched out and no longer compresses.  I ordered the next size down and will see how long that one lasts.
My 7 y.o. daughter absolutely adored these.  She had so much fun creating the purses and then putting play money in them and carrying them all over.  Great craft fun.
7 y.o. daughter loved these and shared them with her friend.  Even my 3 y.o. had fun.
My 7 year old daughter really liked these.  They do get repetitive after a while - all the folds are the same, but the cutting is different.

I find it incredibly hard to get past a plot in which the hero takes a woman who has suffered a terrible ordeal, and he uses her vulnerable state to exact some sort of revenge on her for her past behavior.  It's reprehensible and in no way could it possible result in the hero and heroine falling in love, because once she found out what he did, she would (rightfully) never forgive his callousness.  So, there was no point for me to read further.  I *hate* it when an author allows a heroine to forgive treatment that is reprehensible all in the name of love.  Sorry, no man who would do that to a woman could ever be considered a hero in my mind, and no woman who would overlook that terrible treatment would have a happy ending with him.And I would add that I *might* have been able to overlook this terrible plot if the writing had been anything other than DULL, BORING and PLODDING.  I think the Drake character deserved a much better story than this.  Disappointed to never be able to read that.
I wanted the version without the long rap sequence, but ended up buying the wrong one.  This is a good song, I just wish I'd bought the right version.

I've been using Retainer Brite on my Invisalign night guards for years, but I've noticed that they don't "fizz" as much as they used to and they are also quite spendy compared to this product.  So, I thought I'd give CleanGuard a shot based on the reviews here at Amazon.  I've been using them now for several weeks and I think they do a good job.The instructions say to use 2 tablets, but I only use one.  I like the fact that you can leave your guard in the solution all day.  With the RetainerBrite, if I don't take it out after the 15 minutes, I feel like it leaves a slimy coat on it and I have to really rinse it off afterwards.  I don't find that is the case with the CleanGuard. I also like that it fizzes more - it may just be a visual, but it feels like it's really working to remove the germs etc. on the guard.People aren't kidding when they say the cap is *VERY* hard to get off.  Especially the first few times.  My advice:  find a flat, thin piece of metal (a blunt knife, or letter opener, or ruler even) and use that to wedge the cap off.  It will save your poor fingernails a lot of pain =).  Second, once you have it off, don't push it back down the entire way - leave a little space so it's easier to get off next time.Bottom line:  both products work well, but CleanGuard is much less expensive so I'm sticking with it as long as that's the case.

I love most of the Nivea Lip Care line and this one is my favorite.  Got a 6 pack at an amazing price ($10), but now it's more than twice as much, so figure out cost per stick and then see if you can buy it locally for less.

Okay, so here is my take on Zumba wear:  some of it is super cute and comfortable to wear.  However, if you are losing weight, it's too expensive to invest in their clothing when you'll grow out of it (downsizing) in no time.  I bought these and loved them for about 3 weeks and then they were too loose on me and now sit in my drawer doing nothing.My advice:  buy less expensive fun clothing at Old Navy or other store and then when you outgrow it, you can buy the next size down and still have money leftover from what you'd pay for a Zumba original item.

I bought this because in terms of Zumba wear, it was pretty cheap.  I figured I could take in the waist since it was gigantic compared to the nice fit of the legs.  However, it just looks frumpy with the "skirt" thing, and when I wore it to classes, it restricted my leg movement at the hips and so I stopped wearing it after two tries.  My advice:  if it's on clearance, steer clear because there is something wrong with the design.

I had an adjustable belt from a different manufacturer that I loved (it had three zippers so you could cinch in more as you lost inches), but I shrunk so small it no longer fit and they don't make a smaller version.  I ordered this one based on online reviews and I like it.  I used to wear it all the time to workout - as most women who've had kids will relate:  it kept my jiggly bits in place during high-impact activities and supported my lower back (kind of a cheap man's SI belt).  My only complaint is that when I would wear a cotton top, moisture would pool at the top and bottom and the cotton would just wick it up, leaving me with noticeable wet patches at the top and botttom of the belt.  This was not as bad with lycra tops, so I just wore those instead.

I thought these shoes were very comfortable, but they were way too long in the toe box, so I had to return them.  Bright, vibrant colors, too, though if you planned to use them outside, I could see the yellow getting drab over time.  Overall, though, I wish my feet were longer so I could have kept them.
Got this for my hubby who cooks all the meat in our house.  He's very happy with it.

Bought these to put mini-portions of salad in for a party.  They weren't meant for this purpose, but held up well and did their job.  Used the rest for cupcakes and they looked very pretty when served.

Bought these to put mini-portions of salad in for a party.  They weren't meant for this purpose, but held up well and did their job.  Used the rest for cupcakes and they looked very pretty when served.

Well, we haven't had this long enough to "Love it" but I give it a solid 4 stars because it does what it says with minimal fuss.  We had to let go of our TiVo service (I LOVE TIVO - no one's DVR features are even close to what they offer) because, sob, we don't get any over-the-air channels here!  So, we rely on Netflix and Amazon Prime for our TV and Movie watching fixes.  Except...we spaced the fact that our Roamio was WIRELESS and we have no way to connect our TV to the internet anymore for streaming.  In rides the utterly inexpensive Fire TV Stick, which we plugged in and POOF, like magic, we were again connected to the internet.We've played a little bit with the app for our iPads and iPhones, and all seems to work fine.  Our only complaint is that we wish it had a volume control, which I understand you can get with the upgraded remote.  Not worth it for us for that, but otherwise, it's perfect so far.  Once we've had it longer, I may come back and upgrade to 5 stars.
Just as good as the Apple cord but at a fraction of the price.  And I like the black better than the white, personally.
What is there to say?  My daughters love it, it doesn't leak and it's easy to clean (dishwasher top rack).  The design on this one is really cute.

This is an excellent sealer bag roll.  Much thicker than anything we've bought before, and a good price on Amazon.  We've purchased it twice now and will continue to buy it as long as they offer it at a good price.

I've got nothing against this product, but as many reviewers have pointed out, you can buy these exact figurines in the Busy Book for less.  Here's the link: http://smile.amazon.com/My-Little-Pony-Busy-Books/dp/2764322569/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1433226021&sr=8-1&keywords=My+little+pony+busy+book.  Just FYI.

Sometimes I will hear a song and I can listen to it over and over and over again and it never gets old and it just makes me FEEL something that I like.  Do you ever find a song like that?  A million years ago in college, it was Lita Ford's "Kiss Me Deadly."  I have no idea what it was about that song, it's not my typical music at all, but I couldn't get enough of it.  There have been just a few others since then, and this is one of them.I love the lyrics even though they are a bit depressing, they are just so true.  "Love is a polaroid/Better in picture/But never can fill the void."  And so playful, too, "I am a head case/I am the color of boom/Thats never arriving/And you are the opera/Always on time and in tune/And I am the color of boom."  Who doesn't want to be the color of boom?  And how many of us Operas are moths to the flame of someone like that?  We Gregs want our Dharma,  Chuck Bartowskis want our Sarah Walkers, it's the classic case of opposites attracting.  But it's always better in pictures, isn't it?I can totally picture this being used by a SYTYCD choreographer for a mash-up piece with ballerinas and hip hop dancers.  I mostly buy music to workout to, and create a lot of my own Zumba-like or dance aerobic routines.  After a few times goofing around with them, I generally have a set routine down, but with this song I can't stop myself from just dancing.  It inspires my imagination.
Great song to get you moving.  Reminds me of the Black Eyed Peas, as in I thought some of the members of the BEP started this band it's that similar.

I love REAL maple syrup, and not that Grade A light colored stuff, the Grade B darker thicker syrup.  And of those, I've tried a few brands and Coombs Family Farms wins hands down.  The organic is even better, but this one is very good too.  Seriously, if you've never done it, buy a small bottle of grade A and grade B and do a taste test.  Once you go B, you'll never go back ;-).

Does anyone remember when Sarah McLachlan wrote a song from pieces of an obsessed fan's letters?  Well, I like imagine Britney put this one together from her "team" telling her to get off the crazy train and get back to making them all tons of money.  She's like you want to live the high life?  You have to work hard for it (at your job).  You want an amazing body?  Also, lots of work (in the gym or track or on the bike, whatever you do).  And this might be depressing, because let's face it, many people work their arses off, but don't live like Britney Spears, but it's also empowering - when you are working toward a goal, it's uplifting.  And then she talks about not letting the sh*t get her down, "Hold your head high, fingers to the sky/They gonna try to try ya', but they can't deny ya'/Keep it moving higher, and higher..." and so on.  I'm obviously reading too much into a silly pop/dance song, but when I listen to this while working out, it makes me feel like kicking arse.

As a song to listen to for working out, this is great.  My one complaint is the lyrics.  So, it's about a guy who is out and about a lot and everywhere he goes there are beautiful women he's drinking with who have "long long legs" and great asses and are willing to go home with him, but "nah nah honey, Im good/I could have another but I probably should not/I got somebody at home,/And if I stay I might not leave alone."  Yeah yeah, what a great guy for being true to his lover....BUT, I just don't like this idea that he's looking and an extra drink would be responsible for his cheating?  Call me crazy, but I might admire a fine physique on a man (or woman for that matter), but when I'm with someone I love, I honestly don't think about other men that way.  I know we're all wired differently, but the lyrics just started to irritate me.  Let me put it this way - if he posted this to his girlfriend, telling her what a stand up guy he is, would she be thrilled and think he's a romantic, or would she get pissed how much he's talking about other women's body parts?  I would say the latter.  Anyhow, this is nitpicky for a silly song that I workout to, but I must admit, I've been skipping it more because of this.

I am a longtime Keen fan and have a pair of leather Newports that are just getting too scuzy, even though they still work awesome as shoes.  I tried to find another Newport, but in my size, neither Amazon or Zappos had them and besides paying full price and then some to make custom ones on the Keen site, I didn't see a style/color I really liked.  So, when these Whispers went on sale on Amazon, I thought what the heck and bought them.  It's a pretty style - the straps are smaller than the Newport and these are nylon on neoprene, not leather.  It took me a ltitle while to get used to the feel of the little straps on my feet but now I don't even think about it.  I have always been a size 8 in Keens even though I'm an easy 7.5 in all other shoes.  The keens are just a fraction too short on my feet, so I go a size up and thus the 8's always swim a little on my feet, but are still comfortable.  Overall, I really like these sandals and they are my go to shoe for this summer.  The purple color really pops, too.  My only complaint is minor - the elastic cords are way too long.  I know I can take apart the plastic mechanism and cut them, but that's a lot of work and tends to scrape up the plastic.  I wish they just made them shorter for women's styles.
Mostly bought this to workout to.  I wouldn't really listen to it otherwise, and find myself skipping over it a lot for other songs when I workout even.

Had to return these.  I really wanted a pair to wear at my Barre class, but these were too small for my feet, although close enough that going up a size might be too big.  I have flat feet, so this happens to me sometimes with speciality shoes like this one.  But for what it's worth, the Small is supposed to fit 6.5-7.5, and I'm an easy 7.5 and these were too small.
I mostly buy music to workout to and listen to when I walk the dog, and this one just caught my ear.  Good, fun beat and interesting lyrics.
We returned it.  I loved the princess style up top online but in person the seam was bulky and folded over so it just looked terrible.

Bought this for my girls.  Three of the stars are for the GORGEOUS illustrations, which is why I bought the book in the first place.  The story, was, "eh."  We don't read it as much as I hoped, because as beautiful as the pictures are, my girls aren't interested in the story.

Well, the jury is still out on these.  Fit is very good - and so far they've been fine for my workout classes.  Based on some of the other reviews, I thought that they would have more padding on the sole.  They do have a nice "elastic" stitch over the top of the arch, which I think helps with support.  It's too soon to say if they will last.  Overall, for the money I paid, I think they were a good choice, but I may spend more next time and look for better padding.  One thing I did note that is negative - these socks get more than damp with sweat when I workout.  I'm not a sweaty foot person, and none of my other socks do this.  I'm not sure if they don't breathe well enough, or what the deal is, but as long as I don't have to put the socks on again (for example, after RIPPED I take them off for yoga, then have to put them back on to walk home), it doesn't really bother me.

I really wanted to like these.  They looked good on my feet, although the laces were pretty wide (i.e. the shoe seemed on the narrow side).  I have a pair of Merrell barefoot cross trainers, but the style was discontinued, so I got these as I wanted a mostly black pair (my other ones are bright blue).  However, after wearing them around the house for an hour, I had incredible pain in my feet.  There is a high arch in the shoe, which pushes into the inside of your foot and if you don't have an arch to match it, I think that's when you get the pain I was feeling.  So, basically, too narrow and the arch is too high.

When I saw the pilot way back when, I loved it and was so thrilled Amazon greenlit the series.  Now, all I can say is, "Amazon, when is the second season coming?"  This season is well done, and Titus Welliver is amazing as Harry Bosch.  I had to take off one star because of multiple WTF moments where you as the viewer can't believe the stupidity of the actions of supposedly seasoned cops or of the plot line.  The political machinations are also a bit far-fetched.  SPOILER ALERT - don't go further if you don't want to read about key aspects of the season.  The series points out several times about how the press and 24/7 coverage can impede an investigation or even convict (in public opinion) innocent people surrounding a crime.  And yet, it supposes that if a camera man goes along on a screwed up police outing, the DA can just confiscate the memory card and that would stop it from getting out.  Hello.  The camera man would never give up the only copy that easily, except that he knows there's a cloud backup...which he then gives up just as easily to the deputy police commissioner?!?  He would've made a copy for himself.  That's a big flaw.  Not to mention that EVERYONE would be asking, where's the footage?  You couldn't keep the fact that there was a camera there secret, and then the news story would be, "DA steals memory card in an attempt to cover up his giant screw up."  And then there is the fact that Waits killed a man after his escape, then he killed a store clerk, killed a male prostitute and a female prostitute, but it was only after he kidnapped a new mother that the Chief of Police puts all available cops on the case to track him down?  That's crazy too.  Once they had the lead about the boy's home, they would have had a slew of cops combing the files and they would have found the killer's file in a day instead of the long, drawn-out process that it took with only a few people looking.  And same thing with the car the killer was driving.  They can't see the license plate, but they could easily look up all the gold minivan's owned by little old ladies (his mother) and narrowed it down that way.  And my biggest WTF is the fact that Harry Bosch's psych profile was leaked to a reporter and there was no investigation or complaint filed?  First, there are only a few people who would have access to that file to leak it, so it wouldn't be hard to find who did it.  It's not like any cop in the area can get his confidential psych records, so the fact that Pounds or whatever his chief's name is, wasn't immediately fired is just stupid.  Second, Harry Bosch could sue the department this way and that for not protecting his confidential information.  All this hub-bub is made of his rookie girlfriend filing a bogus harassment case against him to save her job, but Harry, who has been violated by a senior officer through this leak, can't do the same?  It's absolutely ridiculous.But, having pointed out all that (and I'm sure there are more), I still loved the series.  The actors are all top notch and the setting, the mood, everything pulls you in and keeps you engaged.  I can't wait to dissect the next one =).

I'm a sucker for dystopian future  novels, and I decided to listen to this one on audiobook after seeing a movie came out and thinking I might want to watch it (I never watch a movie based on a book without reading the book first).  I just couldn't get past the inconsistency of the premise.  SPOILER ALERT - don't read further if you don't want to know plot points and events that happen in the book.  First, we're thrown into the world of the Maze without any background, and most of the book is spent in this universe, so you would think it had some meaning, or larger purpose.  But no, we find out at the end that it was an "experiment" to test the subjects, in anticipation of them doing something in the disastrous world that remains.  Ok, so I'm cool with that, but WHAT was the point of the maze?  What was the point of killing them off?  What was the purpose for keeping them there for over two years?  It all seems stupid and pointless.  And apparently, the boys were chosen because they tested as extraordinarily smart, but it takes them TWO YEARS to figure out the maze makes a LETTER each day?  It takes them over TWO YEARS to figure out that the WICKED on the side of the creatures who threaten them stands for World In Catastrophe: Killzone Experiment Department?  I mean, come on!  They boys all come across as INCREDIBLY STUPID instead of the geniuses they are supposed to be.  And the whole point of the serum given after being stung by a WICKED beast is never really explained.  If these boys are your future hope, why are you poisoning them?  And my favorite instance of "genius" stupidity was where they enter the words into the computer to escape, kids are dying by the second and they can't freaking figure out that the last word PUSH means to PUSH a button?!?And then, they escape and get out, only half survive (technically less than half since many died before they even attempted the escape and only those who tried to escape are counted in that 40), and they come face to face with a woman scientist who clearly doesn't see them as human beings, one of their former cohorts who they thought was dead is clearly being mind-controlled and stabs Chucky, who is Thomas's "little brother" in spirit.  Does Thomas go crazy and attack the WOMAN who is clearly controlling the situation????  Nope, he attacks the clearly in pain and struggling boy who was forced to throw the knife.  What a crock!  He is supposed to be SMART and he acts like an idiot.  And finally, the whole ending where rebels break in and steal them away - even I could see it was just another part of the experiment.  How did the rebels know they broke out at that exact minute?  How did the rebels with their antiquated guns break in to a secure facility?  All of these obvious markers that it's just another ploy by the WICKED team, and yet none of our supposed geniuses even thinks about it.  Yeah, so, it just didn't fly for me.  I couldn't get past all of these glaring problems with the premise.  I rarely quit a series, but I just don't care what happens to these dimwit kids who can't figure the simplest crap out on their own.  You might argue that I'm an adult and this is meant for kids, but 1) I know 12 year olds who would agree with me about figuring everything out way ahead of the characters and 2) I would argue that this book's violence is way too mature for kids not in their teens at least.

These are pretty but too small to use with Pandora style (in my case, IRIS) charms.  Since that's what I bought them for, I can't really give them more than 2 stars.  If you are constructing a bracelet from scratch, these are very pretty pendants.

These are pretty but too small to use with Pandora style (in my case, IRIS) charms.  Since that's what I bought them for, I can't really give them more than 2 stars.  If you are constructing a bracelet from scratch, these are very pretty pendants.

These are fine except they are significantly smaller than the IRIS charms I have, so I can't use them as I'd hoped (spacers between glass beads and also to hold charms).  When they say they are compatible with Pandora style charms, it's not really true - they are way too small.

I listened to the novel on audiobook and was fascinated by the premise.  I like the author's elegiac take on an apocalyptic event and the aftermath.  I even liked they way she threaded her various characters around the celebrity actor whose death is the beginning of the end for North America, though at times I found myself saying, "another tidbit about this dead guy...I want to know about the people who are still alive."  But I do see how Arthur Leander stands in for good people who have gone astray in a world of materialism and excess, and also the crazy way in which charismatic charlatans become our "false gods" like the way Arthur's son, Tyler, becomes a prophet based on misreading the bible and creating a new religion based on a comic book written by Arthur's first wife.  It's a very subtle indictment of our society while also mourning its loss at the same time.But, there are two issues that really irked me.  Other reviewers have commented on the inability of the remaining population to reestablish modern living conditions.  I also found this incredible.  No one tried to reestablish power in 15 years?  Did all the satellites fall from the sky and all the fiber optic cable get cut when people died of the flu so that cellular service disappeared overnight?  That's crazy.  The infrastructure didn't collapse - the population did.  Resources would be bountiful and it would be a matter of locating ideal places in the world where smaller versions of culture could be maintained by those who are left.  At the very end of the novel - 20 years since the flu - a settlement has lights.  It would never have taken that long.  Even if every electrician died in the outbreak, library books exist and people can learn how to work the system.  It's ridiculous to think that a flu epidemic would force a dark ages.And finally, I have a beef with any novel that just ends.  What happens to Jeevin?  What about the city of lights?  What ever happened to Miranda, who we last left in the beach dying of the flu...or did she?  What about those ships that were all off shore and so not impacted by the flu?  What did they do for 15 years?  What about the pilots who left and didn't t return?  And our main characters stories are clearly not through.  There must be another novel in the works to finish their story.  I'm so sick of trilogies and what not that don't bother to give you a complete read in each novel.  There should be a beginning, a middle, and an end.  Anything else is sloppy.Having said all that, I still really liked the novel and will read the next one if/when it comes out because I'm invested in the characters.  But, I have to say there is another story from this same premise that is so much better.  I hope some other aspiring writer will write it.

If you need some logic in your romances, then the set up for this novel will have you pulling your hair out with the stupidity of it.  First, I doubt it's even possible for a husband to leave his life insurance and other benefits to someone other than his spouse and child.  The child has RIGHTS to support from a parent.  Then, when the person who was left the money comes to give it back (and I just cringed at how much TAXES the wife would have to pay because her husband left it to someone else), she REFUSES based on some utterly stupid need to "stand on her own."  WTF???  I stopped listening right then.  NO MOTHER who is not absolutely CRAZY would deny their child the money that should have rightly been his.  Any sympathy I might have had for her was gone at that point, so I couldn't care less what happened to her.  Books like this one are what make reader scoff at the notion of "Romance" fiction.  It was lazy and sloppy and just plain stupid.

I purchased the larger size of the Blue/Purple with White Flowers and the smaller size of the Pink/Yellow Geometric Circles.This product was SO EASY to install.  I measured my windows, measured and marked my lines on the clear plastic that is attached to the film, and cut my pieces.  I cleaned the window first, as the instructions said.  Then I spritzed the whole window (this is the key part - use a spritz bottle and don't be stingy!), unpeeled my piece and voila.  I just smacked the whole thing on, lined up the top straight and smoothed it out with my hands.  Used a towel to wipe up the excess water that comes out the sides and bottom.  SO EASY.  Anyone who says it is hard is NOT using water!  I didn't even need a squeegee - just used my hands and the towels to work out any air bubbles and in about an hour, checked and the window was dried and the vinyl on perfectly.My only con is that I wished the colors on the Blue/Purple one were a little more vibrant.  I feel like they are somewhat muted compared to the pictures shown on Amazon, and also to the other style (pink/yellow circle design), which are much brighter and really pop in the sunlight.  But, both styles are beautiful and I've received several compliments on them already.  As for letting the light in, these do that well.  We have much needed privacy now and no longer have to look at our neighbors junk and ill-kept yard, but without sacrificing the sunlight.I have some pictures to post, and I will try to figure out how to do that...when I hit the link I get a 404 code.Bottom line, very pleased with this product.

I read so many reviews that said the Judy Clocks were better and sturdier and would last forever, so imagine my surprise when this one arrives and it's just a big piece of cardboard!  I am so tempted to return it...it's really not worth the $25+ they charged for it.  I will probably keep it since I really need help teaching my daughter time telling right now, but otherwise I'd been sending it back.  Look carefully for a PLASTIC durable version that has gears.  If it says "WOOD" it means cheap, flimsy cardboard that your children will destroy in no time.

Christmas in Cornwall for the whole family might not be something which appeals to every one but Anna and Mike want their family to have one last Christmas together before they go their separate ways as they have decided to divorce so they have rented a large country house for the holiday period.  Thea and her brother and sister, Jimi and Emily are not keen on seeing their parents split up especially as they seem be getting on so well but they are willing to enjoy the holiday.  Thea is still recovering from splitting up with Rich after their relationship went wrong and she needs something to take her mind off it and help her to start afresh - could handsome Sean be the one to help her get back on her feet?This is an entertaining and heart warming story about a family group snowed in for Christmas with two uninvited guests - Charlotte and Alec - wished on them through force of circumstances and a few crossed wires. I enjoyed the mix of generations and the quite distinctive characters who make up the family.  I especially liked Thea herself and Anna her mother.  Emily is a little annoying with her constant worrying about everything.  Charlotte is larger than life with a lack of tact to match.Even if it isn't Christmas yet this is a feel good story which can be read at any time of year with plenty of laugh out loud moments, lots of banter and a few poignant moment to leaven the mix a little.  If you want cheering up and reminding of the annoying things as well as the good things about family life then this would be a good book to read.  The characters are interesting lively and believable and the tensions between family members is very well done.If you had mentally classified Judy Astley as a writer of chic lit then you might need to adjust your thinking as this is a family story with all ages represented plenty to entertain and amuse whatever your age.  I received a free copy of this book from NetGalley for review.

I thought I would enjoy this book but unfortunately it contains characters who are so dislikeable I didn't really care what happened to any of them.  I liked the idea; a house where someone has just died and where his family have come back to clear out the house and hear how he has left his property in his will.  There are ghosts as well as live people in the house and we hear from all of them about what happened to them in the past  in each room and what is happening now.So far so good - I like the idea - it is a little bit quirky and the ghosts have an interesting existence.  But there the good bits end as far as I'm concerned.  The ghosts don't seem to have learned anything about themselves and what went wrong in their lives and the live people are so dysfunctional the word might as well have been coined to describe them.There is Caroline, the alcoholic and child-like estranged wife of the late owner of the property; her children Trenton - physically damaged in a car accident and well on the way to serious mental problems and Minna who is basically a nymphomaniac from whom no man is safe from the undertaker to the delivery man.  Then there is Minna's young daughter, Amy who really seemed to me to be the sanest one of the lot but maybe she was too young to be anything else.I'm afraid I just wanted to shake the whole lot of them and tell them to sort themselves out.  I'm sure the book will appeal to other people but for me it did nothing at all.

Business is not actually booming for the detective agency or for the garage business and Mr J L B Maketoni can no longer afford to pay both his staff and Charlie has to go.  Precious has taken on a case that she is really not at all sure about and her assistant - now partner - Grace Makutsi has decided to open a caf.Will things improve for all the businesses concerned and can Precious solve the case of the woman who apparently has lost her memory without getting into trouble with the immigration authorities.
