This is a great lip exfoliator. Since it comes in a lipstick form, it is really easy to apply. It has brown sugar and a sweet taste and, most importantly, it is really effective. I have backups of this, For just $3 on the ELF website this is a bargain!

I got this for $1 at the DollarStore ($3 on the ELF website). This is a tiny brush that is just perfect for applying a highlight in the inner corner of the eye or for smudging shadow under the lower lashline. It's of really nice quality, too! I'd recommend this!
I got this for $3 on the ELF website and I think it's great for packing shadow onto the lid and even for blending it out a little bit. So nice and full and sooo soft! This product is a winner!

I got this for $3 on the ELF website and I think it's nice for applying cream products to the crease. This is a stiffer domed brush, so it's not really the best bending brush for powder eyeshadow (those work well with fuller and fluffier brushes). But I do like it for cream products or for a more concentrated application of powders that I then blend out with a different brush.
I got this for $3 on the ELF website and I think it's great for blending through the crease or for contouring the nose. So soft and actually quite full. I really like this brush!

I got this for $1 on the ELF website and I think it's great for shaping the brows into place. The only possible downside is that it may be a bit rough around the edges, but it works like a dream. This product is a winner!
I got this for $1 on the ELF website and I think it's great for setting the brows into place, I use both sides for that. This product is a winner!
I got this for $1 on the ELF website and it's actually a really nice blending brush. For just $1 it's always worth a try. I have several of these and they work great for me!

I got this for $3 off of the ELF website. It's a bit of a gimmick, but it is useful to catch any fallout and to prevent those unattractive racoon eyes. However, you can also choose to apply your foundation after doing your eye makeup and once you're done with your makeup, just run a pad with makeup remover over your undereye area and you're fine. The product itself seems to be of good quality, so you'll enjoy it if you choose to purchase it, but I do not think it's a must.

I have over 30 of these nail polishes. The shade selection is great and the colors are really pretty. With no top coat, on me they chip after 2-3 days (I do all dishes by hand and a lot of housework). For $2 on the ELF website, these are nice. Dragon fruit is a great shade for the summer.

This is a really nice product to give your brows quick definition - just run the brush through your brows and you're good to go. I have not used the clear part yet, but the tinted side is really good. For $3 on the ELF website, I'd definitely recommend this.

This primer works great! It is wonderful to use with loose pigments or glitter. It is slightly tacky so the loose shadow will stick to it and they last all day. And for $2 on the ELF website, there's nothing to complain about.

This kit gives you a defined, yet very natural eyebrow look. The wax sets the hairs and lays a color basis and the powder smooths the look out making it even more natural looking. Although the powder is much lighter than the wax it works great! (I was skeptical at first about that). You get a large quantity of product for your buck. Also, this is $3 on the ELF website so a great value!

I haven't purchased this in 4 years, but back then Midnight was very dry. The two eyeliners that I have purchased in April 2014 seemed to be reformulated (I did not get the shade Midnight on that occasion though), so I suspect that the whole line has been reformulated to be creamier. The shade is nice, so I'd say it's worth a try (for $3 on the ELF website). If this did indeed get reformulated, it should be great. This shade comes off as a softer black and it is virtually impossible to see any blue in it.

I haven't purchased this in 4 years, but back then Midnight was very dry. The two eyeliners that I have purchased in April 2014 seemed to be reformulated (I did not get the shade Midnight on that occasion though), so I suspect that the whole line has been reformulated to be creamier. The shade is nice, so I'd say it's worth a try (for $3 on the ELF website). If this did indeed get reformulated, it should be great. This shade comes off as a softer black and it is virtually impossible to see any blue in it.

This is everything an eyeliner should be: dark in one application, creamy, easy to work with and long-lasting (for $3 on the ELF website). I've repurchased this item. I can still use my old one, although it has dried up a bit (purchased two years ago). I find it easier to use with an angled eyeliner brush, but the tiny brush it comes with is also workable, just make sure not to load it too much, otherwise you'll get no color from the tip of the brush and two parallel black lines from the edges. I have super-watery eyes and at times, after extended wear, it can smudge a little bit under the eye, but nothing dramatic. I have tried this in black, coffee, midnight, teal tease, purple, ivory and punk purple and all the colors are very pretty. Midnight is basically black, you won't really see any blue coming through (it looks like they reformulated their whole line to be creamier, but midnight was rather dry some 4 years ago). I'll keep buying this!

I got this in April 2014 from the ELF website for $3. It is super creamy, pigmented, it goes on smoothly and lasts all day. The color is gorgeous and it looks amazing on brown eyes, especially during the summer. I love it!

I got this in April 2014 from the ELF website for $3. It is super creamy, pigmented, it goes on smoothly and lasts all day. The color is gorgeous and it looks amazing on brown eyes, especially during the summer. I love it!

This eyeliner in Coffee is perfect for filling in my brows (my hair is dark brown and my skin is very light). It is a very nice cooler shade of brown that lasts all day and gives you a great result in a very short time. Just use it VERY lightly! A great deal for $3 on the ELF website!

I got this for just $1 on the ELF website. Even though the name implies that this is a liquid lipstick, I think of it as more of a lip gloss with decent pigmentation. I really like it and given the very affordable price, it's so convenient to through one of these in each of your purses, an office drawer, the car etc. I'd recommend this.

I bought these falsies for $1 on the ELF website. I wouldn't recommend using the glue that they come with. The lashes themselves are actually quite nice. Certainly not the quality of some more expensive brands, but a solid product that looks nice on the eyes (these aren't human hair, but they are easy enough to apply). I have repurchased both the dramatic and the natural kit, as I like them both. The look of these lashes is however not very natural, I would actually qualify them as quite dramatic.

I got this compact for $1 off of the ELF website. It features a big mirror and 4 pans that also fit MAC eyeshadows. It is compact and super-sturdy. I have 5 of these and I have traveled with them extensively and never had any issues. A great product at an amazing price, highly recommended!I have all the eyeshadow colors and I really like them. They are pigmented and they blend nicely. They are nice smooth shadows and the color selection is very tasteful as well. I am a big fan of the customizable compact concept: you can pick and choose 4 of these shadows and pack them in your bag. This is what I use when I want to do a quick look on the go and they haven't disappointed me in any of the airports I've used them so far. With a primer, they don't crease. The only con is that they are a bit powdery so your palette may get a bit messy if you don't blow on it every once in a while, but I like that they do not go on chalky at all. And each shadow retails for just $1 on the ELF website - I think they're a great deal, something of a hidden gem of the drugstore. The only question is which 4 shades exactly are you getting with this bundle?

Although I've been a fan of ELF products for some time, I have shied away from trying this one thinking that it couldn't possibly be good for just $1 (on the ELF website/Target). When I finally did try it I was shocked: it is very pigmented, easy to apply, does not smudge or budge, although it does not claim to be waterproof. This is my favorite eyeliner of all times, I use it everyday in either black or midnight. Highly, highly recommended!

It may be my fault for not being a fan of this product: I'm not sure on how I may use it. I got this hoping that it will be a kind of glittery silver liner and it is not. It is just a uniform metallic silver color which is nice enough, but I feel that it doesn't look nice on my eyes on its own. Maybe I should try layering this on top of black liner, but as of now, I can't find a use for it. Otherwise, it seems s decent product and even if I find no use for it, I only paid $1 for it on the ELF website, so no big deal.

This is a glitter liner that I use when I want a bit more dazzle. The glitter is pretty, but beyond that there isn't a lot of pigmentation which is just fine with me for $1 on the ELF website.

Great, bright night light for no night time fright. Phew, say that ten times fast. But seriously, kids love this light - it is much brighter than the Maxxima MLN-50 Light but does tend to get a but more light up in your face. It's in the design of the angle of the light. Kids don't seem to mind this at all though.We recently traveled with this and all three kids were comfortable with just this light and stayed in the second bedroom, leaving quiet nights of sleep for parents. Five stars for this alone. Also, this was great for travel due to the light weight (much lighter than other emergency, plug-in we have) and the plug rotates into the base. Plus you can get even more light with the three-LED switch. Notably, you can illumate both the single and three LEDs at the same time.

We purchased three of these in various colors for our kids to carry their own water during hikes. Sizing was perfect for modest sized water bottles - we used various 12-24 ounce Contigo, thermos, and other bottles, plastic disposable up to 1.25L (42 oz) although this size was a bit difficult to get in/out of the holder. I would also note that silicon wrapped bottles are easy to insert, but cause the holder to flip inside out when removed. IT's easy enough to put back in place, but this would get cumbersome during a hike. The entire holder, including straps, are made from neoprene and you can adjust the sizing to meet almost anyone's requirements. We had no issues with using this with out kids ranged 5-9 (and they are on the shorter side for their ages). With the youngest, we adjusted the strap to the shortest and tied a knot on the top strap to shorten it even further. The knot sat behind and was totally out of the way and unnoticed during use (after the initial complaints about why it had to look different).

Kids loved these for playing in the pool. On a recent vacation, several other children were playing with out children and asking to play with the toys - they were a huge hit. The kids were taking turns hiding the toys and searching, tossing them around, and using them as dive toys. each piece had enough character and detail for the children to get attached to a certain one. My youngest named the octopus Ollie (thanks Zoo-phonics). They toys are very vivid in color and the color held fast with sun, chlorine, and salt water exposure. The plastic seems high quality - no breaks or chips. The pieces are rigid and do not flex.

I purchased these as gym headphones and love them for that. As a bluetooth headset, I've used better.Pros:- Convenience (wireless, no chord interference)- Decent sound- Adequate battery for nearly any workout- Fast charge- Stays in place (better than anything else I have used at the gym)- Comfortable- Not earbuds (allows you to hear external sounds, you can hold a conversation, hear overhead announcements, etc.)Cons:- Sound quality does not match even modest cost earbuds for music- Sound does not match top bluetooth headsets such as Plantronics, but it is serviceable even for work calls- Battery does not match other bluetooth headsets (I am getting 3-4 hours or 75% of a day including stand-by)- Has a tendency to fall towards the heavier side with the microphone pretty quickly when walking around

Items does run big. I typically wear a M/L in golf gloves and found the Medium Akona to be perfect in finger length, but broad around the hands and fingers. There is no stretch to the gloves. The strap helps mitigate this quite a bit. I found the gloves accumulate a lot of sand in the fingers. This must be due to the nylon backing. The backing is a positive though in terms of drying time. Traction was good pushing off rocks and I found the level of protection adequate for snorkeling, even with sharp rocks. The dots on the fingers and palm help with traction.

Classic toy, I knew from the reviews the boat would not go very far, but it really does not go very far. Maybe a foot with 30+ turns of the paddle. This was frustrating for boy age 9, ok for a boy age 5, but he was a bit young to do this on his own (30 turn, he could do like 5). Do not even thing about using this in a pool - it won't do anything.

I'm a long-time Swedish goggle user (the kind with no padding). I tried these out for a recent vacation and loved the improved visibility. I did find the product bulky when trying to swim laps - particularity when pushing off walls, but never had an issue with them falling off. The suction is very strong to the face / eye socket. This can cause discomfort after some time. I found that after about 30 minutes continuous use I needed to take a few minutes break. Goggles were particularly good in peak sun and I loved the tint and UV protection. I will definitely travel with these again.
Purchased as a pool toy. It sinks - kids had fun diving for it. Colors were nice and accurate. Fins bend wit some force, but return to shape.

We used this product during a recent family trip and found it useful in repelling mosquitoes. It seems to work well for about one hour, but not if you get wet. Sweat seems to be ok if you don't touch the skin. We found ourselves (kids included) reapplying the product hourly during a longer hike. We were using another essential oil mix (DoTerra with Witchhazel) but switched to this for convenience and better effect. This did not leave the skin as oily.I highly recommend that you do not loose the inside cap (there are two caps) to prevent leaking. No issues to irritation or painful skin contact despite several days use in a row. Application is white cream, but rubs in clear very quickly. Needs to be appied liberally. Scent is strong, floral but ok for a man; dissipates quickly to a lower level, but scent does not go away completely.  No issues with using on the forehead - did not run into eyes.
As with some other reviewers, I found these leaked and did not properly fit the standard 12-ounce FUNtainer.

Excellent disposal - much better than the aging 1/2 hp Badger 5. Granted the Badger 5 was older, but the Waste King is much faster and quieter than the Badger. It was well worth the upgrade.Instructions were very good. Although, in marketing materials and instructions they assume you know the difference between EZ Mount (Waste King) vs. 3-Bolt (Badger). Now you know that unless you have an EZ Mount, you will need to replace the entire mounting system when switching disposal units.Installation was simple once I figured out that I had to disassemble the entire unit from my sink (see above). Note, I have a Corian sink. The only things you may need to purchase that was not included is a screwdriver, wrench, and plumber's putty.The Waste King unit itself is much larger than the Badger - the girth is enough that we have to fit in one of our two trash bins sideways. Make sure you measure this in advance to account for the larger size of this unit.

I agree with the other two-star reviews - the seams tear in very little time (less than one week of moderate play). Also, the only round ball is the soccer ball - the baseball and basketball are round/square-ish. Not ideal if you are looking to use these with an indoor basketball hoop. Granted these were the cheapest plush ball set on Amazon, and there is a reason. I would not buy these again and will not recommend them. Pay more for something that will last.

So this was a tough one for me to rate. I like the Niagara Sava Spa 1.75 but my wife does not. This comes down to personal preference regarding water flow.We switched one shower to the Niagara earth massage 2.0 and did not feel much difference (in a good way) vs. the 2.5 gpm standard showerhead we had previously. I thought I would try to go down a bit further to 1.75 gpm in the second shower. I like the coverage of this showerhead, but my wife does not like the lower flow. The combination of the lower flow (1.75 vs. 2.0) and wider coverage make this feel like the flow is not sufficient for her.Beyond preference, the showerhead is a very high quality product - exactly what I would expect from Niagara. It has a fine appearance and installed perfectly into our shower. We have definitely noticed the impact on water consumption.

These are very bright and very cost effective. Our previous night lights were 15 watts - good compared to traditional lights, but not really cost effective enough to keep on all night. Our kids did not like traditional might lights because they were not bright enough - so we had to keep those previous 15 watt lights on. There are plenty bright for the kids, but run at a fraction of the operating cost. Win Win!

UPDATE: GOOD NEWS!After a little more than one year use, and several drops, the corner fell off the product and needed to be replaced (big drop on the last one). I bought another. Normally, I would say something negative about a product that breaks before it's intended live, but hey, the phone was protected and the case did it's job. Can't ask for more. Upgrade to 5 stars.ORIGINAL REVIEW:This is a very minimal cover for the DROID Ultra. My wife was concerned about the larger size of this phone (compared to her last Android phone) so she wanted a less bulky cover. This cover has a very nice, high quality feel, very bright color (pink) and fits her Ultra very well. The button slots line up well and provide the necessary space for the buttons to work properly. The only negative is the top and bottom of the phone are not completely covered and are thus exposed if the phone was to call on an edge just right. The corners, back, and sides are covered.

I installed this spring with my 80lb heavy bag, which is installed on my garage rafters. Overall I like the dampening effect. There is less vibration that goes into the rafters. Perhaps about half. The spring is quite large, however; I had to remove all the chain links to get the bag to sit at the same level. Even so, there is a definite change in cadence of the bag - not bad, just something to get used to.

I've purchased a few of these types of keyboard covers over the years for various Dell computers and thus far this is as good as any of them.Pros:- Fits keys very well (like a glove)- backlight comes through very well- slight texture feel, but not rubbery like some covers- seems to sit on the keyboard very well - no migration or edge liftCons- not perfect transparency (but not bad enough to take a star awayI have not had it long enough to comment on durability - if there is any issue I will re-post.

***Update***After not a whole lot of use (I used these only for travel, perhaps 8-10 times over the course of approx one year) the shoes developed a tear in the heal strap. When I say developed a tear - I mean they tore completely off. I liked the fit and the convenience, but can no longer recommend this shoe due to lack of arability. I ended up getting the New Balance Men's MX20v3 Minimus Cross-Training Shoe as a replacement and like it much more.***Original Review***I'll start by saying that I am not a runner. I do occasionally jog (especially while traveling) if I can not get to a gym to swim. I do, however, use the gym frequently and love to continue my routine while traveling. Often times though, I find myself on week long or longer business trips and am forced to not pack shoes to exercise of use a hotel (or local) gym. I have been searching for a very lightweight and minimal shoe to pack for these occasions. The Hattori fits this need very well. I like the flat heel, light weight, minimal profile (even lighter and flatter than Five Finger shoes) and strap (the attachment to the foot is very good). So far the construction has held up (in a few months of use), although I am concerned that long term these do not feel like the most durable shoes, from a construction standpoint. One point here is, as others have mentioned, these shoes do run small. I purchased my typical shoe size and it fits, but my toes exert more pressure on the top material than I prefer. If the shoes were to break down, it will be near the toe bed. All-in-all, very good shoe for travel and I would recommend to others.

This is a fun game and easy to understand. Compared to the other Top Trump card games, this set seems particularly well suited for younger children. My five and seven year old children both enjoy playing and can follow the game well; my three year old can follow the game and particulate, but does not understand the strategy component. The criteria are very easy to understand (the easiest of the 4 Top Trump games we have) and the statistics are easily compared between characters (for example, we had difficulty with the Transformer game due to the comparisons of Transformers to humans).The cards are durable. There are 30 characters and five criteria (some Top Trump games have six). The criteria are: Size, IQ, Popularity, Eyes, and Scream Can Rating. They each have different value ranges so it adds to the difficulty for the younger children - they tend to focus on one or two criteria.Each game takes about ~10-15 minutes. The game is reasonable entertaining to play a few rounds with the kids - after that it gets a bit dull for adults. Kids can play for hours. We have introduced variations to the game such random selection of cards, strategic card selection, varied number of cards, leaving cards in the middle and randomly selecting them as a tie-breaker.

This is a fun game and easy to understand. Compared to the other Top Trump card games, this set has very realistic head shots of the Horses and Ponies, very easy to understand criteria and very comparable statistics (meaning it does not seem like you are comparing apples to oranges so to speak) (for example, we had difficulty with the Transformer game due to the comparisons of Transformers to humans).The cards are durable. There are 30 characters and five criteria (some Top Trump games have six). The criteria are: Height, Colour Variety, Sportability, Beauty, and Speed. They each have different value ranges so it adds to the difficulty for the younger children. I am no expert on horses, but I found the characters to be well represented insofar as we are able to make clear comparisons. I also appreciated that there is a flag designating the country of origin for each horse/pony, as well as a brief description of their background. The only con I found is that the type face is a bit smaller than with the other Top Trump games (I think due to the space taken up by the descriptions).Each game takes about ~10-15 minutes. The game is reasonable entertaining to play a few rounds with the kids - after that it gets a bit dull for adults. Kids can play for hours. My 5 and 7 year old children both enjoy playing and can follow the game well. We have introduced variations to the game such random selection of cards, strategic card selection, varied number of cards, leaving cards in the middle and randomly selecting them as a tie-breaker.

My daughter is getting ready to take the PSAT this fall.  She was so relieved to receive this study guide, because she was experiencing a bit of that old "fear of the unknown".  While the size of the book caused her to pause a bit, when she looked at how it is structured and saw that it is not just reading but guides you through actual practice as a workbook, she wasn't as intimidated.  She's working on it through the summer to prepare.I am impressed with the readability and ease of practice this book offers.  I'm not saying the work itself is necessarily easy - just that it walks you through things and discusses all sorts of tips to help you feel more at ease with the test.  There are 16 additional chapters of preparation materials available online, included when you sign up online with the purchase of this book.There is one practice test in the book and a second available online.  I will say, I was a little disappointed with only having 2 tests available with this guide.  We have the College Board SAT guide, which includes 10 practice tests in the book, which I feel offers more practice.  In all other respects, this book is very similar to the College Board book.Obviously, I cannot give our opinion yet on how well this helped her actually pass the test.  I'll definitely update this review in the fall after she takes the test.

This was a great book - couldn't put it down!  The storyline, the suspense, the romance, the characters - it was all great.  This is the second book I've read by Lisa Carter, and I really enjoy her writing.I did not realize when I picked it up that this book comes after "Carolina Reckoning", and there were indeed times where I felt like I was missing something that had happened in the previous book, like how you feel when you are missing an inside joke.  However, this story did not depend on the previous book to make sense.  I actually want to read "Carolina Reckoning" now, as well.I definitely enjoyed this book & recommend it if you enjoy Christian fiction and mystery.

My husband bought this for our anniversary two weeks ago.  I absolutely love it!  I prefer understated jewelry, and this necklace is exactly that.  The pendant lies right at my collarbone, making it suitable for a number of outfits.  I wore it to dinner the night he gave it to me with a burgundy V-neck dress, and it looked stunning.The combination of rose gold and silver is lovely with what I feel is a bit of a vintage feel.  The photo here is enlarged, so be sure to look at the measurements in the listing under Jewelry Information.  The diamonds are really just tiny accents, they don't stand out.The chain is not as delicate as I thought it would be, which I like - I don't feel like it's breakable in the way that some finely textured chains I've had have been.  The clasp is easy to work and to hook together.I couldn't be happier with this piece, and I'll be wearing it often.

1:15 Mins I've been around babies long enough to know that some toys seem like a great idea and are wonderful at first, but they can quickly wear on you with their sounds, or can be boring.  For this reason, it's hard to choose a toy like this online without hearing it for yourself... I made a short video for this review to allow you to see and hear just a bit of the capabilities and sound.I do like the ability to turn it on and off!  Some toys with sound don't have this option, which is crazy and annoying and burns out the batteries.  This also has the option for two different volume levels, which can help in the car or quiet living room vs. in a loud place where baby can't hear as well.The little grey slider bar at the bottom of the "screen" doesn't do anything - it's just for show.  So don't think you have control over brightness, fast forwarding, locking, or refreshing - despite the fact that those indicators are printed there.Finally, the frustration-free packaging was great.  I can't tell you how many times our kids received a gift, and then we had to snip an abundance of tough wires, ties, and/or tape to get it out of the package.  The packaging for this makes it more fun right away for both the child and the parent when received as a gift!

My husband's day job revolves around setting up routers and switches for companies both large and small, so he has written this review:Overall, I'm a little under-whelmed by this wireless router. When pulling it out of the box, it's heavy and feels solid, which initially told me quality. While the interface to configure it is nice, the wireless performance for me just isn't solid or reliable.++++++++++Pros:- The web interface is simple, clear and easy to use- Able to place this router into access point mode which is nice if you don't need routing or NAT; I like this because it gives me flexibility in how I use it in conjunction with another routerCons:- Reception in the house is worse than my older Linksys WRT54G; my wife and daughters are coming to me way too often saying they are losing connectivity; sometimes a reboot helps, sometime it doesn't; still troubleshooting it, but it's intermittent- When running in router mode, the content filter is way too simple, only allowing for you to pick certain websites (and only a handful at that); you cannot filter based on keyword or category at all; what good does it do to block 6 or 10 website URLS when there are trillions out there? I'd rather be able to block by keyword & category- Slow when moving through the web GUI++++++++++Honestly, I was expecting more with technology that has moved on from the old WRT54G days, but I am considering powering this new router down and firing the old one back up. I'm hoping that future firmware updates will fix the things that are frustrating me.

This was a great book, couldn't put it down! I already have the preorder for the sequel in my Amazon cart...The storyline sounded a bit fluffy, but definitely enjoyable, so I picked this up for a poolside read. Turned out, the storyline was not fluffy, and I really enjoyed the depth of the characters.I loved the way Jessie rebounds and finds her way, and the way she boldly takes risks starting a new business despite feeling out of place in the new life she was forced into. I was glad to find she's not shallow despite her apparent spoiled lifestyle that she begins with at the start of the book.I also enjoyed Danny's kind heart, the way he stepped up to help her out above and beyond just his initial job of investigating her missing husband. The way his character unfolded through the story was nicely done - we don't know everything about him up front, and find out more even as the book is drawing to a close.The Christian element in this story is definitely present, but not overly preachy. It was interesting how Jessie's thoughts and inclinations toward God are not resolved at the end of this book, so I anticipate that being part of the sequel.The one odd element for me was the weaving in of Jessie's grandfather's thoughts about Jessie's growing up years. While the memories were sweet and helpful for understanding Jessie's character, I found it odd how his present-day character was not part of the present-day storyline. It felt a bit disjointed when jumping back and forth between the two, especially at the beginning, but I was used to it by the end.I can't wait for the next book in this series, especially after reading the teaser at the back of this one!

Last year, I tried a hummingbird feeder that did not attract a single hummingbird.  I left it up all season, and hummingbirds came to my flowers and trees, but not to that feeder.  So this spring, I decided to try this new Perky Pet feeder.  I considered placing it in a different spot, but the spot where I had it last year still seemed ideal to me because it is close to a plant with red trumpet flowers that the hummingbirds love.The very first day the feeder was out, I saw a hummingbird stop by!  It checked out the feeder, visited the trumpet flower bush, and then went back to the feeder for a while.  I was ecstatic!  Since then, we've seen hummingbirds just about every day.I was concerned with all the rain we've been having that the water would somehow get into the feeder through the yellow parts, water down the solution, and deter the birds from visiting.  However, I have not noticed it affecting the birds, they keep coming around!One final note: don't bother with the store bought solutions - I actually have noticed the birds didn't come around when I put those solutions out.  Instead, I followed the advice of a coworker: make a simple (inexpensive!) solution by boiling 3 parts of water with one part sugar, cool completely, then add it to the feeder.  If you make extra, you can keep it in a pitcher in the fridge for refills.

This spring, I planted a flat of Verbena around the trees in my front yard, only to see a rabbit sitting under one of the trees a few mornings later, eating what apparently considers a delicious Verbena Salad.  He was only eating the flowers, not the plants, so my hope was that by using this product, I could keep rabbits away long enough for the plants to grow enough to generate more flowers.I followed the directions for sprinkling the pellets in a 2-3ft radius from the area I wanted to protect.  I noticed within two days I had new flower buds, and a couple of days after that they were blooming!The biggest issue I've had with this product is really not the fault of the product, but the fact that we have had an incredibly wet, rainy spring here in north Texas.  This product, being made of natural elements, gradually washes away.  A single rain or yard watering wouldn't do it, as stated on the bag.  However, we have had so much rain this product couldn't help but be dissolved and washed away after a few short days right now!  This means I've had to reapply, but I haven't always been able to because it's been raining practically every day.  As a result, there have been spurts of flower loss.  On the flip side, the spurts of time when the product is fresh and doing its repelling job, combined with all the rain, the Verbena has had lots of growth, and I have not lost the plants.As to the fragrance of this product, I do not find it offensive or very strong.  In fact, chemical fertilizers have a much stronger smell than this does; even organic fertilizers tend to have a stronger odor than this product.

This is the second Ace Collins book I've read - I also read The Color of Justice last month.  I enjoyed Hollywood Lost, but not quite as much.The author is skilled at writing a book with intensity of story and well-written characters.  I enjoyed the storyline along the way even as I was on the edge of my seat to find the answer to the mystery.  Suspicions are cast in every direction, making it tough for me to truly put a finger on who did it until the very end!The characters are developed well, so that I felt I knew and recognized them early on, yet there is enough complexity to each one that they do not feel contrived. The allure and glamour of Hollywood was fun to read about while also portraying the occasionally harsh realities behind the scenes.As the book progressed, I became disappointed in the character of Bill Barrister/police captain.  I felt that he put Shelby under pressures that a police investigator would not put a civilian woman under, even back in the time period this was written about.  It cast an unrealistic shadow that I couldn't shake through the rest of the book when it came to his character, and even affected how I felt about the big build-up to the revelation of the true murderer at the end.  For this reason, I didn't enjoy this book as much as I did The Color of Justice - however it was still a thrilling and exciting book!

FYI: This review contains ***Possible Spoilers***I really enjoy Biblical fiction, and was looking forward to reading "Angels at the Gate".  When I say Biblical fiction, I am thinking of books that take a story from the Bible, even if it is minimally described there, and use historical study plus creativity to write a great story that holds true to what the message of the Bible is.As I began reading this book, I liked the premise, despite the difficulty imagining a girl of this time period being raised with her identity hidden so she could remain with her father in his travelling trade.  The storyline is compelling, mysterious, and suspenseful, with places of intense action or anticipation.  In that regard, this book has a lot for those who want to stay on the edge of their seat. As the book moved on, however, I noticed more and more places where the author was asking the reader to suppose alternate possibilities of what else could have occurred when the Bible is short on description.For example, the "men" and "angels" described as appearing to Abraham, and later to Lot, are not described much in the Bible.  Therefore, the author gives us the idea that Mika and Raph were indeed men - very tall, very imposing men.  OK, I'm willing to give this a possibility for the sake of the story, because after all, the Bible does give the possibility in Genesis 6 that angels married women who gave birth to giants.  But as the story keeps going, what could have been the power and manifestation of God working through Mika is eventually referred to as "magic", and he doesn't "hear from God" as I would expect if the message were staying true to the heart of the Bible.  Instead, he has to use a magic stone in a ritual that is just like a pagan one, which included having sex with the main character Adira after getting her drunk, and beseeching the goddess Ishtar.  When Mika addresses the king regarding what he was told in this ritual, he does not say, "The Most High God has shown me..." as Biblical language would suggest from other prophetic words spoken throughout the Bible; he says, "This then is what the gods told me."The author uses references to Islam, including quotes from Islamic texts, which I was willing to see past, since Abraham's son Ishmael is included in this story, and the history of his descendants and their religion could help make up the historical context of part of the book.  However, as I continued, it felt to me that the author was trying to blend the religions of Hebrew and Islamic religions, as well as the pagans, into one universal thing.  Something along the lines of "We all call our gods and goddesses and their powers different things, but it's all the same."This book does NOT stay true to the overall message of the Bible, as I would have expected from Biblical historic fiction.  I must say I was quite disappointed, because I had started this book so looking forward to it thanks to all the great reviews currently posted for it.  If you are interested in Biblical fiction that follows the heart of the message of the Bible, I suggest Francine River's A Lineage of Grace: Five Stories of Unlikely Women Who Changed Eternity and Sons of Encouragement, as well as Davis Bunn & Janette Oke's Acts of Faith (3 Book Series).

I am a Burts Bees fan, so I looked forward to trying these face cleansing wipes.I was very pleased with the way they washed my face, my skin felt very clean.My skin did not feel dried out or greasy afterward, nor did I sense any residue left from the cleanser.My one negative for these: I did not have great success removing eye makeup with these - it took 5x as long and far more swipes to get my mascara and eyeliner off.  I still need eye makeup remover (on days I wear it - which is not every day).I can actually cut these in half - half of one is really enough for me to wash my face for one night.My daughter tried a pack of these, and she loves the convenience of washing with wipes. She's rather impatient and doesn't always take the time to wash with cleanser and a washcloth, and her skin suffers for it (acne). But with the wipes around, she washes every night and her skin looks better.My mother also tried a pack of these, because she has both sensitive skin and a sensitivity to fragrances. She loved them! There was no fragrance to irritate her sinuses and throat, and her skin had no problems with the cleanser.

This book was beautifully written, such a joy to read!  I forgot I was reading a book targeted at a younger audience.  While the main characters were children, the book does not feel childish at all (not to mention the sheer size of it - it's a long book!)  The characters have such heartful complexity that I couldn't put it down.  However, it is not too complicated that a young person would not be able to follow along - my 12 year old daughter is reading it right now, and has found herself being completely drawn in as well.  I would not hesitate to recommend this book to a child or an adult.The theme of music being both healing and a place to find refuge is universal and timely.  So many kids today do not realize that there was once a world where music was not so easily accessible.  All three stories in this book are from a time when music was a treasure.  I hope this story introduces young people to the precious thing that music can be in their lives.

I'm always interested in helpful tools to cook more foods on the grill, so that I can keep my house cool in the summer.  When I saw this griddle, I was excited because most of the time when I wanted to cook something that needed a tray, I just put a cheap cookie sheet on the grill, which was honestly too thin and I had to be very careful not to burn things.This griddle is very heavy duty, from a thick gauge of steel, which goes a long way to keep food from burning over the grill flames.  The weight also keeps it from scooting around easily while I'm flipping and moving food on it.The hinge on the elevation bar is very stiff, which is a good thing because it doesn't flip down easily while the tray is in use or being moved.  It would be a pain having to flip that thing back up when the whole tray is hot to touch.The drip tray is helpful, and didn't fill up when I cooked turkey bacon on here.  For most other foods that I cook on here, though, the drip tray is unnecessary (such as French fries or pancakes).If you've cooked with stainless cookware, you know that it can be tougher to clean than nonstick, so be prepared for the shiny new finish on this to be quickly marred by both foods and grill smoke marks.  However, if you properly prepare it before cooking foods that stick, that helps.  Also, a paste of baking soda and water can be used to gently and effectively scrub away stuck on and burned food.One note on the packing - Amazon packaged this product just fine to ship it to me, but the actual product box was very damaged at one corner when I opened the shipping box.  Unfortunately, this meant that the corner on the opposite side of the drip dray was bent.  Considering the heavy gauge of the steel used, I am convinced it was a significant impact to the actual product box before shipping that caused this.  Thankfully the bent area does not affect the use of the tray, but I'm disappointed that they would ship a product that has obvious damage.

I've used the original Nivea Lip Butter, and liked it quite well, so was looking forward to trying this cocoa butter version.It smells delicious, but doesn't have any flavor to match, which I found odd.This product applies very smoothly and definitely feels like butter.  It's not waxy, sticky, or cheap feeling at all.  However, I don't feel like it lasts very long, and I've had to reapply it often.  For me, long lasting moisturization is the main goal of lip balm, I don't like having dry lips!  The original lip butter lasted longer for me than this cocoa butter version, so of the two, I would choose the original for this reason alone.The tin the Lip Butter comes in is not easy to open and close - the lid sticks to the main tin, and not because of something sticky, it's the actual design.  It could just be a manufacturing defect, because the tin from my original lip butter never did this.I'm not a fan of trying to apply products this thick with my finger, because I don't like standing there rubbing and rubbing just to get enough on my finger for suitable application. Honestly, the tin is large enough that I'm able to put it straight to my lips and apply like a stick balm straight from the tin. I'd really prefer to have this product in stick form, actually, it would be much easier to apply.

This book was not quite what I expected, yet in a good way. Rather than an exposition on taking time to value in the world around you, it is more of a journal of the author's personal experience with this topic. It is organized by month and season, so you can read along as the year passes by. There are suggestions for moments of contemplation and moments of action, all focused on special moments exclusive to the season.At times I became a little lost in the prose of this book, because the author can be quite flowery, as if she is writing poetry. I would rather read straightforward, practical language that cuts right to the heart of the matter, but that's just personal preference.

The flavor of these has brought mixed reactions as we have tried them.Neither I nor my 12 yr old daughter liked them at all.  I felt they were sickly sweet and artificial tasting, which is very odd since they are naturally flavored with real raspberry puree'.  I gave them a second try another day, thinking I'd misjudged them the first time, and found them equally displeasing.  I really like nuts, so I am disappointed!However, my husband actually snatched the bag from me when he found out I didn't like them, and he vowed to finish them off because he liked them so well.  I shared a few with one of my coworkers the first day I was trying them out, and she said they were delicious.So it seems they are a flavor that is loved by some, and not pleasing to others.  As far as the actual nuts go, they were crunchy, not soggy, which is certainly an important quality in nuts covered by a coating like these.

These dishtowels have a very nice, smooth feel, especially after you wash them a few times, but they're not so smooth that they don't absorb. They absorb similarly to a woven tea towel (if you've ever had one of those), and do not soak up as quickly as a thick towel. For a spill, I would probably grab a thick towel instead, but for drying dishes and such, these work well for me.They are generously oversized, much larger than what standard kitchen towels usually are. There is a hanging loop on the back of one of the corners. However, because of the generous sizing, when you hang it from the corner it hangs down about 36". I would have to put the hook on a wall, not a bottom cabinet door, which doesn't suit my kitchen.The color is a lovely turquoise that coordinates well with my kitchen, and has been quite a popular color lately.When these are laundered and dried, the edges curl and buckle in the dryer. I'm not going to be ironing my kitchen towels, but that's what it would take for them to fold flat and have a smooth appearance after that first laundering.Overall, these are nice if you're looking for oversized kitchen towels. If you're wanting a more standard size, these are not it.

This replaced a 6 year old cracking plastic drain cover that was nasty, despite my attempts to keep it clean.  When I measured it before ordering the new one, it was 4 1/2" wide, but I decided to take the risk because I was so ready to get rid of the old one.I am soooo glad I decided to replace it, and this metal drain cover is so much easier to keep clean!  It doesn't have the thick 3-dimensional grid that dropped down below what you see on top that the plastic one had, which was the part that was always nasty.  Plus the metal has a much nicer look than plastic that gave just a little touch of class to the shower floor, if that is possible!The only drawback I found is that this doesn't actually snap in place, despite what the title says.  It stays in place thanks to gravity, but not due to snapping tabs or anything like that.  For the most part, this is fine.  However, it does shift around a little, maybe as much as 1/4 of an inch in any direction, probably due to that initial size difference.  This is not a deal breaker for me, and it most certainly is not sliding all over the shower, but I felt the product description/title was misleading.

Initially I liked the idea of veggies added to the actual pasta.  The vitamin content of these noodles is significantly higher as a result.I made a creamy noodle and chicken dish my family loves, and the noodles had a distinctive orange color that threw my kids for a momentary loop ("Why is this orange?" followed by dubious looks...)  Everyone did eat it, however, and enjoyed it!  You can't taste the orange after all, ha!Here's my concern with the veggie idea - this is still a white wheat product.  There is no added whole grain which adds fiber and other important nutrients.  I don't usually purchase pasta that isn't 100% whole wheat, or multigrain with added fiber (such as the Barilla Plus).  And if you look at the back, there are only 2 carrots and half a cup of squash processed into the *entire box* - that's not a lot of veggies as far as I'm concerned.  At least, not enough for me to consider switching to use this instead of the better health benefits of whole wheat and grains.

I actually had a tough time initially getting into this book.  I felt like the author was quite hedgy about giving any background or details about connections with people in an attempt to create suspense, and this made me feel lost.  However, this seemed to end rather quickly after that first chapter or so, as connections were explained and the suspense started to build more naturally.I ended up really enjoying this book!  The mystery is full of tension as the red herrings fly left and right.  The romance has a beautiful draw, as a second chance is such a hopeful, heartwarming theme.  The Christian aspects of this book are well done, in what I felt was a realistic and non-preachy way.I'm going to be looking for more from Christy Barritt - she had me on the edge of my seat with a hard-to-put-down story!

I'm so happy that Soul Music Records ( a division of Cherry Red in the UK who is also the parent company of Big Break Records) decided to reissue Tasha Thomas's album MIDNIGHT RENDEZVOUS on a special two-CD expanded edition set.The remastering is absolutely fantastic and I can really hear different instruments like finger-cymbals and horns on cuts like "Street Fever" and "Shoot Me (With Your Love)" and the bass line on SM(WYL) is still vibrant and on top of the rest of the instrumentation."Hot Buttered Boogie" and "You Put The Music In Me" last a few seconds longer than their record tracks and you can understand what the male voice is saying on HBB (Butter, Butter), so the remastering does the album justice and  warrants an upgrade.The additional CD contains different versions of "Shoot Me,"' "Street Fever," "Hot Buttered Boogie," and "Midnight Rendezvous" so you do get extras.A booklet is included with 2015 liner notes by Justin Kantor (July '15), original liner notes from Chris Albertson, and excerpts from an interview with Thomas from 1979. Unfortunately there aren't any additional pictures on the inside.It's unfortunate that Tasha Thomas died so young in November 1984 but this (her only solo album) is a testament to her talent not only as a singer but as a songwriter as well.

THE BROWN DERBY RESTAURANT book could've been easily twice or three times the size (and by that I mean the number of pages) because according to the introduction by Sally Wright Cobb (wife of owner Robert Cobb), she went through hundreds of photos to make this book and whittled it down to the ones that made it to print.Not only does the book show wonderful black & white and sepia toned photographs of the famous stars of the Golden Age of Hollywood, but the book also shows the outside of the Brown Derby Restaurant locations (Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Los Feliz, Wilshire) and includes a picture of the construction of the "hat" shaped Derby on Wilshire and a picture of the staff in front of the completed hat.It also includes recipes, I haven't tried the recipes, and pictures of the menu as well as the interior of the restaurant and it includes a homage to the "I Love Lucy" episode (LA At Last - My favorite) where Lucy, Fred and Ethel visit The Brown Derby and run into William Holden.Also, the famous caricatures by Eddie Vitch that were on the wall are reproduced on the inside of the hardcover and throughout the book. Vitch, I learned from the book, came into the restaurant and asked Robert Cobb if he could sketch the stars in exchange for something to eat and Cobb was amazed at the speed that Vitch did the drawings and hired him on permanently.The book says that there was a staff photographer at the restaurant and that's why so many wonderful pictures were taken and taken with the stars permission and when they were ready. That's why you don't see any pictures of a celebrity stuffing their face or picking their nose or any other inappropriate behavior or having food stuck in their teeth or faces, LOL.Just looking at the pictures and seeing everyone dressed up and very elegant makes me long for that period. But of course I'm yearning for a fantasy and a romanticized notion of that time and have to remind myself that even these pictures were posed and staged for full effect..Anyway, the book is wonderful and if you enjoy classic Hollywood lore this should be on your list.

This is an excellent CD from Culture Club. I had it on cassette tape way back then because I liked the single "Miss Me Blind," but the whole album is great.There a good mix between up-tempo and slower ballads on COLOUR BY NUMBERS and the bonus tracks are good too (although I swear that the title track "Colour By Numbers" was on the original cassette because I have heard that song before). Anyway, I think this was the second album from Culture Club and it proved that they were no flash-in-the-pan.The CD has the hits "Karma Chameleon," "It's A Miracle," "Church Of The Poison Mind," and "Miss Me Blind," which were all hits and got a fair amount of radio play back then. I remember because I couldn't afford to buy albums back then, being a broke teenager, so I would rely on radio play to hear songs and the songs mentioned above were on constant play.Also on this CD are slower ballads like "Black Money," "Stormkeeper," "Victims," and "Changing Everyday," the latter more an up-tempo ballad, but each with profound lyrics. And even though they're of the slower variety they still jam. I was actually surprised to learn that all of the songs were written by Boy George along with others including his band mates because I didn't know this back then.I had the cassette of this album and eventually got the first issued CD of it, and now I've got this expanded edition. This CD comes with a fold out booklet that has pictures of the band members and the lyrics to the songs, but no other liner notes except credits. Get it you won't be sorry.

The KILOLINE PRO HEAT GLOVE works well, but don't think you can use this glove like an oven mitt. This glove is worn so that if you accidentally touch the side of a curling iron or wand you won't get a serious burn.If you hold the iron for extended periods against the glove you will feel the heat.The glove can fit either the left or right hand.

The VICHY PURETE THERMALE works like it should.I used it the other night to remove makeup and Urban Decay's 24/7 Eyeliner, I went to the Madonna concert and wanted a certain look, and it worked like a charm. I thought it was going to burn my eyes because it took several wipes to remove the eyeliner but it didn't. Also, it didn't coat my contact lenses with oil, which makes them temporarily blurry, like I sometimes get with baby oil, so that's a plus.Even though the directions on the VICHY PURETE says you don't have to rinse after wiping, I rinsed my face off anyway because I didn't want to any residue on my face.It hasn't broken me out and the formula is very mild and doesn't sting when applied.

The CAILLER PRALINES are delicious. I've never had pralines before and these are very soft.The box comes with 16-pieces covered in chocolate and the box itself is beautifully presented, wrapped, and ready to give as a gift.It also comes with a small booklet (the green book on the ribbon pictured) that has a picture of each candy and its description.I'm not sure if these will hold up in the hot weather, they might melt during transit, but mine arrived just fine.

Buy this for the music only because this is a BARE bones release. RUFUS & CHAKA KHAN CLASSIC ALBUM SELECTION collects the first six studio albums from 1973s RUFUS up to STREET PLAYER from 1978 from this great group.Although each CD comes in a replica album jacket, and all six come housed in a cardboard display box, there's nothing else included. No booklet, no liner notes, NOTHING. According to a review that was on a blog there are also problems with the pictures on some of the CD jackets and features the wrong line-up of the group, as well as spelling errors on song titles.This reminds me of the bare bones "Original Album Series" by Rhino, which offers album releases on CD for a reasonable price.The music of Rufus & Chaka Khan is wonderfully funky, so buy this set for the music only. Don't expect to learn anything about the group or each album or anything.

These NO-SHOW SOCKS have a very large silicone pad on the heel so it stays on, unlike some other brands with the small dot or strips on the back, since it has more of a gripping surface .I got the size XS-Mens because I wear a size 9 in loafers and dress shoes (Cole Haan, John Varvatos Star, also 9 in Chuck Taylor Converse) -- in sneakers I wear between 9 1/2 -10 1/2 (Nike, Adidas) -- so I went with the XS according to the Stomper Joe size chart and these fit just right. In fact they could be a bit smaller length wise for a tighter more secure fit because the back part of the sock I have to tuck down a little because my Cole Haan ZeroGrands push the sock a touch above the rim, so some of it shows until I push it back down. Otherwise the fit is on point.If you wear a smaller size than a Men's 9 the XS may not fit well, and that's the smallest size for Men, so if I were you I'd look for the comparable size in the Women's section of the same sock.Walking around this past weekend to dinner and bar hopping,  these STOMPER JOE'S NO-SHOW SOCKS stayed up. Normally when I wear the other brands the heel will slip off inside my shoe and I have to stop and take off my shoe and fix it, which is a pain!I also got these in the tan color and I've washed the pair I wore. Since the silicone pad in the heel was a solid piece (oval shaped) I thought it might become loose or something after I threw them in the washing machine, but there was no change.

NEXXUS OIL INFINITE SHAMPOO does make my hair soft and manageable. I find that I don't have to use a conditioner after shampooing and after showering, I don't have to use a leave-in conditioner (except a little on the ends so that my hair doesn't look too wiry) .It has a perfumey scent something like Frankincense incense and one of those inexpensive perfumes that they sell in the drugstore, which might be the oil in the shampoo. The scent is strong when you put it on, but after rinsing off it's not bad.Another reviewer said that this shampoo didn't lather up well enough, but I didn't have that problem. It does contain Sodium Laureth Sulfate and Cocamidopropyl Betaine, which are chemicals used to make products like shampoo and facial/body cleansers foam up, so it lathered up very nicely for me. Those ingredients also cause some people who are allergic to them or have sensitive skin, get skin irritation; some even say that it causes negative reactions to those who have no allergies or sensitivities, but who knows?As long as you're fine with those ingredients and you don't mind the scent, the NEXXUS OIL INFINITE SHAMPOO should be good for use.

I like the ANDIS PET NAIL GRINDER even though I still use the manual nail clippers on my Shiba.I found that by cutting with the manual clippers her nails get jagged and rough and they hurt when they come into contact with my skin. So the Andis helps with that issue.Normally I clip her nails after her bath, her nails get really long, and then the next day I'll use the ANDIS to further shorten the nail (since I keep far from the quick) using the sanding head. I then follow that with the polishing stone head, which smooths out the nail and keeps them smooth even after they grow out. I couldn't be happier since her nails no longer scratch when they come into contact with human skin.I initially had the Dremel Nail Grinder but after a couple of years the battery wouldn't hold its charge (and it didn't come with a polishing stone). The ANDIS PET GRINDER is corded so I don't have to worry about that.The kit comes with a case, instruction sheet, extra sanding bands, polishing stone head, 1 large drum head, 1 small drum head, wrench, and a silicone covering that you can use on the unit for better grip, but I don't use it.

The AUSSIE INSTANT FREEZE HAIR SPRAY doesn't smell like the "Scrunch Spray" which is the wonderful smell of the original "3-Minute Miracle" conditioner. I really like that original scent and so I purchased this hoping it would smell the same but it doesn't. It's smell OK -- reminds me of the 80s "Final Net" hair spray scent -- but I wanted the other scent.I only give it 3-stars because the spray nozzle clogs up and you can't use it. I'm not sure if it's getting clogged in the actual face of the nozzle or the stem but this also happened on the AUSSIE SCRUNCH SPRAY. To fix it I took another nozzle spray top from an empty bottle of a different brand and use it on this bottle and the problem was solved.The hair spray does hold pretty stiff so use it sparingly. I only spray the front of my hair to give my part some lift and I noticed that it doesn't flake and you can wet it to re-stiffen it or reshape your hair when you're out and about.

If you haven't already bought the "Poirot: The Movie Collection Set 6" and/or the separate Blu-Ray of "Poirot: Murder On The Orient Express," and instead have started your collection with the AGATHA CHRISTIE'S POIROT SERIES like I did, then you should definitely pickup POIROT SERIES 12.Fellow Amazon reviewer Paul J. Mular does a pretty good job explaining the differences between the Poirot "Movie Collection" set and the Poirot "Series" sets, which really confused me when I started buying the "SERIES" Blurays since many of the more recent episodes weren't available on Blu-Ray and I started finding the "movie collection set" DVDs, but they both contain the same movies/shows that were broadcast, just not in the same order. As long as you started with POIROT SERIES 1 and have continued in sequential order ending with "SERIES 13" you will have all of the episodes; there is no difference between the shows on the "Poirot The Movie Collection" and the ones on the "Poirot Series."This is the second to the last set of AGATHA CHRISTIE'S POIROT: SERIES starring David Suchet as Hercule Poirot.I had originally bought the stand alone Blu-Ray of POIROT: MURDER ON THE ORIENT EXPRESS (http://www.amazon.com/review/R3NPJE6U1T0O9W/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B003L80FLC - here's the link to my review for that disc) and was surprised by the different characterization of "Poirot" by Suchet, which was really dark and short tempered. I can't remember which "Series" I had finished I think 4 or 5, while waiting for the Blu-Ray release of the subsequent ones and maybe that's why I was taken aback. I've never watched the shows while they were on the air, so I had to wait for home viewing and would watch back-to-back. When I bought the stand alone "Orient Express" Poirot was very different from what I was used to. According to IMDb the show started in 1989 and "Murder On The Orient Express" aired in 2010, so the show has been on for quite some time with obvious breaks/gaps in between, and during that time the show morphed from a sequential type series to more feature length films.Interestingly enough as I was able to go forward and watch the episodes in broadcast order, I was not as off-put by the change in character once I got to MOTOE. Perhaps as the show went on subtle changes in characterization was happening and so it wasn't so stark once you get to that episode, but when you watch from the earlier shows and jump to this one it's very different.Anyway, this includes the special of Suchet on the real Orient Express.Definitely pick this up if you don't already have the "movie collection" set. If you haven't started with any of the "Poirot" series, you don't need to have seen any of the previous ones to enjoy each of these episodes since they work as stand-alone shows. Also, I don't know if they follow the Christie stories to the letter so I can't comment on that but I enjoyed watching the entire series.***  SPECIAL FEATURES  *** "David Suchet on the Orient Express" (2009) - 47-minutes:01-secondFollow the actor as he goes on board the real Orient Express, going from the UK to Venice to Prague. You get to see the compartments, the dining car/bar, the porters, and there's wonderful historic footage included as well, and Suchet interviews the train's experts, and real passengers riding on board the iconic train. Suchet even gets to drive the Orient Express on one stretch of track. And you also get to see some beautiful scenes of Venice as David gets to spend some sightseeing time on a quick stop before heading off to Prague.* Photo Gallery*

This FEBREZE AIR EFFECTS CLEAN SPLASH spray smells like dried urine to me. I don't know if I got a bad can,  I bought this elsewhere because it says it reduces allergens, but the smell is really odd. It's awful!I don't know if actually reduces allergens but with a smell like this, who cares? It smells like dried urine and feet. And that scent lingers. I like other Febreze sprays so I don't know what's going on with this one, but I had to throw it out.

I enjoyed watching MIDNIGHT LACE starring Doris Day and Rex Harrison.The movie is a suspenseful thriller where Day plays this stereotypical "damsel in distress" -- I guess this was the accepted norm for female characters in 1960 who weren't the bad girl femme-fatales in Noir films -- named Kit Preston, a vanilla white newlywed trophy wife who has recently moved to London to be with her husband Anthony Preston (Harrison). Someone starts threatening to kill poor Kit, once in a fog-filled park and then endlessly on the telephone, with this high-pitched, sing-song voice and the poor woman is terrorized to the point of madness! But she looks great clutching her head with both hands with the look of absolute HORROR on her face, crying, as the phone rings incessantly, while things go bump in the dark, and poor Kit is frozen with fear.In the storyline viewers only hear the threatening voice twice, in the beginning and the end, and the other characters never hear it until the end, so one is never quite sure if Mrs. Preston is actually receiving threatening calls from the same person, what the voice is actually saying, or if she's just becoming unhinged and imagining all of it or worse making it all up because she feels neglected. This plot device is what keep viewers interested in the movie until the end, and where Day really shines in this characterization as the hysterical wife, because one can see all of the above outcomes being possibilities. At times you want someone to kill her, at others you think she's making it all up, still others one thinks that she's losing her mind, and that keeps viewers watching until the truth is revealed.Anyway, listening to the fabulous intro by TCM's host Robert Osborne and we learn that this movie was so emotionally taxing that Doris Day had a nervous break-down during the filming and vowed to never do another like it.The picture quality is pretty good, but I do notice a haze around the shots with Day and Myrna Loy (who plays her Aunt Bea), which was probably in the actual source film (I heard that gauze and Vaseline was used as a camera filter on movies from this era as a way to make actresses more ethereal and dreamlike, not to mention ageless/no wrinkles, on the big screen) so that probably couldn't be helped.I took off one-star because of the above and some viewers might actually have trouble with suspension of disbelief especially with certain scenes in the movie -- of course context is everything -- like when the caller calls, why doesn't Kit hangup immediately instead of listening, crying and shivering and asking "why?" as she continues to listen to him? Of course we wouldn't have a movie in that case, but some viewers will find it hard to believe and quite comical at times. Also, NO SPOILER, but at end, it seems very odd as though some scene was cut-out, but the very end is nonsensical.Roddy Mcdowall, Hermione Baddeley, and handsome John Gavin co-star in the movie as well. I think Gavin's character is supposed to be British but his accent isn't really there especially when he's in scenes with Baddeley, but with a face like his who's listening?There's some good extras on this DVD as well:***  SPECIAL FEATURES  **** Intro by Robert Osbourne* "High Style Elegance of Midnight Lace" - Fashion Featurette - 06:32-minutesMore like a fashion show this special has the costume designer, Irene, describing the wonderful clothes that Day wears in the film, as test shots are showed with Day modeling the outfits. This promo was actually played in theaters and the clothes were displayed in department stores according to the text at the beginning of this featurette as a way of drumming up publicity for the movie.* StillsNumerous stills from movie posters to lobby cards, fashion sketches to publicity stills, and you can select by category.* TCM Db ArticleThis is a text article written about the movie for TCM's site that provides additional information on filming and what the various stars had to say about the picture.* Radio Interview - 03:59-minutesExcerpt from a radio interview with Day about the movie.* Doris Day Animal Promo - 01:02-minutesCommercial featuring Day asking viewers to consider pet adoption.* TrailerAs long as you aren't expecting too much from this movie, I think most people will enjoy MIDNIGHT LACE in a cult-like way. I'm not sure why she looks like Dinah Shore on the cover, but Doris Day is pretty good in the movie and it's a shame she didn't do more thrillers! After all, who else but the whitest woman in America could portray such utter helplessness and  madness convincingly?

I like the CLAIROL HERBAL ESSENCES WILD NATURAL HAIR CONDITIONER.It has a nice grapefruit scent and leaves my hair nice and soft.  I've got very thick and dry hair so I usually have to apply some leave-in conditioner, otherwise my hair will end up looking like a Q-Tip, so this was no different. However, even without that extra step my hair was nice and soft with just rinsing with this conditioner.There's other stuff in the ingredients like a lot of alcohol derivatives (I assume to stabilize the other ingredients) so be aware of that fact. Also, I haven't notice the conditioner striping out my hair color or causing any scalp irritation so that's also a plus.

It's about time that Expos's debut album be given the deluxe treatment. I loved EXPOSURE and so I was overjoyed when I found out that Cherry Pop in the UK was releasing this 2-CD expanded version of it. I'm amazed that it's usually Japan or the UK that does these lovingly expanded re-issues of older soul/disco/r&b music from the USA (look at Universal Japan's reissue of the original Donna Summer "Live & More" album or Big Break Records UK expanded edition of The Pointer Sisters "Break Out" album for example), while the US record companies just keep putting out the same stuff just repackaged (I'm still waiting for a Janet "Miss" Jackson's CONTROL album to get an expanded makeover).I only know the original album (I actually had it on cassette) and the old CD, so I don't know if many of these remixes have been released before, as another customer stated, and I think I have two remixes that are on a "Free-Style" compilation, but I'm not sure if they're the same as on this edition, so mostly all of these extra tracks are new to me.On track #6 "Point Of No Return" from the original album, the track listed here on CD 1 is the extended version and runs 6:08-minutes. I no longer have that old cassette tape, but on the previous CD version of EXPOSURE this track is only 3:29-minutes, so that's one difference that I found, but that might be because the CD version had an edited version of the song -- I can't remember if the track was longer on the original.The remastering sounds fantastic and I think Cherry Pop did a great job.EXPOSURE DELUXE EDITION comes with a booklet featuring the lyrics to all songs, track annotations by the song-writer Lewis Martine who talks about the inspiration for each song and how it came about, liner notes by Bill Pitzonka written on Aug 2014 that includes interviews with Jeanette Jurado, Gioia Bruno, and Ann Curless discussing how the group was formed etc., discography, some publicity pictures from back then, and single/album sleeve pictures.According to the liner notes there was a different group of singers who initially recorded "Point Of No Return" and "Exposed To Love" and featured lead vocals by Al Lorenzo, who sounds exactly like Jeanette Jurado, and in the credits on lead vocals in the booklet it lists Lorenzo as the singer of both songs that feature the 1985 mixes. Jurado --once the group was formed with the lineup of Bruno, Jurado and Curless -- went back to the studio and recorded her own vocals on the two songs and Lewis Martine says that if you owned any of the first 125,000 pressing of the EXPOSURE album you have Lorenzo's vocals, and any after are Jurado. I didn't know that so the liner notes were very informative.However it should've been mentioned that Gioia Bruno was diagnosed with throat cancer (I think that's what it was), which caused her to drop out of the group and be replaced by Kelley Moneymaker, while she recovered, and eventually she rejoined the group. I learned all this when I saw them perform at an LGBT Pride Festival back in either late 90s or early 2000s and Bruno was back in the group, and all were in fine voice.Another interesting tidbit is the group's performance at the famed Apollo Theater in New York, which you can find on Youtube, when they were touring. They brought the house down and I remember watching this on TV.Anyhow, if you were a kid in the 80s and went out clubbing you'd know this album and so I definitely recommend picking it up. If you like "High Energy/Free Style" music from the 80s then EXPOSURE is what you need.Normally, I don't really care for remix versions of songs, but in this case all of the additional tracks are based on the strong hits from the album and the remixes are extended mixes that doesn't change the song around too much.

I finally watched IT HAPPENED ONE NIGHT after seeing the iconic scene a number of times that featured Claudette Colbert hitch-hiking with Clark Gable and using her leg to get a car to stop. Now I see why this is considered a classic and why it swept the Oscars.If you haven't seen the film, Colbert plays a spoiled heiress who is on the run --rebelling from her father-- and she crosses path with Gable portraying a reporter; they meet on a night bus to NYC and one thing leads to another and suddenly they fall for one another.The beauty in this story is the fun that audiences get to share in as the characters go along the journey from being indifferent and almost hostile toward one another to falling in love and that's what makes it a classic. Supposedly IT HAPPENED ONE NIGHT was the film that started the genre of the "romantic/screwball comedy" and the chemistry between Colbert and Gable is spot on.This new CRITERION BLURAY edition of IT HAPPENED ONE NIGHT also comes with a bunch of extras that should keep fans happy and has been digitally restored. I was reading another review that said the Blu-ray's picture quality was on par with the DVD release and since I haven't seen that version I can't comment on it, but the image on BR looks good to me considering that this movie is from 1934.The blacks are black, the image is sharp and clear, and there aren't any visible dust/hair/scratches that I can see.*****  EXTRAS  *****"Frank Capra, Jr. Remembers" -- featurette (11:16-min/ 1999)Son of director Frank Capra discuses how the movie came about (it was based on a short story called "Night Bus") and was filmed in four weeks."Screwball Comedy?" -- featurette (38:36-min/ 2014)Film critics Molly Haskell and Phillip Lopate talk about the film and how it came to signify the genre of the "screwball comedy" and they also discuss Capra's filming techniques."Fulta Fisher's Boarding House" -- silent short film (12:03-min/ 1921)Capra's first movie that was based on a story/ballad by Rudyard Kipling."Frank Capra's American Dream" -- documentary (01:36:02-min/ 1997)Hosted and narrated by director Ron Howard this full length documentary shows Capra from his humble beginnings to becoming a  powerful director/story teller. And it shows the ugly side of America's past as Capra was investigated by the House Un-American Activities Committee during the McCarthy witch hunts. It also talks about Frank's last movie he directed (which was a remake of his own "Lady For a Day" and that was "Pocketful Of Miracles") and it's ironic for me because this remake starring Bette Davis was the movie that introduced me to Frank Capra. He became disillusioned with Hollywood and making films because the studios no longer trusted the director and all movies were now being star driven -- in this case it was Glenn Ford who was calling the shots, I don't know why since I never saw Ford as that big of a star or money maker -- and the "star" was basically telling the director how to make the movie. Another interesting note is that "It's A Wonderful Life" was not a commercial success when it was released, only to be rediscovered years after, which  would then become the great Christmas classic we all know now."AFI - American Film Institute - Tribute To Capra" --  special (59:11-min/ 1982)From its 10th anniversary, the AFI salutes Frank Capra and features many of the Hollywood greats that starred in his movies including Bette Davis, Jimmy Stewart, Claudette Colbert, and Peter Falk. There are also many other celebrity cameos as they reminisce and talk about Capra who was present with his wife and children and grand kids. I must say that I was impressed with Colbert's speech: she went up on the stage and gave a touching recollection of working with Frank and Gable and IHON and she did so without cue cards and no teleprompter (most of the other celebs on stage including Davis and Stewart used cards which is why I noticed).TrailerMini Poster with close-up picture of Colbert and Gable along with information about the transfer and liner notes including an essay by Farran Smith Nehme who blogs about classic films.I think the CRITERION BLURAY of IT HAPPENED ONE NIGHT is definitely worth buying for all movie lovers.
