Wonderful and inspirational book that features men from all walks of life.What I really like about Guiseppe Santamaria's book MEN IN THIS TOWN: LONDON, TOKYO, SYDNEY, MILAN AND NEW YORK is that he photographs men of different colors and ages, and with different styles of dress, so you aren't just looking at guys wearing 3-piece suits.There are several spotlight interviews with a few guys in the book, but for the most part this book has limited text descriptions of the outfits.The pages are printed on thick, but matte pages and it comes with its own bookmark.

I'm a HUGE fan of the movie MOMMIE DEAREST and so when I found out that the soundtrack was released on CD, I had to buy it!The CD contains the wonderful musical score that was in the movie and fans of it will have no trouble discerning, by the sound, which scenes each track comes from.Unfortunately there isn't any incidental dialogue from the movie on the CD (like on the Brian De Palma movie soundtrack of "Carrie"), but it's still a fantastic score.I didn't know that Henry Mancini was the compose of the film's soundtrack.This limited edition CD contains a booklet with liner notes by author Jeff Bond that provide insightful information on the behind-the-scenes of the movie and synopsis of each track and what was presented in the accompanying scene for those who haven't seen the film. The booklet also contains color pictures from the movie.

Although I like the graphics and the shape of the I LOVE LUCY HEART SHAPED CALENDAR, it's only half the size of my previous "I Love Lucy 2014" wall calendar by Mead.Because of its unique shape this calendar is folded in half for display purposes meaning that the date part is actually contained in the rectangular-shaped bottom, while scenes from the show are in the heart shaped part (the Mead calendar had the picture on the top half and the dates on the bottom half so it was larger and easy to see). That makes seeing the date or any written in schedules hard to see unless close-up.Even though I schedule appointments and dates into my phone calendar, I still write them in on the wall calendar as a reminder because I hang the calendar next to my bed and can see the month's schedule.I should've paid more attention to this detail. It's OK but the small date section defeats the purpose of having a wall calendar.

My picky Shiba loves the MILO'S KITCHEN STEAK GRILLERS DOG TREATS!She's about 23lbs and so I break up one or two snacks into thirds and give them to her for a treat. She gobbles them up and keeps sniffing the spot where I put them down, so she really does enjoy them.I like that the first ingredient is beef and that these are made in the USA. The treats smell like beef jerky.They must be easy to digest because she doesn't have any problems like gas or diarrhea or other issues, not that she has a sensitive tummy but sometimes certain foods or snacks will make her gassy or have runny stools.Anyway, I recommend them to anyone with furry kids!

I've been using the L'OCITANE SHEA BUTTER BODY LOTION on my hands and feet just before bedtime for the past month and I am impressed with how it softens my skin, making it appear healthy and smooth.The cuticles around my fingers are excessively dry and cracked, I usually get hang-nails easily and I have to clip them with cuticle cutters, and I get the same on a couple of my toes (not so much the cuticles but the front of the toes) and using the L'OCCITANE every night and those issues have been minimized greatly.I still have some dry spots on my right thumb and some on my middle finger of the right hand, but otherwise my hands look and feel healthy. Likewise, my feet are in much better shape and I can go much longer in-between using the Ped-Egg on the dry calluses than before I was using the lotion.I knocked off one-star because the lotion is somewhat greasy after you put it on, but it does dry pretty fast, and there is a floral type scent that reminds me of the "Rose Milk" lotion or Nivea type lotions, so it lingers for a while, but it isn't overpowering.Because it is a fairly heavy-type lotion, I don't want to use it on my body because I tend to break out. Otherwise the L'OCCITANE SHEA BUTTER BODY LOTION is pretty good and worth it.

This is the first time that I have watched DOUBLE INDEMNITY 70TH ANNIVERSARY EDITION and it looks great on Blu-Ray. The transfer is fantastic with sharp image resolution and dark blacks, which is really important since light and shadow play such a HUGE role in the way the film was made and also to punctuate the storyline.Allegedly this movie is what started the whole "film noir" genre and rightfully so.The movie revolves around a woman (Stanwyck) who plans to get out of an unhappy marriage by luring a smooth talking insurance salesman (MacMurray) -- by seducing him -- and then making him do the unthinkable. However, the insurance salesman's co-worker, a claims manager (Robinson) starts putting pieces of the puzzle together and that's where the story starts getting even more suspenseful!After watching DOUBLE INDEMNITY,  I see why many refer to it as THE classic film noir movie.Anyway, the DOUBLE INDEMNITY 70TH ANNIVERSARY EDITION comes with digital download (works on Ultra Violet & iTunes I don't see an expiration date listed), 5 reproductions of lobby type cards which are the size of a standard DVD/BR clamshell case, commentary, featurette, and TV movie.*** EXTRAS **** Introduction -- Turner Classic Movie (TCM)  host and film historian Robert Osborne provides an intro to the movie and gives some insight.* Featurette -- (2006 - 37:56-min.) -- "Shadows Of Suspense"This featurette has some major Hollywood players including director William Friedkin, Cinematographer Owen Roizman, Author James Ellroy, Film Professor Drew Casper, Time Magazine film critic Richard Schickel and others who talk about "Double Indemnity" and how the movie came about. It also discusses the "film noir" genre, casting the movie, cinematography, and locations etc., and was very entertaining, as well as informative.* Trailer -- (02:16-min)Standard definition trailer including dust and scratches.The following I have not watched or listened to yet:* Feature CommentaryCommentary by film historian Richard Schickel, Lem Dobbs, and Nick Redman* Double Indemnity (1973) Made for TV movie based on the filmSince I have not seen the previous DVD versions of this film I can't compare, but I would highly recommend this edition of DOUBLE INDEMNITY to all film noir/suspense fans and fans of older/classic films.

The BEST OF HULLABALOO COLLECTION 2 DVD is wonderful to watch and is hosted by a very young George Hamilton and features live performances by The Ronettes, The Hollies, The Impressions, Brenda Lee, Noel Harrison, The Womenfolk, and Wayne Fontana & The Mindbenders.There's some other performance clips which I believe are from another show and they feature The Everly Brothers with Steve Lawrence, and Peter & Gordon with Michael Landon, and Cannibal & The Headhunters.Picture quality is fair and it's shown in black and white and not in color as shown in the inset pictures on the DVD cover art. I think these are from the Kinescope copies of the HULLABULOO shows and are the only original masters that exist, so the picture quality can't be fixed beyond what is presented here. That's why I gave this DVD 4-stars. Even though the picture quality isn't the best it doesn't interfere with viewing pleasure.The show starts with the opening jingle and the "Hullabuloo dancers" and is a hoot to watch. I wasn't alive back then, so I never saw the show as it was presented, so I can't comment on whether or not the format is the same. From what I've seen, the first 90% of this DVD is from one show.Included is a special featurette that interviews one of the dancers!  SPECIAL FEATURE* Donna McKechnie Interview -- 19:43 min -- 2013Present day interview with Hullabaloo dancer Donna McKechnie who talks about the show, filming live in front of an audience, the 60s, the hosts of "Hullabaloo" like Sammy Davis, Jr., and acts like Petula Clark, the Supremes and others. She also talks about famed and legendary Broadway choreographer Michael Bennett who was also a dancer on the show (who knew?) and what it was like working with him.I hope that these interviews are featured on the other editions of the HULLABALOO DVDS because it brings insight into the show and the people on it. It would be interesting to know who the other dancers were and where did they end up, not to mention what was their experience like.If you enjoy 60s music or are a history buff or just a fan of classic television shows, I would definitely recommend this DVD.

I chose the DOVE ADVANCED CARE ANTIPERSPIRANT & DEODORANT because I wanted something unscented and it seems that most deodorant sticks on the market have perfume or other strange stuff in it -- especially those marketed toward men.The DOVE is unscented and goes on smooth and keeps wetness and odor away, but I don't really perspire too much under my arms. Being unscented it won't clash with or change the fragrance of your cologne or perfume so you don't have to pick one over the other. Also, I don't have really strong body odor, like some guys, so I don't know if this will work on men or women with that type of skin chemistry.I deduct one-star because you have to massage the deodorant in after you apply it because it leaves a white film that can transfer to dark color clothes.Otherwise it's pretty good.

I can't really comment on whether or not the AIRBORNE EVERYDAY really does combat colds or helps strengthen the immune system, but I'm sure it can't hurt it.I've been taking it daily for 25 days, since it is also a multi-vitamin, and I haven't caught a cold yet but that's not saying much.Anyway, the pills are chewable and the berry flavor reminds me of the candy Sweet Tarts. It's strange that they only give 50-pills per bottle because the recommended daily dose is 2 chewables per day, which leaves you short for the month.I'll probably stock up on more of these once Fall comes around and cold season starts.

The RUTA-SLEEP AID PILLS works but you must take it about 2-hours before you want to go to sleep. I have a sleep disorder called "delayed sleep phase syndrome," which is a circadian rhythm issue usually affecting blind people, and that makes falling asleep at night difficult for me. Some call it being a night owl, but since I have to be up in the daytime (that's when I'm usually sleepy) to go to work, I need a sleep aid at night.Supposedly, RUTA-SLEEP uses the extra time to clear your body of any caffeine and then the melatonin takes effect. I took it according to the directions and after about an hour and half I started to feel very drowsy. I went to sleep pretty fast after that and slept pretty much through the night, getting up only to use the bathroom.The reason I only give it 4 instead of 5 stars is because  a 3mg Melatonin tablet, taken sublingual (under the tongue), works a lot faster. Within 30-minutes of taking a 3mg Melatonin tablet, I'll be very relaxed and drowsy and able to drift off to sleep, so I usually do that instead.Otherwise the RUTA-SLEEP  AID works but I like the Melatonin pill better.

These MILK BONE BRUSHING CHEWS are great to give to your dog to chew on. They aren't super hard like Nyla-Bones, but they aren't soft/hard like Greenies.I've given one chew every 2-3 days to my 3-year old Shiba and she loves them. She doesn't like most "dental chews" like Terra-Bones or the breakable Nyla-Bones (the ones that look like hardened biscuits), so I was surprised that she enjoys these.I brush her teeth once a week, sometimes I skip a week, but she gets a Greenie every night before bed. Her teeth are pretty clean and it seems that the MILK BONES BRUSHING CHEWS help remove some food stains from her teeth.They come in a resealable bag and the mini-size is just right for her small mouth. I'll be buying more of these.

I love the Barbra Streisand/George Segal movie, "The Owl & The Pussycat," and have always enjoyed hearing the soundtrack music while watching the movie (that was done by the group Blood, Sweat & Tears), but for years it has been out of print.Finally, Wounded Bird Records has reissued it in this CD RARE, RARER & RAREST. It also includes other hit songs by Blood, Sweat & Tears including "Spinning Wheel," their hit cover version of Brenda Holloway's "You've Made Me So Very Happy,"  and Laura Nyro's "And When I Die," so there's much more on this CD than just the soundtrack.I never had the original LP of The Owl & The Pussycat, but going by other reviewers there was incidental dialogue from the movie on the record. This CD has no dialogue just the music and it's FANTASTIC!The only way to actually make this better would be to add the original dialogue/music background tracks as bonus tracks, but it's fine the way it is. I also wished there had been liner notes included in this release because I'm curious as to why dialogue was added to the original soundtrack album in the first place (did the record producers feel that they had to have Barbra on the record for it to sell?) and I'd like to know why the album was out-of-print for so long?On a side note, this was Streisand's first non-singing role in a movie.

The FRESH GUARD SOAK is AMAZING! Before trying it, I was cleaning my night guard with the big orthodontic brush that my dentist gave me (when I got the guard for teeth grinding) and leaving it at that, which I thought was fine and didn't realize how dirty it was getting.So when this stuff came up on Amazon Vine, I decided to give it a try. I didn't even know that there was such a thing! I thought all the cleaners out there were for dentures only.Anyway, after the first use my night guard was dramatically cleaner -- I could see the difference -- and with subsequent cleanings it looks almost brand new. It's clear and I can practically see through it whereas before there was a dingy opaqueness on the guard. It even cleaned the crud out of the bottom of my tooth brush cup that I use to rinse after brushing!I'm cleaning once a week and that's seems to be just the right amount of time to keep my night guard in clean condition.* Easy To Use* Minty Scent* Cleaning Water Turns Blue (when the Fresh Guard pellets are added) Then Turns Clear When Finished* Removes Crud & Stains On My Night Guard & CupI'll be buying this product from now on.

I give half of the WAGGIN' TRAIN SMOKY JERKY TREATS to my Shiba and she loves them.They have a scent of Teriyaki sauce or something along those lines, and she likes to chew them up.She hasn't gotten sick, thrown up or died, nor has she had bad gas or diarrhea, so I guess I got the lucky bag. Evidently, according to some reviewers, their dogs have died are gotten serious health issues from these treats, so I thought I'd put this in as a so you can be informed.Anyway, the treats are made from chicken and are advised to be given to adult dogs over 11lbs. I only give her these once in a while and give her lamb lungs and bully sticks for other times.

This this is TERRIBLE. It worked in the beginning, but I still had to hold onto the WRAPTASTIC while pulling the plastic wrap out to unroll it. I had used the remaining roll of GLAD CLING WRAP in it until I used it up and then I switched to the included plastic wrap, which was AWFUL!On that roll, it would NOT unroll at all with the lever in it, which keeps the plastic wrap from sticking to itself, and so I took it out. Then half of it decides to stick to itself and when I tried to unroll it the plastic wrap just tears down the middle. This happened over and over again and finally the torn part just kept on unraveling, so I couldn't get it back evenly, and I decided to switch to the GLAD CLING WRAP.And low and behold the large roll doesn't fit. RIDICULOUS. Save your money and find something else. This thing is actually worse than the box the GLAD WRAP comes in.UPDATE 02/2015Both dispensers have been trashed. This happened awhile back and I forgot to update this review. Anyway, there are two prongs inside the WRAPTASTIC and one-side broke which made it difficult to use, and then the other side broke off. This made the device unable to open back, once you push down on it. And it happened to both dispensers. In my photo you see the little white stick at the top of the photo? That's the two prongs I'm talking about.

Although it was a great idea, the GILLETTE BODY RAZOR FOR MEN needs some improving.Yes, it was much easier to shave the boys because of the rounded corners of the razor head, but for some reason it seemed to get clogged faster than my regular razor. At first I thought it was because the head was smaller on the body razor, but that's only an optical illusion; it appears smaller when looking at both the body razor and my Mach 3, but on closer inspection the razor is exactly the same size (see pics above).If GILLETTE made the razor's head longer, while keeping the rounded edges, I'm sure it wouldn't get clogged so fast.Another issue is the cheap feel of it! It really feels like a disposable razor rather than one you can buy refill heads for. I don't know if this was due to trying to keep the razor light-weight, but it feels really delicate.Likewise, the release button for the cartridge feels very flimsy, not at all like the Fusion or Mach 3, and so I'm not sure how long the handle would last.And it doesn't come with a holding case or cover for the head, just the cheap plastic it came in (see photo), so none of this screams a razor that you'd want to keep and refill. I did double check to make sure this was NOT a disposable razor and it isn't; there are razor cartridges that you can purchase.Aside from these issues, the GILLETTE BODY RAZOR does the job and makes it a lot easier to shave downstairs. When Gillette makes those fixes above this razor will be a 5-star game changer -- at least for the body. The razor itself is reasonably priced, but until those fixes are in, I'm not sure if the upgrade is worth it? The cartridges still cost double the price of the razor.

I find the KING OSCAR SARDINE WITH JALAPENO delicious! The jalapenos give it a nice kick and the spiciness cuts down on the unctuous taste of the olive oil, so it's a good combination. Normally I buy my sardines packed in water because I'm not too fond of that oily olive oil taste, but with the added cut jalapenos I like it.Even though the jalapenos are cut and layered on top of the sardines, the fish have picked up some of the heat, so picking the peppers off won't help if you're giving them to someone who doesn't want any hotness on their tongue or is sensitive to spicy foods.To me the hot scale is medium-hot, whereas something like Sriracha Hot Sauce I consider hot, so keep that in mind. I like spicy foods so what might be medium-hot to me maybe too hot for those who only want mild heat.Anyway, these sardines are great for snacking on. Here's a tip: add some soy sauce to it to further reduce the oiliness of the olive oil.

Great tasting and you can smell the chicken! My furry child loves the PURINA WAGGIN' TRAIN CHICKEN JERKY TREATS that she gobbles them up even though she has a small mouth and normally doesn't like to eat large things (I usually have to break snacks into smaller pieces, but in this case she makes an exception).The WAGGIN' TRAIN CHICKEN JERKY TREATS are made with just chicken breast and glycerin, so no by-products or any other fillers and that's great for those who are trying to eliminate that stuff from their pet's food and treats.I give two jerky sticks for her weight and she loves them! Might I also add that my dog is very PICKY about what she eats -- snacks included -- so if she goes wild for these snacks, I'm sure your pooch will, too.

I bought the TOPEAK CAGE MOUNT  to use with the TOPEAK MODULA CAGE EX WATER BOTTLE HOLDER to hold my Polar Water Bottle on my bike.When I was installing it, I thought that the mount wasn't going to hold securely to the bike's frame because when I adjusted the metal strip (you can't see the strip until you take it apart) to the hole that was closest to the frame it wasn't shut all the way and the next hole was too small. But as I tightened the nut inside the body of the mount, the ring did tighten nicely.There's a piece of rubber/plastic that keeps the metal strip from coming into contact with the bike's frame and it keeps it held flush and securely.I took one star off because you have to buy these things (water cage AND the mount) separately! You can't mount the water cage without it so I don't know why Topeak sells them this way.

I never knew that Ren Woods had released a couple of albums since they weren't commercial hits. However I remember her from her acting work in the movies "Car Wash" --even though she had such a small role-- and in her dynamic vocal performance in Milos Forman's screen adaptation of the rock musical "Hair." Again Woods only had a tiny role, she sang the opening song "Aquarius" in the movie and that was it, but it left an indelible impression on me. She also had small acting roles on television.Anyway, when I came across this re-release I was excited and turned to YouTube to hear some samples (I don't know why you can no longer sample songs on Amazon for certain CDs) and I was again blown away by that wonderful voice.This album came out in 1979, which was at the beginning of the backlash against disco music that eventually spun out of control and ended in Comiskey Park's "Disco Demolition Night," so I can see why this album gained no traction or attention and it wasn't because of a lack of talent or shoddy slap-together material.It has an excellent disco sound, but not the overly lush orchestrations like the Andrea True Connection (More, More, More) or repetitive chants like Silver Convention (Fly, Robin, Fly). The sound on this album is more along the lines of Donna Summer with full lyrics and choruses and actual singing.The album was produced by Earth, Wind & Fire's guitarist, Al McKay, and it does have that sort of flavor, too. Most of the tracks are upbeat and danceable grooves, but there are a couple of ballads on here including the heart-aching "I Need Someone To Touch Me,"  and "I'm In Love With You" that sounds a lot like Deniece Williams's "I Found Love" and "Cause You Love Me."Incidentally, Ren Woods sounds like a cross between Deniece Williams with shades of Stephanie Mills, but retains her own unique song styling and she can sing! Whether on ballads or the uptempo disco numbers, Woods handles both with ease. And the producers of the album allow that voice to shine, which is why I say that this album had top notch production.I can't express how many times I've been disappointed by finding re-released material that contained one strong single while the rest of the album tracks were filler! I found none of that on Ren Woods OUT OF THE WOODS EXPANDED EDITION CD. I enjoyed the CD from start to finish, including the bonus tracks.The CD contains liner notes written by music journalist Alex Henderson (Oct '13), which provides information on Woods, this album, etc. and why she hasn't been a more prolific recording artist.According to the liner notes, Woods is back in the recording studio and doing a cover version of the Cherrelle and Alexander O'Neal's duet hit "Saturday Love."It's too bad that bad timing is to blame for this album tanking commercially because had it been a hit, there would've been more output from this wonderful singer.

The PETSAFE INDIGO FRESH FLOSS BONES MEDIUM might've been too big for my 3-year old Shiba. She's about 20lbs and the medium is recommended for dogs between 25-60lbs, which I didn't know when I chose them for my Vine selection.Anyway, I've got a picky dog! She did eat the first one, which took her a while, licking it, whimpering, licking it, and then finally gnawing on it like she should, but maybe because of the size she didn't want to be bothered by them again. I'm sure if they tasted more like meat she would've made the effort, but I guess the payoff wasn't worth it.I tried to break one of the FLOSS BONES in half so she could chew it easily, but they're really hard and rubbery, so it wasn't possible. They also give off a sour type of scent, which might be the blueberry juice in them, I'm not sure, but my dog won't eat them anymore.I think this has to do with the size rather than the taste, but like I said I've got a picky dog when it comes to dental cleaning treats. She loves Greenies and Bully Sticks, but won't touch Terrabones, so go figure.Anyway, the medium size is for bigger dogs 25-60lbs and the bag says that these treats are NOT recommended for dogs under 5lbs or under 6-months of age.

I've been using the CLEAR SCALP AND HAIR INTENSE HYDRATION SHAMPOO every other day for several weeks and I like it.The shampoo has a pear-scent (reminds me of the Bath and Body Works "Marshmallow World" body lotion) and it instantly foams and softens the hair! I've got coarse and dry hair and with the CLEAR SCALP SHAMPOO, I can use it and I don't have to do a separate conditioning step. But I do use a scalp oil as a leave-in treatment, even still the shampoo left my hair nice and soft in the shower.* Pear Scented* Velvety Foam* Rinses Clean* Hair Feels SoftI haven't tried the conditioner but I'm sure it works great if used in combination with each other.

After reading the product description, I was hoping to use the TP-LINK TL-WR710N MINI ROUTER as a Wi-Fi booster in "repeater mode" because the reception in my home-office is somewhat weak.I'm not an IT expert but I have been able to configure another portable mini-router before, which I use when I go on vacation, so I figured that I could do the same with this one but I couldn't get it to work in that mode.First of all the Ethernet cable that is supplied is so short that it makes it difficult to set-up the TP-LINK MINI ROUTER for any use other than the default setting of wireless router. For the other selection modes (client-repeater-access point-WISP client) you have to have the mini router connected to your computer and an AC outlet, so that you can change the configuration from the default setting. Also, in the instructions it says that the light on the device is blue, but it was green on mine, and there's no legend for other colors; it's either a solid light or a blinking one, so that was a little confusing.BTW, I did this on my Sony Vaio laptop, Win 7 (OS-Operating System)/64-bit.I followed the instructions for "repeater/client mode" and everything went as outlined: I was able to sign into the TP-LINK setup page, set the router to "repeater" and then have it search for available Wi-Fi networks. It found mine and I selected it, put in the SSID password, and then clicked "reboot," which restarts the router with the new settings.I removed the Ethernet cable and I looked down at my Wi-Fi settings in Windows and saw that the signal strength was indeed boosted and described as 'excellent,' but when I tried to access the internet I got nothing. No connection at all, so I tried to do the entire process again and as soon as I plugged in the Ethernet cable to my lap top, I was able to access the internet, but if I removed it I got nothing -- even though the Wi-Fi signal was full strength.According to the instructions, once you reboot you must sign on to the Wi-Fi using the "instant wireless connection" instructions, which says that you must select the TP-LINK's SSID and sign on that way, but I don't see it in my list of available Wi-Fi networks! So I went through the same set-up process a few more times, thinking maybe I missed a step, but to no avail. The TP-LINK MINI ROUTER  doesn't show up for me to sign on, and if I sign on using my regular SSID, I get nothing! It connects but then I have no internet use whatsoever.Since I don't want to screw everything up on my computer, I'm going to leave it alone for right now until I can ask our IT guy when he comes around again.I give it 3-stars because it did boost signal strength and it did work while tethered to my laptop's Ethernet port, which means it was receiving the Wi-Fi signal from my office network (I checked my computer settings that confirmed that it was receiving the Wi-Fi signal through the MINI-ROUTER, which was then transferring it to my laptop through the Ethernet port giving me an internet connection, and not through my normal Wi-Fi port on my laptop), so it might be a user error (on my part) type of situation and the fix could be really simple, but I don't know what it is.The process should be a lot easier if you're only using the device as a router like in a hotel room since it should be plug and play.If I do find the solution I'll update this review, but in the meantime I better leave well enough alone because I don't want to really screw up my office network.UPDATE 03/05/14I have upgrade my review to 5-stars. Thanks to another Amazonian, C B, who suggested I try using IE in the comments section, I was able to get the device working as a repeater by using Internet Explorer to set it up! I knew it might've been something simple, but I didn't know what! I was using Firefox initially and although it allowed me to set-up the TP LINK I couldn't get a connection unless it was connected to my computer. Now, it's working like it should and boosting my existing router's signal strength to full and I don't have it hardwired.

I'm slowly but surely becoming a BAXTER OF CALIFORNIA convert! I really like the BAXTER OF CALIFORNIA NIGHT CREAM AHA (Alpha-Hydroxy-Acid) because it goes on thick and velvety, but has absolutely NO GREASY feel or look, including the next day!Normally when I use a night time facial cream that moisturizes, my face will end up looking like a grease pit in the morning -- but not with this cream. I have combination, oily with dry areas, skin and I occasionally breakout, but experienced no adverse reaction to this cream; it left my skin feeling nicely hydrated and soft.I don't have deep wrinkles, but I do have some fine lines on my forehead and in-between my eyebrows and after using the BAXTER OF CALIFORNIA NIGHT CREAM for nearly a month the lines have softened a bit. I'm sure with continued use they'll be almost non-existent.This cream, like all other BAXTER OF CALIFORNIA products, is supposed to be specifically formulated for men's skin, which tends to be thicker and oilier than women's, according to research, and so perhaps that's why it works better than the average night cream that you find in the drugstores.Although it's described as an Alpha-Hydroxy Acid cream it won't leave you red with burned and peeling skin like a prescription one (i.e. Retin-A), so don't worry about that unless you have the most sensitive of skin. You should also wear a sunscreen in the daytime after you start using this cream because AHA creams leave the skin ultra-sensitive to sunlight and UV rays, and so your skin is more susceptible to getting burned (even when you'd normally tan).I highly recommend this cream to guys of all ages! Although the price might turn some men off you're really getting a lot for your money because you only need to apply a little bit and it is a fairly large sized tube. Most men should definitely add products to their hygiene routine, other than soap and shaving cream, so that they can look their best no matter what age they are and BAXTER OF CALIFORNIA can help with that.PLUSES* Safety-Sealed* Thick, Velvety Texture* Slight Scent of Soap(?)* Non-Greasy* Large "Tooth-Paste" SizeMINUSES* None

I was really surprised at how well the BAXTER OF CALIFORNIA OIL FREE MOISTURIZER performed on my skin. I have combination oily and sometimes dry skin, but mostly oily in the "T-Zone" area, which is the forehead, nose and chin.This moisturizer immediately absorbed into my face and my skin felt hydrated. It left no oily shine or texture and it doesn't feel oily or leave your face with a greasy after feel. And my face was pretty much shine-free for the rest of the day at work.BAXTER OF CALIFORNIA OIL FREE MOISTURIZER has no scent and is formulated for men's skin. I don't know if I really believe that there's that much of a difference between guys' and gals' skin (research says that there is and men tend to have thicker, oilier skin than their female counterparts) but this moisturizer works much better than other "oil-free" ones that I've tried.I'm also experiencing better performance from other BAXTER OF CALIFORNIA products like the body lotion, so maybe there is some difference in how a product is formulated and whether it's designed for male or females.The only reason I don't give a full five stars is because the moisturizer doesn't contain a sunscreen so you'll have to do an extra step if you're going to be out in the sun at all. Also, for those with really dry skin, or patches of dryness caused by chemical peels or acne medication, this moisturizer won't be able to do the job on those areas.I break out occasionally and use acne products that contain Benzoyl Peroxide, which my skin can handle most of the time, but every now and then the medicine will cause me to get extremely dry patches of skin and the BAXTER OF CALIF OIL FREE didn't help in those areas.Other than those two issues this is a great product line for men!PLUSES* Safety Sealed* Non-Scented* Large "Toothpaste" Sized Tube* Hydrating Matte FinishMINUSES* No Sunscreen* Won't Help Extremely Dry Areas

I like the BAXTER OF CALIFORNIA'S HERBAL MINT TONER for men. The solution is a great astringent toner that contains no drying alcohol, so it's great for dry or sensitive skin, and it works well with combination and oily skin types, too.It has a refreshing minty-eucalyptus "Sea-Breeze" like scent and it feels great going on my skin. Because it doesn't contain alcohol you don't get that extreme tingle/sting like most other toners, but it still feels refreshing.I highly recommend the toner and although it costs more than a drugstore brand, you only need to use a little of it. Another plus is that it's formulated for men's skin, which is supposed to be thicker and oilier than women's skin, so theoretically the products work better than just the store bought type.

I bought THE ART OF MANLINESSS: CLASSIC SKILLS AND MANNERS FOR THE MODERN MAN in the "Art Of Manliness Collection" Cigar Box Set, which also includes the other book "The Art Of Manliness: Manvotionals," but I haven't read that book yet, so I'm just reviewing this one.The book has a lot of useful information that guys can use like how to tie a tie, folding a pocket square, different types of cuffs on pants, and how to iron a shirt; it also includes great information on etiquette and behaving like a gentleman in public and private. It also includes stuff like how to jump start a dead car battery, pitching a tent, clean a fish, make a camp fire and how to administer first aid to a snake bite victim or saving a drowning person. Other nuggets of information include how to be a responsible father and husband and how to be a good friend to other men.I give it only four stars because the book focuses entirely on heterosexual men. With chapters on dating females and taking care of a pregnant wife, etc., THE ART OF MANLINESS: CLASSIC SKILLS AND MANNERS FOR THE MODERN MAN missed the opportunity that could've addressed sexual orientation by letting readers know that being a "real man" has little to do with sexual preference or machismo. Perhaps the authors didn't know how to broach the subject or they didn't want to confuse the issue, but if the goal of this book was to teach young men how to be "gentlemen" then it should have been addressed. As it is any young gay man reading this book will probably feel that they've been left out and therefore can't be a "man," while others will think in the stereotypical ideal of a chest thumping, war mongering "manly man" which is unfortunate because those readers will miss the point of this book.Likewise, although the book contains lots of great advise, some of the suggestions on how to treat women harkens back to the days when females were seen as weak and ineffectual and some women might take offense at that type of behavior.Aside from those issues this book is still a worthy buy and would make great gifts for young men and guys in general who either grew up without a male figure in their lives or who have had fathers who weren't very helpful when it comes to things like this because of lack of knowledge or experience.

There are very few new TV shows out there that have been able to catch my interest, but SHERLOCK is definitely one that I'm hooked on. After watching a first few episodes from SHERLOCK SEASON 1 for free (because of Prime membership) on my Kindle, I knew this was a show that I could get into and so I bought the first season on Blu-Ray.SHERLOCK SEASON TWO continues on with the great formula that they started in the first season with the graphic embellishments and updating the original stories to match a modern context. Chemistry between Holmes (Cumberbatch) and Watson (Freeman)-- and consequently their relationship -- continues to evolve and there's a shocking cliff hanger on the last episode "The Reichenbach Fall," but I won't give it away.Anyway, definitely pick this up if you like well-acted, brilliantly written, and cunningly executed TV shows. Although there are only three episodes in this season, they run about 90-minutes each (about the length of a feature film), so it doesn't feel like you're being short changed.BONUS CONTENT"Sherlock Uncovered" -- Featurette 19:06-minutesShows behind-the-scenes footage and has interviews with cast and producers, including Cumberbatch and Freeman, and the show's co-creators and Executive Producers Steven Moffat and Mark Gatiss (Mycroft Holmes).Even if you're a fan of the classic Sherlock Holmes movies -- which I love -- that starred Basil Rathbone and Nigel Bruce, or even the new ones with Robert Downey, Jr. and Jude Law, I believe that you'll enjoy this incarnation with Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman.I can't wait to get SHERLOCK SEASON THREE, which I already pre-ordered, and I hope that this show will continue on for many more seasons.

Although some might balk at the price of the BANANARAMA CD SET, as of this writing it's about $26.00, you're actually getting a good deal. The release by Edsel/Rhino has 2 CDs with bonus tracks including different mixes and versions of the songs contained on the self-titled second album from Bananarama, including the song "The Wild Life," which was added on the cassette back in the 80s but missing from the first CD version of this album. Plus, you also get a DVD that has all the music videos released for the singles from BANANARAMA and performances on the BBC!But the goodies don't stop there! There's also a booklet that features color and b&w photos of the group and the various album art from different countries, as well as song credit, and the lyrics to all of the songs -- including the bonus ones. This is especially appreciated because most of the really good reissue companies like Big Break Records don't include the lyric sheet with their reissues opting to focus on interviews and other info from the recording sessions instead.There's also liner notes written in August 2013 by the reissue producer, Tom Parker, that provides the background information of  what happened between the group's first release and this one, and the inspiration behind each of the songs. I didn't know that group (Sara Dallin, Keren Woodward and Siobahn Fahey) also contributed to the writing of the songs on BANANARAMA and many of them had strong lyrics dealing with social issues, which was belied by their angelic harmonies.The discs are housed in medium weight cardboard sleeves with a cut-out notch at the top and bottom, allowing part of the disc to be visible, so they can be accessed and put away easily, and the set is looks like a hardcover book. I would use the term "digi-pack," but this is much more sturdier than most digi-packs that feature only a cardboard cover (like a mini album replica). One note though, the inside of the sleeve isn't laminated as much as I think it should be (I don't even really know if that makes a difference) so I don't know if repeated taking the discs in and out would cause scratches. Normally I'll place the discs in a CD case but I'll probably leave them as is in this situation.If you're a fan of the group than I would definitely recommend picking this up because not only is it worth it, but it lets companies that take the time and care to reissue older music with care that there is a market out there and if they make it we will buy it.

At first I thought that the PERFECT FITNESS RIP DECK SYSTEM was only designed to do fly pushups using the Perfect Pushup concept, but it does much more!You can do fly pushups, but you can also do regular Perfect Pushups, Normal Pushups, Forearm Fly Pushups, and you can separate the two sides and use the sliders under your feet to assist in either doing the Chaturanga or Plank Run!Some simple assembly is required, not involving tools, but it's very easy and fairly quick. Here's the rundown:GOOD* Mutli-Use -- allows for multiple exercises on one machine including fly-pushups and regular pushups.* Secure Perfect Push-up Positions -- has two clip locks that will keep the sliders from sliding so you can position yourself in the correct alignment for wide, regular, and close Perfect Pushup positions. This takes the guess work out of how far or close the Perfect Pushup paddles are supposed to be for that particular exercise, which is great for beginners.* Tracks Separate -- the two tracks, left and right, separate so that you can use the sliders vertically, under your feet, to do plank or Chaturanga run (P90-P90X).* Hand Grips -- snap in and out easily. This allows you to use the paddles for either the run or the forearm fly pushup. And you can use just the paddles on the ground like regular pushup bars, so that they don't rotate, which is good if you're not ready for the rotation pushups.BAD* Workout Instructions -- these are not included, at least not in my set, so you have to print them out from the company's website.Once you figure it out and put the RIP DECK SYSTEM together, you'll find that it's really clever and works well. I have the older and newer sets of the PERFECT PUSHUP PADDLES and have been using them off and on in my workouts for a while to get better results and to do pushups more effectively.If you aren't strong enough to pushup, you can also do these on your knees so you don't have to be super strong or physically fit. Also, there's a 300-pound weight limit on the RIPDECK, so keep that in mind.Anyway, I recommend the RIP DECK for home gym use and should make a great addition to your workout arsenal.

The AXE STYLING CONTROL CREAM PEACE provides a light-medium hold and has a matte finish.It comes in a jar with instructions printed under the cap and has a soft and pliable consistency, so you can easily dip your finger in and spread it through dry hair without struggling like with hardened wax hair products.The hold is touchable, tames frizzy and flyaway hairs, but you won't be able to do any extreme styles with it. Likewise, it doesn't do much to texturize the hair and give it separation, but makes the hair bond together. I also discovered that when I run my hands through my hair hours after, I feel a little tackiness on my palms so it seems like it transfers.This product also has that "Axe" scent, but it seems less than the usual strength, which is good because I don't like that cloying smell.Overall it's not bad.

The GENTLEMAN: A TIMELESS GUIDE TO FASHION book by Bernhard Roetzel is beautifully bound and has really thick, high quality pages.There's lots of pictures and good tips on how to iron a shirt, how to tie a tie, how to properly wash your hair, etc., and it also includes interesting bits of information on the history and evolution of men's clothes and why certain things are the way they are. It also takes the reader behind the scenes with step-by-step photos of how good shoes are made, and how they hand craft suits, while supplying information on what is appropriate attire when one is out and about at different functions. It also includes good tips on cleaning and storing suits and shirts etc. and should come in handy to almost every reader out there.Keep in mind that this is based on European/British clothing styles and so many references are to where the suit or jacket originated and how they are worn today (like one must wear certain clothes and hat at a particular horse race) are given in a British context, but Roetzel also discusses US and Italian styles and how they all differ.This isn't a "wear this" type of book, but does offer suggestions on what goes with what. It's more of a general book about sophisticated and elegant dressing for the "gentleman," think old school/Golden Age of Hollywood types like Fred Astaire and William Holden, so don't expect to see popular designers or anything like that in this book.The one thing that I wish it had was that on certain sections like when its discussing the different types of shirt collars, it would have helped greatly to the reader if the parts of the collar being referred to were highlighted, so one can get a clearer understanding of the differences.Otherwise the book is really nice and enjoyed reading it. Also bear in mind that a lot of the stuff presented in here is TOP-OF-THE-LINE items that many of us won't be able to afford, nor would want to, but you get a good idea of what's elegant or timeless.

The 20 FEET FROM STARDOM BLU-RAY is a fascinating look at the unsung heroes -- the unknown backup singers -- who really push good songs into the stratosphere and make them iconic. It's amazing that most people will know these popular songs, will know the chorus and can identify the background singers' sound, but not be able to name them.This documentary has two parallel story tracks, maybe three, aside from just getting the backup singers' individual stories and that helps focus the movie so it isn't just a bunch of talking heads. The documentary takes us into the fascinating story of Darlene Love, who was THE voice of the whole Phil Spector "Wall Of Sound" and how her voice was used in many number one hits, as lead singer, yet credit was given to other singers/groups (The Crystals). Once you hear Love's singing you'll know instantly that voice (if you're a fan of 60s girl group songs) and she represents one dynamic to the story.Contrasting that we are introduced to Judith Hill, who rose to fame being selected to take part in Michael Jackson's comeback tour before his untimely death a few years back, and she's young and starting her career. She's a triple threat being uniquely beautiful, an enormously talented singer, and she writes and plays music. Hill is desperately trying to avoid the pitfall of getting stuck and comfortable in the background and trying to achieve her dreams of solo stardom.And that brings us to the next dynamic in the story and that is Lisa Fischer. She was the incredibly GIFTED (and still is) singer who was Luther Vandross's protege. He took her on tour and gave her wings to fly. She released her solo album in 1990, SO INTENSE, which featured the number one hit single "How Can I Ease The Pain," that she co-wrote, and won the Grammy (tied with the incomparable Patti Labelle -- no less), and was a monster success. But Fischer turned her back on all of that, instead choosing to remain a backup singer for which she was more comfortable, and one in high demand, traveling for the last 25 years with the Rolling Stones, as well as with Sting and others. I always wondered what happen to her and it's good to know she's still thriving. She represents the middle ground between Love and Hill, and she enjoys being able to continue sharing her gift, while at the same time still being able to be anonymous. Of course that's not good news for us fans! I've been waiting for the next Lisa Fischer CD to drop for more than a decade ever since I fell in love with that voice on her first album.Of course there are many other background singers featured in 20 FEET FROM STARDOM, I just chose those three to give you a sense of the story line, but other incredible singers featured are Tata Vega, Merry Clayton, Claudia Lennear, the Waters (Julia, Oren, Maxine - I wonder if these were the same "Waters" that were the Andantes at Motown?), Susaye Green, Edna Wright, David Lasley, Jo Lawry, Gloria Jones, among many others. And there's also a reunion of Darlene Love with her The Blossoms group mates Fanita James and Jean King. Many of these singers have released solo albums but, with the exception of Fischer, none ever reached critical acclaim or success that they deserved, not counting underground/cult followings. Hopefully this film will rectify that.Anyway, there's plenty of music and singing in the film and includes many archival footage of these singers in action. Also, though the film focuses mainly on female background singers there are male background vocalists too like David Lasley, Luther Vandross, Oren Waters and others which are featured throughout.Plus there are plenty of celebrities on hand as well like Sting, Bruce Springsteen, Bette Midler, Mick Jagger, and Stevie Wonder who express their deep gratitude to these unsung heroes and why they've been so important.******  BONUS BLU-RAY FEATURES  *******Deleted Scenes* -- 29:00-minutesHere you can select 'play all' or choose which scene you'd like to see and includes other interviews and shots not in the film.*Buddy System* -- 08:52-minutesFeaturette that explains the "buddy system" and how background singers will refer each other to sessions that they hear about and how the music industry is changing where it's becoming more difficult to find work, since most soloists are doing their own backgrounds or hiring family members to do them.*New York Times Talk* -- 29:24-minutesLive Q&A with Darlene Love, Lisa Fischer, Merry Clayton, and the director Morgan Neville on how the project got off the ground. Singer and prolific songwriter Valerie Simpson is in the audience.These are just some of the many stories out there about the highs and lows of being in the "background," and it's both entertaining and heart-breaking at the same time. You do come to realize that many more factors come into play other than talent and ambition, or even fairness, when one is fortunate enough to realize their dream of being a star and here is the proof.Likewise, not every seminal background singer is featured here like Venetta Fields who was part of the Ikettes (in one iteration) and went on to become a very much in demand background singer for many superstars (Streisand, Ross, Quincy Jones, Joe Cocker, Rolling Stones to name a few) in the 70s.Another interesting story would've been Martha Wash, although she is featured in the bonus section in a short clip. Wash was another great singer who, along with Izora Rhodes-Armstead, started out as background singers for Sylvester and the two would become the Weather Girls. Wash would eventually go solo and then, like Darlene Love before her, sing lead on many huge hits in the 90s, particularly for groups like C.C. Music Factory and Black Box, but get no credit for it. Her story would've showed that stuff like this was still happening even in the current day.I also would've like to learn or hear more from those who started in the background but gained at least some success like Deniece Williams who was one of Stevie Wonder's background singers in a group called "Wonderlove" before she would achieve some acclaim with her solo records, hitting big in the 80s with "Let's Hear For The Boy" from the movie Footloose. And superstar Mariah Carey also got her start singing backup for Brenda K. Starr, so it would've been interesting on they were able to maneuver from the back to the front, but maybe those interviews would've detracted from the main story.Anyway, 20 FEET FROM STARDOM  is definitely a must see.

I have three criticisms of this lube, in this order:1. It does not absorb into the skin completely. It leaves a film when it dries down that is just the slightest bit sticky. The first time I realized this, I was looking at my arm in the morning light and thinking to myself "what's that shiny stuff dried on my arm?" It was this.2. It's a little bitter tasting. Like you just get a hint of soap flavor at the beginning, then it's sweet for a brief second, then nothing.3. It's the least lubricating lube that I've ever used. You know how when you spread water onto plastic it tends to form droplets instead of staying in a single glob? That's what this does. It behaves similarly to water on the skin. If it is spread thin, it won't stay put, separating into veins, leaving parts of skin without lubricant. No bueno.I will say this, it stays wet for the longest time. Some of it was on the bottle when I put it in the cupboard. I came back 3 months later and found the bottle looking like it had water on it.I'll be trying other things. And updating when I find something I like better.UPDATE 9/15/15: I tried Aloe Cadabra in Vanilla and like it much more than this.

I bought 4 packs of these at Target, two in black, two in natural. The color was fine, black was a little sheerer than I expected, natural made my pale legs look naturally tanned. The reason I'm giving them one star is because EVERY SINGLE PAIR got runs after the first use. Embarrassing. The fabric is cheap, and I was actually appalled at the difference when I compared these with my trasparenze and JC Penny tights.Won't ever buy these again, complete waste of $40. I'd rather buy one pair of $20 tights that will last for months than two of these that won't last one use. JC Penny makes amazing tights that last much longer. I think the brand is called Sheer Caress. H&M also makes really nice tights, but I have long legs and I always felt that the crotch of them sits a little too low for me. Trasparenze is also a nice brand, but they also run a little small and can't take a beating like the JC Penny ones.

I was curious about what the putty would feel like. It's oily feeling, but then kind of has an oobleck quality to it. The arrowroot powder behaves kind of like cornstarch, so that's probably why. I've had to remix it a few times, since it was so thin on the top and so thick at the bottom. Only a little of the product is needed. I found that if I put too much, it would roll off in white globs. Surprisingly, it didn't mark my black shirts.The deodorant works. Keeps me smelling good for a solid twelve hours. Doesn't smell like vanilla to me at all, hence the deducted star. Smells like 100% lavender, albeit a very soft, toned down, relaxing kind of lavender. The company packaged this BEAUTIFULLY and included a free eye serum.I probably won't repurchase, but not due to any flaw of the product. I'm just picky about what I put on my body and I can't really get with the paste formula. I hate applying anything that feels the slightest bit sticky to my skin. But again, I'm picky. I really only like roll-ons and sprays.

Buy direct from Pacifica. It will be fresh and you can earn rewards points.This is a nice and clean, mature, true vanilla smell that is not overly sweet. A toned down, cleaner vanilla extract smell. Not a warm vanilla at all, which I like. Can't stop smelling it. It kind of reminds me of the smell of homeopathic arnica that I took as a child. It dries down a little powdery smelling at first, and then it's just subtly sweet. As with all Pacifica perfumes, the scent wears off after only a few hours. For this one, I'd say about 5 hours, which is considerably longer than the rest of the Pacifica perfumes that I have tried. 8 hours in, it's still faintly detectable on the wrist where my Persian Rose perfume would have worn off hours before.

Either you wear tights all the time and are an expert at putting them on correctly or you love tights and have enough time to futz around with them in the morning. If you aren't one of those people, go with the control top instead of this.The bands at the tops of the stockings are thinner than they are in the picture, which can make for a lot of twisting and confusion when they aren't correctly oriented. I've seen sheerer 40 denier, but I actually like that this brand is less sheer. All Trasparenze items I've tried run shorter on the legs than other brands. I'm 6'0 and the largest size (4) is almost too short, hence the deducted star. If you are tall and plus size, these may be too small for you.

As a prior customer of hydracentials, I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review. My rating and review reflect my honest opinion.This lunch tote does keep things nice and cool. The fabric is thick and durable, and I can tell that it will hold up for a long time. I put it to the test against my trusty LL Bean lunch tote, putting a frozen water bottle in both and waiting 10 hours. This one kept the water bottle almost completely solid. LL Bean water bottle had melted down by 1/3. So it definitely is well insulated.It is bigger than most lunchbags I've owned. On the plus side of being big, lots of food can fit inside. I had no trouble fitting a big salad, cake, and a big bag of pretzels. It's too big to fit into a backpack, it's really meant to be carried on its own, so I don't think that this would be good for kids bringing their lunch to school.I'm deducting a star because I find that it's really hard to put over my shoulder: the strap isn't really long enough to be comfortable and the bottom of the tote is also a little too wide in the middle to comfortably rest between the body and arm. I really wish it had a place to put a shoulder strap, so it could rest at the hip. Otherwise, it's perfect.

They are pricey.10 wipes at Target on sale for 89 cents = 8.9 cents or a dime when they aren't on sale for every wipe.288 wipes on the Honest Company website for $18.95 = 6.5 cents per wipe.384 Seventh Generation wipes for $14.99 = 3.9 cents per wipe.(NOT Cruelty free) 72 Pampers wipes at $1.97 = 2.7 cents a wipe.Vegan and natural. No fragrance. They do a great job of removing face makeup but not eye makeup. It takes a lot of rubbing to take off permanent maker. The Yes to Cucumbers wipes do a far better job of quickly taking things off, but they can't be used on sensitive bits. The Honest Wipes don't burn your sensitive bits, but can make them feel a little dry for a few minutes. On non-sensitive bits they are just soothing. I like that they are on the drier side and don't leave your hand dripping wet. Some people might not like that. The fabric is nice and soft. It's a pain in the neck to get the wipes out unless you have the packs with the plastic closure. These are the best natural wipes that I've tried so far. I will update when I find better ones.

All I can say is WOW. I always thought the Physician's Formula would be garbage because of it's cheap looking packaging. Boy am I kicking myself now. These are the most creamy, pigmented, long lasting, smudge proof eyeliners I have ever owned! My Mac and Urban Decay pencils don't hold a candle to these. I can put them on the back of my hand and wipe them a few seconds later, and they stay put! I am super impressed. Wore these for 12-hours and they looked THE SAME as when I put them on. Didn't even use a primer. There's a little sharpener on the bottom of the pencils that you would never know was there unless you read the packaging. Will be buying more colors in this line and repurchasing these.

I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review. If I didn't think it was great, I wouldn't give it 5 stars.I originally purchased the 25oz size for smoothies. I thought the 25oz size was sleek, but the 16oz is even sleeker and much easier to hold. I still use the 25oz bottle for my green smoothies, but I've been using the 16oz bottle for my lunch beverages - most recently, iced tea. It's the perfect size for accompanying a meal.My two small gripes with these bottles is that the straw at the very top is clear (so people can almost see what you are drinking) and the paint begins to wear off the edges at very bottom of the bottle with the normal wear and tear of setting it on surfaces. This could be prevented by adding some kind of protective barrier to the bottom. Non-slip silicone might be a nice addition. But in any case, the koozie that they sent to me is perfect for protecting the bottle, and it also helps keep the contents insulated for even longer.I love how it is opaque and how when liquid is sucked through the straw there is no unpleasant suction, like other straw water bottles. The straw is silent - there are no strange noises when I sip from it, which is nice when you work in a quiet office with lots of other people, like I do. Nothing comes shooting out of the straw when it's turned open after sitting for a long time, either.I'm also totally impressed by how well insulated these bottles are. I put my beverages in at 5-6AM and they stay cool well past 3PM. And no condensation on the outside of the bottle! I was a little nervous the bottle might be too cold and have condensation or leak when I first got it, but now I toss it into my bag without worry.It comes with two straws, which is nice if you are in a rush and don't have time to clean one of them. The company will also send a card with the bottle the tells you how to claim a nice little fabric cover free of charge. I just went to the webpage on the card and put in my Amazon order #. Then I get an email from the owner of the business asking what address I wanted the cover sent to. They sent a gray koozie, an extra straw, and two straw brushes, free of charge. Fabulous customer service. They really stand behind their products.I love how the bottle fits in my hand and how easy it is to hold onto. It just feels so well designed. I will be buying these for birthday gifts for years to come.

This would be a great book for someone that is on the shy side, has never had phone sex, or talked dirty. It's a good, solid collection of sexy phrases and succinct explanations for why they work. As far as being a beginner's book, I think it falls a little short on how to describe what you're doing, going to do, or want done to you. But if you want to learn how to dirty talk or want liberate your partner into expression, this will suit your needs.It's not for the experienced, though. If you've had a fair share of phone sex, you won't find anything new here. It's a quick read, I finished it in about 15 minutes, but that may be because most of the phrases are things that I have heard and already say. Not much kinky stuff. I only found one phrase in the entire book that I had never heard before (#128). I bought this looking for new ideas, so I was a little disappointed. But I would definitely recommend it to newcomers or those that need a refresher.Update 7/20/15 -Wanted to come back here to share an insight I had about talking dirty. There's nothing worse than a predictable lover. All the hottest things that have ever been said, the things that really get people going or make them climax in an instant are... completely unfiltered, unedited. They are speaking exactly what is felt, direct responses to what the partner responds well to. It's instinctual. There's an element of unpredictability in the heat of the moment, the I-can't-believe-he-just-said-that kind of thrill. So in summary, good dirty talk is hot because 1) it shows your partner how in tune you are to them and 2) it's unpredictable. Don't go by what they found hot last time, go by what they moan to this time. Above all else, go by how enthusiastically your partner responds to your words and DON'T FILTER YOURSELF. Say exactly what you think in the tone you thought it in. If your partner likes teddy bears, talk teddy bears. When they respond well to a certain idea, take the idea a step further. If they don't respond as enthusiastically, don't sweat it, just take it back a step and go in a different direction. Let your instincts take over. I think this concept is applicable to good sex in general.

I bought these because I hate metal shower curtain rings. These are quiet and look nice. I do prefer the way metal looks, but I hate the noise it makes, how it rusts, and how you have to bend it to secure and unsecure them. Not to mention they are sharp... no tetanus for me, thanks.I would repurchase this product.

Essential Foundation Brush - Meh. Out of the entire range of RT brushes, I haven't used this one very often because I don't feel like it's big enough to apply foundation to my entire face. I usually reach for my Boots no. 7 or Mary Kay foundation brush. If you like your foundation brushes on the smaller side, you might like this.Multi Task Brush  YES. This brush is my most used out of all my RT brushes. I use it to apply powder foundation, blush, bronzer, highlighter, contour... just a GREAT brush overall, extremely versatile.Domed Shadow Brush  Great for blending eyeshadow. It's on the bigger side of eyeshadow brushes.Panoramic 2-in-1 brush case/stand  Meh, I tossed this because I found it a pain to use. I didn't like that it was always open and that my brushes weren't sealed off from the outside environment when the case was closed. I would prefer if they came in a case like the Sigma brushes, or if they included a cute little bag to keep them in, but that's just me. I don't like having to put each brush back into a specific place, and I feel like this gets dirty and isn't easy to clean.I could do my entire face with these three brushes. I would say that this is my favorite set of brushes out of all the RT brush sets.I've had the full set of these brushes since they first launched in 2012. Since getting them, I've used at least three of them every single day. That's two years of constant use, and they look and preform the same way they did the day I received them. Since getting the full line of these, I have not purchased a single new brush. My old mac brushes lay untouched in the back of my drawer. Not to mention that just one Mac brush costs as much as the whole set of these ones. Did I mention that you can now buy these at Walmart?These brushes are superior to animal hair brushes in every way. They are cruelty free. They are extremely easy to clean-- I timed myself, and I can wash twenty brushes in seven minutes. They do not get stained. I purposely didn't clean red OCC Lip Tar off of my lip brush for a month, and the lip tar came off as easily as any other product. (I use Trader Joe's Tea Tree Body Wash or just regular Equate hand soap to clean mine.) They  don't hold any funky smells or bacteria after washing, since the bristles aren't porous, unlike animal hair bristles. For the same reason, they dry off very fast. My RT face brush takes about 30 minutes to dry if I leave it damp on a washcloth, and I can dry it almost completely in a few seconds if I rub the brush against a sham. I've cleaned and dried my brushes right before using them to do my makeup regularly. My mac brushes take hours (sometimes days) to dry completely, even if I wipe them against a sham first. Another advantage of the non-porous bristles is that you don't have to condition them. After washing animal hair brushes, you are supposed to condition them with an oil or conditioner so they stay soft and don't get brittle. If you don't, your brushes will start shedding. The RT brushes don't need to be conditioned, and they don't shed.Then, they are soft. Softer than animal hair. They pick up product and dispense it with ease. Product doesn't linger in the brush nearly as much it does on animal hair brushes, which lets me use less product. Truly a pleasure to use and apply makeup with. My one small gripe is that sometimes product can get stuck on the black grip part of these brushes, but that is hardly an issue since it cleans right off. They just might look a bit dirty after rolling around in your makeup bag.These are so durable and have held up better than any brush I've ever had before. As I said before, I've been using them for two years already and they look and feel the same way they did the day I got them. I'm sure that they will last for years to come. I would give these to a friend. I would repurchase. Affordable, durable, just a great product. These would be a great gift to anyone that wears makeup. I would recommend these over any other brush on the market. I feel that this is a truly superior product in every way.

Detailer Brush - Smallest brush in the kit. I use this brush to apply lip tar and sometimes concealer. It's nice. It has a pointy end for very precise application.Pointed Foundation Brush - Nah. Out of the entire range of RT brushes, this is one of the ones I've used the least. It's really small. I feel it's way too small for foundation. It's more of a specialized kind of brush that could be used for getting foundation in a tricky place, applying highlighter, applying concealer, or possibly blending. I don't use this brush at all.Buffing Brush -  I use this brush every day. I use it to apply foundation, powder, powder foundation, bronzer, blush, highlighter, contour, or to just blend away edges. Extremely versatile and a good size.Contour Brush - I use this a few times a month. It's great for contouring under the jaw, but I find it too fluffy to contour my cheeks, nose, forehead, or chin. It does the job, but I prefer using my Becca paddle brush to contour, and my RT buffing brush to blend it.Panoramic 2-in-1 brush case/stand - Meh, I tossed this because I found it a pain to use. I didn't like that it was always open and that my brushes weren't sealed off from the outside environment when the case was closed. I would prefer if they came in a case like the Sigma brushes, or if they included a cute little bag to keep them in, but that's just me. I don't like having to put each brush back into a specific place, and I feel like this gets dirty and isn't easy to clean.I've had the full set of these brushes since they first launched in 2012. Since getting them, I've used at least three of them every single day. That's two years of constant use, and they look and preform the same way they did the day I received them. Since getting the full line of these, I have not purchased a single new brush. My old mac brushes lay untouched in the back of my drawer. Not to mention that just one Mac brush costs as much as the whole set of these ones. Did I mention that you can now buy these at Walmart?These brushes are superior to animal hair brushes in every way. They are cruelty free. They are extremely easy to clean-- I timed myself, and I can wash twenty brushes in seven minutes. They do not get stained. I purposely didn't clean red OCC Lip Tar off of my lip brush for a month, and the lip tar came off as easily as any other product. (I use Trader Joe's Tea Tree Body Wash or just regular Equate hand soap to clean mine.) They  don't hold any funky smells or bacteria after washing, since the bristles aren't porous, unlike animal hair bristles. For the same reason, they dry off very fast. My RT face brush takes about 30 minutes to dry if I leave it damp on a washcloth, and I can dry it almost completely in a few seconds if I rub the brush against a sham. I've cleaned and dried my brushes right before using them to do my makeup regularly. My mac brushes take hours (sometimes days) to dry completely, even if I wipe them against a sham first. Another advantage of the non-porous bristles is that you don't have to condition them. After washing animal hair brushes, you are supposed to condition them with an oil or conditioner so they stay soft and don't get brittle. If you don't, your brushes will start shedding. The RT brushes don't need to be conditioned, and they don't shed.Then, they are soft. Softer than animal hair. They pick up product and dispense it with ease. Product doesn't linger in the brush nearly as much it does on animal hair brushes, which lets me use less product. Truly a pleasure to use and apply makeup with. My one small gripe is that sometimes product can get stuck on the black grip part of these brushes, but that is hardly an issue since it cleans right off. They just might look a bit dirty after rolling around in your makeup bag.These are so durable and have held up better than any brush I've ever had before. As I said before, I've been using them for two years already and they look and feel the same way they did the day I got them. I'm sure that they will last for years to come. I would give these to a friend. I would repurchase. Affordable, durable, just a great product. These would be a great gift to anyone that wears makeup. I would recommend these over any other brush on the market. I feel that this is a truly superior product in every way.

UPDATE 5/21/15- For the past six months, I have been using Bioderma's Cleansing Milk which I got for $6 on eBay by accident when I thought I was buying their micellar water. While the Bioderma Cleansing Milk may not be as soothing for dry skin as the NUDE cleanser, it is AMAZINGLY moisturizing, so much cheaper, and has replaced this product as my holy grail. The only situations I would recommend this product over the Bioderma is if you have 1) chronically dry skin, or 2) heavy duty costume makeup to remove.ORIGINAL REVIEW-This was the first Lisa Eldridge recommendation that I thought was going to be a total let-down. When I first tried it, my initial thought was "it's just oil." I needed two or three pumps of the stuff and it took my makeup off just like my other cleansers. Then, I gave it a second chance. That was when I realized how extremely gentle and extremely effective it was. It's easy to apply, it's pleasant to massage around the face, it cuts through heavy waterproof makeup with ease, it doesn't foam, it doesn't run into the eyes, it doesn't sting the eyes if you do, it washes off in a creamy milk that doesn't run off the face, and it doesn't dry out the skin. It's the perfect cleanser with none of the downsides of soap. Now my chronically dry skin doesn't feel parched after I cleanse. Also, the  dry patches of dead skin rub off easily while massaging the oil around to remove makeup. When I finish cleansing, my face is soft, like baby's skin. I will never use another cleanser. This is my holy grail. Will repurchase again and again.

I use this brush to apply my liquid foundations. It doesn't create streaks, and will apply the product as thinly as I please. It feels oh so soft against my face, and is a nice shape for getting into crevices. I do use my fingers to blend my foundation in for a seamless look, but I'm sure if I didn't want to get my hands dirty I could probably use this brush. I prefer a stiffer, denser brush for blending in foundation, like the Boots No. 7 foundation brush, but that is my preference. This brush isn't as stiff or dense. One thing I should note is that the metal part on the brush I received is silver, where the picture of the one here is black. All in all, I would repurchase.

I use this powder (white) to highlight my nose, cheekbones, forehead, chin, and cupid's bow. I also use it as an eyeshadow. It applies smoothly and evenly. It has a subtle sheen that looks very natural on the skin. It blends seamlessly into the skin, and looks totally flawless.It doesn't contain mineral oil, but it does contain parabens. I know some people avoid those, so fair warning.

I use this powder (taupe) to contour my nose, cheekbones, forehead, chin, and jawline. I also use it as an eyeshadow. It applies smoothly and evenly. It has a subtle sheen that looks very natural on the skin. In the pan it looks a teeeeeensy bit sparkly, but on the skin it doesn't. I know you are supposed to use matte to contour, but this is almost matte. It blends seamlessly into the skin.It doesn't contain mineral oil, but it does contain parabens. I know some people avoid those, so fair warning.

This isn't an extraordinary thing. It's a stick of wax. It goes on matte, not shiny, and is, for all intents and purposes, invisible... so apply as much or as little as you need. I use this for taming my brows and keeping them neat looking. I don't use a brow powder with this. I definitely prefer this stick as opposed to the poured pots that you apply with a brush, which I think are better if you are applying brow color. I think the stick really helps mold things down and keep them looking tidy. It's especially good for in-between tweezing/trimming, when your brows are looking a little unruly. It molds them into shape with ease. It is a little hard to stick down unruly hairs that are really long or have a curl to them, so when I encounter those I usually just pluck them out. Would repurchase. I have occasionally seen drugstore brands of this that seem to work the same for cheaper.I am also a fan of Revlon's Brow Fantasy, but the brow fantasy gel doesn't last as long as this (8+ hours).

When I saw holographic nail polish on Pinterest, I had to have it. I saw the OPI, but opted for this (less expensive) option instead. It's an absolutely gorgeous sky-blue toned holographic. Check google images to see pictures of it. It stays on for a good 4 days without chipping. I put seche vite over it, which takes its lasting power up to 2 weeks. It does not stain the nails, either, and comes off easily with nail polish remover. Will repurchase, and will be getting other colors in the collection. Absolutely gorgeous.

I bought this after I saw Lisa Eldridge use it in her Kate Winslet red carpet video, since I have very red skin. I think it's just okay. It's a water-based moisturizer, hypoallergenic and unscented. It doesn't really give me the moisturizing my dry skin needs. It does reduce my redness, and the green tone of the product neutralizes the remaining redness. The weird thing about this product is that once it dries, it has a tendency to roll off my skin in green blobs... especially when I'm applying makeup. I am not sure if that is because I have dry skin, but I would not repurchase this.However, the La Roche Posay B5 Baume is an amazing product (my HG daytime moisturizer) that sucks the redness out of my skin and moisturizes very well. If you have dry skin like me, I recommend you start there.

(I have this in Roseglow). I love this product. It's a light-weight illuminator, concealer, and corrector. It has a creamy consistency that tends towards slick rather than sticky, and translucent rather than opaque; especially when I compare it to my Laura Mercier secret concealer, which is incredibly sticky and opaque (the one in the pot, not the compact). Because the Dior Skinflash is so creamy, slick and slightly translucent, it's very easy to blend. Comparing this product to the By Terry equivalent (By Terry Touch Expert Advanced Multi Corrective Concealer Brush - # 1 Fair), I would say that this product is far superior. I purchased both products at about the same $40 price tag.I mainly use this to conceal my blue-ish undereye circles. Sometimes I also use it to highlight down my nose, the tip of my chin, and the tops of my cheekbones. If I'm feeling really lazy or my skin is very clear, I might use it to conceal some tiny acne scars that are still healing. Usually I use Laura Mercier Secret Camouflage to conceal spots though (it's my holy grail for covering spots).I like the twirl stick, which makes the product very convenient to dispense. I don't have to get my hands dirty if I don't want to. I get about 2 uses out of one click. The brush is small and just the right size. It feels soft against the skin and gets the job done.
