I've cleaned it a few times just to make sure it doesn't have bacteria growing on it just by taking some Bioderma and wiping it off, no big deal. The thing that I love the most about this product is that the highlighter is not over the top with noticeable glitter, which makes it very easy to work with. It doesn't matter where I apply it on my face, it won't look strange (I am also a very good match to the color that I purchased). This is important to me because it ensures that the product looks natural and seamless; like it isn't even there. Because I have very fair skin, I would recommend this product to fair-skinned girls looking for concealer light enough for them. The color does have that salmon-ish aspect which makes it great for blue-ish color correction, but it's not salmon-ish enough to eliminate it from regular concealing.I will repurchase this until I find a better product, and will update this review if that happens.

Let me get my one gripe out of the way first. The packaging is horrible. Turning the cap causes product to pour everywhere and billow into the air. Powder gets stuck on the corner edges of the package and there's no stopping it from going EVERYWHERE whenever you put on the lid or take it off. Therefore, I have transferred mine to a baggy with a corner trimmed off one side (very tiny hole). I pour a little out on the back of my hand or in a bowl when I need it, and I keep the corner twisted and taped closed when I'm not using it. It successfully stops the product from billowing into the air and getting all over the place, but white powder in a plastic baggy does look a little sketchy.The powder goes on beautifully over foundation, cream blusher, highligher, cream contour, even eyeshadow. It is translucent. It absorbs oil and is soft to the touch when over foundation. If applied over still wet foundation, it is possible to apply too much, which can make you look washed out. It's setting powder, not powder foundation. It's a fabulous dupe for high end setting powders, and for a very reasonable price. Will repurchase.

I have not found a kit anywhere that includes this many pieces for a comparable price.The brush bristles could be a little better... slimmer, a little less scratchy, but these get the job done fine. The rubber on the bottom of the bowl could be more grippy so it doesn't slip. The plastic on the combs and clips could be less flimsy. At this price though, I can hardy complain about any of this. The bowl even has measuring marks on it. If you are just starting out coloring your own hair, this is the set to buy.

Edit: Not sure why this review is getting so many downvotes. If you have dry skin, this product is great. If not, it's going to be way too oily.Original Review:I have chronically dry skin from undergoing accutane treatment. I was really struggling with my makeup because I had so many dry and flaky patches on my face that whenever I applied concealer, cream foundation or liquid foundation, it would get stuck on the dead skin and look very unnatural and unattractive. I've tried a lot of drugstore moisturizers, and my all time favorite was the Olay Perfecting Cream (now named Olay Deep Hydration Regenerating Cream) because it was the only thing that could clear up my dry patches and not irritate my skin. However, it was only a temporary fix and would never keep the dry patches away for more than a few hours.I discovered the La Roche Posay B5 after hearing Lisa Eldridge recommend it for dry skin in her Beauty Nightmares video. As soon as I tried the B5 baume I was in love. It was like it mimicked my skin's natural oil. As I rubbed it into my face, I could see my dehydrated skin absorbing it. My dry patches disappeared, and the dead skin rubbed off and was gone. I applied my makeup, and no dry patches in sight. It was magical. I've always had eczema on my shoulders and hands. This dramatically helps those patches, but takes about 2-3 reapplications to get rid of them completely. I would warn that if you have normal or oily skin and use too much of this, your face will look like an oil slick. I think this is really meant for dry skinned people. The other thing I've noticed about this product is that it takes down my redness. I believe that is because of the vitamin B5, which soothes irritation.I use this everyday underneath my makeup. I will repurchase this item time and time again. It has been a complete game changer for me.P.S. If you have dry skin like me, try out Waleda's skin food. It's heavier than this product and really hydrates deep. I use it at night.

I've had two of these now, and they are great. I also have the older version with the purple refills, and I have to say I don't notice a difference between the two. They don't crimp lashes like cheap eyelash curlers usually do, and my stick straight thick lashes stay all day. I have given them out as stocking stuffers year after year. They last a long time, preform well, and I love that they come with 3 refills. You don't have to squeeze super hard to get a curl. Just do three easy squeezes.

I've had two of these now, and they are great. I also have the newer version with the blue refills, and I have to say I don't notice a difference between the two. They don't crimp lashes like cheap eyelash curlers usually do, and my stick straight thick lashes stay all day. I have given them out as stocking stuffers year after year. They last a long time, preform well, and I love that they come with 3 refills. You don't have to squeeze super hard to get a curl. Just do three easy squeezes.

This product does exactly what it claims and smooths down hair. It has the consistency of most other smoothing products-- lotion consistency, holds its shape, is thicker than a serum, yet slippery when rubbed between the fingers. I run it through my ends when my hair is still damp. It helps to de-tangle and de-frizz. After my hair dries, it looks smoothed down. I didn't notice a difference in terms of lusterizing, but I did notice the insane amount of glitter on my hands after I applied the product. I'm not a great fan of that, and cringe when I think about the glitter getting on my sensitive skin around my face an neck. The other thing is the smell of this product, which to me smells of strawberry yogurt. I would skip this next time around in favor of Jonathan Dirt or Phyto 7.

I have the Mac, Bobbi Brown, Laura Mercier and Real Technique equivalents for this brush, and I have to say... this one beats them all! The bristles are soft enough for the eye area, yet stiff enough to easily achieve a precise application. One thing I love about synthetic bristles is how easy they are to clean, but even next to the Real Techniques eyeliner brush, this one is faster and easier to clean! I have used this for fluidline a few times and it has been great, but mostly I use this brush for pin-point concealer application with my Laura Mercier secret concealers. Anyone that has Laura Mercier concealer will know how hard it is to wash out of brushes after it dries. With this brush, it's no problem.

I love the other Kasugai gummies, and I love ramune, so I eagerly bought these. I don't think they taste like ramune at all. They have a strange chemical taste, that, combined with the lemon flavor comes across as Windex flavor. I shared these with two friends, and they both said they tasted like shampoo. I decided to get second opinions since I saw so many positive reviews online, so I gave them to my aunt, uncle, and young cousin too. My aunt and uncle made faces while they chewed, and my cousin (who loves trying new candy) spit it out. I think it's really hard to get past the soap flavor. Maybe they don't taste like that to everyone, different body chemistry and taste buds, but know when purchasing that you run the risk of Windex-flavor. I would not buy these again. However, I highly recommend the Kiwi, Peach, Mango, Orange, Strawberry Kasugai gummies, all of which are well-liked and I have repurchased time and time again.

I get these in a 12 pack at my Asian market for $2, which is why I sometimes buy them. I find them a bit dull on their own. The chocolate is thin and waxy and not flavorful. The marshmallow is decent, and the cake is very dry, like just like they are in Moon Pies. Overall, they're okay. Microwaved with a dab of jam they are better, but I would much rather spend my money on another treat.

Update 1/19/14: I purchased the Manic Panic Dreamtone foundation in white (Manic Panic Virgin Dreamtone Gothic Foundation Vampire White) and tried mixing it with this foundation and I made my perfect color. The Manic Panic is thicker and creamier, whereas the Makeup Forever is watery, but they mix together perfectly.Original Review:Chances are, if you are reading this, you have very pale skin with deep, cool, pink undertones. This is the kind of skin that I have. I have searched and searched for a foundation pale enough for years. I've tried every major brand (even Dainty Doll), and everything is too dark or too yellow. I had such high hopes for Make Up For Ever's HD Foundation in 107. It came so close to being the right shade. So so so close, but a tad too dark of a pink. I am thinking I will buy Face Atelier's white foundation and mix it with this one for the right shade. This was so frustratingly close-- in my hand it looks like the right color, and when I blend it into my wrist, it's seamless... But on my face, it looks too salmon and not pale enough.This foundation is rich and luxurious to apply. It dries beautifully, with a natural finish. It's not luminous. It wears well, and will last all day if set with a powder. What a great foundation, but so sad that the lightest shade is still not light enough... I will update once I find a solution or buy the white Face Altier foundation. I've also been considering Graftobian, Cinema Secrets, and RCMA. If you are having the same problem I am, check out those websites.Tips: Always test foundation on your jawbone, between your neck and cheek, in natural light.

Simple, easy to use, and has worked in my office for years. Has minimal buttons, scans documents fast and effectively. Easy to load paper into. Prints extremely fast. Saves a lot of time, not to mention we rarely have to replace the ink. We actually keep ours in a drawer, and I like that it's simple looking and not a strange shape.

Fits nicely and doesn't slide off. Has a matte finish that is smooth to the touch and not shiny. The buttons don't have holes cut for them-- instead, there are rubber buttons on the case that work just like regular buttons. The only gripe I have is that one of my charger plugs doesn't fit in my phone when this is on it.

Buyer beware: Carhartt makes a mens' jacket out of a different, much better nylon fabric. They used to make a womens' jacket out of the same material, item #WJ002 - Carhartt Women's Waterproof Breathable Jacket. Carhartt has since discontinued this jacket, and now makes two very similar jackets with the same material, similar names, but different fabric types that are more typical of common windbreakers. There's this one, #WJ019 - Women's Women's Downburst Waterproof Breathable Jacket, and also #100054 - Women's Cascade Jacket. As many people who own the original jacket (including myself) have noticed, the new jackets are nowhere near as good as the original one (#WJ002). I have complained to Carhartt about this. I explained to them that the original jacket earned raving 5-star reviews, and the new ones are getting a lot of negative reviews, especially by people that loved the original one. Carhartt was very responsive and told me that their womens' line changed frequently due to customer reviews. I can only hope that they will re-continue the Waterproof Breathable Jacket in the future.

Buyer beware: Carhartt makes a mens' jacket out of a different, much better nylon fabric. They used to make a womens' jacket out of the same material, item #WJ002 - Carhartt Women's Waterproof Breathable Jacket. Carhartt has since discontinued this jacket, and now makes two very similar jackets with the same material, similar names, but different fabric types that are more typical of common windbreakers. There's this one, #100054 - Women's Cascade Jacket, and also #WJ019 - Women's Women's Downburst Waterproof Breathable Jacket. As many people who own the original jacket (including myself) have noticed, the new jackets are nowhere near as good as the original one (#WJ002). I have complained to Carhartt about this. I explained to them that the original jacket earned raving 5-star reviews, and the new ones are getting a lot of negative reviews, especially by people that loved the original one. Carhartt was very responsive and told me that their womens' line changed frequently due to customer reviews. I can only hope that they will re-continue the Waterproof Breathable Jacket in the future.

If you need cheap, sexy underwear that you can afford to throw away, go for it. These will work. They fit as expected. After a wash they lose a bit of their shape, but are still usable. After a few washes they started giving me panty-line.

I needed a plastic case to cover the back of my iPhone 4S that had the glass in the back shattered. This fits that purpose well. It becomes somewhat more difficult to use the volume buttons and vibrate switch, especially if you have large fingers. I could also see a potential problem with some headphones if they had a thick base around the jack. My headphones still fit. The case snaps on and REALLY stays on. Not loose at all. The back design has a cream color, and the sides are white with a bluish hue, which doesn't match the color of a white iPhone. The plastic seams are rough, but not enough to bother me. For the price, I'm not going to complain. It's a cheap, painted piece of plastic, and was exactly what I needed. Would repurchase.

Buyer beware: Carhartt has made two very similar jackets with the same material, similar names, but different fabric types that are more typical of common windbreakers. It's #100054 - Women's Cascade Jacket, and #WJ019 - Women's Women's Downburst Waterproof Breathable Jacket. As many people who own the original jacket (including myself) have noticed, the new jackets are nowhere near as good as this one (#WJ002). I have complained to Carhartt about this. I explained to them that this jacket earned raving 5-star reviews, and the new ones are getting a lot of negative reviews, especially by people that loved the original one. Carhartt was very responsive and told me that their womens' line changed frequently due to customer reviews. I can only hope that they will re-continue this jacket in the future.I first tried this jacket on 2 years ago and fell in love with it. Unfortunately, I needed an XL for my taller frame. I went home and looked at Carhartt's website, only to see that it wasn't in stock. I searched high and low, but could not find any stores that still had it in stock. Dismayed, I added it to my Amazon wishlist, in hopes that Amazon would restock XL. After 2 years of searching, I managed to snag this used on eBay.Wow. What a great jacket this is. This is the jacket to have if you are up against some real weather. It sheds water, rain, snow, doesn't let the wind through, and yet, it is breathable enough to keep me just the right temperature underneath- keeping me sweat free and bone-dry. It's perfectly warm enough for extremely cold temperatures if paired with a long-sleeved shirt and/or fleece underneath. Think of it as the ultimate outer shell. It isn't made of the same weave of nylon as typical windbreakers- this is thicker nylon, thicker nylon than some winter jackets I have, and it isn't as shiny.The hand covers on this jacket are one of my favorite features, as they prevent cold from creeping into and up the sleeves of this jacket. As someone with long arms, this has long been a problem for me. The hand covers are made of a thin, stretchy, spandex-like fabric, and work great with gloves layered over.The jacket is shorter in the front and longer in the back. It looks great on. I seem to be the only one that is reviewing this jacket in XL, as I notice that a lot of petite women have reviewed this before me (I'm 6'0, about 165 with a D-cup). They've commented that the jacket fits large on them, but I actually had the opposite experience, where the jacket in the normal size I would buy (L) was actually was too short in the arms and wasn't roomy enough to layer clothing in the middle. In the XL, it's perfect--arms are long and it's roomy enough to add layers inside. For me, the jacket looks a lot more like it does on the model, which another reviewer mentioned that it didn't. I also don't find the positioning of the pockets awkward, as another reviewer here said.The many pockets are great. There are two hidden pockets inside the jacket, slightly below the chest. The positioning is great, as the objects I keep inside are not being held against my breasts. The pockets on the outside of the jacket are lined with material, and keep my hands warm. The breast pocket is the same, with a plastic coating around the zipper, so anything in the pocket is kept perfectly dry. It's perfect for keeping my wallet in.The hood is convenient, and I am so glad that it snaps on and off as opposed to Velcro on all of my other jackets. There is a Velcro closure on the front of the hood to cover the neck. The jacket has a double zipper and 2 layers of fabric that snap closed to cover the zipper. The snaps are not visible except for the ones at the very top and bottom of the jacket. At the top of the jacket, there is fleecy fabric on the inside so the rougher outside fabric doesn't rub against the skin of the neck.A lot of thought went into this jacket. It's easy to tell that it is of superior quality and make. I constantly receive compliments. I would happily repurchase this, even if it was $250.

I have this in Pomegranate and Vanilla. The smells are pleasant. It's not really a shave cream so much as it's a shave lotion-- it's not aerosol and it doesn't foam up. It's like a lotion. When my legs are wet and I try to smooth this on or lather up with it, it drips off pretty quickly. I find it's better to turn the water off and shave or just shave dry. On the other hand, it does make my legs smooth and shiny, and they feel somewhat more moisturized after using this. Because I am vegan, I am happy that EOS does not test on animals. Put simply: it works OK, it smells OK, and they don't test on animals. I look at shaving cream as kind of a luxury anyway, but I would not repurchase this.

I'm a chocoholic. When I first went vegan I thought that the only way I would be able to escape dairy in chocolate would be to make my own. I'm happy that I was wrong. The best part of this product is that it tastes like good quality chocolate. This product does everything that normal chocolate does, and I've even made truffles and candies with it. It tempers just as well as normal chocolate. I've used these to make vegan s'mores, candy bars, frosting, cookies, and various other sweet treats. I have a cousin that is fatally allergic to peanuts and wheat, while somewhat less allergic lactose. He was very happy to learn that he could eat the goodies I was making. Can't beat that. Have repurchased many times over, and am sure that I will continue to do so in the future.

Not sure what this is meant for but I'm sure it isn't cut for the Sprint LG GPad 7.0 LGLK430. Corners are not rounded on protector, camera is covered and it came in chipped. Son had to take a file to the edges to round out the corners. I'm making it work for now. But not happy:-(

I have followed Crystal for a couple of years and always talked about saving all her emails and printing them out so I would have her wonderful ideas and advice at my fingertips. But. I never got around to it (round tuit anyone?)There are no more excuses to be had. I now have a lot of her wisdom at my fingertips in this book.And it isn't just for MOM's!My adult son moved home in order to save for college next year and he has made off with my copy of Money Making Mom! He's going through it page by page and constantly talking about the ideas that catch his attention. He's learning how important a budget is and that a well thought out budget doesn't restrict you, it FREES you! He's working on his first one thanks to Crystal. He, the eternal live in the moment 25 year old young man, is writing out his plans: 6 month, 1 year, 2 year and on up through 10 years down the road. I am in awe. Crystal has touched something in his psyche that I wasn't able to figure out how to activate and he's looking at the present and the future with new eyes. In all of her encouragement, she stresses to get out of, and stay out of, debt and that alone is so freeing. If you don't have to pay it back, you can pay it forward.We all have strengths and she is so encouraging about finding YOUR strengths and building on them. You won't find cookie cutter answers, but you may find the right questions in this book.I received a copy of this book during a special promotion.

I am a trackball fan. Mouses. Corded or not usually drive me nuts! I got the opportunity to try this gaming mouse at a discount during a special promotion and am retiring my trackball. This fits my hand perfectly and I have small hands. The sensitivity is adjustable so, unlike other mice I have used, I don't have to chase it all over my desk. Small movements and I can hit every corner of my screen. It comes with weights you can add to change the weight and handling. Even with all of the weights installed it still glides across my desk with no resistance.

This charger really surprised me. I'm used to my phone taking hours to fully charge, and my tablet even longer. This charger took my LG G3 from 8% charge to 94% charge in about an hour and a half (110 mile drive). My 7" tablet charges in about 3 hours. Plus it gives you a second port for your headphones, GPS or other toys. It has a coiled cord (which is stronger than you might expect) that makes storing it in a small space easy. I did receive this at a discount during a special promotion.

Very nice and surprisingly strong manual coffee grinder. Fully adjustable burr settings and really easy to clean. The handle removes easily when not in use to make storing the grinder a simple matter. I would prefer if it had some type of a keeper or pin to keep in attached, but that's my quirk. If you're pressed for space or camping, this would be a perfect answer to stale, pre-ground coffee. I did receive this at a discount during a special promotion.

This is a fun,and private, way to get a taste of ballroom dancing. My husband and I have talked over the years about wanting to try various forms of dance, but we usually park the conversation for a "better time". This system has let us find that better time: now. While we won't win any contests, and are probably making too many mistakes to count...we are having fun and ballroom dancing, even learning it, is actually a decent workout. I did receive this at a discount during a special promotion.

Not just for camping. I need to say that. This has been one year we haven't made it to the woods. Sad year but this handy pocket chain saw has still been an amazing tool. In 1969 I had my neck broke in 3 places.In 1983 I had my mid back broke in 2 places.In 2007 I was in a semi accident that destroyed my shoulder and after 3 surgeries it still isn't right.Those are just the highlights of the abuse my body has taken. And I still need to live my life to the fullest.I have been taking just glucosamine for several years and swear by it. This supplement includes glucosamine, MSM and ginger along with other supplements. The ginger is warming and anti inflammatory. The MSM is a building block of bones and cartilage.My body will never be 20 again, but for almost 50 years old I have more mobility and less pain with this daily supplement than I do without it. It may not work for everyone, but it works for me. I received this at a discount during a special promotion.

My house consists of me and a herd of 5 cats. I know that I use the proper facilities when I need to go potty. I assumed that my furry kids used their appropriate equipment. Then I got a smell that seemed to defy their commode cleanings and mopping. The entire herd is neutered and spayed so I didn't think I had to worry about territorial spraying and the like. I hunted high and low because the smell wasn't stationary. It seemed to haunt us.Then I received this black light UV flashlight. My eyes were opened. Both the front and back door thresholds had been sprayed as had 2 of my front windows....on the OUTSIDE. My kits were using their commodes as expected. The neighborhood travelers had left gifts to tempt (?) my kits to come out and play... Without this light I would never have known where the haunting aromas were sneaking in from.An added bonus, I now keep this light on my nightstand for when I go to the bathroom in the middle of the night. No squinting and hating the bright lights plus no falling over randomly sleeping furry balls either. Triple win! I received this at a discount during a special promotion.

We all have to wear seatbelts. It's the law. Or you happen to go into the lake or river and your doors won't open and with the outside water pressure, your windows won't go down. I received this at a discount during a special promotion.

50 years old is sneaking up on me like a freight train and I am finally starting to notice life taking its toll on my skin. Mama warned me about this years ago, but then I was young. Eucalyptus oil has so many uses as long as you use it with the respect it deserves. Never use it neat (without dilution on your skin). Keep it out of the reach of children and pets (especially cats as any essential oil can kill a cat).I mix about 5 drops of this in a 4 ounce bottle of water with 1 drop of baby shampoo and use it as an air freshener and mild antiseptic on surfaces and clothing. Without the drop of shampoo it wouldn't blend into the water (water and oil don't mix), but the one drop of soap doesn't make the water foamy.When I'm sick I spray this solution on my cold weather gear: hats, gloves, scarves and face masks. I feel it helps cut down on my sharing any germs I may carry and helps keep other peoples germs out of my way too. Might or might not be true, but it makes me feel better.This is a quality essential oil that doesn't show any of the impurities that I find in so many commercial preparations.With winter coming, and having arrived in parts of the country, it might be worth adding to your winter health toolbox.I received this at a discount during a special promotion.

Made from wintergreen and birch, this is a lovely exfoliating gel that helps remove pore clogging impurities on and in your skin. Without leaving you looking like a scalded cat. It's right there on the tip of my tongue...can you see it? Have you had those "senior moments" where no matter what you think you know, the thought just won't appear? I raised four kids on breast milk and Gerber. This was long before Gerber brought formula onto their menu. I trusted Gerber and still do. Now that Gerber has formula I had to recommend that as an option. Her thoughts and concerns were well founded when my grandson was born. She was unable to keep up with his dietary needs and had to supplement. Her doctor and hospital recommended other, sponsored to them, brands, which she dutifully tried. They were included in her going home kit and she figured they should be ok as the hospital provided them. Her son was not as impressed. I found this sample box quite by chance and sent it to her. Once it arrived and she tried it, she called me in tears. His first bottle gave her the first rest she had had in the 2 weeks since he arrived. His tummy accepted it, he didn't spit it up, and he actually slept in peace. Once again, Gerber proved to be the best option for our family.

My husband is in the Navy, and must wear navy blue undershirts under his NWU's (camo uniforms). The undershirts that they sell at the NEX come in a two pack for $17, so this is a much much much better deal! They're great all-purpose shirts, and don't have to be just undershirts. They are soft, good quality, and the price is much better for the Hanes brand than Gildan. My husband likes these better than Gildan, and I like the price, so it's a win-win!

We bought this game when it was on a lightening deal. Our family had never played it before, and usually we only buy games if we've played with with friends or family, but I'm so glad I bought it! My husband and I played this with his parents one night, and we had a blast! It was hard to keep our voices down with our kiddos sleeping. The premise of this game is pretty simple to learn ("corner the market" by collecting all the cards of a certain commodity), fun to play, and games go by quickly; perfect for family game night or parties!

I mean, my black lab didn't actually TELL me that he loves them, but by the way he devours them, I know he likes these treats. I keep these on hand for bath time and during nail trimming (both of which he's not a fan of), and it makes those activities much more tolerable for the both of us. I've been a fan of Zukes products since I bought a Zukes bone at REI a few years ago. I love knowing that they're made in the USA from natural ingredients. They've never made my dog sick or given him gas (as discount brands have). Zukes has a customer for life!

Both of my boys (ages 2 years and 10 months, respectively) have very fair skin and eczema. I veer away from anything scented or fragranced for our entire family. My son even had a reaction to a common eczema lotion!We've used Babyganics baby shampoo/body wash since my oldest was born, and it's never caused a reaction. We've also used their sunscreen, bug spray, and lotion. My son asked for bubble bath, so I bought this, and I'm so glad I did! It makes bath time much more fun. My oldest loves swishing the water around to make more bubbles, and my youngest loves playing with them. The bubbles last a while but because it's naturally derived, it's not as bubbly as other brands. I'm ok with that. I put 2-3 squirts in and it provides bubbles for up to 30-40 minutes. The more the bubble bath is agitated, the more bubbles are made. Rocket science, I know! But seriously, I would recommend this. Amazon's price is usually much better than other stores, too!

I frequently use SOS (Soup or Sauce) Mix, which is a substitute for cream-based soups. (Google this; the recipe is simple and delicious!) Nonfat dry milk is one of the main ingredients, so I was happy to find this at a great price on Amazon. The expiration date was about 18-24 months out once I received it. I've also used it to make homemade oatmeal packets and oatmeal energy ball bites. Good quality at a great price. Hooray!

This is a very pigment (and shimmer) rich eyeshadow. It's gorgeous, but I don't use it as a daily eyeshadow because it's not particularly easy to apply for my quick daily makeup routine, and it packs a punch. I like some shimmer but my daily eyeshadows are a bit more matte. I use a Sephora angled eyeshadow brush or eyeshadow blending brush to apply this. You have to be careful because if you get it anywhere you don't want it, it's hard to get off! Once it's applied it really is lovely. I only have one color (Amber Rush) so far, but will be buying more. I usually buy hypoallergenic eye makeup, but this doesn't irritate my skin or eyes. At amazon's price, it's a great deal!

This is (almost) the perfect breastfeeding pillow. I used it for my first son for a few weeks until he switched to breastmilk in the bottle, and I used it for my second son for eight months. I firmly believe that having a breastfeeding pillow makes nursing more enjoyable for everyone.I absolutely love that it is very adjustable (I am a size 16/18), the cover is soft and machine washable, and the shape of the pillow itself is conducive to nursing. This pillow, while a bit more bulky than the Boppy, won't slide off because it's attached around your waist. It takes a few more seconds to prep yourself to nurse because of this, but it's well worth the lack of stress during feeding from the pillow sliding out from under baby. I have decent upper body strength, but holding a baby for 10-40 minutes without support is a challenge! I also appreciate the pocket on the pillow. I kept a cloth diaper (see below), nursing pads, and Mother Love nursing cream in it.The reason I didn't give this five stars is that underneath the cover, there is no waterproof barrier. This is a big oversight in my book. Babies drool, spit up, milk lets down when baby's not latched....things happen. Babies are gross, guys. While the cover does provide a barrier between dirt/drool/milk and the foam pillow, it's not enough protection. I used the My Brest Friend pillow at the hospital and it didn't have a cloth cover, but a plastic waterproof cover on it that the nurses could wipe down with a wipe. Make sense, right? Or, if the pillow wasn't lined, the least they could do is line the interior of the cover (like a cloth diaper cover).  Anyway, I kept a cloth diaper underneath my little one's head while he was nursing, so if any milk did leak out of his mouth (...or me...) I could just wash the cloth diaper instead of the whole cover and pillow. This prevented needed to wash the cover or spot clean the pillow excessively (but I did that a few times, too).That being said, I would still highly recommend this pillow as it's the best one I've used. It has its faults, but it's not a deal breaker. Nursing is an incredible way to bond and nourish your baby (if you are able/want to), and this is a great tool to have in your arsenal to assist with breastfeeding. Best of luck to you and your sweet little one!

This eyeshadow is great. It's smooth, easy to apply, and stays on for most of the day (I have yet to find an eyeshadow that truly lasts all day!). I normally wear hypoallergenic eyeshadow because my eyes and skin are very sensitive, but this eyeshadow didn't cause any irritation. I'm giving it four stars because there's room for a small mirror in the top section (when open), and that would make it a perfect little compact. Also-and this isn't a slight against the product-mine arrived damaged. It wasn't worth the hassle to return it, and it's still usable. Overall, I'd recommend this eyeshadow and plan on buying it in other color palettes.

My kids (ages 2 and 10 months) both love this fruit. It's large enough that I'm not worried about my little one choking on it, and it's hard to find toys that both boys can play with and are interested in at this point. This set is better made than I thought it would be, and holy smokes, that velcro isn't coming off. The colors are vibrant, and the pieces are fun to "cut" and put together. The apple is the only piece of fruit that's one solid color (it's odd and doesn't really look like it belongs in the set). The other pieces have more true-to-life color. It's great for pretend play, life skills, color, and shape recognition. I'd definitely recommend this for little kiddos, as I can see this entertaining my boys for years to come!

We have two fair-skinned little boys (our oldest is 28 months, and our youngest is 10 months old) and use Desitin every diaper change for our youngest and almost every diaper change for our oldest (sometimes we use Baby Anti Monkey Butt powder). I don't have any hard numbers, but I know it's prevented many, many, MANY diaper rashes. When my son was 16 months old, we went on a short family vacation. I forgot to pack Desitin, so we were just using the powder. I figured he would be fine for a few days. Nope. He had one bout of diarrhea (which we quickly cleaned up), and the next day he had an awfully red and blistered bum. I actually cried because it was so painful to even look at, poor guy! I know the rash wasn't just from his poop, because he's had that issue before, but had no rash develop when we used Desitin. We learned from that mistake and make sure to use Desitin at least twice a day.When a rash gets *really* bad, we use Triple Paste, but it's cost prohibitive to use that daily. Desitin has done well by us, and considering it's what my mom used on her kiddos, I think it'll be around for a while. Quite simply, it works!

I have two boys (at the time of writing this, my oldest is 28 months old and my youngest is 10 months old) with very fair skin. I used Desitin as our every day cream, and that has prevented many a diaper rash. We also use Baby Anti Monkey Butt powder on my oldest. However, when they do get redness that the Desitin doesn't help, we use Triple Paste. Yes, it's expensive. But it works. And to me, it's worth the cost for my baby not to be in pain-and not to have to take him to the doctor for a rash that won't go away! I wish I could upload before and after photos, but I don't think my little ones would appreciate that when they got older. :)Recently, my 10 month old got a diaper rash after he pooped a few hours before he woke up (and the poop didn't wake him up). He was miserable, but within 36 hours of using Triple Paste, he didn't cry during diaper changes and the redness had dramatically lessened. My oldest had an awful rash when he was 16 months old after I forgot to pack Desitin on a weekend trip. We had just been using powder, and he got diarrhea. That was an awful combination, and he woke up one morning with a blistered bum. Triple Paste came to the rescue and cleared up his rash within a few days.I think it's worth noting that if your baby's rash is yeast-based, this will exacerbate the rash, as it contains cornstarch (which yeast loves).

This is a great alternative to the super cheap strips sold in bulk and the more expensive tests sold in drug stores. These have been accurate each time I've used them. The first time I used it I thought I messed it up because it absorbed differently than others I've used, but if you wait the allotted amount of time, the results are clear.

I've tried about four other brands of stainless steel cleaner and polish, and this one is the best. You definitely have to put some upper body strength into it (especially on the more "shiny" stainless steel finishes; the matte finishes are much easier to clean), but it works. I wish it would add some sort of fingerprint-proof film on it...but that's just wishful thinking from a mom with two young kids. :)All of our appliances (fridge, oven/stove, microwave, and dishwasher...plus our toaster) are stainless steel and I use this on all of them. The fridge is the hardest to clean, but being as it has the most surface area, that makes sense. But, as I mentioned earlier, it has more of a shiny finish, so it doesn't repel fingerprints. If I could go back in time and spend a couple hundred more bucks on a fridge that had a matte/fingerprint resistant finish, I would. I use this about once a week and a bottle lasts us about 2-3 months. I usually spray it on a microfiber cloth instead of spraying it directly on the appliances, as this greatly reduces the overspray.Hope this helps!

I know this isn't scientifically "accurate", but really now, it's a toy. I bought it for my husband/son and they both love it! My 2 year old has speech delays, and this book has been very helpful in therapy. I bought this for my son's baptism, and it's definitely a keepsake now. The fabric is well made and it doesn't look cheap at all. Because he's such a drooler, a bib was a great idea. I initially purchased the Unicorn Beetle case (http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00MYZLLIY/ref=sr_ph?ie=UTF8&qid=1426279646&sr=1&keywords=unicorn+beetle+iphone+6), but the volume rocker buttons did not work well with this case. I returned it and purchased this one instead. While it's not perfect, I definitely like it more than the Unicorn Beetle case. I have two kids under two, so my phone goes through a lot. In the past I've only used Otterbox cases, but I'm happy with this case through the water, drool, juice, dust, dog hair, and drops it's experienced.Pros of this case:-Easy to take off and on-Interchangeable face plates-Good splash, dust, and drop protection. It's not waterproof, but for the price point, I wouldn't expect it to be. It definitely provides more protection than the UB case. The only part of the original phone that's exposed once this case is on is the back camera.-Sleek and stylish-All buttons and the screen work perfectly (although I haven't tried out the touchID feature)Cons:-Not very grippy, but more grip than the UB case (on the sides)-Not a wide variety of color selection-No holster clip included (not a big deal for me since I wouldn't use it anyway, but it might be for some)Overall, I think this case is a steal for the price point. It's a good looking case that provides great protection!

I love glass food storage, but we recently moved into a house with porcelain tiles. Turns out they love breaking glass. I needed some more food storage, so I embarked on a quest to find a high-quality plastic set. I'm so glad I stumbled onto this! It's the perfect compromise between the traditional Rubbermaid plastic food storage and glass food storage. The plastic is thicker, stronger, and clearer-and foods that traditionally stain plastic (think tomato sauce) don't make a mark. I also like the the lids "snap" together, so they don't all come tumbling out of the cabinet if you accidentally bump one. It's also lighter weight than glass, which is perfect for lunches and taking food to a friend's house. I definitely recommend this set-even more than my Tupperware pieces (and I LOVE Tupperware)!Update 5/2015 (three months after initial review):Guys. This is the real deal. These have stood up to almost daily dishwashing, drops, microwaving, and the fridge. My food storage cabinet is nicely organized because they stack together well, and they are reasonably priced. Yes, they cost more than the "standard" Rubbermaid, but it's well worth it. I love these so much I bought a second set at BJ's. And then my mother-in-law bought herself a set after seeing our set. Love it!

We love Melissa and Doug products, and this is another winner in my book! The knobs are easy for my son to grab, and the colors are vivid. These seem to be pretty well made, but we'll see how they hold up to toddler abuse. Other Melissa and Doug puzzles are still going strong after a year, and I don't have any doubt these will be the same. My son definitely prefers the animals over the shapes at this point, but that's just because he loves animals. Great educational (and fun!) toy.

I bought these when they were two ninety nine on amazon, and that was a great steal! Now they are closer in price to Avery. They're fine for the average use, but I wouldn't classify them as heavyweight. They also have quite a bit of glare. I bought them to use in my recipe binder, so for my purpose, they'll work just fine. If they're close in price to the Avery heavyweight sheet protectors, I'd go for Avery instead.

This works fine, is well made, and is easy to use...but it just doesn't sharpen quite as well as the traditional sharpening steel. It claims to work on serrated blades, and I guess it technically does, but I wasn't overly thrilled with the result. I got the best result on my chef's knife. It's okay, but I wouldn't recommend it. I was looking for an alternative to a sharpening stone or steel, but I will stick to what I know.

I had high expectations for this book based on Amy's work on SNL and Parks and Rec, as well as what I've learned about her through mainstream media. Buuuut....it didn't meet my expectations. Don't get me wrong, I would recommend this book, and am glad I purchased it, but many parts felt rather forced. There are a few times where she bemoans the effort required to write a book. Well, yeah, I know it wasn't a particularly easy process, especially with the busy schedule she keeps, but she chose to write the book! If you're looking for a in-depth analysis of her personal life, you won't find it here. She discusses her career at length (which I loved...mostly), but veered away from specifics about her relationship and subsequent divorce from Will Arnett. That's her choice, and I respect her for that-but I think some people might pick up this book hoping to get some dirt. What you will get are a grouping of essays on her career, her childhood, her college experiences, and her boys (which was one of my favorite chapters, as I have two young boys as well). This is surprisingly well written (the few "celebrity" books I've read have been sub-par) and was easy to read. There was quite a bit of name-dropping, but I was expecting that...I mean, she's worked with tons of well-known folks!Overall, as I mentioned earlier, I would recommend this book. I hope she will write another book focusing more on everyday topics. It's worth the read, but falls a bit flat on occasion.

I love any product that helps organize, but this is one of my favorites. I originally purchased it to keep on our bathroom counter, but have since moved it into the medicine cabinet we installed, where it fits great. I love that it can hold all the little things you need in a bathroom. Right now, I have two tubes of toothpaste (one for my kids, one for my husband and I), two toothbrushes, a section just for cotton swabs, a small container of vaseline, a battery-powered facial scrubbing brush, a tube of lipstick, and floss. Without this organizer, these small items would be awkward to just sit on a shelf by themselves without falling off or getting bumped off. For the price, I'm very happy with my purchase.

Update: I'm really bummed because this stopped working after owning it for nine months and using it once every two weeks or so. For the price, this should last much longer than 18-20 uses.Initial review: I've used a few different trimmers over the years, and this is my favorite. I've been using this for three months now. Please note this is a *trimmer*, not a shaver. Although I suppose you could take the guard off, I wouldn't recommend using this for a full shave. My previous trimmer was rechargeable, but I actually prefer batteries. The charge would frequently last no longer than a few minutes, even when I actually remembered to charge it. My favorite feature of this trimmer is that the pointed tips of the guards are rounded. This may sound like a feature that should be common sense, but other trimmers have been more pointy (and thus, painful). This works great, and I'm very happy with my purchase.

Another reviewer wrote "Well worth the peace of mind," and I can't agree with that more. They were easy to install (MUCH easier than other child-proofing products we've purchased!) and when we tipped the bookcases and dressers a bit to see how these hold up, we felt confident that they could withstand the force of a small child trying to climb them. They'd also worth great in earthquake-prone areas (I'm looking at you, California! :)). Well made, relatively inexpensive, and easy to install? These are a keeper!

I've read a few books focusing on parenting toddlers. I have a 22-month-old son (and a 2 month old, as well) and was having trouble disciplining him since his brother was born. Jo's book provides suggestions and in-depth examples and scenarios to assist in implementing her advice. I've been using her techniques for about a month now, and notice that although my son still has tantrums, my overall relationship with him is better. Some tips like getting down to your child's level, maintaining consistency with discipline, letting your child exercise, and providing a healthy diet for your child  may be common sense, but Jo goes into detail as to why she recommends what she does. She also emphasizes focusing on the child. All too often we get distracted by electronics or TV, when all our child wants is US! I deducted one star because at times the tone of the book was condescending, and I wish there was a recap at the end of the book because it felt a bit jumbled at times. Overall, this is my favorite parenting book I've read so far. I would (and have) recommended this book to friends and family.

Love Ran Red is Chris Tomlin's 11th record. From his first album, The Noise We Make, to now, he has been a huge influence to praise music and people everywhere. TIME magazine proclaimed him "likely the most often sung artist anywhere." Chris Tomlin has a GRAMMY Award, 18 Dove Awards, one platinum album, and three gold discs.Some questions people may have:Q. Is this album better than Burning Lights?A. I think it is, but the answer will differ depending on who you ask. Tomlin has more variety, the lyrics are more gospel-focused, and it is more worshipful than Burning Lights.Q. Is this a praise album?A. Yes. This album has more praise songs than Burning Lights did. Chris Tomlin seems to be returning to a focus on praise music.Q. Are the songs very different from Tomlin's usual style?A. In some ways, Tomlin has kept his old style, but he has also changed some things (he now uses more synth).Q. Is this a good album for someone who is new to CCM?A. I cannot think of a better album. The songs are full of praise to God, and are very well written and performed.Q. Should I buy the regular album or the Deluxe Edition?A. The deluxe edition includes the song In the End, an awesome remix of Waterfall, and two acoustic songs. Unless the difference in price is small, I would go for the regular album, because the only really amazing song you will get in the Deluxe Edition is the Waterfall Tritonal remix.These are the songs in Love Ran Red (with description):1.  GreaterA great way start to the album. The message is clear: Jesus is greater than my sin, and greater than the grave. The accompaniment and vocals go well together, creating an incredible song.2.  WaterfallThis song is amazing, combining a beautiful accompaniment that has piano, percussion, and more, with great vocals and stirring lyrics about God's love.3.  At the Cross (Love Ran Red)The background vocals, the piano, and the lyrics shine out on this song. The focus is on the cross, which is great.4.  Jesus Loves MeA beautiful song with a beautiful message. It is awesome to know that Jesus loves ME.5.  Boundary LinesThis song blew me away with the soaring melodies, upbeat synth accompaniments, incredible background vocals, and more. I love the line, "If my heart is a cup, Your love is an ocean."6.  AlmightyIn my opinion, this song rivals How Great Is Our God in its simplicity and worshipfulness.7.  The RoarAnother great song with a great message about God's deliverance.8.  Fear NotUnique accompaniments, a powerful bridge, and remarkable background vocals complete this song.9.  The TableThis unique, almost gospel-like song is very enjoyable.10.  Psalm 100This song is nothing short from amazing. With joyful lyrics from Psalm 100 and upbeat synth throughout the song, this song is sure to be loved by anyone who listens to it.11.  I Will BoastA beautiful, slow-moving song.12.  Jesus, This Is YouChris Tomlin has ended many of his albums with great songs, such as Shepherd Boy in Burning Lights, and Awakening in And If Our God Is For Us, but this song is better than any of them. Another worshipful song like Almighty, but much bigger.The deluxe edition includes these songs:13.  In The EndThis song has a nice melody, but, in my opinion, isn't quite as good as the other songs in the album.14.  Waterfall (Tritonal Remix)An incredible remix. I can't really find words to describe it.15.  At the Cross (Love Ran Red) (Acoustic)The acoustic version of At the Cross.16.  Let It Be Jesus (Acoustic)Chris Tomlin's acoustic cover of Let It Be Jesus, originally sung by Christy Nockels in the album Passion: Take It All.Album length: aprx. 49 min.Similar Christian Albums:Burning Lights by Chris TomlinPassion: Take It All by PassionYour Grace Finds Me by Matt RedmanThanks for reading! Please feel free to comment and rate my review helpful or unhelpful.

UPDATE: I now own the BDP-S1500, which is the 2015 equivalent of this Blu-ray player. I am very satisfied with it, and would suggest it over this model.When it comes to DVD and Blu-ray players, Sony is by far my favorite brand. I have owned, and still own multiple Sony DVD players and Blu-ray players, and every one of them is great. That's why I chose another Sony Blu-ray player.I must say, this Blu-ray player much exceeded my expectations. There are so many things I really like about it. It's starts up fast, and loads discs very fast. While some DVD/BD players have trouble with any amount of dirt or scratches on a disc, this one plays through most without a problem (though really dirty/scratched discs will of course still have problems).Best thing: NOT MADE IN CHINA!!! It's made in Malaysia (at least mine was).PICTURE/AUDIO QUALITY_____________________20/20Blu-ray discs look incredible (on an HDTV, of course). DVDs obviously aren't as nice, but still look great. The audio quality is awesome. I am using the coaxial audio port, but the HDMI carries audio, too. Beautiful digital surround sound audio!FEATURES_____________________17/20Besides being a BD/DVD/CD player, it also has a USB port for plugging in a USB flash drive and viewing personal pictures, videos, and music (which can be a little slow to load, though, when opening folders with many files). The USB port is also for BD-Live.But the big thing about this Blu-ray player is the internet apps, including Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, Hulu Plus, Vudu, YouTube, Pandora, AccuWeather, Facebook, and many others. It also has the Opera TV Store with more apps, but there's not much worth mentioning there. There are three things to note about the internet features, though: 1) Starting up the apps can be a bit slow, especially if your internet isn't very fast. Not too bad, but not as fast as my Vizio Smart TV. 2) Navigating is a little hard. Basically, there are a few columns for pictures, videos, music, and other things, and you have to scroll through the hundreds of apps with the up and down buttons on the remote. The more popular stuff is near the top, thankfully, so they're not too hard to reach. 3) You can't use Wi-Fi, you will need to plug it in with Ethernet.DESIGN_____________________18/20The compact design is very nice, but is too small to fit a front panel display, which shows the run time of the disc that's playing. To see how much of the disc has played and how much is left, you instead have to press the DISPLAY button on the remote (under the VOLUME control).REMOTE_____________________14/20I know, the remote is a little small. I can't complain about it, though, because of two things. First, after some practice, you can find most of the important buttons by feel. Second, the remote's range is huge, and it doesn't have to be pointed directly at the Blu-ray player. I'd also like to mention that the remote has controls for your TV, too (VOLUME, TV POWER, and INPUT). To get the remote to work with your TV, you have to hold down the TV POWER and enter a number (usually from 01-20). The manual will tell you which number you have to press for it to work with different TV brands. Some brands are not listed in the manual, but may still work with the remote. Just try entering every number from 01 to 20 until one of them works (Vizio is 04).VALUE_____________________10/20This Blu-ray player works well and has almost all the features you could possibly ask for, yet it is still affordable. UPDATE: Since this is a 2013 model, it is pretty outdated, and I do not recommend it any more. Instead, I suggest you take a look at Sony BDPS1500 Wired Streaming Blu-Ray Disc Player (Black).Thanks for reading! Please feel free to comment or rate my review helpful or unhelpful.

What's good about it: It's tiny, so you can leave it in the USB port of your laptop and take it wherever you go. It's pretty powerful, so you can put your keyboard, mouse, etc. quite far away and not have any problems. It doesn't look cheaply made, so I'm pretty sure I'll lose it before I break it. It can also have up to six devices hooked up to it, which is very convenient.What's bad about it: Nothing really. It is easy to lose, but I would rather have it be tiny than for it to be big and bulky. I do think it is a little overpriced, but it is cheaper than buying a new mouse/keyboard/etc.All in all, it's really awesome, so if you need a replacement, don't hesitate to buy one.TROUBLESHOOTINGIf the receiver (dongle) isn't working, try some of these things: Go to Logitech's website and download the software for the receiver (just Bing or Google "Logitech Unifying Receiver Software"). Make sure the batteries in the keyboard, mouse, etc. are fresh. Make sure the keyboard, mouse, etc. isn't too far away from the receiver (dongle). Make sure the receiver (dongle) is plugged in firmly.If you have further questions, feel free to post a comment.Thanks for reading! Please feel free to comment and rate my review helpful or unhelpful.

I have had this monitor for a few months now, and have been able to compare it to many other monitors. I previously used a slightly older Dell monitor (it was a 1909w), and I must say, this one is much better. I love the fact that it is 16x9. I don't like 16x10 monitors as much, because widescreen videos don't fill the screen. I also love the full-HD 1080p resolution. The picture is very sharp. As for the sound, I haven't used the speakers, so I don't know how they sound. I wouldn't expect much from them, though.COLORS__________________18/20The colors are very vivid and real. All my older Dell monitors' colors were a bit warm, but this monitor's colors are very nice. I don't think you can find many monitors with better colors at this price.CONTRAST RATIO__________________17/20The blacks weren't quite as dark as I was hoping, but I definitely can't complain. The whites are amazing, but make sure ASCR is on (press the MENU button and go down to IMAGE, select ASCR, and change it to ON).FEATURES__________________18/20Having VGA, DVI, and HDMI makes this monitor easy to connect to a computer or laptop. Also has plenty of calibration settings, as well as preset settings, which is nice. It doesn't have USB ports or a headphone port, so that's why it got an 18/20, instead of 20/20.DESIGN__________________15/20The monitor looks nice, but it won't stun you with its beauty. The stand tilts and has a hole in the back to run the cables through, so that you can't see them from the front of the monitor.VALUE__________________19/20You can't go wrong with this monitor. You will get amazing quality at a decent price. Remember that Amazon's prices can change rapidly, so watch out for a price drop.By the way: I noticed this monitor has been discontinued by manufacturer. I think it was replaced by the VE228H-P. Here's the link: ASUS VS228H-P 22-Inch Full-HD 5ms LED-Lit LCD MonitorThanks for reading! Please feel free to comment or rate my review helpful or unhelpful.

I own many desktop speakers, so I can compare these to many other speaker systems. Besides these, I have the Logitech Z506 5.1 Speaker System, Cyber Acoustics CA-3602 2.1 Speaker System, and the Altec Lansing VS-4121 2.1 Speaker System.Logitech Surround Sound Speakers Z506: These speakers are incredible for movies, and quite good for music (such as electronic/dance and pop)Cyber Acoustics Subwoofer Satellite System (CA-3602a): Immensely popular, these speakers are great for music (pop, jazz, and electronic/dance sound great on them)Altec Lansing VS4121 Powered Audio System (Black): I've heard many good things about this brand, but these specific speakers are quite outdated, and are okay for music, movies and games.Now, these speakers (VM ECXS212): Great for music (rock, pop, and songs with plenty of bass) and nice for movies, too.Considering the price, these speakers really blew me away. The bass is the best part; it's rich and powerful. The mids are audible, but seem a little lacking. The highs are clear, but are not extremely impressive.AUDIO QUALITY___________________18/20As I said earlier, the bass is impressive. The 50-watt subwoofer pumps out deep bass, but the 15-watt speakers (30 watts altogether) can be heard over it, although the mids and highs aren't perfect. These speakers are great for music with lots of bass, but are really nice for movies, too.DESIGN___________________7/20Unfortunately, I cannot rate design very high. The volume control is on the front of the subwoofer, which is supposed to be placed on the ground, thus making it hard to reach. The bass control and power switch are on the back of the subwoofer, making it even harder to reach. Also, it does not have a headphone port or a second Aux. in. I guess VM sacrificed ease of use to put more money into great sound. If hard to reach volume controls isn't a major problem for you, you will get a serious bang for your buck.DURABILITY___________________15/20These speakers have taken some minor spills, and still look and work great. The speakers do feel a little light, but are quite hard to knock over.VISUAL APPEAL___________________14/20The subwoofer looks really nice, but the LED light on the front is a little bright (it does turn off when you turn off the speakers, though). I have seen better-looking speakers, but they are pretty good.VALUE___________________18/20These speakers definitely outperform many others in this price range. Overall, a great buy, as long as having the volume control on the subwoofer isn't a problem.Thanks for reading! Please feel free to comment or rate my review helpful or unhelpful.

I am one of those people who does lots of research before buying something. After looking at hundreds (maybe thousands) of headphones, I found these. Here is why I chose them over all the others I looked at:After much research, I found that there are basically two types of headphones, those for studio use, and those for home use. Many popular headphone brands such as Audio Technica and Sennheiser make headphones for studio use, which are not as good for listening to music, watching movies, or playing games. Since I wanted headphones for music, those were out of the question.Headphones for home use can be further divided into: headphones designed for music (like Beats and Skullcandy headphones), headphones designed for games (like Logitech and Razer headphones), and headphones designed for multiple things (Bose headphones are great for music and movies). There are also home theater headphones, but those aren't so common. These headphones fall into the music category, though they're pretty good for movies, too.When comparing music headphones, I found that headphones such as Beats and Skullcandy were not rated very highly by critics, partly because they were overpriced. Sony brand headphones had much better ratings. Because of the ratings and the price, I went for these, and couldn't be happier.AUDIO QUALITY_____________________19/20If you want incredible sound, these headphones are for you. The highs are beautiful. The mids are clear and easy to hear. The bass is rich and powerful, but doesn't drown out mids or highs. The range is huge: 3hz-28khz, and I can hear things I couldn't hear on other headphones.Electronic/dance and pop music sounds best on these, but rock and classical are great, too. Jazz and hard rock are okay, but not as amazing as the other genres.NOISE REDUCTION_____________________14/20These aren't noise canceling, so you don't need to put batteries into them, but that does mean more ambient noise can be heard. Although they are on-ear headphones, the cushions really envelope your ears, so a good amount of outside noise is blocked. I found that while mowing the lawn, the headphones cut the sound of the mower almost in half, and I could hear my music pretty well. Though not perfect, it does a pretty good job.COMFORT_____________________20/20I have worn Beats headphones. Great. I have worn Sennheiser headphones. Nice. I have worn Bose. Very Good. The list goes on. But when I put these on, I went AHHHHHHH! These are so comfortable, I sometimes look forward to putting them on. The pads are squishy and a little cool to the touch, but can heat up after a while. 20/20 for comfort.PORTABILITY_____________________18/20The cups swivel 90 and flatten out to 8 in. x 1  in. x 7  in. If you want to put them in the case, though, you have to collapse the cups (make sure the pads face each other). The case is 6  in. x 4 in. x 5  in. The cable, which locks in place in the headphones, is easily detachable, and can be placed with the  inch adapter in a pocket inside the case. The cable is short (4 feet) and wide, so it is hard to tangle. The case does have some nooks and crannies for storing a small mp3 player, USB, etc. 18/20.APPEARANCE_____________________17/20To me, these headphones look pretty cool, but they don't stick out and scream, "WEIRDO!" like yellow Beats would. These headphones also come in silver/red, but are priced different than the silver/black, so be careful. I would actually suggest silver/red, because it has better (and more) sellers, but that's subject to change.VALUE_____________________19/20These headphones are a HUGE bang for your buck as long as:1) You can get a great deal for them. The retail price for these is anywhere from $100-$300. Amazon's prices go as low as around $80 (and less if you buy it used), which is definitely a great deal.2) These are the type of headphones you want. Great for music, not so great for studio or professional use (such as mixing).Thanks for reading! Please feel free to comment or rate my review helpful or unhelpful.

Just so you know: Before buying this HDTV, make sure that the model number has a "B" in the number and not an "A", which is the 2013 model (unless it's the 80 inch, which doesn't have a "B" model). The 2014 "B" model is definitely better. Also, different sizes of this model will have different statistics.I did countless hours of research and comparing HDTV's in stores. After much thought and many comparisons, I concluded that Samsung HDTV's had the best picture quality (at least to me). Their colors were very strong, vivid, and real, and their whites and blacks were amazing. The problem was the cost. Probably second or third best in picture quality came Vizio, and at a much more affordable price.When looking to buy an HDTV, I found this Vizio HDTV, and compared it to the Samsung HDTV's for sale on Amazon. There were three Samsung HDTV's with a 120Hz refresh rate (like the Vizio) in the size I was looking at (40-42 inches): The UN40H6203 Smart LED TV, the UN40H6350 Smart LED TV, and the UN40H6400 3D Smart LED TV. The latter two were too expensive for my budget, and the first one didn't have as good stats and features (only 2 HDMI ports, no back-lit keyboard on remote, etc.) Because of these things (and the fact that most of the one star reviews for this HDTV at the time were on the 2013 model), I chose this over the Samsung's, and I'm very glad I did. It has everything I could possibly ask for, especially at this price!COLORS:_____________________17/20The colors are not quite as good as good as a really nice Samsung HDTV, but incredible nonetheless.CONTRAST RATIO:_____________________19/20With the active LED zones, this HDTV can dim different parts of the screen for darker blacks. The blacks are so dark, that if you are viewing a blank black screen, you wouldn't easily be able to tell if the HDTV is on or off! The whites are really white, not yellowish or grayish.SMOOTH MOTION:_____________________20/20The 42-80 inch HDTV's in this model (the 2014 "B" model) are 120Hz true refresh rate, and the 32 inch is 60Hz. Motion is so smooth that it takes my breath away. Incredible for sports and movies with a lot of movement.SOUND:_____________________11/20The built-in speakers on this HDTV are slightly above average, for built-in speakers. They aren't muddy or tinny, and there is a very small amount of bass. You can always hook up a speaker system if you want great sound.DESIGN:_____________________19/20This HDTV is so beautiful that I sometimes just sit and stare at it, even when it's off. It is not ultra thin, but it is quite thin. The bezel, or frame, surrounding the screen is extremely thin, which makes it look very nice whether it's on or off. Everything about this HDTV looks like it was well thought through.REMOTE:_____________________19/20I love the remote! After a while, you can find most of the often used buttons by feel. This remote has all the important buttons, and has a keyboard at the back that lights up. It looks really nice, too.FEATURES:_____________________18/20This baby has hundreds of apps, including YouTube, Facebook, Amazon Instant Video, AccuWeather, Netflix, Twitter, iHeartRadio, Pandora, Spotify, and much more. It also has a USB port for viewing your personal pictures, videos, and music. It is wall mountable as well. It also has a built-in digital tuner, so you can plug your antenna right into the HDTV without a nasty converter box. You can even name the inputs, so that you know which input is for which device. There are lots of settings and calibrating you can do with it, but I won't go into detail.VALUE:_____________________20/20This is one of the top LED HDTV's (excluding, OLED and 4k UHD, which are in another league), yet at an affordable price. Although it isn't quite as nice as an expensive Samsung HDTV, It comes extremely close (and surpasses in some areas) and is a good amount cheaper. You can't go wrong with Vizio, especially this Vizio HDTV!Two more notes:#1: Most TV Manufacturers exaggerate the refresh rate. They come up with names such as Clear Motion Rate, SPS, or MotionFlow, and label their HDTV's with higher refresh rates than they actually have (for example: 240Hz Clear Motion Rate). When reading statistics, check for the true refresh rate, often called "Native Refresh Rate." These Vizio M-Series HDTV's are 120Hz true refresh rate (except for the 32 inch, which is 60Hz). In case you were wondering, the refresh rate tells you how many times the screen "refreshes," so generally, the higher the number, the smoother the motion will be.#2: Vizio has released the 2015 M Series. They are 4k Ultra HD (four times the resolution of full HD), and will probably be some of the most affordable 4k TVs this year (but if they are anything like the 2014 M series, they will still perform very well). They come in 43-80 inch sizes and are a bit more expensive than the 2014 version (but cheaper than the 2014 4k P Series). If you don't need 4k, I still highly recommend this TV.Thanks for reading! Please feel free to comment or rate my review helpful or unhelpful.

Pros:  It works  Cheap priceCons:  Cables are quite thin.  There is a little quality lossSummary:  This cable isn't incredible, but it is worthy of three stars because of the price. It's really cheap in price, and the quality is great.

Subwoofer - Approx 58 mm (2-3/8 in.) dia.*****UPDATE June 9th*****  My top 4 bluetooth speakers (that I own) are:1- SONY x552- Stelle Audio Pillar3- JBL Charge 24- JBL Clip (pocket-sized)  I don't go anywhere without podcasts and or music.Thank you.

Echo, the feisty heroine protagonist goes on a mission to find the "FIREBIRD" which legend holds- will finally put an end to the bitter fighting between the 2 factions. Oh, and along the way, she becomes involved in a love-triangle,  hehehe.  I like that the Author, Melissa Grey, was born and raised in New York City, thereby is able to describe it very well and in rich detail. I read that she wrote her first short story at the age of twelve and that after earning a degree in fine arts at Yale University she traveled the world. Well it definitely shows when she writes, in scrumptious detail, about about the many different foods to be had on this earth.

PROS:- Amazing loudness from such a small speaker- It's hard to believe so much bass coming from those little passive radiators.- Beautiful one-piece aluminum body- Most of the bottom is a rubber pad which eliminates vibration.- The Li-ion battery is user-replacable- Bluetooth works flawlessly- The prongs on the plug-in adapter fold flat: Sideways. I have never seen such ingenuity before.- A pleasure to listen to , even at full volume. A real rarity among small speakers.CONS:- The bass sounds a bit muffled, as if there is a towel in front of the speaker.- The highs are under represented, which means the bass and drums can get muddled together on certain tracks which are bass heavy.FYI:- after listening to 20 different speakers in the 100 - 200 dollar range, I chose the SONY srs-x5. It has a subwoofer for the lows and a surround-sound feature which adds sparkle to the highs. Go listen to both in person and listen for the individual instruments. I simply put on some Red Hot Chili Peppers and picked out the bass line quickly on the Sony, while it was hard to distinguish on the Bose.***UPDATED - May 11***My Top 4 portable speakers: 1- Sony SRS-X55 (NEW) 2- Sony SRS-X33 (new) 3- Denon Envaya mini 4- The Bose mini

As an ancient history enthusiast, I was well aware of Alexander the Greats campaigns, his amazing military victories, as well as his untimely death. I was also aware, in general terms, of the fact that his empire was ultimately divided among his top generals. However, I was not aware of the intricate details of how this partitioning actually took place or how bloody it turned out to be  the whole process lasting up to about a decade and a half after Alexanders death. Consequently, this book shed light on a period of ancient history that I knew very little about.I found that the author has done a superb job in recounting these complicated events, complete with the cast of intriguing characters, details of battles, political agendas, shrewdness showed by some and the unbridled determination of all parties involved. From one of the books sections to the next, the author hops from one or two individuals activities to those of another one or two, etc., while remaining more or less within the same timeline, i.e., this is what was happening over here while that is what was happening over there. This leads to several thrilling cliff-hangers which make the book very hard to put down. In addition, since many individuals have taken part in this story, the author often refreshes the readers memory of whos who by re-iterating an individuals identity when that person hasnt been discussed for several pages; I found this strategy to be indeed quite helpful.The writing style is clear, always lively, highly accessible and immensely captivating. Although any interested reader can enjoy this remarkable book, I believe that ancient history enthusiasts are likely to relish it the most.

In a book with this title and subtitle, I was expecting to see adequately detailed descriptions of navigational techniques complete with well-labelled geometrical diagrams as well as the necessary mathematics. I was also expecting to see a brief history of the sextant, along with clear diagrams of how it works. And finally, I was expecting to read about the adventures of past explorers and their contributions towards mapping the world. However, what I found within its covers was not quite all the above.On the positive side, I found the authors narratives about past explorers to be indeed quite captivating and lively. I think that it would have been difficult to write up these adventures in a more engrossing style. On the down side, as a reader with very little knowledge of navigation and its instruments, I found the discussions on the fundamentals of navigation to be not adequately illustrated. The sextant and its history are briefly outlined but not as detailed as I was hoping. Perhaps an appendix could have been included to contain clear and detailed figures and all of the necessary mathematics to allow an uninformed but mathematically-inclined reader like me to better understand what the various explorers had to do to find their way at sea using the sextant and the other techniques/instruments available. Also, the book contains a great many nautical terms that I was not familiar with. A brief glossary of some terms is included at the back of the book; however, a great many of the terms that I looked up there were not there. Needless to say, a significant part of the authors log entries during his trans-Atlantic voyage as a young man were unintelligible to me.Overall, I enjoyed the historical components of the book, but I was occasionally frustrated with the lack of technical navigational details. Consequently, I believe that those who are likely enjoy this book to the fullest are history enthusiasts who are already knowledgeable about navigation and about nautical terminology.

In this book, the author weaves a thrilling tale of a zombie apocalypse falling upon an unsuspecting town. Written in the first person, the story revolves around a mathematics professor at a local college who gradually stumbles upon various uninfected colleagues and students who try to escape a zombie invasion and survive. Generously peppered throughout the story are detailed discussions on the mathematics, i.e., calculus, used to quantify various zombie characteristics. Most of the more involved derivations and calculations are relegated to an appendix which continues the story, in parts, through more detailed mathematics. Finally, a second appendix contains a more leisurely discussion between two of the characters about the basics of calculus  essentially a brief review.I found this book to be really quite captivating. In fact, the story was so gripping that I had difficulty putting the book down. The calculus is very well presented in a clear and accessible manner. In the books introduction, the author recommends that readers should have learned at least some calculus to better appreciate the book overall. I agree with that recommendation. However, a reader with no knowledge of mathematics and who totally ignores all of the mathematical discussions could still follow the essence of this thriller, i.e., the more typical human components.Finally, on a more realistic note, its hard to believe that a group of people who are fallen upon by a horde of murderous shuffling zombies would find the time or have the stomach to partake in teaching each other the finer points of calculus. But it certainly does make for a more enriching story.

Its been a while since Ive read a book as absolutely gripping as this one. The books title is certainly appropriate since all the stories discussed display some element of mystery. But the author does more than just recount them; he provides excellent, thoughtful and very often witty, commentary as the stories evolve. I was already familiar with a few of the stories in this book, but the way in which they are presented here is clearly the best and most engaging that Ive read so far.As can be gleaned from the above, I found the authors writing style to possess all of the essential characteristics found in the best page-turners. The prose is friendly, smooth, lively, adequately detailed, clever, accessible and highly absorbing. When I reached the end of the book, I was actually disappointed  I wanted to read about even more mysteries. Needless to say I found the book almost impossible to put down.Im sure that this book can be enjoyed by absolutely anyone, especially those who love good mysteries - particularly when they are either alleged to be true or are simply popular myths or legends. History enthusiasts should also find this book quite intriguing.
