After having read this book from cover to cover, I can say that I am a bit disappointed. Although the author writes in a friendly accessible prose, some of his technical explanations are not so clear; a few even seem to be self contradictory. Unfortunately, I found this to be a relatively common occurrence in his prior two books of this series. However, I did find his first one, 100 Essential Things You Didnt Know You Didnt Know, to be a bit better than the next two.In the books 100 chapters, several topics are discussed. So, as expected based on personal interest, I found some quite captivating and informative but others rather boring. A few chapters contain some simple mathematical formulas but most do not. I would have preferred more mathematics since this might have compensated for the lack of adequate written explanations. In most of the chapters one does find some association between mathematical concepts and one of the arts.This book may be of interest to those with a curiosity about relationships between the arts and mathematics. Even the artistically inclined math-phobic could learn quite a bit from this book without the fear of being encumbered by mathematical formulas.

In this spellbinding book, the authors describe volcanic eruptions in the world with particular attention to the effects on humans, civilization and the environment. But the books main focus is on an Icelandic volcano called Laki and on the devastating effects of its 1783 eruption on the local inhabitants as well as in Europe and indeed the Northern Hemisphere. Other volcanic eruptions discussed include Toba, Tambora, Krakatau, Vesuvius, Etna and several others mainly in Iceland. Although the mechanics/geology of eruptions is briefly discussed, its the actual materials/chemicals that are spewed out and their respective devastating effects that the authors devote more space to.I must say that I had a very hard time putting this book down. The prose is clear, friendly, very lively, highly accessible and immensely captivating. The descriptions of the effects of the eruptions on people and livestock are particularly heart-wrenching. This book can be enjoyed by absolutely anyone, especially those interested in the devastating effects of volcanic eruptions and what the future may hold.

This is the second book from these authors, depicting various events in the lives of funeral directors. I have read their first one (Mortuary Confidential) and enjoyed it, but I found this one much better from my perspective. The prior book contained 50 stories from mortuaries across the USA, as collected and published by the authors. However, in this highly captivating book, the authors recount many of their own experiences in their profession, as well as a few choice stories from abroad. In addition, they share various aspects of their own personal lives, thus making this book more personable and, to me, more appealing. Although their prior book is mentioned a few times, reading it is not a prerequisite for reading this one.The authors writing style is, as in their prior book, clear, friendly and accessible; but in this case I found it more lively and engaging. Once again, the fact that the authors shared so much of their own personal histories in this profession made the book more enjoyable to me. This book can be relished by anyone, especially those with a curiosity about the people who work in this relatively mysterious field.I found that both books take a much needed light-hearted look at a subject that makes many people feel rather uncomfortable.

I learned quite a bit from this fascinating book. The authors main focus is on the rarity and/or value of various metals, e.g., the rare earths, gold, silver, platinum and several others. In doing so, he discusses our planets natural resources as well as their distribution, geology, chemistry and the technologies that would benefit from these metals. He also delves into various quite interesting issues such as politics, both national and international, military conflicts, economics, waste disposal and even the possibility of acquiring these metals from outside our planet.I found the authors breadth and depth of knowledge to be quite impressive, especially on the related socio-political issues in the world. I also found the writing style to be clear, lively, friendly, often witty and widely accessible.On the down side, I found a number of inaccuracies mainly in the early chapters where nuclear physics is discussed. I have listed the main ones at the end of this review for those who are interested as well as for consideration by the author should a revised edition of this book be published in the future.Overall, I found this book to be quite captivating. It can be enjoyed by anyone, particularly science enthusiasts as well as those interested in the social, political and scientific problems that may be faced in the development of new technology.Inaccurate/Misleading Information1) At the bottom of page 53, it seems to be implied that plutonium was used in both bombs dropped on Japan during World War II. In fact, the Hiroshima bomb was a uranium bomb.2) Near the bottom of page 57, the Ivy Mike test is discussed where it is pointed out that it was a twelve-kiloton explosion  four times the combined might of the atomic bombs dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki. In fact the yield of the Ivy Mike test was about 10 megatons making it about 300 times the yield of the combined bombs dropped on Japan.3) The discussion on the decay of carbon-14 on page 72 and its use in radiocarbon dating is incorrect. Carbon-14 decays by beta minus emission to stable nitrogen-14. What is used in carbon-14 dating is the concentration ratio of carbon-14 atoms relative to carbon-12 atoms in a formerly living organism - carbon-14 decaying at a known rate, thus decreasing the above ratio at a known rate over time. Carbon -14 is never stable, before or after the organism dies.4) Regarding the creation of curium and americium, near the top of page 73, it should be noted that neither of these two elements have any stable isotopes.5) Near the bottom of page 101, the inverse square law is discussed. In calculating the dose rate at a given distance from a source of ionizing radiation, several factors must be taken into account, e.g., nature of radiation, shielding, scattering, source shape, etc. If one is using the inverse square law, this implies that the source must be a point source as seen at the distance where the dose rate is being determined.

When I read the comments on this books cover, I thought that it would be filled with hilarious, knee-slapping anecdotes from funeral directors as they were experienced during their careers. After all, the potential is certainly there. But what I found was different.This book is comprised of a series of fifty stories/experiences reported by various funeral directors (or their staff) across the USA during their careers. The book is divided into a series of sections that cover the different aspects of their business: removal of bodies, preparing them, interactions with family members of the deceased, wakes, funerals, etc.I found most of the stories to be interesting in that they represent various incidents that can happen during a funeral director (or parlor employee)s day-to-day life in the business. Some of the stories were rather sad, some were mildly humorous but most were events somewhere in the middle. So, the outrageous hilarity that I was expecting was definitely not there. In retrospect, I believe that people in any trade/profession could write a similar book, possibly with much more humour, especially if dealing with members of the public is a factor.The book is well-written in a style that is clear, friendly, accessible and occasionally lively. It should be of interest to anyone curious about the professional lives of people who take care of us after we die.

With a twisted sense of humour, tremendous wit, plenty of pub-friendly lingo, lots of odd sketches and a wild yet fertile imagination, the authors of this book have presented a great many tidbits of information which they claim is all true. The topics are quite varied, but they are all carefully classified by subject  40 of them  each subject being presented in the form of a list of four or five (or more) entries which are each discussed over a page or two.Once I got used to the lingo, there were still a few one-liners that went over my head, especially those involving some peoples names - people that Ive never heard of before (but thats only due to my own ignorance). However, I did find the book quite enjoyable and a rather quick read.This book should appeal to a wide range of readers, especially those in search of odd facts and plenty of hearty laughter.

Ive been following Arnolds progress in bodybuilding since the 1970s. I also read his book Arnold: The Education of a Bodybuilder as soon as it came out. So I was already familiar with much of the information in about the first third of this book. After enjoying Arnolds series of movies over the years, I lost track of him when he went into U.S. politics and became governor of California. This book contains all of stages in Arnolds life and it certainly filled in the gaps for me. Of particular interest were the behind-the-scenes activities/problems/challenges/etc. faced by actors and movie makers when developing and filming a movie. This gave me a new insiders perspective for when I watch Arnolds movies again.I found this book to be not only an excellent page-turner, but also a most inspiring work. Arnolds intrinsic mindset, his bull-headed determination in setting difficult goals and working hard to succeed in achieving them, and his much sought-after ability to turn obstacles into opportunities have been instrumental in constructing the amazing life that he has led.Arnold has always been an icon for me, so it goes without saying that this book should be greatly enjoyed by Arnold fans, like me, everywhere. But I also believe that there is so much here that anyone could appreciate: one can learn a great deal about life in general and that the fulfillment of ones dreams is attainable  if one is willing to make the necessary sacrifices and do the necessary work.

One would think that a book detailing the history of nuclear/atomic accidents, with lots of technical detail, would likely be of interest only to the most devoted nuclear/reactor physicists/engineers. Not so in this case! Certainly there are a lot technical descriptions of how reactors and other apparatus are made and how they operate, as well as play-by-play descriptions of how the various accidents occurred and their aftermaths. The descriptions are clear, most specialized terms are explained and the events leading to the various disasters are told in a most captivating way. But in my view, what makes this book so special is the authors writing style, particularly his careful choice of words when describing the events that transpired: wittiness, tongue-in-cheek narratives, subtle sarcasm, etc. I often found myself laughing out loud at the way the author presents some of his material. Because of all of this, at least in part, I believe that this book can be enjoyed by a fairly broad readership.One might expect that a tome like such as this one would contain a number of mistakes  editorial or otherwise. I must admit that I found very few. Other than a couple of misprints, i.e., on page 12, radium-266 should be radium 226 and on page 283, cesium-167 should be cesium-137, I did find one error of greater significance which may of interest to nit-pickers like me: footnote 82 at the bottom of page 99 is incorrect. In particular, the roentgen (R) and the rem are entirely different quantities. Very briefly, the roentgen applies only to X-ray and gamma-ray photons and is defined in terms of the ionization of air, i.e., the absolute value of the total charge of the ions of one sign produced per unit mass of air. Roentgens can be converted to rads (or rems) to human tissue using appropriate conversion factors whose values depend on the energy of the incident photons.Overall, I believe that this book is a major contribution to the literature that describes various aspects of the nuclear field, which has often been perceived by the general public as being disturbing and obscure, in understandable, relatively jargon-free, language. It puts various nuclear accidents into perspective and makes the structure and operation of several nuclear devices more widely accessible.

From getting up in the morning to going to bed at night, the author describes a typical day in his life, all the while concentrating on mathematizing various things/events/processes that he sees around him. From functions to differentiation to integration, the reader is gently guided through the nature of calculus and how it can be used to solve various problems in the real world. This is all done in a most painless way; the more in-depth calculational details are relegated to appendices. Although, as pointed out by the author, the mathematical models that are developed here are crude approximations to reality, the approaches that are used are important and serve to illustrate the power of calculus.On the down side, I did find a few errors, e.g., Galileo did not invent the telescope (as stated on p.17), the speed of light is not 11,176,920 miles per second (as given on p. 47), etc. However, I did not find many such mistakes and they do not detract from the essence of the book.I found the writing style to be very friendly, lively, authoritative, highly accessible and quite captivating. Although any interested reader could enjoy this little book (117 pages of main text), it would likely be most appreciated by math/science enthusiasts. The book could also be used as an enjoyable complement to an introductory course in calculus.

In this enjoyable book, the author recounts what is currently known about the history of the San Andreas Fault in California and the mechanics of earthquakes in general. Adjacent faults are also discussed and explanations are provided as to how these faults are related to each other, how they behave and, of course, the damage that associated earthquakes have caused. The author also provides brief yet quite captivating accounts of the contributions of dedicated individuals who have done pioneering research into the scientific understanding of earthquakes. Included are: the types of faults, how earthquake magnitudes are measured, important considerations for building structures, efforts at predicting future cataclysms, etc.I found this book to be well written in a style that is friendly, lively and generally captivating. However, since some of the passages are fairly technical, e.g., types of rocks and strata, types of faults, interrelationships between them, etc., I believe that diagrams/figures should have been included for illustration purposes; such figures would certainly have helped me.I believe that this book can be enjoyed by a fairly broad readership: general readers can glean information on earthquakes and human efforts towards understanding them, and avid earth science buffs can, in addition, appreciate the more technical discussions.

The end of the Bronze Age, which has been estimated to have occurred c. 1200 B.C., has been the subject of much discussion among scholars for many years. The main issue being: How could several thriving empires  the civilized world at the time - all suddenly collapse within just a few years/decades? In this fascinating book, the author, an archaeologist and expert on this topic, attempts to answer this intriguing question.Starting a few centuries earlier (fifteenth century B.C.), the author sets the scene. He describes the empires/civilizations that existed at the time, how they evolved and how they interacted with each other, especially through trade. He then describes the destruction of each of these major centers: when it happened and how it appears to have happened. He then discusses each of the probable causes for such a widespread calamity. Throughout, he backs up his arguments with solid, up-to-the-minute archaeological evidence and also presents the views of other scholars in this field.  Finally, he describes what he and several other experts believe actually happened to bring an end the Bronze Age  something which I found rather surprising yet very compelling.For me, this book was quite engaging and very hard to put down. The author writes for a wide readership in a style that is authoritative yet accessible, lively, friendly and very captivating. I believe that this book can be enjoyed by any interested reader; however, ancient history/archaeology enthusiasts, like me, should be in for a treat.

I found this to be a truly amazing book! The author, a professor of physics and a long-time science fiction aficionado, provides a scientifically critical look at science fiction and fantasy stories. The book is divided into four main parts: fantasy (wizards, etc.), space travel, other worlds/aliens, and the survival of humanity (world building, possible future capabilities, etc.). The author does not shy away from the mathematics involved. Consequently, (and to the joy of math/science enthusiasts like me) the book contains plenty of formulas that are immensely helpful in better understanding the various points that the author makes. These formulas are kept simple, are not generally derived but are clearly explained and used in the main text.I found the authors writing style to be very clear, quite authoritative, lively and extremely captivating. On the down side, the book contains a significant number of editorial mistakes of various sorts. Also, in some formulas, sometimes the same symbol is used for different quantities (in different formulas); this can be sorted out through careful reading of the text. Finally, in a very few formulas, a given symbol is not defined; again, a careful perusal of the text can usually make sense of them.Despite the fact that those who are math phobic may cringe at the sight of the books subtitle, I do believe that they can still enjoy it and learn much from it  the authors prose alone contains all the essential information. Consequently, I think that this book can be enjoyed by any interested reader; however, science buffs should relish it the most.

The books title refers to Edmond Halleys ocean voyages which were commissioned to map the deviations of magnetic north from true north  this mainly to provide a tool for mariners to estimate longitude at sea. However, the book contains much more. In fact, Halleys scientific life is rather well covered, as well as his interactions with his contemporaries, e.g., Isaac Newton, Robert Hooke, John Flamsteed, etc. Halleys interests in so many scientific disciplines, as well as his significant contributions to them, are truly outstanding.I found the book to be generally well-written in a lively, often quite gripping prose. My only disappointment was with some of the passages pertaining to scientific, technical and nautical matters. Several specialized terms were used without being defined or explained. Science enthusiasts, like me, have an advantage here in the scientific discussions; however, in my case, some of the nautical terms left me scratching my head.But despite this shortcoming, I believe that this book could be still enjoyed by a wide readership -  particularly by those who have a penchant for seventeenth/eighteenth century European history and, of course, by science buffs.

In this charming little book, the author discusses various aspects of randomness. From ancient perspectives on chance events to modern thought on whether randomness truly exists, the author guides the reader through a subject matter that has perplexed humankind for millennia. In addition, various probability problems are discussed, as are results of research in this fascinating discipline.The author writes well, in a prose that is friendly, lively and engaging. I did find, however, that some of the technical discussions could have been explained a bit more clearly. This book can be enjoyed by any interested reader.

This is one of several books on the risks of medical screening that have been written in recent years. Here, in eleven chapters, the author discusses the screening of various body parts to search for abnormalities: from whole body CT scans to eyeball pressure  there are even chapters on mental health screening and self-screening. In each case, he discusses how the supposed need for the screening of healthy individuals came about, the promoters, the techniques used, their effectiveness (or lack thereof), the dangers involved of the techniques themselves and the possible post-screening consequences. Along the way, he presents various case studies of healthy individuals who were somehow injured through unnecessary medical screening. Throughout, the author makes what I think are common-sense recommendations that should be seriously considered by everyone.I found the authors writing style to be clear, friendly, lively and quite captivating. I believe that this book, and others like it, should be read by everyone, if only to make healthy people aware of the possible dangers of medical screening and guide them towards making well-informed decisions.

Several decades ago, I took a superb thermodynamics course as part of a university physics program. It was extremely theoretical with, as can be expected, a lot of mathematical derivations, proofs, etc., but short on applications to the real world. This excellent book complements such a course: it is loaded with actual applications of various heat engines: jet, gasoline, diesel, refrigerators, heat pumps, etc.The book is designed so that it does necessarily not have to be read from cover to cover, which is what I did. Consequently, each chapter contains a certain amount of repetition  something which I found to be quite refreshing. References are routinely made to other chapters regarding various techniques, definitions, etc. Once a topic is presented, practical examples are given in a clear step-by-step format. The various formulas that are included are simple and generally not derived in the book.I noticed that the author has used various terms/quantities that I was not familiar with. It turns out that these are particularly useful in the engineering/technological world and not necessary in the theoretical physics domain.I believe that this book could be extremely useful to engineering/technology students because of its friendly style, clarity and all the practical applications. But I also believe that it could be useful for physics students who are exposed mainly to the theory/mathematics/derivations in thermodynamics but less to real world applications.

Holy Cow!!!!  What an ending!!!  Lauren has stepped up her game when it comes to suspense.  She definitely left me hanging with this one.  Lauren is truly a master when it comes to giving us passion, suspense, mystery and romance in her stories.Sinful Longing is the 3rd book in Lauren's Sinful Nights series.  This series is a romantic suspense series.  Each of these books are about a new couple but the storyline is a continuing one, so it is not recommended to read these books out of order.  I think you would be lost or confused if you did.The Sinful Nights series is about the Sloan family (Shannon, Ryan, Colin and Michael) and their love interests, but it is also about solving some old haunts when it comes to the murder of their father 18 years ago.  The mysterious storyline begins in Sweet Sinful Nights (Book  1) and Sinful Desire (Book 2) and then carries over into this book and will conclude in Sinful Love (Book 4).  Some questions are answered in this book, but some new ones are created.  I am going to go ahead and label this book a Cliffhanger, because the epilogue will definitely leave you hanging and wanting Michael's book ASAP!!!!  Now that I say that, you don't have to wait for Sinful Love (Michael's Book) to be released to read this book.  Just know that some new questions are going to arise when you finish reading this book.  I know I can't wait to see how this story will be wrapped up in the final book.I have to be honest and say this isn't my favorite out of the three books so far.  I just felt something was missing in this story.  Now don't get me wrong the suspenseful storyline is truly what saved this book for me, that and all the spicy scenes ;)  I love where this story is going and that Lauren keeps the reader guessing all the way through.  What I had trouble with in this book was the connection between Colin and Elle.  It was just missing something.  I had a hard time connecting with Elle's character.  As for Colin he is just as dreamy as his brother Ryan and he sure knows how to melt a pair of panties!!!Colin and Elle's story is all about taking risks.  Elle is a single mother of a 14 year boy and she is a social worker at a community center.  That is how Colin and Elle know each other.  Colin is a venture capitalist who volunteers at the center.  Colin is also a recovering addict and Elle is scared to connect with Colin because her husband died of a drug overdose and Elle watched him spiral out of control.  She is afraid of that happening with Colin and she won't put her son through that again.  So to say that they are more like friends with benefits would be an accurate portrayal of their relationshipat least in the beginning.  As time moves on and Colin and Elle open up to each other, Elle learns she can trust Colin and he isn't like her dead husband.  But of course things get in their way and Elle is quick to push him away.  Will Colin's risk taking and past come between these two??  You need to read this book to find out.At the end of Sinful Desire we meet Marcus and he is revealed as the Sloan's half brother.  His mom is their mom also.  I liked that we got to know Marcus more in this book and loved the connection she created between him and the Sloan siblings.  I am interested in seeing how things will work out after the bomb Marcus drops at the end of the book.  It was also great seeing the other couples in this book.  We got more Ryan and Sophie in this story and I was thrilled about that because they are my favorite couple of this series.  We did get a little bit of a sneak peek at Michael in this book and hints about his past, I am interested to see who his love interest will be.So I'll leave you with this.even though this isn't my favorite, you still need to READ this series/book!!!  You won't be sorry and I can be sure that you will become addicted to Ms. Blakely's writing like I am.  I look forward to every book she releases and I always walk away with a smile on my face and wanting more of her books!!!

I am not one who normal picks up a book that is in the middle or end of series, but I have always heard great things about Carly Phillips books and the cover and blurb for Dare to Seduce caught my attention.  I am a sucker for a forbidden Brother's Best Friend love story.Now as with any interconnected standalone series, like this one, Each book can be read by itself, but to get the true feeling of the characters it is recommended to read the books in order.  Now don't worry if you don't because this is the first book in this series I have read and I wasn't lost or felt like I was missing anything.  Carly does a wonderful job keeping the reader informed about past couples or characters.  I will admit however, that after reading this book I am definitely going back to read all the other books in this series.  I fell in love with Carly's writing style and creative stories and lovable characters.  Plus she knows how to write one steamy love story ;)One thing I truly enjoyed about this book was that we get to the heart of the story right away.  Carly doesn't add in extra details to the story.  I find that refreshing :)  This was also a fairly quick read written in dual POV.  Also this book wasn't overloaded with outside drama.  Any drama that was written into the story was caused by the fears or insecurities of the heroine.  But what I loved the most was how Max stuck by Lucy no matter what.  He wouldn't allow her to run away because of her fears.  He helped her work through things.  Truthfully they helped each other overcome past fears and pains.In this story we follow the love story of Max Savage (Best Friend of Gabe and Decklan Dare, Lucy's brothers) and Lucy Dare.  This is definitely a friends to lovers story, but in the end it is also kind of like a second chance love story.  Lucy and Max have known each other since they were kids.  Lucy of course has been in love with Max since then, but Max's feelings didn't truly grow until Lucy was older and returned home from College.  Scared her brother's wouldn't approve Max fought his feelings.  Some seriously tragic things happen, which intern keep Lucy and Max apart for years.  Now Lucy is back for her brother Decklan's engagement party and Max isn't letting her slip through his fingers again.  Can Max and Lucy finally give into their feelings and find their HEA??  You'll need to read this book to find out.I would definitely recommend this book.  If you are looking for a quick, sweet and sexy friend's to lovers story, then you don't want to pass this one up.  I know after reading this book, I look forward to reading the other's in this series.  Carly Phillips has definitely found herself a new fan :)

The only downfall to Kendall Ryan writing a novella, is that it is not nearly long enough!!!  I want more of Hudson and Gracie!!!I fell in love with Hudson in Screwed and was excited to find out he was getting his own story.  This book didn't disappoint at all.  I love Hudson even more now and Gracie was just so sweet and innocent, But not in an annoying way.Monster Prick is a standalone novella told in Dual POV.  It is a forbidden romance story because it is a story about a brother's best friend, which we all know is forbidden territory.  This is a very quick read and should only take a couple hours to read at most.  But what I thought was great, was that even though this is a novella, I didn't feel like anything was missing.  We got a fun, sweet and sexy read.  She even added a touch of drama to keep things interesting.  I think the reason I had such a connection to these characters was because we met them in Screwed.  That book is not required to be read first but to get the true feeling of both Gracie and Hudson, I would recommend it.Gracie and Hudson have known each other most of their lives and both have been harboring hidden feelings for one another the whole time.  Gracie has always held back her feelings because she didn't think Hudson would ever go for her.  And Hudson always held back because of his close friendship with Hayden (Gracie's Brother).  That is until Gracie announces that she signed up for online dating and was looking for someone to take her v-card from her.  Hudson, not happy with that at all, comes up with a plan to help her.  What neither of them were expecting was that their feelings might grow into something much bigger.  Find out how Gracie and Hudson weather the storm as they enter uncharted territory, by reading Monster Prick.  Will these two get their HEA??  You'll have to read it to find out.If you are a fan of Kendall Ryan's you don't want to miss this little gem.  If you are someone looking to pass a couple hours with a sweet and sexy read, then you definitely should give this novella a try, you won't be sorry!!!!

No matter whether she is writing about a swoony cowboy or fast talking NASCAR driver, Kelly Elliott knows how to write about LOVE.Ignite is the first book in a new series by Kelly Elliott and it was just as fabulous as her Wanted Series.  I love reading anything by Kelly because her books just sweep me away.  She writes such swoony love stories, you can't help but fall in love with her characters and stories.What I loved about this book was that she went outside of her norm and entered the world of race car driving.  I haven't read too many books about NASCAR so that piqued my interest right away, but then knowing Kelly wrote it, I knew I HAD to read this book.  I am so glad I did, because what we got is the best of Kelly Elliott.  This book was told in Dual POV.  It's a second chance romance book with the hint of suspense.  The book was truly about the love story between Emmitt and Adaline, but she added some suspense to the storyline to keep you turning the pages.  She was even able to shock me at the end of the book.  I totally didn't see it coming.This is the love story of Emmitt and Adaline.  Emmitt and Adaline have been friends since elementary school and then moved into a relationship as they grew older.  At age 19 Emmitt was starting to make a name for himself in the NASCAR world, but Adaline wanted to follow her own dreams.  She has wanted to be a nurse and go to school for that.  So deciding to follow her dreams she decides to leave Emmitt and go to school.  Now it's 3 years later and she is ready to go back to Emmitt.  Although Emmitt might not have the same feelings.Adaline's return into Emmitt's life was not a smooth one.  Even though Emmitt has loved Addie for the past three years he is having trouble letting go of the hurt.  I enjoyed watching these two work through everything.  They do have their ups and downs and Addie has some trust issues, but over all they function together fairly well.  Just like her cowboys, Emmitt the NASCAR driver was great!!!  Even though in the beginning he was a player, I fell in love with him as the story progressed.  What I loved about both these characters was that they loved with their whole heart and went after what they wanted!!!As always Kelly introduced us to some wonderful secondary characters, and she also gave us those characters we love to hate.  It wouldn't be a Kelly Elliott book without some of the drama she cooks up.  I am looking forward to reading Malcolm's book..that is going to be an interesting story ;)So if you love Kelly Elliott or are looking for a great second chance love story built around the world of NASCAR, then you aren't going to want to miss this book!!!

The Last Shot is the third novel that I have read by Sara Hubbard and I really enjoyed it.  Her stories suck me in with her blurbs and then keep ahold of me as soon as I read the first page.  I took a chance on a new author when I read her book inCAPABLE and I am still extremely happy I did.  She hasn't disappointed me yet.What I love the most about her books is that she doesn't overload them with extra stuff that normally slows a story down.  She keeps the pace and flow moving right along.The Last Shot is a second chance love story based around a hockey theme.  I will tell you though the hockey aspect really plays a small part in this story, so if that's the reason for choosing this book, just beware the hockey theme is the secondary plot to the storyline.  If you are a fan of second chance love stories, then you really don't want to miss this one.  I thought this story was well written.  It is told in Dual POV.  Another thing I liked was that this book wasn't too heavy.  I say that because what we learn about Annie's and Ethan's past.  I like that she gave us just enough history on the characters for us to connect with them and know why they are the way they are without bringing the mood of the story down.  I was happy she concentrated on the second time around for Annie and Ethan.  They had a special love story :)We meet Annie and Ethan in this story.  They have known each other since Annie moved to Rawdon as a young child.  Annie is abandoned  by her mother and when things go bad for her in foster care she is sent to live with her nan.  This is how she meets Ethan.  Ethan came from a  good home until his mom dies of cancer and his dad falls off the deep end turning into a drunk and a mean one at that.  Ethan seeks comfort from Annie and her nan.  They forged a friendship that eventually turned into more and then Ethan was given his ultimate dream.a contract in the NHL.  Annie and Ethan try to make things work when he leaves, but Annie was always told by her mom, to leave a man before he can leave you, so that is what Annie does.  Now fast forward 3 years and Ethan is forced to come back to Rawdon, because his brother Manny was hurt and in the hospital.  This is when Annie and Ethan reunite.  What I'll say from here is that their road to a HEA is not an easy or smooth one, but they work through it all together.The only secondary character I liked was Manny (Ethan's brother)  I think he has a story there and I hope we get a book about him.  He deserves to be happy too.I don't think there was just one thing about this book that spoke to me, it was everything about this book.  The writing was fantastic.  The characters were engaging and believable.  The storyline was great and I just loved how the author told this story.  I would definitely recommend this book, especially to those readers who are fans of the second chance romance.

Wow!!!  What an amazing ride this book was.  I have to be honest.I truly think this just might be my favorite Emma Hart book and it even beats out Twisted Bond (book 1 in the series).Emma Hart has done it again!!!  Tethered Bond is the Third book in her Holly Woods Files Series and this book is the reason I fell in love with this series.  It had everything mystery, suspense, intrigue, romance, Nonna and a crazy Parrot :)  My heart was racing through most of this book.  I couldn't turn the pages fast enough to find out how this story unfolded.I am going to warn you this review is going to be short and vague, because I can't talk about the storyline hardly at all because everything would be a spoiler and this is a story you want to unravel yourself ;)This book had me guessing and on the edge of my seat all the way through.  I found this storyline interesting because I haven't read a mystery/suspense story with a religion based storyline.  I thought this was a unique and intriguing story and very well written.  I also loved that Emma focused more on the mystery of the story and threw in just enough romance between Noelle and Drake to keep her readers happy.  I mean what would a book in this series be without the sassy and smart mouthed banter between Drake and Noelle.Tethered Bond is not a stand alone book.  Just like Twisted Bond (book 1) and Tangled Bond (book 2)  Tethered Bond is a complete story and the mystery is solved by the end, but what makes these books NOT stand alones, is the on going story between Drake and Noelle.  Each of these books follows their journey and how they handle being in a relationship together.  This book will test their bond.  Will they come out unscathed or will their job threaten their happiness together??  You'll just have to read the book to find out.What I loved about this book was we got some more background on Drake and Noelle.  We find out why Drake doesn't like Messina and we also find out exactly happened with Noelle in her past in Dallas.  I enjoyed watching these two continue to open up to each other and continue to learn how to trust and love one another.  There are many times these two characters had me laughing out loud.  I absolutely love their dynamic and when you throw in her family, Nonna and a crazy talking Parrot, you can't help but laugh :)So if you are a fan of Emma Hart, you don't want to miss this book!!!  I would also recommend this book/series to anyone who is a fan of a romantic suspense story.  If you like a book that is full of twists and turns, mystery, and intrigue..then PICK this book up, you won't be sorry!!!

What drew me to this book was the blurb but what truly sucked me in was when I read the sneak peek of the Prologue!!! This is the first book by either of these authors that I have read and I am so glad I took a chance on something new, because this is a book everyone should read!!!!Cruel and Beautiful is a story with so much emotion. I knew going into this that this book was going to be both heart warming and heart wrenching and I was correct. The emotions this book drew out of me was amazing!! This is truly one woman's journey to finding love, letting love go and learning to love again. Cate truly had to go through the cruel to find the beautiful.The authors created a story that you can't help feeling like you are a part of these characters lives. All the characters, both the primary and secondary ones, were essential to this story. They all landed support, love, guidance and even some comic relief. This book does cover a sensitive subject and I believe this story will hit home for many readers out there. You will definitely need tissues while reading this book.I absolutely love when two authors join forces to create a story. What is truly remarkable is when their writing style mesh so well you can't tell who wrote what part. The flow of this story was amazing. I also loved that this was a stand alone novel.This story is told in Cate's POV. We learn about her past and present in alternating chapters. I thought this was an interesting way to tell her story, but I have to admit I was slightly confused in the beginning. I also felt that the alternating chapters between past and present went on too long. This was my only negative about this book. The main reason I wish the authors would've shortened the past storyline sooner was because I felt that there was more to Cate's present story that could've been played out. Like the epilogue could've actually been more of the main story for Cate.I would 100% recommend this book, but just remember to have some tissues with you when you do. You will need them.

This was an enjoyable read and a good addition to this series. I will say that I still liked the first book better. This one the story was fairly predictable and the storyline was just missing something. I still really enjoyed this read and will continue to read the other books in this series when they are released.What I think I had the hardest part with in this book was that it lacked a WOW factor like the first book. Truth Kills was all about the mystery and romance and sex and it kept you on your toes, but this one really didn't have that. I felt kind of underwhelmed once the "lie" was revealed. The author did try to add some element of surprise when it came to Lenore, but by that time I felt it was too late to be in the storyline. I would've liked the Lenore storyline to have played more of a role in the book, because that would've brought in that element of mystery and suspense.All in all I enjoyed this book and would recommend to readers. Just like the first book, this is a standalone story and you don't have to read Truth Kills first to understand the story. Jamie does a great job connecting the dots for the reader so you know how everyone is connected and what part they play in each others lives.

As excited as I was to read Painter and Melanie's story, I have to say this wasn't my favorite of Joanna Wylde's books that I have read.  Now I will say that I did enjoy this book but it just didn't WOW me.  I loved the overall storyline and the intriguing storyline involving all of the MC clubs, but I think what brought this book down for me was the connection between Painter and Melanie.This book was filled with A LOT of drama and angst when it came to Melanie and Painter.  Now I knew going into this that their journey wasn't going to be an easy one, that point hits home even more once you read the prologue, but I didn't think the angst and Melanie's stubbornness would last the majority of the book.  I did really like both Painter and Melanie as characters.Painter was an Alpha with a bossy attitude but he also had his sweet side and tender heart (especially when Izzy came into play).  You truly can't help but fall in love with him.  Yes he makes some MAJOR mistakes in this story, but you can totally feel his regret and we get to see a completely different side to him.  He did everything he could to change his ways and prove his love for Melanie.Now Melanie on the other hand, I really liked her character as well, until like the last 30% of the book.  She is strong, and fierce and loved with her whole heart.  She believed in Painter when no one else did.  Then when things went south, she pulled herself together and made it through.  What my biggest issue with her was how long she held her grudge against Painter.  No I didn't want her to just roll over and forgive him, I loved that she made him work for it, but once he proved himself to her, she still wouldn't let it go.  I had to agree with Painter when her called her a hypocrite.  She would bag on him about the Reaper's but at every turn they were there to help her when she needed it.  By this point I really wanted to smack her.  This didn't totally deter my enjoyment of the book, but it was why I couldn't give it a higher rating.I will continue to read Joanna's books, because when it comes to an MC story she is the best by far.  Just because this wasn't my favorite, I still look forward to more of her stories to come.  I loved that she gave us a double epilogue, because the first one finished Melanie and Painter's story and the second one set up Gage and Tinker's story.  That is a story I am looking forward too ;)

Each time I read a Kristen Proby book, I fall more and more in love with her writing.  Her books just put me into a happy place and I can't help but have a huge smile on my face.  Her books are literary works of art in my opinion.Her stories and characters are so full of love and emotion, you can't help but get drawn in.  She writes with such feeling you can't help but feel like you are a part of these books.  What I love the most about her books is that they aren't overloaded with excess drama.  Yes she adds a little here and there just to keep the readers attention, but she knows how to balance all the elements of the story to make it a smooth read.Easy Melody is the 3rd book in her Boudreaux Series and it was just as wonderful as the first two are.  I absolutely love this Boudreaux Family.  They have such warmth and compassion and really look out for each other.  They are what I believe most families aspire to be in real life.  This book was a sweet and sexy read with an amazing Hero and a sassy heroine.  I can't say for sure but I swear the books in this series are getting steamier and steamier as they are released ;)  Not that I am complaining!!!  As with the other book in this series, this is fairly quick read, one you can finish in a day or less.Easy Melody is the story of Declan Boureaux and Callie Mills.  Callie is originally from New Orleans and was raised by a single dad after her mom dies when she is young.  Her dad over time becomes an alcoholic, so when Callie is old enough she leaves New Orleans for Denver and starts her life over.  10 Years later she is forced to come back to New Orleans after her father passes away.  He has left the family bar to her and she has to figure out what to do with it.  While she is back in New Orleans, her boyfriend and boss Keith calls her and literally breaks up with her and fires her all in one phone call.  So realizing she has nothing to go back to, Callie decides to stay in New Orleans and run the bar with her BFF Adam.  This is where she meets Declan, because he is a musician who plays at the bar a couple times a week.  Lets just say when Declan sees Callie for the first time he is smitten and will not take No for an answer.  He is determined to get to know Callie, in every way her can.  Now Declan is known as a player, so will Callie be able to tame his wild ways and make an honest man out of him??  You'll just have to read the book to find out!!!Again in this book we get to see all of the Boudreaux clan and we also get to meet some new characters.  I love that all the characters overlap in the stories.  Each of these books can be read as a stand alone, but to fully appreciate this family unit, you will want to read them in order.  As like in the first two books, the epilogue in this book is a sneak peek to the next book in the series.  Easy Kisses is going to be Charly and Simon's story and I can't wait to meet Simon ;)  Another aspect to this book that I truly loved was that she included a cameo from a few of the couples from her With Me in Seattle Series.  I thought that was great!!!So whether you are a fan of Kristen's books or haven't read any of them yetdon't wait, pick up this book and read it now!!!  You don't want to miss reading about this amazing family and what is  left to come for them.

Are you a fan of the Forbidden Love Story?  Do you like Angst??  Well if you answered yes to either or both of these questions, then you NEED to read Sins of Sevin by Penelope Ward.I have been a HUGE fan of Penelope's from the very beginning.  I have read every book she has written and I am happy to say that I have NEVER been disappointed by her work.  Sins of Sevin was no exception.  I truly loved this book.  I have to be honest I was a little nervous going into this book, because after reading the blurb, I was afraid of how she would handle the aspect of cheating and a love triangle (both which are hard limits for me when reading a book)  Well don't worry, she does a fantastic job while covering these things.  Yes there is cheating in this book, but the way it was written into this story, it just worked and I found I wasn't bothered by it.  As for  the love triangle aspect, this wasn't really an issue.  I can't really explain why without spoiling things, but just know that this isn't a triangle type story.  There is clearly one couple who are meant to be together in this book.I honestly don't know if I can truly express in words how I felt about this book.  Nothing I come up with seems to do it justice.  I felt so many things while reading this story.  It truly is a heart wrenching story of forbidden love.  I love how Penelope sucks you into the story right from the beginning.  The prologue is sure to grab your attention and you won't be able to put the book down until the story is over.  That is one thing that is consistent with Penelope's books.I never want them to end and they seem to end way too quickly!!!!Sins of Sevin was an interesting storyline.  In some ways the set up and the delivery of the story reminded me of My Skylar, but it was also so different from anything I have ever read.  This just proves that Penelope is a phenomenal writer, because she can always seem to come up with outstanding books and characters that continue on in your heart and mind well after you have finished the book.  This book was truly beautifully written and surpassed all my expectations.  This story was intense at times, heartwarming at other times and down right heart wrenching at other times, but just know that in the end, Penelope knows how to heal a broken heart in the best way!!!!  I will say that at times I had to remind myself that this was a contemporary romance because with the way Penelope wrote some of the scenes, it truly felt like I was taken back in time.  It's hard to explain, but you'll understand once you read this book.This book is one I truly believe people should go into blind because I think any teasers or reviews might spoil the true feelings you get while reading this book.  Penelope throws so much at Sevin and Evangeline that you can't help but feel bad for everything they have to go through, but you also can't help by root for their HEA!!!!.If you are a fan of Penelope Ward's or even if you have never read a book by her yet, you don't want to miss this book!!!  This is definitely one I will read again in the future and recommend to all my friends.  Penelope's books always leave me speechless and in awe of her talent.  I can't wait for her next book!!!!

Tattooed Emotions is exactly like the name infers.  This book is packed with so many different emotions, you can't help but get swept away!!This book starts off on a sad note but also a happy note, it's hard to explain that without spoiling the story for others.  Just know that Alicia doesn't hold back the emotions for later in the book, she grabs at your heartstrings right from the beginning.Tattooed Emotions is only the second book of Alicia's that I have read (even though I do have all her other books waiting on my kindle to be read).  I enjoyed her first book so much, but I have to say that this book is by far my FAVORITE.  There was something about this storyline and characters that just sucked me in and held me all the way to the end.  I will say that there are aspects of this story that kind of reminded me of another book (hint: Christian Grey) but yet this story is so completely different.  You will understand why I say this once you read the book.  There were just certain things that brought me back to the Fifty Shades series.  Now if you aren't a fan of that series don't worry this book and storyline is not like that one.  So don't let my comment scare you off from reading this wonderful book!!!!Tattooed Emotions is told completely from Raelyn's POV.  I do wish that we would've gotten a little bit of Damien's POV, because there were times I wanted to know what he was thinking, but it in no way deterred me from enjoying this book!!!  I will let you know that this book is NOT a stand-alone book.  Now I wouldn't consider this ending a cliffhanger, because the ending wasn't shocking, it just left you wanting more.  So to me it is a To Be Continued ending.  The way it ends, you just know there is more to come.  There are a lot of things that weren't covered in this book, so a second book is definitely needed.  But I will say that I don't think Damien and Raelyn are going to have an easy road ahead of them.  I also have a feeling the second book ( Tattooed Scars ) is going to heartbreaking, but I am hopefully that Alicia will mend are hearts by the end of the series.What I loved the most about this book is that it wasn't saturated with a lot of drama.  Alicia added just enough outside elements to keep you rooting for Damien and Raelyn, but it wasn't so much that I was frustrated by the end of the book.  This book does end with Damien and Raelyn in a good place and looking towards the future.  I also loved that this couple never had that crazy miscommunication and separation that we normally see in this type book.  I loved that Damien never let Raelyn run very far or for very long.  It was refreshing to see a couple actually work together to solve the issues they faced.I would 100% recommend this book to everyone!!!  I don't think it is necessary to wait for the next book to be released before reading this book.  Just know going in that there is more to come.  I know I can't wait until November for the next book.  I really want to see this couple get their HEA!!!  Raelyn and Damien both totally deserve one after everything they have had to endure.Don't miss this AMAZING read!!!  You won't be sorry.

As always you can't go wrong with a Kendall Ryan book!!!  Screwed is Kendall's first book in the Romantic Comedy category and I thought she did a great job.  I haven't read many books in this category, but I thought she did a great job giving us a fun, sexy, no nonsense type book.Screwed is a light hearted, sexy, fun and sassy read.  It is also a fairly quick read, one that can be read in a couple hours.  The pace and flow worked perfectly with this storyline.  What I loved about this book is it wasn't overpowered with a lot of drama.  She added just enough to keep the story and characters interesting, but whatever drama was created was over fairly quickly.  Now I know many will say that it was over too quickly and that Emery forgave Hayden way too fast, but to me it just worked with this story.In this book we meet Hayden Oliver and Emery Winters.  Hayden is a property developer and owns many properties with his best friend Hudson.  Hayden is your typical player, doesn't believe in a relationship and has no problem with one night stands.  He is also cocky and arrogant, but also sweet and charming.  Things change for Hayden when Emery moves into one of his buildings (which also happens to be the building he lives in) and his business partner Hudson tells him he isn't allowed to sleep with the tenants anymore.  Hayden of course sees this as a challenge in a way and befriends Emery.  Now Emery has had the great pleasure of meeting Roxy on her first day there and to say she didn't paint Hayden in a good light is an understatement.  So Emery is determined to blow Hayden off and focus on her career.  That is until Hayden says he just wants to be friends.  From here we get to see two people learning to open themselves up to the possibility of love and relationships.  I loved watching Hayden and Emery together.  Emery was a great character.  Very strong, determined and I found her to be funnier than Hayden at times.Now I don't truly know what makes an amazing romantic comedy book, but in my opinion, if the book can make you laugh, make you connect with the characters and storyline and leave you with a huge smile on your face then I think the book has done it's job.  I feel Kendall hit each of those marks with me on this book, so to me this book was a great read.  I always look forward to seeing what Kendall gives us next and I am never disappointed.  I look forward to reading Hudson and Gracie's book next!!!

So I just finished this book and I just had to write my review to express my feelings!!!  This book was beyond AMAZING!!  I loved it even more than the first book.This book was filled with such wonderful and heartbreaking emotions, but also twist and turns that you don't see coming.  I was amazed at all the little secrets AL Jackson added to this story.  As per my usual I won't be discussing any of that because I don't want to spoil anything for the readers.  This story will have your emotions going in all different directions.  One moment I was giggling and smiling and the next I was either crying or wanting to throw my kindle, but that is exactly what I love about Ms. Jackson's books.  She knows how to create a story that will touch you on every level.I don't think I have the words to really do Shea and Sebastian's  story justice.  These characters were just amazing!!!  They were full of such depth and heart.  I loved their story or should I say journey, because this was not an easy road for them.  They definitely have their ups and downs, but what I loved most, especially in this second book, was how they worked through stuff together and formed a strong and everlasting bond against the evil doers.What I truly loved about this book, besides the characters, was the writing!!!  AL Jackson has true literary talent.  I have read all her books and every time I pick up her books I know it is going to be a phenomenal read!!  I will say that the Bleeding Stars Series is turning out to be my favorite of hers so far!!  There is just something about a story about musicians and the girls who tame them, but then add in an adorable little girl to the mix and these boys turn to mush.LOVE IT!!!!Drowning to Breathe picks up right where A Stone in the Sea ended and thank you for that, because the Cliffhanger in book 1 was horrible tourture!!!  I was a little nervous about the direction this story was going in the beginning, but that fear was short lived because Sebastian changed his tune pretty quickly ;)  I have to say I honestly believe that this was the perfect ending for Shea and Sebastian's story.  I couldn't be happier with what Ms. Jackson gave us.So I will just finish here and say READ THIS BOOK!!!!  You won't be sorry.P.S.  Drowning to Breathe is NOT a Stand-alone book.you do need to read A Stone in the Sea first or you will be completely lost.

As always, I knew when I decided to read Ryker that I was going to enjoy it!!! and I wasn't disappointed at all.Ryker is the fourth book in Sawyer Bennett's Cold Fury Series and I have to say, I think these books have just gotten better as they have come out.Sawyer has continued to give us fun, sexy and enjoyable story lines and characters in this series.  A Hockey themed sports story is definitely my favorite,  There is just something about reading about a hockey player finding his soulmate and true love.  What I loved best about Sawyer's hockey players is that they are the perfect mix of strong and macho, but have hearts of gold underneath and are willing to do anything for the love of their lives.  I truly loved that Sawyer also gave both Zack and Ryker kids to show their tender and passionate side.  Kids in books just suck me in.Ryker is  kind of a forbidden love story, because it is between Grayson Brannon and Ryker Evans.  Gray is the GM of the Cold Fury hockey team and Ryker is the star goalie, causing a little bit of a  conflict of interest.  I loved the hint of the forbidden that Sawyer gave us in this story.  I enjoyed watching these two characters work to have it all, love and a career.  I was extremely happy that this book wasn't overdone with outside drama.  Yes Sawyer added in some drama in the form of an ex and a pyscho player, but that was very short lived and I loved that Ryker and Gray are able to work through all of those issues together!!!  They truly are a strong functioning couple!!Every time I pick up a Sawyer Bennett book, I know I am going to enjoy the read, I am going to love the characters, and I am going to end up with a huge smile on my face.  I don't know if the Cold Fury series is done now with Ryker, but if she writes more for these guys and this team, I know for sure I will read it.

" Today may be a very bad day, but tomorrow may be the best day of your life.  You just have to hang on until you get there."Mia Sheridan has extremely amazing talent when it comes to giving her readers unique and engaging stories.  This isn't the first time we have seen the storyline with a marriage bargain included, but Mia truly made this her own story and something completely unique from what is already out there.  Yes some of the elements of the story are fairly predictable, but that didn't take away from my complete enjoyment of this book!!!" Forget the Prince and Princess.  I always imagined the real story was between the witch and the dragon."Grayson's Vow is part of Mia's Sign of Love Series based off the Zodiac Sign of the Libra.  I am a Libra, so to say I was most looking forward to reading this book is an understatement.  This book didn't disappoint what so ever!!!  Grayson's Vow is a complete Stand-alone novel, you don't have to read any of the other books before you dive into this one.  I will say that the pace of this story was kind of on the slow side, but I feel that it was the perfect way to tell Gray and Kira's story.  Even with saying that, this story never dragged on, where I felt I wanted to skim ahead just to finish.  I honestly wished it was a little longer, because in the end I fell in love with Grayson and Kira." You have to feel the pain if you're going to feel the joy."Mia does an excellent job when creating her stories, they feel well thought out and developed.  I loved the backdrop of this story being in Napa and at a winery.  I have always wanted to visit Napa and after reading this book, I only want to visit even more.  I also felt that the characters in this story were well developed and felt completely real.  She gave us a wide variety of characters to meet, some you will love, some you will grow to love and others you will just hate!!!!" There's nothing on earth like the feel of someone who loves you grasping your hand in the dark when you're lost and afraid."In this book we follow the story of Kira and Grayson.  Grayson is an ex-con who after spending five years in prison, goes back home to take care of his family vineyard, that was left to him by his dad.  When Grayson realizes that the vineyard is in dire straits and he is out of options, a little witch comes into the picture.  Kira is a girl who grew up in a family of privilege  but no love, so when she was shipped away to Africa for a year, when she comes home she is bound and determined to make it on her own.  She was left a large some of money by her loving grandma, but there is a contingency on it, she has to get married.  This is where she enters Grayson's life.  She hatches a plan that will help both of them." True love is the greatest leap of faith there is."I have to admit, I didn't like Grayson very much in the beginning.  Kira called him a dragon and he lived up to that definition.  I was so glad that we got to see a softer and sweeter side of him as the story went on.  I LOVED Kira.  She was such an amazing character, that you can't help falling in love with her.  She was so genuine in everything she said and did.  Even though she did like to scheme and plot a lot, it was never malicious or mean, it was always to help others out!!!.We met a handful of secondary characters that I loved just as much.  Kimberly, Walter, Charlotte, Harley and Priscilla and Sugie (the dog).  Each of these characters played a major part in this book and helping Kira and Grayson finally get their HEA!!" In love there is truth."This book is definitely filled with a lot of emotions.  There is laughter, romance, sexy times, and hurt.  This book is definitely worth the time to read, especially if you are a fan of Mia's.  This book is well worth the time and money that the reader will invest in it.  I know I will for sure be reading this book again in the future!!!

WOW!!!  What an amazing book!!  This was so much more than I expected.Raven is only the second book of Ashley Suzanne's that I have read, but the first one where she is the only author.  I believe after reading Raven I have found another go to author for me.  I will definitely be reading more books by this author in the future.Raven was such a unique story about a girls journey to happiness and forgiveness.  I was drawn to the book from the blurb.  I couldn't wait to read about a female MMA fighter.  Even though that was the main reason for reading this book and it really wasn't as big of part of the book as I thought it would be, I wasn't disappointed in this book what so ever!!!..  I thought the flow and pace of the story was perfect.  We got just enough history and information to make the characters feel real and the storyline to be believable.  I loved the characters in this story.  I found I was able to connect with Rian and Garrett pretty early on and I felt every emotion they felt while reading this book.In this story we meet Rian and Garrett.  When we first meet them they are teenagers and best friends.  Garrett really looked out for Rian when she was bullied by many at school.  Rian was a young girl from a broken home who had a hippy for a mom and no dad, but she was happy.  That was until her mom married Tom and Garrett if forced to move away with his military family.  What happens from here is a string of bad luck and heartbreak for Rian.  After all this turmoil, Rian is left broken hearted and also not willing to trust or form bonds with anyone.  What I loved about this book was that it also turned out to be like a second chance romance story.  Because Rian does eventually reunite with Garrett and to say it's explosive is putting it mildly.  Now I don't want to go into to much more detail because that would spoil things.  Just know this I truly believe that Rian and Garrett are characters everyone should meet.So I am just going to leave this here by saying this book definitely deserves 5 stars and nothing less.  Even though there are some tough subjects discussed and some heartache throughout the story, this really was a very sweet and wonderful love story between two people who are just destined to be together.  You can't help but root for Rian and Garrett all the way through.Even though this is listed as a first in Ashley's new series, Raven is a stand-alone novel.  You get a complete story with this book and are left with happiness in your heart.
My son loves this cover.  The picture is a little grainy but for an 11 year old it good enough :)

This is my first Alessandra Torre novel and I am happy to say it won't be my last!!!I was drawn to the book because of the blurb and I went in thinking it was going to be similar to another Hollywood type story that I have loved in the past.  I am HAPPY to say that this book was just as good as the other one I was thinking of, but was completely different from that book.  This storyline was completely unique and different from the other movie star romances out there.Yes this is a book about a famous movie star ( Cole ) and a no name country girl not looking for fame ( Summer ) but that is the only similarities there are to others books like this one.  I loved Alessandra's writing style.  This story and characters were engaging, intriguing and held me captive all the way through.  The banter and sexual tension between Cole and Summer was off the charts.  This couple made me laugh, scream and blush and that sometimes happened all within the same chapterLOL :)These characters felt real to me and totally relatable.  I felt like I could be friends with both of them.  I also loved the authenticity of the town of Quincy.  It felt like a pace I would love to visit.  I also reminded me of my own hometown growing up, ( without the Billionaires )  I enjoyed the pace that the author took with this couple and the fact that nothing felt rushed or unrealistic.  My only complaint per say is that I wish Cole and Summer would've united a little sooner in the book so that we got to see more of them as a happy couple.  I absolutely LOVED the ending to this book.  I couldn't have thought of a better one myself.One thing I did really enjoy and didn't expect was the surprise visit by Brad DeLuca.  He is Cole's divorce attorney in this book.  As some may or may not know Brad comes from Alessandra's Innocence Series.  This is one I haven't read yet but I look forward to reading all about Brad's story.  He fascinated me in this story, so his books I have a feeling are going to be good ones.I would recommend this book to anyone who is a fan of Alessandra's, but I will let you know that from what I know this book is completely different from her other books.  Just be aware of that going in.  You also must like a slow burn type romance.  Cole and Summer's love story is slow going, but I truly think it is the way it was meant to be told.  Anything different would've been unrealistic.  So if you are looking for a story about a Hollywood Hunk and a Country Girl that is truly a feel good story, then look no further.this is the book to read!!!!

With each book that Stephanie Smith releases her writing just keeps getting better and better.  I love each new book more than the ones before it.How My Heart Breaks is the third book in Stephanie Smith's stand-alone Try Again Series.  Each of these books can be read as a stand-alone, except I think you get a better feeling of the past characters by reading these books in order.  Especially this one, since the past two couples play kind of a larger part in this story.What I love more and more as these books are released is that we are getting more and more of the Male POV in these stories.  This book we actually get an equal amount of Jake and Lana's POV's.  I just think the story is better told by both characters, so you are never guessing what the other is thinking.  This book is a sweet and sexy story between two people who have closed themselves off to love because of past tragedies.  This book isn't wrapped up in a lot of drama or angst.  We just got a to watch Jake and Lana learn to love again.  With that said, yes there is some drama and lies are told in this story to keep you interested, but it doesn't over power the book.  I was actually surprised that once the lie comes out in the open how quickly it was glossed over and the drama came more from Lana's fears.In this story we meet Lana (Tate (from book 2) Sister) and Jake.  Lana is someone who has closed off her heart to loving people, because she thinks she is jinxed.  She seems to lose everyone who she has ever loved and is tired of hurting like that.  She feels she is better off alone, that is until she meets Jake.  Jake is a single father of 5 year old Hallie. I absolutely love when authors throw children into the mix in books.  They are always so endearing.  Jake is an Army guy and you couldn't help falling in love with him.  He was sweet, sexy and loyal to a fault.  His loyalty is what gets him in hot water, but also leads him to Lana.  I loved watching these break each others walls down.  Learning to love and trust again.  Jake wouldn't give up, no matter how hard Lana pushed him away!!!  Jake is one of those Heroes that will live on in my head because he was just that great.Another aspect of the book I loved was that we got to see a lot of Brooke and Saxon and Tate and Harper.  It was wonderful to see how these couples are doing now after their stories have ended.  We also got meet some new characters. Georgia is one of them and I can't wait to see where Stephanie takes her in the next book!!I would recommend this book and series.  Each book is about learning to open yourself up to love again.  That finding the right person is always worth the risk!!

I just knew when I found out that two of my all time favorite authors were collaborating on a book that it was going to be AMAZING.and I wasn't wrong.Cocky Bastard was OUTSTANDING!!!  I truly hope that Penelope Ward and Vi Keeland continue to write books together in the future.  Their writing styles meshed so well I honestly couldn't tell you who wrote what parts.  I saw elements of both authors in this story.This book had everything that I look for in a 5 star read.  The storyline was interesting and unique.  The pace and flow of the story were spot on.  The characters were relatable and likable.  This story was such a fun, sweet and sexy story, but I also experienced some sad moments and moments I wanted to yell and throw my kindle.  When authors can evoke that many different emotions from their readers, I truly believe they have extreme talent in the literary world.I don't want to spoil the storyline at all, so I am only going to touch on it briefly.  In Cocky Bastard we meet Chance and Aubrey.  Chance is the HOT Aussie model/soccer player who is on his way back to california when he has a chance meeting with Aubrey at a rest stop in the middle of Nebraska.  To say their first meeting was cordial is the farthest from the truth.  They had a lot of animosity  and sexual tension ;)  What happens from here is a road trip to end all road trips.  They had some major laughs along the way, but they also had some bumps.  After spending a week together they are separated for two years.  What happens once they are reunited was explosive.I have to say that Chance was my favorite character of this book.  I loved his cocky ways and his sense of humor.  But what I loved the most was his determination.  I can't explain that because it would spoil the plot.  Just know that after you read this book Chance will make your BBF list, I know he is at the top of mine :)  I did like Aubrey too, but there were times I really wanted to smack her for her behavior.  I was glad to see how this book ended and how everything all played out!!!Cocky Bastard is a standalone novel with a happy ending.  If you are looking for  a book with a lot of laughter, a cocky hero who will make you swoon and even some sad times, then this is the book for you.  If you are a fan of either or both Penelope Ward and Vi Keeland, you don't want to miss this book.  I know this is a book I will read again in the future!!!

I am completely addicted to this series!!!  I don't know what that says about me because of the subject matter of this story/series,, but Mia Storm has completely sucked me in and I hope we get more books to this series.Getting Hot is the third book in the Jail Bait Series.  Even though these books are all stand-alones, it was great to see how the author ties all the characters together.  She even overlaps the story just a tad bit.  What I did find different with this book was how she handled the age difference.  I thought it was glossed over in this book compared to how things turned out in the other two books.  This one didn't feel as realistic to me as much as the other books did.  Now with that said.I still LOVED this book and it in no way took away from my enjoyment of this story.Getting Hot is a taboo/forbidden love story between Bran (26) and Lilah (16).  If you are not a fan of this type of age difference then this book might not be the one for you.  I on the other hand didn't mind the age gap, because one thing Mia does amazingly well with , is creating characters that seem older than they really are.  As you read this story you truly do forget how old Lilah is.  Lilah has been through more stuff in her 16 years of life than most people see in a lifetime.  Even though they are so different in age, Bran and Lilah still seemed to fit together.  they truly do complete each other.  I don't want to spoil the story for anyone, but I think this one is my favorite so far in this series and that is saying something because I LOVED Getting Dirty (Book 1) and Getting Played (Book 2).Each of these books are age related taboo love stories, but I truly believe they are all tastefully written and like I said before she does an amazing job with the characters you truly forget their ages.  These books are all fairly quick reads and talk about STEAMY :)  but not to the point of tacky or raunchy.  I truly can't say enough about these books and this series.I am forever a fan of Mia Storm and her books!!!!!

Back to the Drawing Board was an enjoyable read.  It had what a good romance novel should have.  There was laughter, angst, sexy times, and of course love.  This book didn't have a whole lot of drama and what there was of it was short lived.  I really liked that, because it focused on Julia and Carter.This book is kind of considered a third in a series, but I would also say it is a standalone.  I didn't read the two prior books and I didn't feel lost at all.  This is more of a spin off if anything.  This book was about Blake and Liane's Son Carter.  Even though I didn't read the other books about Blake and Liane, I still got the full jist of their story and how it plays into Carter's story.I will say that this book started out different than I expected.  The prologue sucked me in and is not what I was expecting. (Totally is a good way)  We get most of Carter's backstory in the prologue and it sets up the rest of the book as to where Carter's head is emotionally.  This story is told in Dual POV, which I love.  I felt this was a complete story also.  I didn't end this book with the thought of I wonder how the characters end up down the road.  LL Collins does a fantastic job giving us Carter and Julia's full story.If you are a fan of angst then I would definitely recommend this book to you to read.  The push and pull that Julia and Carter go through in the beginning was a lot.  I understood why Carter was pushing Julia away.it was almost a taboo type story, being that Julia was his boss,  and he didn't want to jeopardize his career.  One thing I truly loved was that Julia was the aggressor in this book.  Usually we see the Hero being the one to pursue the heroine, but not in this one Julia went after what she wanted (Carter) and wouldn't take no for an answer.  I really liked that!!
