If you find Miles insufferable in his seeming inability to actually fail you'll have stopped before you'll want to read this review.  But if you find yourself laughing along and hoping he realizes his goals then you're probably going to stick with it until she runs out of words.

These braided cables work like they should. It transmits both power and data.+ The cables look very sturdy and durable.+ 6 feet, the way I want them to be.+ Works the way they should. No problem there/ The cable is too stiff, and thin, compared to my peripherals that have braided cables. Though I was  aware of it before I bought them, I think they should just make these cables all-black.As for the price, I think they are properly priced. I would have appreciated it though if they included another one, and that would have earned this product 5 stars. I gave it four stars because I felt like these are low-end braided cables. BUT, it is still so much better than regular cables that come with everything else. My expectations were just set a little high.VERDICT: I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.

Reviewer's car: Hyundai Veloster TurboI did not have any problems with these jack stands. However, the lock is very easy to remove, so be aware of that. It did gave my car the support it needed, which these jack stands promised.
Wrench works like a wrench. Feels very durable. It was able to take off lugs with a very tight factory/dealership fit. Those who say it couldn't are just too weak to use a classic hand held wrench.

The product itself works OK, as long as it fits your port. There are however, some ports where it will not sit securely in place, it really depends on the car. In a Hyundai Veloster, it fits put tends to get loose. In a Kia Soul, the fit is more secure, but still does not lock in place. Based on other reviews, I'd imagine that it does work very well with other cars' ports.What I Like+ The electronic circuitry inside does seem to be well designed.+ 3 Amperes for all the power you need.+ Very inexpensive, as compared to others.+ Really, really small. Not intrusive at all.+ Seller is very great if you get any problems with this.What I don't Like Fitting on some ports, caused by the spring.VERDICT: I recommend this product, if the fitting doesn't bother you. 4 Stars out of 5. It's almost perfect.

I trust Creative products. But today, I learned a lesson - only trust them with audio. I don't get why a lot of people love this product. Low standards, perhaps? Old reviews? - maybe.I could not find anything good with this product, at all. Truly, I just threw away my money for a product that is crappy.I am using this product under room lighting. I'm using this LOCALLY - not online - as a surveillance device. I'm not even trying to record - I just turn it on. Doesn't look 720p to me. You wouldn't be able to read anything it captures. Too much: noise, compression, artifacts. 30 FPS? They wish... more like 0.5 frame per second. I mean, come on! It ghosts so bad, I can't tell who is passing in the hallway.Tested it with a plug-and-play driver under windows. The tiny front facing camera from my Nexus 7 (1st Generation) has a better quality output than this.UPDATE: Installed the Creative software.+ Options to adjust brightness, contrast, gamma, color, white balance. Installed a lot of junk, without the option to turn off individual features. Ad-ware on first reboot. Auto-updater, no thanks. Some third party crap-ware (I forgot the name because I uninstalled it already). Still ghosts a lot, and still non-HD quality, and noisy.Verdict: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT.

I got a NEXUS 7, and I was so impressed that I got one for my mom's iPad.The NEXUS 7 screen is gorgeous. However, even with the Gorilla Glass, it is still vulnerable to damage, especially when dropped face down (see drop test of Nexus 7 on youtube). Now enter the Tech Armor Matte Protector. What's good about the matte is it gives it a glare free surface. It is a trade off between form and function. I will take function. It does alter the form which is very subjective. Personally, I like it better because it creates a more robust appearance.HOW TOUGH is the MATTE Protector?It lasted a long time, before I had to replace it. The first one (1 of 3) lasted 4 months, but then I got a small deep scratch so I tried replacing it. Unfortunately, my second screen protector (2 of 3) application was a failure, so I used my final screen protector (3 of 3). It lasted for a while, until I dropped it, FACE DOWN, on a rocky surface, without any protective case. It did destroy the Tech Armor screen protector, with a lot of dents and scratches, and even small pokes from the rocks. However, there's absolutely NO damage to the NEXUS 7's screen. The screen protector took all the beating. Impressive.This is undoubtedly a 4-star rating product, until....I read that Tech Armor replaces the product if for some reason you fail to apply it properly (as in my case on my second screen), or simply from normal wear and tear. I sent them an email, and then - boom - a replacement is all the way.For the price of this thing, they even do replacements? This product is a winner.VERDICT: I highly recommend this product.Claims on the anti-finger-print. While it repels fingerprints, it doesn't do justice with smudges. I've had a matte protector back in the days of Windows Mobile and that did not smudge as much as this one. Still, free replacement on a product that actually works and does what it's suppose to deserves 5 stars.

product is mediocre in ever way imaginable. it does the job.+ Wireless Good wireless.+ Very decent battery life. Lasts longer than its claims+ Tiny transceiver.+ Just works.+ Fold-able and compact. UPDATE [July 2014]  Product still looks and works the same. I updated the review to reflect new [and outdated] information.This product is perfect and impressive. It simply does what it's supposed to do. It is a small tablet holder holder, which is mounted by inserting it to the CD-slot of any car's AVN system. Obviously, if your car does not have a CD slot, then this will not work.A ridiculously similar product exists on eBay called "XENOMIX SHG-4000", for the same price. It's probably rebranding seeing as both are made in South Korea. I have an Amazon Prime membership, and this is Prime eligible, so I decided to get this instead. It arrived exactly two days from placing an order. (Prime perks!)Personally, I like the looks of this one way better than most other mounts out there. Unlike many other monunts, this is low-profile. It does not have gigantic "claws" to grip and hold the tablet in place. It is thin, and looks elegant for my taste. It simply is stunning. Mechanism is also simple: just insert to slot, and flip a switch. No turning of knobs necessary.EQUIPMENT    Product name: PPYPLE CD-N7 (Dash-N7) Reviewer's tablet: Google Nexus 7 (2012 & 2013) Reviewer's car: Hyundai Veloster 1.6 T-GDIWHAT I LIKE  + + Small profile, barely noticeable when tablet is mounted.+ Frees up my entire windshield from obstruction.+ Sufficient grip strength.+ Simple mechanism: Insert and flip a switch.WHAT I DON'T LIKE    Nothing, really. A little wobbly, but that is to be expected from a heavy tablet and the way the mount works. I hardly notice the wobbling though (only on hard bumps).MISC    Includes 3 additional padding - 1.5x, 2.0x, and 2.5x thickness of the default. It locks by griping the top and bottom area/wall of the CD slot opening. It could be rotated 360 degrees, and adjusted in axis. My CD Slot is directly on top of my car's 7-inch built-in AVN ( Audio/Video/Navigation) system LCD screen, but I was able to adjust the mount vertically all the way upwards so it doesn't block the view and operation of my car's dash LCD. Now it looks like I have to LCD screens on my car. Sweet, just looks at my photos uploaded to Amazon Product Images. (I could also adjust it all the way down to cover the screen completely). It locks the vertical adjustment via a Knob, but not the tilt. However, I do not see this as an issue at it is sturdy enough to prevent movement.Link for Amazon Product Images from Customers (where I uploaded)  http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/product-gallery/B00C31MF0WIndividual photo links (Amazon product images I uploaded)  http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/permalink/mo19E5USAO469SE/B00C31MF0W http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/permalink/mo3OVWYKW7AYIOO/B00C31MF0W http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/permalink/mo14UXODH6IPLZQ/B00C31MF0W http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/permalink/mo2D9XJDP48EFEU/B00C31MF0WVerdict: I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS MOUNT. | 5 stars out of five

The title says it all, seriously. I've had a similar Umbrella for less than half the price of this thing. It was way more better in withstanding wind. This thing could not even withstand moderated winds - it flipped.PRO+ Compact when folded.+ Performs as an umbrella, even for heavier rainfall.+ Includes a pouch, with MOLLE-like straps.CON- Weak point is WIND.- Very, very expensive for what it claims (wind-wise).- Small size for the price, IMHO.This is a good umbrella, nonetheless. I just feel like it is way too overpriced AND its name and claims on wind is all a big lie.VERDICT: I do NOT recommend this product. Look somewhere else.

Well, it did work. Repair shop said I have a gasket problem. One (1) liter of coolant in my reservoir would last exactly two days only. I put this product in the reservoir Friday morning and went to work. Got back home and didn't drive over the weekend. Monday morning and still no empty coolant indicator. Drove back home, and still no warning. I am guessing it did work. If this lasts two weeks, then it is all worth it.

UPDATE: I had a replacement because I could not update the firmware of the original one. Also, I updated my review to correct errors and reflect my feelings for this mouse after 1 years.UPDATE: It seems on-board function execution no longer works. Taking off another star.WHAT I LIKE  + + Premium feel. It feels very expensive. Soft rubbery surface, metal underside, hard plastic buttons that doesn't feel cheap.+ Premium looks. Looks expensive too. The lighting is very natural, not overpowering. Braided cable.+ On-Board Memory FOR PROFILE STORAGE ONLY.+ High button count: 15 buttons, arranged in an ergonomic way (kind of). I disagree that it feels super awkward to use. A couple of buttons are a little harder to reach, but you assign those buttons to the least frequently used functions.+ Easy to use software, once you start using it.+ Does not look "meh" like the Logitech G600 and Razer Naga. (Subjective)WHAT I DON'T LIKE    Scroll wheel does not tilt. Boo! 1-key rollover. While a modifier key can be assigned, you have to use the keyboard for the 2nd key. On-board memory profile storage only. Execution still relies on Windows. Software is buggy. Poor driver too: cannot properly detect the mouse. I really wished Corsair put a button at the center-thumb spot of the mouse. Fixed DPI count. User is forced to select 3 DPI settings per profile, no more, no less. Needs some getting used to and has a learning curve.What I wish was there: Wireless, weight customization, lighting options. Selectable scroll-mode (Logitech G700 let's you choose between free-scroll OR "click"-scroll)- - - - -VERDICT: I highly this product. | 2 stars out of 5. This is a good mouse by itself. However, having used Logitech G700, this is not as great. Minus one star for being a 1 key rollover mouse. Minus 1 additional star for depending on Windows for macro execution.

I got this because I need to assign MACRO when I am working on writing codes. I can assign MACRO's to most of the extra buttons (including the FN keys), EXCEPT for the MOST important ones: favorite buttons 1 through 5. I find it dumb to exclude these buttons for MACRO assignment, since these are non-labeled buttons, making them great for MACRO's. If I need MACRO to execute command and assign it to the PLAY button, it's a bit confusing (does it do MACRO, or does it Play media?). Instead, the software limits you to choose either to use it's default function as taskbar favorites OR to assign a shortcut to each of them (file, URL, or App). The ONLY reason I chose this product was for that purpose, and for some reason, the 'genius' programmers at Microsoft did not make this an option.This is a SOFTWARE ISSUE. The keyboard itself is great.What I Like:+ Solid build+ It actually has the updated WIN8 logo for the Windows Key - neat (note 1).+ Free batteries+ Cheap (here at AMAZON) - GET THE BUSINESS EDITION. The ONLY difference is the BOX, which you throw away.+ Good incline without the pop-up feet, GREAT incline with the HUGE pop-up feet.+ THERE IS A DONGLE Compartment underneath the keyboard, beside the batteries, BOTH of which are covered.+ As with most Microsoft low-profile keyboards, it is very comfortable to type.+ MACRO's to the following buttons: Home, Mail, Favorite (STAR), Media buttons, Alternate FN keys, calculator button.+ Not only MACRO's, but the user can assign program/url/file shortcuts.+ Like most Microsoft keyboards, the zoom, volume, num/caps/scroll-lock, win keys have extra user settings.+ APP-specific button assignments.note 1: There is no round carving on the window key - just flat like the rest.What I Dislike:- My rant above. Favorite buttons 1-5 are "special" in that I cannot assign MACRO to it.- A little smudgy.What's not there: Keyboard illumination Wired mode option USB recharging of batteries On-board memory Spacing between the alpha keys, the arrow keys, and the numeric keys. An OFF switch to save battery.VERDICT: I recommend this keyboard. For the price, it's hard to beat.

This is a DAY 0 review of the product.1.Measurements.2.Images (URL Link)3.Build4.Pockets5.Roller6.Tote7.Fun Fact8.Purple9.Conclusion[1] First the measurements of EACH bag:- Roller (HWD): [21"]x[13.5"]x[8.5"+2"]- Tote (HWD): [10"]x[14"]x[6"][2] I have uploaded images for reference of the following information. The surface is some sort of polyester - definitely NOT the thin cloth-like type.[4] POCKETS:The pockets are plain space inside. No "inception" pockets for items (like cellphone, pens, etc.). Just plain storage space.[5] ROLLER:The roller luggage, even for a small size, has handles on both the top and the left side for carrying. It also has a hard plastic handle at the bottom should you need to lift it with both hands.[6] TOTE:The tote as with pictures, has a shoulder strap with small padding. It has a loop at the back so the roller's handle could be inserted into it.[7] FUN FACT:It actually has a small padlock and key included with it.[8] PURPLE:See the image at the link provided above. The images have white-balance adjusted to show the closest match possible to the actual color - when viewed under daylight (6500 Kelvin light).Purple is lighter than what is posted here in Amazon and everywhere else - not not bright either. The first uploader makes the purple look pinkish. It is not, thankfully (since I'm a dude who just likes purple).[9]  CONCLUSION:What I Like + Super cheap price (select colors) here at Amazon for what you will get.What I Don't Like - Nothing yet. Looks like quality product at its intended price range, to be honest. Time will tell.Verdict: I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.

First, I'd like like to point out that this case is for "PRO" (Professional) point and shoot cameras. What this means is that if you have an ordinary Point-and-Shooter, this case will be a little too big. Case Logic has exact case like this for those cameras (without the "PRO") which is smaller (EHC-101-BLACK).If you own a camcorder, Case Logic also has another similar case, which is bigger (EHC-103-BLACK).It makes sense that this model's part number is EHC-102-BLACK.A "PRO" Point-and-Shoot, a.k.a. "Prosumer" camera is mostly twice as thick as regular ones. A perfect example of these cameras are Canon's G-Series cameras. I tested this with a G9 and G15.What I like:+ Fits snugly.+ Padded back side.+ Shoulder strap.+ Belt loop - useful if you're riding a roller coaster. LOL!+ Dual zipper.What I don't like:- Camera fits too perfectly - that an extra battery or the neck strap won't fit inside with the camera.Mixed: The quality seems good for its price range. The shoulder strap feels cheaply made though. I've dealt with many kinds of zipper and I know this one is good. Inside pocket seems useless. They should have made it into a padding instead.Bottom line, you can drop your camera in this case and it won't break or scratch. The lack of front padding is OK, since the EVA material used in front looks durable enough for this purpose.If you are looking to put accessories into the case, I suggest you get the bigger model (EHC-103-BLACK).VERDICT: I RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.

This package which costs only $20 contains two batteries, a rapid charger, screen protectors (3), and a cleaning cloth.Batteries:(+) $20 for two batteries is already a bargain.(?) Not sure about longevity or durability, but still, it is priced cheap (easily replaceable).(-) It doesn't have metal connector covers (like in the original battery)Charger:(+) Rapid charging(+) Feels solid. Looks better in person.(+) Very small, hence, portable.(+) Has car charger included.(+) Has round electrical plug adaptor.Screen protectors(+) 3 in a pack.() Universal. Con: you have to cut it. Pro: It's big enough to split in two - making it possible to have six screen protectors (for 3-inch LCD screens).(-) To be honest, I think it is junk. It is so hard to apply, and the protectors are too obvious and kind of reduces the quality of the screen. I just removed mine.(-) The squeegee is a joke. Easily bent.Cleaning cloth(+) Standard above average size cleaning cloth.Despite the CONS, I am giving this 5 STARS since the the package basically gives you free stuff which are all usable.Bottom line, these are cheaply priced - truly a bargain. It is a must for owners of cameras that uses this battery.Verdict: I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.

It does what it's supposed to do. I use audiophile earphones and there are no noticeable differences when using this product. I do notice subtle differences from my different earphones, so I should know if there would be noticeable difference when using this product. So far, I am happy to report that this product does not affect quality. I DID NOT TEST THIS USING PROFESSIONAL EQUIPMENT.Those who report that the female port of the cable gets loose over time must be plugging and unplugging devices repeatedly and frequently. The product does make a tight plug. I suggest they purchase another one because this is unbelievable inexpensive in my honest opinion.Benefits of this product:+ Reduces wear and tear to the original earphone (or speaker) plug, by not having to plug it it and out repeatedly. The product does takes the wear instead.+ Reduces wear and tear to the original earphone (or speaker) plug, by preventing it from being bent (i.e. in your pocket, or in a tight closed sleeve for small devices).+ Reduces wear and tear to the device, again by preventing the plug from,bending. How? When a force is applied to the side of the plug, the device's port where it is plugged in also absorbs the force, thus possibly increasing wear, which might loosen the port.With the benefits above, this is a cheap investment if you use expensive devices and/or earphones.Verdict: I recommend this product.

The In-Ear 3 from Creative offers superb quality. I have been using the In-Ear 2 for a long time since its inception, and I have been very happy with the quality. I have tried several earphones for its price range*, and I know I am a proud owner of In-Ear2. And then In-Ear3 came out, with a hefty price tag. Even until now, the price stands at $150 from the official Creative store. I got one here at Amazon for under $99. What I got surprised me.What I Like:(+) Dual Armature Driver, gives superior audio quality from single driver earphones (dual-drivers are RARE).(+) Very comfortable fit, I could wear this all day without noticing it. The In-Ear2 is a LOT lighter, but I find this one a lot more comfortable to wear. I have been wearing all my earphones over the ear, and this one is made exactly with that in mind. Very ergonomic.(+) For under $100, this is a grab. I would say comparable earphones are priced at least twice this one, like those from Etymotic and Shure. Sure, those may be a little bit better, but for the price, no one can beat this.(+) Elastic cord. Finally, they chose the elastic type cord found in their low-end earphones like EP-630, versus their "durable" hard cord found on both In-Ear and In-Ear2. I actually find these a lot more durable considering real-world use.What I don't Like:(-) The plug is a little easy to break because it uses a straight plug. I broke mine, as I broke my In-Ear 2 plug. By "breaking", I don't mean unuseable. A 33-cent glue will fix it. I am actually delighted to know that the In-Ear3 has more protection at the plug. When i broke my In-Ear2 plug, the wires are visible. With the In-Ear3, the wires are still covered by the elastic cord. A big plus. I personally think an L-shaped plug would have been better,, it it could just be from the way i use my devices and the earphones.Recommendation:I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT. Don't waste money on both Beats and Bose. They sound crappy and they are expensive - you only really pay for the brand name. Sennheiser is AS GOOD as creative, but offers its products at twice the price (e.g., compare Creative EP-630 and Sennheiser CX-300, you'd be surprised to know that they use the same hardware). I know, because I tried these products.I like Creative products, but this is not a biased review (See my other Creative products review, a bit more harsh).

Perrier  Aromatics has absolutely changed my baking experience with this Haitian Pure Almond Extract. I ordered the 8oz bottle and can say its more than I need. A little bit of this extract goes a long way ! It absolutely blows away generic almond extract.Around Christmas time I make Almond Shortbread cookies:1 cup butter 1/2 cup white sugar 2 teaspoons almond extract 2 1/2 cups sifted all-purpose flour 1/3 cup granulated sugar for decorationDirections:In a large bowl, beat butter with 1/2 cup sugar and almond extract until light and fluffy. With wooden spoon, stir in flour until smooth and well combined. Divide dough into 2 parts. Refrigerate, covered for 2 hours.Preheat oven 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).On lightly sugared surface, roll out dough, one part at a time, about 1/2 inch thick. Using a 1 1/2 inch round cookie cutter, cut out cookies. Place 1 inch apart, on ungreased cookie sheet. With end of wooden spoon, or cookie press, make an indentation in center of each cookie.Bake 25 to 30 minutes, or until light golden brown around the edges. While still warm, roll in sugar. Cool completely on a wire rack.I wanted to try the recipe out once I received this extract, so now instead of using 2 teaspoons almond extract I use 1. I can almost say 1 teaspoon is too much because the flavor is even more bold and taste-able than using generic almond extract. I will not lessen the amount the next time I make these only because I find the bold taste very enjoyable!This All Natural Almond Extract is seriously life changing. It gives a flavor boost that is so delicious, it doesnt taste fake or processed. It's seriously perfection! I highly recommend adding this extract to your cupboard. I cant wait to try different recipes using this !I received this item at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest review.

Wow, at the current price for this watch, under one hundred bills, this is a great buy.  This watch looks very modern and classy.  The two tone metal is the way to go these days in my opinion and this one does it very nicely, not gaudy or cheap looking at all.  This watch is heavy too and seems very well made.  I love the face of it, a light grey color which blends perfectly into the silver metal.  White faces on a watch are too bright and cheapen the look in my opinion.  I have to admit I have no idea what the three smaller dials on the watch face represent, other than that they make the watch face more interesting.  Sorry, I use a watch to tell time and the date if that is available.  The other things on a watch are just extra goodies that I don't need. Womens watches usually can't fit all those extras in, so we aren't used to having it anyways.  But back to the price, wow, this is a steal.  My husband has about 7 watches and this one fits its own niche.  You need a black metal band watch, a black faced watch, fun watches, leather band watches and low profile, simple but elegant watches like this one.  He has paid more for other watches, but this one is just as good as those and I think it looks great on the wrist.  I do have to say the picture used to represent the watch makes it look like a brushed gold and silver metal, but it is really more of the polished gold and silver, so it is shinier, but it still looks fantastic all around.

The Widow is an engrossing tale, told mainly from the viewpoint of Jean Taylor, the wife of Glen, with Glen either being an innocent victim or perverted husband.  You wonder is Jean just a naive devoted wife or co-conspirator here?  No spoilers given.  The book encompasses a 4 year time period, going back and forth many times throughout the 54 chapters.  Thankfully each chapter has a date on it so you know where the story is picking up  each time.  I believe the book had been compared to Gone Girl which I had also read.  Perhaps there are vague similarities, but I think Gone Girl was much more diabolical and complex in a sense.  The Widow is not as intense or psychological as Gone Girl, but it is still a very good book.  It has over 300 pages to it, and on a few short occasions I felt the book was spinning its wheels as it danced around the main question of what happened to tiny Bella.  It is like the story just continuously circles around that question, sometimes getting close to it and then veering away.  It isn't until the very end that it is resolved.  It did keep me up late reading and thinking about the book during the day, so that is always a sign of a good book to me.  It is close to being a 5 star book for me, but those are reserved for such books like The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo with their complex, detailed plots.Overall this book is a quick, enjoyable read.  The cast of characters is small, the settings are few so you stay familiar with everything throughout the story.

This is a very attractive, and slightly out of the ordinary watch for a man.  And it is definitely a man's watch with its sizing.  The face is about 1.75 inches in diameter and about 1/3 of an inch thick.  Much thicker than most watches I've seen.  The glass over the face has a mild dome to it, giving it a slight retro look.  The band is genuine leather and has a pattern to it, not a flat leather at all.  It feels pretty thick and should hold up well to wear.  My husband has worn it a few times to work and says he likes it quite well.  It is easy to see the time on it, and he likes the little window for the date also.When he first put it on, he said that setting the time and date was not very intuitive, he had to fool around with the 3 different dials to get it all right.  But of course, it does come with an instruction booklet, so that would answer all the questions on how to do it.  I have a picture of it on my wrist, which is quite small, so you can see how big it is.  Not something I would wear, but great for my tall husband.This is one of his more unique watches now, I told him it makes me think of Sherlock Holmes, or something from the past because of its shape and styling.  It is definitely a nice change from all the shiny metal watches with  modern faces to them.  It is quite classy in its own way. and seems to have quite an attention to the little details, like LP etched on the stainless steel clasp.

I think this is quite a stunning bracelet.  It has just enough glitz to give it a fancy,dressy look, but it is also simple enough to wear with casual items.  It is not overly heavy and with a little pressure, you can conform it to fit to your wrist.  I would say I have smaller wrists, and after I put it on, I can squeeze it together a little so that I have no worry of it falling off.  At the same time I would by no means consider it a fragile item even though it has bendable qualities to it. Truthfully, whoever created this design, did it pretty much perfectly.  There isn't a thing I would change about it.  My wrist measures exactly 6 inches around, and the bracelet is 7.25 inches, so if anything, I could go smaller, but this does not look  large on me.  Large wristed women might need a bigger one if they don't like bracelets that grab on, although it can be opened wider very easily.  It shines and sparkles very nicely and does not look like a piece of cheap jewelry.  A great all around attractive bracelet.  I am glad it doesn't have that overly shiny look, but has texture to it.  If guys are looking for a gift to give, this would seem to be a very safe bet.

I am not one for glittery, big fancy pieces of jewelry, and glad to say this ring is none of those.  It does have some glitter, but it keeps it low key, and the size is modest.  I was glad to see the metal in the ring is thick and sturdy.  Some rings have thin metal for the band, and over time they can lose their circular shape.  I do not see this happening with this ring at all.  The 2 gold tone hearts on the side make a nice contrast to the sparkling heart in  the middle.  I think it is more of a rose gold color though, as I had a true 14kt gold ring on next to it, and the gold on this Hallmark ring definitely had a copper shade to it.  I don't mind it, as I find rose gold to be very nice itself.My teenage daughter definitely liked this ring too, and if her finger was a size 7, then I am sure I would not see much of this ring. She is modeling it in the picture and it is too big for her.  Lucky for me.  The setting  seems strong and for the price, this ring seems like a good buy.

This is a very nice, and large water bowl, but not sure if 100% necessary.  Almost like it is one of those things for the dog that has everything else.  The 120 oz size bowl is the way to go for multiple dogs.  I have 2 pitbulls and one senior fox terrier and cute little bowls don't do the trick.  This does hold a lot of water, but you have to be careful it does not go too low, then you could damage the water pump recirculater thingie.  Admittedly, one of my other water bowls can run dry, so I have to be careful to watch this one.It replaced a ceramic bowl in my basement that my dogs would eagerly drink from.  Once I plugged this one in, they gave it a wide berth for a day.  It makes a humming noise, similar to a fish tank sound.  There is no water bubbling and you can barely see the ripples in the bowl. Still, it took about 2 days before my dogs would drink from it.  I don't want to make it my main water dish as my old dog has the gift of making the water bowl gross, like he rinses his mouth out in it, and this one would be too much of a pain to constantly change the water out of it.  I am not overly thrilled with the suggestion to change the charcoal filter every 2 to 4 weeks.  Really?  I am more a 2-4 months kind of owner.  So we will see how that goes.  If nothing else it may become a glorified water bowl with no running pump.So, if you like the idea of circulating water for your big dog, this one is a great idea.  Just know it takes more upkeep than a plain old water bowl.  It is a sturdy plastic bowl, and when you do have to clean it out, you don't have to unplug from the wall, it has a connector near the base to make it easier.

I have been an Otterbox fan in the past, having used the commuter and defender series for iphone 5's, and find this one to be the same quality of workmanship.  I don't feel it has half the protection of the defender series and is still a step below the commuter, but compared to the average slap on phone cover, this one has a thick edge to it and does offer some protection.  My daughter quickly put it on her iphone 6 and simply said she liked it.  She doesn't like the bulkier, more protective ones.  She does like the idea that she can put any type of photo or picture on the back of her phone and it will be seen through the back clear cover.  Nifty idea. Gives the phone lots of design options.The one thing that gives me a little concern is how shiny and smooth some of the plastic is, it makes the phone feel a bit slippery to me with this cover on.  The edges of the cover are more of that rubbery plastic and has a grip to it, but the curved bottom side is hard plastic. Larger, sweatier hands certainly won't have a concern with it, but I do like a nice solid grip on the phone, one slip and the phone itself could crack, that is always my worry, but that is with any cover on it that isn't super rugged.I also like it when the phone case/cover  goes over the ports for plug in, and this one doesn't.  I feel that helps the phone last a lot longer by keeping dust/dirt/junk out of it.  I currently use the Otterbox Resurgence that has the extra battery power in it.  It is a heavier case, but a nice rubber feel and the charging port is protected. OtterBox Resurgence Power/BatteryCase for Apple iPhone 6/6s - Retail Packaging - Glacier (White/Gunmetal Grey)  But it is nice to have options and Otterbox has never disappointed me.

A wrestling game, who'd have thought I would have any interest in that?  Normally, I would have passed this game by without a second thought, but I currently have a foreign exchange student in my home who is borderline obsessed with wrestling.  I figured this game would interest him and give us something to do during the upcoming winter.  So far it has been working out great.  I have played lots of board games beyond the standard store ones, while he is pretty much only familiar with video games.  It is fun to introduce someone to the world of boardgaming beyond such games as Monopoly or Risk.  Many have no idea these kind of games exist.  It has taken a few slow learning games to get the hang of it all, but each time it gets a little better and we can develop a bit more of a strategy.  I was pretty much the Queen of Randomness when we started, while he studied the cards a  lot more.  He loves the miniatures included and the great pictures and quality of the cards.  I have seen photos of some of the minis painted and that might be a project for him.We make sure to rotate the 6 different wrestler player cards as they each have their own strengths and weaknesses, and he is already asking if more cards are available.  Not to beat a dead horse, but yes it is rock-paper-scissors mechanics, but that is fine, keeps game play moving along and lets me continue to test my intuition against my opponent.  Admittedly I am not a huge wrestling fan, find it a bit odd to watch, but the sport does provide a base for an interesting game.  Also love the fact that games can last 10 minutes or 30.  I imagine the better we get at planning strategy, the longer it will last.  At this point we haven't tried the tag team, and I don't plan on bringing it up anytime soon.  He will probably be quite happy to play this for a long time, but I hope to make it a jumping off point to many more games as it is a great introductory type of game.

I am no perfume expert by any means and rarely purchase any.  There are some perfumes that you can smell and right away your head starts to throb a bit from the odor.  I was worried this might be one, but my first smell test of it showed that I didn't have to worry about that.  It was very light and airy smelling...at first.  I put some on my neck and wrists and forced my husband to sniff it and he approved.  I then got in my car to drive, with windows up, and soon it became a much stronger smell and a little thicker in scent.  I worried my workmates would get put off by it, but that proved not to be a problem.  I really didn't even smell it much later on during the day, and alas, no one commented on it.  I guess the lesson learned was to put on a bit less and do a more indirect spraying of the mist when putting it on.To me this seems like a pretty safe bet of a perfume purchase.  It might not be someones favorite, but I don't think many people will hate it because it does come off as light and fresh smelling.  The bottle is by no means eye catching, but I for one am appreciative of its wide base.  Tall skinny bottles just get knocked over too easily, and don't get me started on cats and knocking stuff over.

Love games, love the show A Game of Thrones, so this was a must have.  I never played the first edition so I can not compare it to that.  Thankfully the Fantasy Flight website has a tutorial for the game which is quite helpful https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/a-game-of-thrones-the-card-game-second-edition/  It consists of a 17 minute youtube video, but it can make understanding the  learn to play guidebook much easier.I have only been able to attempt the tutorial joust version of the game, and I can see that will be enough for me for awhile.  The tutorial game has you using the Lannister and Stark decks (2 factions), and a prepicked number of cards.  There are 8 factions available, so you can definitely branch out in the game.  Fortunately I have played Magic, the Gathering before, and it has similarities to that, so that made it a little easier.As others have said, there is a learning curve of getting familiar with the cards and what happens during the marshaling and challenge phases.  The guide book will be your best friend as you learn to play at first.The quality of the cards, fake gold pieces and power counters are good, nothing feels cheap or flimsy.  The guide and rule books seem well written and should answer almost all questions.  If not, there is an amazing game site, www.boardgamegeek.com that has a whole forum for this game.  It is also nice that this is not a collectible card game where some people can get rare/valuable cards and you spend too much money trying to get them also.  Instead all the future Chapter Packs will include 60 cards with no random cards.  Awesome.  Well, going to try and play another round with my child.

I work in an independent pet food store and love to read ingredient labels and try out the new foods on my cats and dogs.  I know Wellness has a pretty good reputation for food and this food sounds great, so I had to give it a try.  My 3 cats are not very picky though, and they did eat this up without leaving a kibble behind.  There is even a stray cat at my work, so I put some out for her (she is spayed!), and she ate it up, but that isn't too surprising, she is no doubt hungry.  They do use peas as their binder for food and I did read somewhere that peas are not very palatable to dogs and cats.  Some canned foods have peas in them, and cats are notorious for leaving the peas untouched.Normally I give my cats Orijen dry kibble and Friskies canned food (I know, that one is not the best, will be upgrading).  This Wellness air dried food is almost twice the price of Orijen, and Orijen is not cheap.  I have to give the ingredient panel to Orijen the winning points though.  The first 16 ingredients in Orijen are meat/protein ingredients, followed by fruits/veggies, natural herbs and then more meat goodies.  Their list of chemical vitamins and minerals is much shorter than the list in Wellness.  I prefer that my pets get their vitamins from their food, not synthesized chemicals.  Taurine is an essential amino acid for cats, and a lot of foods have to add that to their ingredient panel to get the recommended levels.  Orijen doesn't need to add the supplement because all the meat they use in the food supplies the necessary taurine.  Got to love that.  I am not an Orijen rep by any means, I just read the labels and do my own research.Raw food is also great for cats, so much meat and moisture in it.  Remember, cats are carnivores, while dogs can deal with grains, cats struggle to digest them.  Stella & Chewys sells frozen and dehydrated raw foods.  Your cat needs moisture, so they should never be fed just a dry diet.  I had one customer at the store I work at say that she would only feed her cat dry food so her teeth would stay good.  For one thing, that doesn't prevent dental issues by any means, and secondly you can cause more damage to the cats health by being ignorant of what they should eat.  Does any wild carnivore eat dry food only?  Well, enough ranting I guess.In all, this Wellness Core Air Dried food is way above so many other dry foods in quality, i.e. Science Diet, Iams, Purina, 9 lives, and so many others.  I wish people would read the ingredients and realize their cats should not eat corn in their food, nor animal digest, nor artificial flavors and colors.  Just because your cat likes it doesn't mean it is good for them, and the health effects don't always show up immediately.  If this food were more reasonably priced, I could see it doing a lot better in the market, but it will still have its followers, or be used as an occasional rotation food.  I am just happy to see more quality food come out for pets.

I'm a mom with teenage daughters who also like reading.  We have done the Hunger Games series, Divergent, Maze Runner, Graceling books and plenty of other YA books.  I remember when this book first came out,  I passed on it.  While recently shopping I saw this book with a sticker on it saying it would be a major motion picture in 2016.  That was enough for me, I decided it was time to read the book then, as I much prefer to read the book before seeing the movie.  Needless to say this book sucked me in right away, I really liked the way the character of Cassie thought and was portrayed.  She was sarcastic, saw the irony in things and certainly didn't take herself too seriously.  She knew that she and her family (as well as the planet) was pretty much screwed when the mothership appeared in the sky.This book reminded me a bit of The Host, but with much more death and invisible aliens.  There are many that complain about how the aliens drag out the decimation of the earths inhabitants, when they clearly could do it quicker, but that is how the author wanted to play it out, and for me it works.  The story resolves in a plausible way, but realistically in an unlikely way.  Still, it made a darn good story for me.  I already purchased the second book and hope it lives up to this one.  I have also told my 14 yr old that this is the next book she is reading, and she will :).  Then she will thank me.

Well, short and simple, my 3 cats gladly eat this food, and it does not come back up so that is a good thing.  With 3 cats, they all split one can in the morning and one can at night, getting dry kibble during the day for snacks.  The only thing I am not thrilled about with this product is that the third ingredient is meat by products.  The type of meat is not specified, and the by products can be a range of items. So in some ways, you can't be 100% sure what your cat is really eating.  But I also realize in some ways, so what, my cat will catch a mouse and eat the whole thing, so I hope Purina is actually using edible, non-diseased meat by products.  This has made me think about my cat food a bit more though, I had been feeding them the Friskies cans, and lo behold, their first ingredients are water, poultry by products and then meat by products.  Yech.  After doing a little internet shop searching, I have been able to find cat canned food cheaper than this case and the ingredients have no by products and no grains, i.e. BFF brand and Weruva.So while this food is quite palatable to my cats, and I did once read that ANY wet cat food is better than the best dry food (because of moisture), I will step up my game a little and try to get my cats something that is a little more purer than this, especially if the price point is the same.Also, this food is a pretty dense pate mixture.  I can spoon it out of the can and hold the spoon upside down and it sticks to it.  That is neither a good or bad thing, and I suppose it beats a food being too watery, but cats are not known to be big drinkers, so moisture in food is very important to them.  Their natural diet of animals would consist of 70% water, similar to moisture content in  canned food, while dry food has about 12% moisture in it.  I believe I also read once that if you just feed  your cat dry food, it has to drink a cup of water a day to equal moisture in its natural diet.  That also plays a part in why some cats get constant urinary issues, not enough water to dilute the urine.

I was pleasantly surprised to be able to give this mineral/cream foundation a try.  For the last year I have been trying various powders and liquids to try and find one I really liked.  At 50 years old,  I have the lovely trifecta of slight rosacea, dark circles and visible pores. Not fun to try and hide. I have tried Smashbox, Estee Lauder, BareMinerals, DermaBlend, Hope in a Jar and a few others in powders and liquids.  My favorite had been the Laura Geller balance and brighten face powder, but now I feel that this product with the mild moisturizing product in it, does a better job of blending onto the face.  I found that liquids tended to highlight pores and get shiny after awhile.  As for this product, Borba's Anti-Fatigue 8 hour mineral foundation, it does a great job.  I suppose it is that hybrid between a powder and a liquid, the mixing of the 2 elements in the case gives it an easy to apply and stay on foundation.  It is by no means a heavy makeup, but does enough to give the skin a healthy look while staying matte.  It does not hide pores (nothing does!), but I think I can say it minimizes them, blurring their edges,  while other foundations I have tried actually made them look bigger, who wants that?!  The medium color is by no means dark, and I would imagine most people would use that unless you have very pale skin.  I have no noticed any shimmer in it either.Applying with a good brush is a must, and although it is a bit costly, if it saves me experimenting with other lines, then I am happy to continue using it.  I think it is also important that they DO NOT TEST ON ANIMALS.  The SPF of 29 is also good to have.

Glad to see that Hill's has stepped up their game in the cat food arena.  My mother is into cat rescue and has over 40 cats (all fixed! and all stray, previously injured) on her property.  She can't afford great food for them, so sticks with the Purina which contains corn, by products and other junk.  They also get decent canned food.  I let her try this food on her cats and she said it was a big hit with them, great for the cats that were picky.  I like this food because it doesn't contain the corn, wheat, by products and other cheap ingredients.  I still believe cats should have grain free, so the barley and rice prevent that from being grain free, but it isn't horrible, much better than the Purina stuff.Still, even though it is a good food, you can buy (what I consider) better food for almost the same price.  Acana's Wild Prairie for cats is grain free, has more protein and less synthetic vitamins and minerals in it.  If you cat(s) throw up, pull out fur, have a dull coat, then you really need to check out the ingredients of their food.  I have seen people try quality food for their cats and really notice a difference.The Hills Crafted is a solid cat food, there are much worse foods out there (science diet i.e.), and it is nice they have a variety of flavors.  If you are a Hill's fan, they by all means try it.  I would love for my mothers cats to have this over Purina, but the cost would prohibit that.  Instead, she will get some as a special treat for them now and then.

First off, I am no expert on vitamins, I buy them in the hopes they are helping in some form or other.  These SmartyPants Gummy vitamins seem like a good vitamin without artificial flavors, high fructose corn syrup, no GMO's, milk, or gluten amongst other things.  They have added fish oils from anchovy and sardine, which seems rarer to find in a child's gummy vitamin.  I already had a bottle of Max & Ruby chewables and there are some big differences. SmartyPants has vitamin B-12 (as methylcobalamin) at 67 mcg, equaling 1117% of a 4 year olds requirement.  Max & Ruby has vitamin B-12 (as cyanocobalamin) at 3 mcg, equaling 50% of 4 year olds requirement.  My adult vitamin has B12 at 6 mcg, 100% requirement.  I have no idea why there is such a difference in the 2 childrens vitamins though.As for the taste, my teenager and I find them tasty to eat.  Although she did say not to give her the yellow ones. She does prefer them to the Max & Ruby chewable . They all seem to taste the same to me.  3 years and older are supposed to take 4 gummies a day, but I just dole out 2 a day, no particular reason though.  At 4 gummies a day, you only exceed your requirements with B12 and the D3 vitamin.  I am still not sure what I believe about vitamins, so I take them on a non regular basis and try to get vitamins from healthy foods.

This book seems to have come at an interesting time, when police shootings are unfortunately becoming commonplace.  Most likely our awareness is raised about these shootings because of people video recording the incident.  There has been a history of the judicial system believing the police over the citizen, but now that is coming under fire with those in authority being able to see the incident instead of just hear reports about it.  This relates to the book, in that Benforado (in my opinion) seems to imply that people become conditioned to behaviors, and even though they think they are being impartial, they still follow their own beliefs.  Such as the Supreme Court judges, if they all have the same Constitution, same rules to follow, same sources to gather information, why aren't all their decisions the same? Their beliefs skew their research so that what they research agrees with what they believe to be right.  Basically, you can always find information to support your belief, and that works for both sides of the coin.  Even though the author does not write about recent shootings, in the past the belief that the officer would not lie, and if there was no proof he was not lying, then his version of the shooting would be believed.  Technology is changing all that, and the truth becomes easier to find and the human variable reduced greatly.  In the book Benforado gives some interesting examples of how human fallibility hurts the justice system.  One story that sticks with me and made me think was the story of a woman who was raped and was then asked to view a police line up of 5 men.  The police had their own suspect in mind (who was innocent) and they pulled the real suspect (by mere coincidence) into the line up also.  The victim picked out the innocent man, and that moment pretty much sealed his fate.  It makes sense that now the victim, who didn't have a clear look at her attacker, now has the face of the innocent man to fill in the blanks for her attacker.  The police went along, the prosecutor and eventually the jury decided that this woman was sure about her attacker even though physical evidence didn't prove he was the one who raped her.  This victim now believed the innocent man was her attacker and in reality, was she suddenly going to change her mind during the trial and say, oh, I made a mistake?  Not likely, instead the man spent 28 years in jail, and the guilty man went on to commit more crimes.  What a horrendous snowball effect.  There are more examples and it does make you think how much reliance we put on others to prove or disprove a persons guilt.  Goodness, how many times have we heard the stories of multiple witnesses to one incident, and those stories  vary immensely as to what the people believed happened.  Why does one story stand out as true and the others don't?The book is written with the anecdotes, then with occasional studies and then with the authors viewpoint and explanation of human behavior.  I can't say it is a light, easy going read, and as I am not involved in legal work at all, I found some of it a bit too rambling for me as I just wanted some insight into human behavior, preferably with anecdotes.  I would hope that lawyers, police officers, judges and people working in the justice system would read this book and have their eyes opened, at least  a little.  But the sad truth is that while we can be enlightened for awhile, we tend to fall back into our old habits and beliefs.  Thus, the hope for improved technology to improve our justice system. Humans have shown they make too many costly mistakes.

Dogs love to chew fabric, and so I don't expect this to be a miracle toy and be impervious to my dogs teeth.  I got it fairly cheap and it felt sturdy, so I let my two 55 pound pitties play with it.  It is holding up after one day, but I know eventually I will be picking up the stuffing all over the place.  Such is life.  If you don't want your dog to destroy it, they need antlers, raw bones, ruff roots, water buffalo horns or something else like that to chew on.  But the reality is they love to tear apart fabric, to hear the ripping, I suppose it simulates them making a catch/kill out in the wild.  If they destroy it, then you know they enjoyed it, just don't spend a lot of money for it if you can.

This is a gorgeous brush to look at and feels good in the hand with a nice weight.  The packaging with it said good for pressed powder and loose powder, but I think it should just say loose powder.  The first time I tried it, I was trying to put on a finishing pressed powder, just to swipe here and there, but the brush would not pick it up, I saw no color transfer on it.  The bristles are not extremely firm, and would just glide over the pressed powder.  The next time I went straight for the loose powder and it did fine with that.  I compare it to a kabuki type brush I also have that I also use as a finishing brush.  Both work well I would say, although the kabuki has firmer bristles to use with a pressed powder.  The advantage me be that with loose powder, this brush won't pick up too much at a time.  This one is supposed to mattify, but I couldn't really tell if that works,  I don't see how the brush will affect my skin or the type of powder I use.  It is a nice thought at least.For the price it is a nice brush to have in your arsenal, but it has no super powers in it.  It is nice and easy to pick out amongst your other brushes as it has bright white bristles and the pretty blue metal on it.  That will also make it easier to remind you to clean it more often when you see the powder build up on the white bristles.

I give it 5 stars because this workout video is tailored to me, middle aged used to be in shape person.  If you are a hard core workout person, then this would probably be too easy for you.  I had it on my shelf for a year (my bad), and finally took it out.  LOVE the short 20 minute work out options.  If they are too long, it is too hard to want to do them.  And you can stream the 3 together, so you really have the option of 20, 40 or 60 minutes of working out.  I prefer doing the circuit segment, which is more motion and light weight use.  20 mins of it and you feel like you did something.  The other 2 are by no means easy workouts, but just a different intensity.I truthfully remember doing the Kathy Smith videos back in the 80's and 90's and she sure hasn't changed much...stayed in better shape than me for sure.  I didn't find her noises and peppy attitude annoying, she definitely keeps the energy level up so you don't have time to slow down.  For the price, you get a good workout and don't need a lot of accessories beyond some light weights.

This is a great feeding tool at a great price.  Not real fun to clean the slimy lickings off of it, but it is dishwasher safe.  I don't really have dogs (3) that are gulpers, so this was more of a fun exercise thing for them.  Plus I feed them a mixture of kibble, meat and water, and although that would clearly work in this bowl, it just gets messy.  I like that it is a good size for large dogs, you could get their whole feedings in this bowl.  Might be overkill for small dogs, but it would still work.  I also think it is a great thing for cats, of which I have 4.  They obviously can't stick their noses/tongues in far enough to get the food, but it makes them use their paws to fish the dry food out.  With their un-busy lifestyle, they have plenty of time to fish kibble out of this bowl.I would recommend this one over the other slow feeder, Northmate Interactive.  That one almost looks painful to use.And remember, you shouldn't free feed your dog, have scheduled feeding times for them at least twice a day.

Forget badminton.  With speedminton, if you play it right, you will work up a sweat.  The racquets are much more sturdier than badminton ones, but not as bulky as tennis racquets.  I have spent many an hour playing with my kids and a neighbor.  You can really whack the birdie with these racquets.  A tennis court size playing field is about right, although you play with a net (imaginary one for me) that is higher.  You usually loft the birdie up high instead of doing low shots.  You will get some good exercise moving to hit the birdie and swinging with almost full force.  So nice that you can play on grass, sand, cement, almost anywhere.  I never play with a defined court, just do a lot of hitting back and forth.  With the kids, we are lucky to get 10-15 hits in a row, with a good player, you can easily go 40-50 till someone makes a mistake.  Can't recommend this game/sport enough.  The birdies are much sturdier and heavier than badminton ones, they fly great and when you hit the sweet spot on the racquet, you know it.

My daughter is using this as a high school senior to keep track of lots of papers.  It does the job without any complaints.  We like the color and how it is oriented to stand tall instead of the long way.  The plastic seems pretty sturdy, but I won't be surprised that if eventually the seams start to crack.  It just seems inevitable, but that is fine.  I suppose the less wear and tear, the longer it will last.  A good deal for the price.

I recently purchased the ZAQ Mirage Diffuser, but had problems with the adapter working.  I then decided to give this one a try so I could use my oil blends.  This one is nice and worked right off the bat.  The way it is set up is a little clunky, at least compared to the ZAQ one.  The lights and timers are nice, but the buttons and writing are small.  It does not rotate through as many colors as the ZAQ does, but that isn't a big deal. The ZAQ does not have a timer, but just stops when the water dries up, as does this one, but it also has timers.  The Samyo has its mist come out from the side of the rim, so you sort of point it in the direction you want the mist to go.  The ZAQ's mist comes right out of the top of the diffuser.  The ZAQ has a bigger footprint, so might not be able to fit in all locations, while the Samyo is just a little bigger than a soda can.  There is about a twenty five dollar difference in price and that is pretty substantial.  I am glad I have both, I feel the Samyo is great for a kids room, while I keep the ZAQ in the kitchen/living room area.

The picture of the ZAQ Dew pretty much looks like the Mirage without the plastic base around the bottom, probably added to keep it stable.  Anyways, I am thoroughly enjoying the ZAQ Mirage.  I am just slightly worried about the longevity of it.  When I first took it out to try, I followed the instructions. Add water to the line, add oil drops, plug in.  Push the button to start it and a brief flash of light, then nothing.  Pushed button to start again, and it ran about 5 seconds and shut off.  Rechecked the connections, and after about 3 minutes, it starts working like a charm.  It just seems a little fiddly to start every now and then.  I thought I read somewhere on another review that it takes a minute to warm up kind of thing, but that doesn't sound like it happens with everyone.  Still, it makes a great mist and the 4-5 drops of oil do a great job of filling up a room.  At night I put it in my bedroom, in the daytime it goes in the kitchen/living room.  I think it runs a good 5-6 hours on one fill up of water.The Mirage does not come with a handy filling container, that would have been nice, but livable without it.  I don't use tap water, just filtered water and make sure to dry it out when it runs empty.  The instructions that come with it are extremely basic.  I have been using oil blends from Edens Gardens, one of my favorites is Joy, which contains bergamot, geranium,  jasmine, lemon, mandarin, palmarosa, chamomile, rose,rosewood, sweet orange and ylang ylang.  Wow,, all that goodness in one inexpensive bottle.  They have so many other great blends and sell them on amazon.I would recommend this diffuser and really hope it lasts a long time, and that my issue with it turning on is just a quirk. **UPDATE** After less than 1 week of having it, its quirk has turned into a problem.  It won't turn on...unless I continuously hold the wire tightly against the adapter when it is plugged in.  And to be honest, I don't feel like doing that for 3 hours.  Plus the slightest movement and it turns off.  I think the unit itself is fine, the adapter is a piece of junk with loose wiring inside. GRRRR.  Looked for similar adapters in my house, but none with the same volts and output. Shame that something that should be easy to work ends up being another poorly made item, and not cheap at that.**Another UPDATE**  The company, Bombay Electronics did respond to emails about the adapter and promptly sent a new one in the mail. The wiring to the new one feels more secure, and the diffuser started up immediately without any issue or hesitation.  Thank you Bombay Electronics.  Rating upped to a 4 again.  I did also purchase aSamyo 100ml Aromatherapy Essential Oil Purifier Diffuser Air Humidifier with 4 Timer Settings & 6 Colors Changing Light for another area of the house and was pleased to see the adapters are the same.  I must say I do like the ease of use of the ZAQ Mirage better than the Samyo.  The Samyo seems to work fine, and it is cheaper, but I would keep the ZAQ one over it.***May 2015*** The diffuser has worked perfectly since the new adaptor. It might  get used once or twice a week, and probably hasn't even been cleaned properly, but it lights up and spews the delightful aromas every time I turn it on.  5 stars

With 2  daughters with kind of difficult hair, I am always on the look out for non drying hair products.  I am so tired of all these fancy shampoos and conditioners that promise the world, and then when I read their ingredient panel, they all sound the same, chemical after chemical, alcohols, sulfates and petroleum products.  I saw this bottle and one daughter has become borderline obsessed with argan oil, swearing that it is making her hair softer and grow fast.  So this one has water as its first ingredient, then argania spinosa kernel oil, vitis vinifera seed oil, glyceryl stearate, dimethicone/silsequioxane copolymer, ceteareth-10, boswellia carterii oil, peg-4 sorbita stearate, cetrimonium chloride, hyaluronic acid, parfum, hydroxypropyl guar, phenoxyethanol.  So, it is not fully "natural', the last ingredient is a bit controversial, but at least it is last.  Nonetheless, I have only used this conditioner once, and normally conditioners pretty much all leave my hair feeling the same, but I did notice it felt softer and not so fly awayish, kind of a silky feel to it.  Very nice.  Might splurge for the shampoo half of it now.

I have 2 kids with varying degrees of asthma and often a cold turns into some kind of bronchial problem.  One daughter did get sick recently and I insisted she try this.  I also recently started using colloidal silver, and they make a sore throat spray, so she was taking both of those medicines each day.  Coincidence or not, she did not develop a full blown chest cold and did not miss any school.  Borderline miraculous considering she has had pneumonia and often has had to take nebulizer treatments. I realize it is hard to tell if this medicine did much to prevent the cold from getting worse, but seeing how it won't hurt her, I will  make sure she takes it again if the same symptoms rear their head.

You have to have a little faith when you pop pills and swallow them.  The write up on these Krill supplements sounds great, and I suppose if they do half of what they claim, then it is a good thing.  I know the smaller the fish, the better the oil for you, and Omega 3's are all the rage now.  I used to take regular fish oil pills, but wanted to try and get more bang for the buck.  I don't know if there is any coincidence, but my skin feels smoother!  Whether that has any relation or not, I will continue to take this pills as they ARE supposed to be good for you, and there is no discomfort or negative issue in taking them.  Especially since I do not consume much fish, I don't worry that I am overdoing it at all.  Do your research and you should find that these are a good brand with high quality.

We got this as a second roller, I thought the printed instructions on it was a brilliant idea.  Our other roller is longer, but plain, and was used quite a bit.  It would be almost impossible to print on the foam part, so there does have to be that special covering with the printed material on it.  Still, it doesn't impede the function of the roller, so it's benefits outweigh any bad.  Like someone else wrote, you probably could cut that part off, but that just sounds like crazy talk.  It will definitely feel firm and uncomfortable if you aren't used to using one, but when you are sore, it "hurts so good" to use.  My daughter is currently dominating it, recovering from ACL surgery and trying to get back into shape.  If you need/want a roller, this one should not disappoint.

I have so many books I want to read, but yet at the store, I saw this one and put it in my cart figuring I would get to it one day.  Somehow it made it to the top of the pile and after finally finishing another book that wasn't worth my time (took me 2 months to read!), I started this one.  Less than 24 hours later, the book is finished and I just marvel at how good it was.I often pick up animal stories with trepidation, I don't want a cry fest about a sad story that just makes you feel bad about whatever happened to the animal in the story.  Thankfully, this book wasn't like that at all.  In all honesty, it wasn't so much about the animals, rather about humans, dead and alive.  There is no unbelievable animal talking, but pretty much all the animals in the book act like animals generally do.  The story line does go into a research chimp and its ties to the main characters.  But still, it isn't a depressing story filled with awful details.  I managed quite well, and am a wimp with that stuff.  The picture on the cover of the book will likely grab you, as it should, because when you start reading, make sure you have enough time to finish the story.  You will want to.This is a debut novel and the author is tied to animal rescue endeavors. I completely cheer him on with his future writings and rescue work!
